graphicRenderEngine 3.2.0
This is a simple render engine based on OpenGL in MAC-OS, which use C++17
  • ceres
  • 3rdparty
  • imgui
imgui.cpp
1// dear imgui, v1.87 WIP
2// (main code and documentation)
3
4// Help:
5// - Read FAQ at http://dearimgui.org/faq
6// - Newcomers, read 'Programmer guide' below for notes on how to setup Dear ImGui in your codebase.
7// - Call and read ImGui::ShowDemoWindow() in imgui_demo.cpp. All applications in examples/ are doing that.
8// Read imgui.cpp for details, links and comments.
9
10// Resources:
11// - FAQ http://dearimgui.org/faq
12// - Homepage & latest https://github.com/ocornut/imgui
13// - Releases & changelog https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/releases
14// - Gallery https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/4451 (please post your screenshots/video there!)
15// - Wiki https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki (lots of good stuff there)
16// - Glossary https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Glossary
17// - Issues & support https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues
18
19// Getting Started?
20// - For first-time users having issues compiling/linking/running or issues loading fonts:
21// please post in https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/discussions if you cannot find a solution in resources above.
22
23// Developed by Omar Cornut and every direct or indirect contributors to the GitHub.
24// See LICENSE.txt for copyright and licensing details (standard MIT License).
25// This library is free but needs your support to sustain development and maintenance.
26// Businesses: you can support continued development via invoiced technical support, maintenance and sponsoring contracts. Please reach out to "contact AT dearimgui.com".
27// Individuals: you can support continued development via donations. See docs/README or web page.
28
29// It is recommended that you don't modify imgui.cpp! It will become difficult for you to update the library.
30// Note that 'ImGui::' being a namespace, you can add functions into the namespace from your own source files, without
31// modifying imgui.h or imgui.cpp. You may include imgui_internal.h to access internal data structures, but it doesn't
32// come with any guarantee of forward compatibility. Discussing your changes on the GitHub Issue Tracker may lead you
33// to a better solution or official support for them.
34

57// [SECTION] INCLUDES
58// [SECTION] FORWARD DECLARATIONS
59// [SECTION] CONTEXT AND MEMORY ALLOCATORS
60// [SECTION] USER FACING STRUCTURES (ImGuiStyle, ImGuiIO)
61// [SECTION] MISC HELPERS/UTILITIES (Geometry functions)
62// [SECTION] MISC HELPERS/UTILITIES (String, Format, Hash functions)
63// [SECTION] MISC HELPERS/UTILITIES (File functions)
64// [SECTION] MISC HELPERS/UTILITIES (ImText* functions)
65// [SECTION] MISC HELPERS/UTILITIES (Color functions)
66// [SECTION] ImGuiStorage
67// [SECTION] ImGuiTextFilter
68// [SECTION] ImGuiTextBuffer
69// [SECTION] ImGuiListClipper

72// [SECTION] MAIN CODE (most of the code! lots of stuff, needs tidying up!)

91//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
92// DOCUMENTATION
93//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
94
95/*
96
97 MISSION STATEMENT
98 =================
99
100 - Easy to use to create code-driven and data-driven tools.
101 - Easy to use to create ad hoc short-lived tools and long-lived, more elaborate tools.
102 - Easy to hack and improve.
103 - Minimize setup and maintenance.
104 - Minimize state storage on user side.
105 - Portable, minimize dependencies, run on target (consoles, phones, etc.).
106 - Efficient runtime and memory consumption.
107
108 Designed for developers and content-creators, not the typical end-user! Some of the current weaknesses includes:
109
110 - Doesn't look fancy, doesn't animate.
111 - Limited layout features, intricate layouts are typically crafted in code.
112
113
114 END-USER GUIDE
115 ==============
116
117 - Double-click on title bar to collapse window.
118 - Click upper right corner to close a window, available when 'bool* p_open' is passed to ImGui::Begin().
119 - Click and drag on lower right corner to resize window (double-click to auto fit window to its contents).
120 - Click and drag on any empty space to move window.
121 - TAB/SHIFT+TAB to cycle through keyboard editable fields.
122 - CTRL+Click on a slider or drag box to input value as text.
123 - Use mouse wheel to scroll.
124 - Text editor:
125 - Hold SHIFT or use mouse to select text.
126 - CTRL+Left/Right to word jump.
127 - CTRL+Shift+Left/Right to select words.
128 - CTRL+A our Double-Click to select all.
129 - CTRL+X,CTRL+C,CTRL+V to use OS clipboard/
130 - CTRL+Z,CTRL+Y to undo/redo.
131 - ESCAPE to revert text to its original value.
132 - You can apply arithmetic operators +,*,/ on numerical values. Use +- to subtract (because - would set a negative value!)
133 - Controls are automatically adjusted for OSX to match standard OSX text editing operations.
134 - General Keyboard controls: enable with ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard.
135 - General Gamepad controls: enable with ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad. See suggested mappings in imgui.h ImGuiNavInput_ + download PNG/PSD at http://dearimgui.org/controls_sheets
136
137
138 PROGRAMMER GUIDE
139 ================
140
141 READ FIRST
142 ----------
143 - Remember to check the wonderful Wiki (https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki)
144 - Your code creates the UI, if your code doesn't run the UI is gone! The UI can be highly dynamic, there are no construction or
145 destruction steps, less superfluous data retention on your side, less state duplication, less state synchronization, fewer bugs.
146 - Call and read ImGui::ShowDemoWindow() for demo code demonstrating most features.
147 - The library is designed to be built from sources. Avoid pre-compiled binaries and packaged versions. See imconfig.h to configure your build.
148 - Dear ImGui is an implementation of the IMGUI paradigm (immediate-mode graphical user interface, a term coined by Casey Muratori).
149 You can learn about IMGUI principles at http://www.johno.se/book/imgui.html, http://mollyrocket.com/861 & more links in Wiki.
150 - Dear ImGui is a "single pass" rasterizing implementation of the IMGUI paradigm, aimed at ease of use and high-performances.
151 For every application frame, your UI code will be called only once. This is in contrast to e.g. Unity's implementation of an IMGUI,
152 where the UI code is called multiple times ("multiple passes") from a single entry point. There are pros and cons to both approaches.
153 - Our origin is on the top-left. In axis aligned bounding boxes, Min = top-left, Max = bottom-right.
154 - This codebase is also optimized to yield decent performances with typical "Debug" builds settings.
155 - Please make sure you have asserts enabled (IM_ASSERT redirects to assert() by default, but can be redirected).
156 If you get an assert, read the messages and comments around the assert.
157 - C++: this is a very C-ish codebase: we don't rely on C++11, we don't include any C++ headers, and ImGui:: is a namespace.
158 - C++: ImVec2/ImVec4 do not expose math operators by default, because it is expected that you use your own math types.
159 See FAQ "How can I use my own math types instead of ImVec2/ImVec4?" for details about setting up imconfig.h for that.
160 However, imgui_internal.h can optionally export math operators for ImVec2/ImVec4, which we use in this codebase.
161 - C++: pay attention that ImVector<> manipulates plain-old-data and does not honor construction/destruction (avoid using it in your code!).
162
163
164 HOW TO UPDATE TO A NEWER VERSION OF DEAR IMGUI
165 ----------------------------------------------
166 - Overwrite all the sources files except for imconfig.h (if you have modified your copy of imconfig.h)
167 - Or maintain your own branch where you have imconfig.h modified as a top-most commit which you can regularly rebase over "master".
168 - You can also use '#define IMGUI_USER_CONFIG "my_config_file.h" to redirect configuration to your own file.
169 - Read the "API BREAKING CHANGES" section (below). This is where we list occasional API breaking changes.
170 If a function/type has been renamed / or marked obsolete, try to fix the name in your code before it is permanently removed
171 from the public API. If you have a problem with a missing function/symbols, search for its name in the code, there will
172 likely be a comment about it. Please report any issue to the GitHub page!
173 - To find out usage of old API, you can add '#define IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS' in your configuration file.
174 - Try to keep your copy of Dear ImGui reasonably up to date.
175
176
177 GETTING STARTED WITH INTEGRATING DEAR IMGUI IN YOUR CODE/ENGINE
178 ---------------------------------------------------------------
179 - Run and study the examples and demo in imgui_demo.cpp to get acquainted with the library.
180 - In the majority of cases you should be able to use unmodified backends files available in the backends/ folder.
181 - Add the Dear ImGui source files + selected backend source files to your projects or using your preferred build system.
182 It is recommended you build and statically link the .cpp files as part of your project and NOT as a shared library (DLL).
183 - You can later customize the imconfig.h file to tweak some compile-time behavior, such as integrating Dear ImGui types with your own maths types.
184 - When using Dear ImGui, your programming IDE is your friend: follow the declaration of variables, functions and types to find comments about them.
185 - Dear ImGui never touches or knows about your GPU state. The only function that knows about GPU is the draw function that you provide.
186 Effectively it means you can create widgets at any time in your code, regardless of considerations of being in "update" vs "render"
187 phases of your own application. All rendering information is stored into command-lists that you will retrieve after calling ImGui::Render().
188 - Refer to the backends and demo applications in the examples/ folder for instruction on how to setup your code.
189 - If you are running over a standard OS with a common graphics API, you should be able to use unmodified imgui_impl_*** files from the examples/ folder.
190
191
192 HOW A SIMPLE APPLICATION MAY LOOK LIKE
193 --------------------------------------
194 EXHIBIT 1: USING THE EXAMPLE BACKENDS (= imgui_impl_XXX.cpp files from the backends/ folder).
195 The sub-folders in examples/ contain examples applications following this structure.
196
197 // Application init: create a dear imgui context, setup some options, load fonts
198 ImGui::CreateContext();
199 ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
200 // TODO: Set optional io.ConfigFlags values, e.g. 'io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard' to enable keyboard controls.
201 // TODO: Fill optional fields of the io structure later.
202 // TODO: Load TTF/OTF fonts if you don't want to use the default font.
203
204 // Initialize helper Platform and Renderer backends (here we are using imgui_impl_win32.cpp and imgui_impl_dx11.cpp)
205 ImGui_ImplWin32_Init(hwnd);
206 ImGui_ImplDX11_Init(g_pd3dDevice, g_pd3dDeviceContext);
207
208 // Application main loop
209 while (true)
210 {
211 // Feed inputs to dear imgui, start new frame
212 ImGui_ImplDX11_NewFrame();
213 ImGui_ImplWin32_NewFrame();
214 ImGui::NewFrame();
215
216 // Any application code here
217 ImGui::Text("Hello, world!");
218
219 // Render dear imgui into screen
220 ImGui::Render();
221 ImGui_ImplDX11_RenderDrawData(ImGui::GetDrawData());
222 g_pSwapChain->Present(1, 0);
223 }
224
225 // Shutdown
226 ImGui_ImplDX11_Shutdown();
227 ImGui_ImplWin32_Shutdown();
228 ImGui::DestroyContext();
229
230 EXHIBIT 2: IMPLEMENTING CUSTOM BACKEND / CUSTOM ENGINE
231
232 // Application init: create a dear imgui context, setup some options, load fonts
233 ImGui::CreateContext();
234 ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
235 // TODO: Set optional io.ConfigFlags values, e.g. 'io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard' to enable keyboard controls.
236 // TODO: Fill optional fields of the io structure later.
237 // TODO: Load TTF/OTF fonts if you don't want to use the default font.
238
239 // Build and load the texture atlas into a texture
240 // (In the examples/ app this is usually done within the ImGui_ImplXXX_Init() function from one of the demo Renderer)
241 int width, height;
242 unsigned char* pixels = NULL;
243 io.Fonts->GetTexDataAsRGBA32(&pixels, &width, &height);
244
245 // At this point you've got the texture data and you need to upload that to your graphic system:
246 // After we have created the texture, store its pointer/identifier (_in whichever format your engine uses_) in 'io.Fonts->TexID'.
247 // This will be passed back to your via the renderer. Basically ImTextureID == void*. Read FAQ for details about ImTextureID.
248 MyTexture* texture = MyEngine::CreateTextureFromMemoryPixels(pixels, width, height, TEXTURE_TYPE_RGBA32)
249 io.Fonts->SetTexID((void*)texture);
250
251 // Application main loop
252 while (true)
253 {
254 // Setup low-level inputs, e.g. on Win32: calling GetKeyboardState(), or write to those fields from your Windows message handlers, etc.
255 // (In the examples/ app this is usually done within the ImGui_ImplXXX_NewFrame() function from one of the demo Platform Backends)
256 io.DeltaTime = 1.0f/60.0f; // set the time elapsed since the previous frame (in seconds)
257 io.DisplaySize.x = 1920.0f; // set the current display width
258 io.DisplaySize.y = 1280.0f; // set the current display height here
259 io.MousePos = my_mouse_pos; // set the mouse position
260 io.MouseDown[0] = my_mouse_buttons[0]; // set the mouse button states
261 io.MouseDown[1] = my_mouse_buttons[1];
262
263 // Call NewFrame(), after this point you can use ImGui::* functions anytime
264 // (So you want to try calling NewFrame() as early as you can in your main loop to be able to use Dear ImGui everywhere)
265 ImGui::NewFrame();
266
267 // Most of your application code here
268 ImGui::Text("Hello, world!");
269 MyGameUpdate(); // may use any Dear ImGui functions, e.g. ImGui::Begin("My window"); ImGui::Text("Hello, world!"); ImGui::End();
270 MyGameRender(); // may use any Dear ImGui functions as well!
271
272 // Render dear imgui, swap buffers
273 // (You want to try calling EndFrame/Render as late as you can, to be able to use Dear ImGui in your own game rendering code)
274 ImGui::EndFrame();
275 ImGui::Render();
276 ImDrawData* draw_data = ImGui::GetDrawData();
277 MyImGuiRenderFunction(draw_data);
278 SwapBuffers();
279 }
280
281 // Shutdown
282 ImGui::DestroyContext();
283
284 To decide whether to dispatch mouse/keyboard inputs to Dear ImGui to the rest of your application,
285 you should read the 'io.WantCaptureMouse', 'io.WantCaptureKeyboard' and 'io.WantTextInput' flags!
286 Please read the FAQ and example applications for details about this!
287
288
289 HOW A SIMPLE RENDERING FUNCTION MAY LOOK LIKE
290 ---------------------------------------------
291 The backends in impl_impl_XXX.cpp files contain many working implementations of a rendering function.
292
293 void void MyImGuiRenderFunction(ImDrawData* draw_data)
294 {
295 // TODO: Setup render state: alpha-blending enabled, no face culling, no depth testing, scissor enabled
296 // TODO: Setup viewport covering draw_data->DisplayPos to draw_data->DisplayPos + draw_data->DisplaySize
297 // TODO: Setup orthographic projection matrix cover draw_data->DisplayPos to draw_data->DisplayPos + draw_data->DisplaySize
298 // TODO: Setup shader: vertex { float2 pos, float2 uv, u32 color }, fragment shader sample color from 1 texture, multiply by vertex color.
299 ImVec2 clip_off = draw_data->DisplayPos;
300 for (int n = 0; n < draw_data->CmdListsCount; n++)
301 {
302 const ImDrawList* cmd_list = draw_data->CmdLists[n];
303 const ImDrawVert* vtx_buffer = cmd_list->VtxBuffer.Data; // vertex buffer generated by Dear ImGui
304 const ImDrawIdx* idx_buffer = cmd_list->IdxBuffer.Data; // index buffer generated by Dear ImGui
305 for (int cmd_i = 0; cmd_i < cmd_list->CmdBuffer.Size; cmd_i++)
306 {
307 const ImDrawCmd* pcmd = &cmd_list->CmdBuffer[cmd_i];
308 if (pcmd->UserCallback)
309 {
310 pcmd->UserCallback(cmd_list, pcmd);
311 }
312 else
313 {
314 // Project scissor/clipping rectangles into framebuffer space
315 ImVec2 clip_min(pcmd->ClipRect.x - clip_off.x, pcmd->ClipRect.y - clip_off.y);
316 ImVec2 clip_max(pcmd->ClipRect.z - clip_off.x, pcmd->ClipRect.w - clip_off.y);
317 if (clip_max.x <= clip_min.x || clip_max.y <= clip_min.y)
318 continue;
319
320 // We are using scissoring to clip some objects. All low-level graphics API should support it.
321 // - If your engine doesn't support scissoring yet, you may ignore this at first. You will get some small glitches
322 // (some elements visible outside their bounds) but you can fix that once everything else works!
323 // - Clipping coordinates are provided in imgui coordinates space:
324 // - For a given viewport, draw_data->DisplayPos == viewport->Pos and draw_data->DisplaySize == viewport->Size
325 // - In a single viewport application, draw_data->DisplayPos == (0,0) and draw_data->DisplaySize == io.DisplaySize, but always use GetMainViewport()->Pos/Size instead of hardcoding those values.
326 // - In the interest of supporting multi-viewport applications (see 'docking' branch on github),
327 // always subtract draw_data->DisplayPos from clipping bounds to convert them to your viewport space.
328 // - Note that pcmd->ClipRect contains Min+Max bounds. Some graphics API may use Min+Max, other may use Min+Size (size being Max-Min)
329 MyEngineSetScissor(clip_min.x, clip_min.y, clip_max.x, clip_max.y);
330
331 // The texture for the draw call is specified by pcmd->GetTexID().
332 // The vast majority of draw calls will use the Dear ImGui texture atlas, which value you have set yourself during initialization.
333 MyEngineBindTexture((MyTexture*)pcmd->GetTexID());
334
335 // Render 'pcmd->ElemCount/3' indexed triangles.
336 // By default the indices ImDrawIdx are 16-bit, you can change them to 32-bit in imconfig.h if your engine doesn't support 16-bit indices.
337 MyEngineDrawIndexedTriangles(pcmd->ElemCount, sizeof(ImDrawIdx) == 2 ? GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT : GL_UNSIGNED_INT, idx_buffer + pcmd->IdxOffset, vtx_buffer, pcmd->VtxOffset);
338 }
339 }
340 }
341 }
342
343
344 USING GAMEPAD/KEYBOARD NAVIGATION CONTROLS
345 ------------------------------------------
346 - The gamepad/keyboard navigation is fairly functional and keeps being improved.
347 - Gamepad support is particularly useful to use Dear ImGui on a console system (e.g. PS4, Switch, XB1) without a mouse!
348 - You can ask questions and report issues at https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/787
349 - The initial focus was to support game controllers, but keyboard is becoming increasingly and decently usable.
350 - Keyboard:
351 - Set io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard to enable.
352 NewFrame() will automatically fill io.NavInputs[] based on your io.AddKeyEvent() calls.
353 - When keyboard navigation is active (io.NavActive + ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard), the io.WantCaptureKeyboard flag
354 will be set. For more advanced uses, you may want to read from:
355 - io.NavActive: true when a window is focused and it doesn't have the ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs flag set.
356 - io.NavVisible: true when the navigation cursor is visible (and usually goes false when mouse is used).
357 - or query focus information with e.g. IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags_AnyWindow), IsItemFocused() etc. functions.
358 Please reach out if you think the game vs navigation input sharing could be improved.
359 - Gamepad:
360 - Set io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad to enable.
361 - Backend: Set io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad + fill the io.NavInputs[] fields before calling NewFrame().
362 Note that io.NavInputs[] is cleared by EndFrame().
363 - See 'enum ImGuiNavInput_' in imgui.h for a description of inputs. For each entry of io.NavInputs[], set the following values:
364 0.0f= not held. 1.0f= fully held. Pass intermediate 0.0f..1.0f values for analog triggers/sticks.
365 - We use a simple >0.0f test for activation testing, and won't attempt to test for a dead-zone.
366 Your code will probably need to transform your raw inputs (such as e.g. remapping your 0.2..0.9 raw input range to 0.0..1.0 imgui range, etc.).
367 - You can download PNG/PSD files depicting the gamepad controls for common controllers at: http://dearimgui.org/controls_sheets
368 - If you need to share inputs between your game and the imgui parts, the easiest approach is to go all-or-nothing, with a buttons combo
369 to toggle the target. Please reach out if you think the game vs navigation input sharing could be improved.
370 - Mouse:
371 - PS4 users: Consider emulating a mouse cursor with DualShock4 touch pad or a spare analog stick as a mouse-emulation fallback.
372 - Consoles/Tablet/Phone users: Consider using a Synergy 1.x server (on your PC) + uSynergy.c (on your console/tablet/phone app) to share your PC mouse/keyboard.
373 - On a TV/console system where readability may be lower or mouse inputs may be awkward, you may want to set the ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos flag.
374 Enabling ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos + ImGuiBackendFlags_HasSetMousePos instructs dear imgui to move your mouse cursor along with navigation movements.
375 When enabled, the NewFrame() function may alter 'io.MousePos' and set 'io.WantSetMousePos' to notify you that it wants the mouse cursor to be moved.
376 When that happens your backend NEEDS to move the OS or underlying mouse cursor on the next frame. Some of the backends in examples/ do that.
377 (If you set the NavEnableSetMousePos flag but don't honor 'io.WantSetMousePos' properly, imgui will misbehave as it will see your mouse moving back and forth!)
378 (In a setup when you may not have easy control over the mouse cursor, e.g. uSynergy.c doesn't expose moving remote mouse cursor, you may want
379 to set a boolean to ignore your other external mouse positions until the external source is moved again.)
380
381
382 API BREAKING CHANGES
383 ====================
384
385 Occasionally introducing changes that are breaking the API. We try to make the breakage minor and easy to fix.
386 Below is a change-log of API breaking changes only. If you are using one of the functions listed, expect to have to fix some code.
387 When you are not sure about an old symbol or function name, try using the Search/Find function of your IDE to look for comments or references in all imgui files.
388 You can read releases logs https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/releases for more details.
389
390(Docking/Viewport Branch)
391 - 2021/XX/XX (1.XX) - when multi-viewports are enabled, all positions will be in your natural OS coordinates space. It means that:
392 - reference to hard-coded positions such as in SetNextWindowPos(ImVec2(0,0)) are probably not what you want anymore.
393 you may use GetMainViewport()->Pos to offset hard-coded positions, e.g. SetNextWindowPos(GetMainViewport()->Pos)
394 - likewise io.MousePos and GetMousePos() will use OS coordinates.
395 If you query mouse positions to interact with non-imgui coordinates you will need to offset them, e.g. subtract GetWindowViewport()->Pos.
396
397 - 2022/01/10 (1.87) - inputs: reworked keyboard IO. Removed io.KeyMap[], io.KeysDown[] in favor of calling io.AddKeyEvent(). Removed GetKeyIndex(), now unecessary. All IsKeyXXX() functions now take ImGuiKey values. All features are still functional until IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO is defined. Read Changelog and Release Notes for details.
398 - IsKeyPressed(MY_NATIVE_KEY_XXX) -> use IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_XXX)
399 - IsKeyPressed(GetKeyIndex(ImGuiKey_XXX)) -> use IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_XXX)
400 - Backend writing to io.KeyMap[],io.KeysDown[] -> backend should call io.AddKeyEvent()
401 - one case won't work with backward compatibility: if your custom backend used ImGuiKey as mock native indices (e.g. "io.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_A] = ImGuiKey_A") because those values are now larger than the legacy KeyDown[] array. Will assert.
402 - inputs: added io.AddKeyModsEvent() instead of writing directly to io.KeyCtrl, io.KeyShift, io.KeyAlt, io.KeySuper.
403 - 2022/01/05 (1.87) - inputs: renamed ImGuiKey_KeyPadEnter to ImGuiKey_KeypadEnter to align with new symbols. Kept redirection enum.
404 - 2022/01/05 (1.87) - removed io.ImeSetInputScreenPosFn() in favor of more flexible io.SetPlatformImeDataFn(). Removed 'void* io.ImeWindowHandle' in favor of writing to 'void* ImGuiViewport::PlatformHandleRaw'.
405 - 2022/01/01 (1.87) - commented out redirecting functions/enums names that were marked obsolete in 1.69, 1.70, 1.71, 1.72 (March-July 2019)
406 - ImGui::SetNextTreeNodeOpen() -> use ImGui::SetNextItemOpen()
407 - ImGui::GetContentRegionAvailWidth() -> use ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x
408 - ImGui::TreeAdvanceToLabelPos() -> use ImGui::SetCursorPosX(ImGui::GetCursorPosX() + ImGui::GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing());
409 - ImFontAtlas::CustomRect -> use ImFontAtlasCustomRect
410 - ImGuiColorEditFlags_RGB/HSV/HEX -> use ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB/HSV/Hex
411 - 2021/12/20 (1.86) - backends: removed obsolete Marmalade backend (imgui_impl_marmalade.cpp) + example. Find last supported version at https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Bindings
412 - 2021/11/04 (1.86) - removed CalcListClipping() function. Prefer using ImGuiListClipper which can return non-contiguous ranges. Please open an issue if you think you really need this function.
413 - 2021/08/23 (1.85) - removed GetWindowContentRegionWidth() function. keep inline redirection helper. can use 'GetWindowContentRegionMax().x - GetWindowContentRegionMin().x' instead for generally 'GetContentRegionAvail().x' is more useful.
414 - 2021/07/26 (1.84) - commented out redirecting functions/enums names that were marked obsolete in 1.67 and 1.69 (March 2019):
415 - ImGui::GetOverlayDrawList() -> use ImGui::GetForegroundDrawList()
416 - ImFont::GlyphRangesBuilder -> use ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder
417 - 2021/05/19 (1.83) - backends: obsoleted direct access to ImDrawCmd::TextureId in favor of calling ImDrawCmd::GetTexID().
418 - if you are using official backends from the source tree: you have nothing to do.
419 - if you have copied old backend code or using your own: change access to draw_cmd->TextureId to draw_cmd->GetTexID().
420 - 2021/03/12 (1.82) - upgraded ImDrawList::AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect() to use ImDrawFlags instead of ImDrawCornersFlags.
421 - ImDrawCornerFlags_TopLeft -> use ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopLeft
422 - ImDrawCornerFlags_BotRight -> use ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight
423 - ImDrawCornerFlags_None -> use ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersNone etc.
424 flags now sanely defaults to 0 instead of 0x0F, consistent with all other flags in the API.
425 breaking: the default with rounding > 0.0f is now "round all corners" vs old implicit "round no corners":
426 - rounding == 0.0f + flags == 0 --> meant no rounding --> unchanged (common use)
427 - rounding > 0.0f + flags != 0 --> meant rounding --> unchanged (common use)
428 - rounding == 0.0f + flags != 0 --> meant no rounding --> unchanged (unlikely use)
429 - rounding > 0.0f + flags == 0 --> meant no rounding --> BREAKING (unlikely use): will now round all corners --> use ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersNone or rounding == 0.0f.
430 this ONLY matters for hard coded use of 0 + rounding > 0.0f. Use of named ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersNone (new) or ImDrawCornerFlags_None (old) are ok.
431 the old ImDrawCornersFlags used awkward default values of ~0 or 0xF (4 lower bits set) to signify "round all corners" and we sometimes encouraged using them as shortcuts.
432 legacy path still support use of hard coded ~0 or any value from 0x1 or 0xF. They will behave the same with legacy paths enabled (will assert otherwise).
433 - 2021/03/11 (1.82) - removed redirecting functions/enums names that were marked obsolete in 1.66 (September 2018):
434 - ImGui::SetScrollHere() -> use ImGui::SetScrollHereY()
435 - 2021/03/11 (1.82) - clarified that ImDrawList::PathArcTo(), ImDrawList::PathArcToFast() won't render with radius < 0.0f. Previously it sorts of accidentally worked but would generally lead to counter-clockwise paths and have an effect on anti-aliasing.
436 - 2021/03/10 (1.82) - upgraded ImDrawList::AddPolyline() and PathStroke() "bool closed" parameter to "ImDrawFlags flags". The matching ImDrawFlags_Closed value is guaranteed to always stay == 1 in the future.
437 - 2021/02/22 (1.82) - (*undone in 1.84*) win32+mingw: Re-enabled IME functions by default even under MinGW. In July 2016, issue #738 had me incorrectly disable those default functions for MinGW. MinGW users should: either link with -limm32, either set their imconfig file with '#define IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_IME_FUNCTIONS'.
438 - 2021/02/17 (1.82) - renamed rarely used style.CircleSegmentMaxError (old default = 1.60f) to style.CircleTessellationMaxError (new default = 0.30f) as the meaning of the value changed.
439 - 2021/02/03 (1.81) - renamed ListBoxHeader(const char* label, ImVec2 size) to BeginListBox(). Kept inline redirection function (will obsolete).
440 - removed ListBoxHeader(const char* label, int items_count, int height_in_items = -1) in favor of specifying size. Kept inline redirection function (will obsolete).
441 - renamed ListBoxFooter() to EndListBox(). Kept inline redirection function (will obsolete).
442 - 2021/01/26 (1.81) - removed ImGuiFreeType::BuildFontAtlas(). Kept inline redirection function. Prefer using '#define IMGUI_ENABLE_FREETYPE', but there's a runtime selection path available too. The shared extra flags parameters (very rarely used) are now stored in ImFontAtlas::FontBuilderFlags.
443 - renamed ImFontConfig::RasterizerFlags (used by FreeType) to ImFontConfig::FontBuilderFlags.
444 - renamed ImGuiFreeType::XXX flags to ImGuiFreeTypeBuilderFlags_XXX for consistency with other API.
445 - 2020/10/12 (1.80) - removed redirecting functions/enums that were marked obsolete in 1.63 (August 2018):
446 - ImGui::IsItemDeactivatedAfterChange() -> use ImGui::IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit().
447 - ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDarkening -> use ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg
448 - ImGuiInputTextCallback -> use ImGuiTextEditCallback
449 - ImGuiInputTextCallbackData -> use ImGuiTextEditCallbackData
450 - 2020/12/21 (1.80) - renamed ImDrawList::AddBezierCurve() to AddBezierCubic(), and PathBezierCurveTo() to PathBezierCubicCurveTo(). Kept inline redirection function (will obsolete).
451 - 2020/12/04 (1.80) - added imgui_tables.cpp file! Manually constructed project files will need the new file added!
452 - 2020/11/18 (1.80) - renamed undocumented/internals ImGuiColumnsFlags_* to ImGuiOldColumnFlags_* in prevision of incoming Tables API.
453 - 2020/11/03 (1.80) - renamed io.ConfigWindowsMemoryCompactTimer to io.ConfigMemoryCompactTimer as the feature will apply to other data structures
454 - 2020/10/14 (1.80) - backends: moved all backends files (imgui_impl_XXXX.cpp, imgui_impl_XXXX.h) from examples/ to backends/.
455 - 2020/10/12 (1.80) - removed redirecting functions/enums that were marked obsolete in 1.60 (April 2018):
456 - io.RenderDrawListsFn pointer -> use ImGui::GetDrawData() value and call the render function of your backend
457 - ImGui::IsAnyWindowFocused() -> use ImGui::IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags_AnyWindow)
458 - ImGui::IsAnyWindowHovered() -> use ImGui::IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow)
459 - ImGuiStyleVar_Count_ -> use ImGuiStyleVar_COUNT
460 - ImGuiMouseCursor_Count_ -> use ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT
461 - removed redirecting functions names that were marked obsolete in 1.61 (May 2018):
462 - InputFloat (... int decimal_precision ...) -> use InputFloat (... const char* format ...) with format = "%.Xf" where X is your value for decimal_precision.
463 - same for InputFloat2()/InputFloat3()/InputFloat4() variants taking a `int decimal_precision` parameter.
464 - 2020/10/05 (1.79) - removed ImGuiListClipper: Renamed constructor parameters which created an ambiguous alternative to using the ImGuiListClipper::Begin() function, with misleading edge cases (note: imgui_memory_editor <0.40 from imgui_club/ used this old clipper API. Update your copy if needed).
465 - 2020/09/25 (1.79) - renamed ImGuiSliderFlags_ClampOnInput to ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp. Kept redirection enum (will obsolete sooner because previous name was added recently).
466 - 2020/09/25 (1.79) - renamed style.TabMinWidthForUnselectedCloseButton to style.TabMinWidthForCloseButton.
467 - 2020/09/21 (1.79) - renamed OpenPopupContextItem() back to OpenPopupOnItemClick(), reverting the change from 1.77. For varieties of reason this is more self-explanatory.
468 - 2020/09/21 (1.79) - removed return value from OpenPopupOnItemClick() - returned true on mouse release on an item - because it is inconsistent with other popup APIs and makes others misleading. It's also and unnecessary: you can use IsWindowAppearing() after BeginPopup() for a similar result.
469 - 2020/09/17 (1.79) - removed ImFont::DisplayOffset in favor of ImFontConfig::GlyphOffset. DisplayOffset was applied after scaling and not very meaningful/useful outside of being needed by the default ProggyClean font. If you scaled this value after calling AddFontDefault(), this is now done automatically. It was also getting in the way of better font scaling, so let's get rid of it now!
470 - 2020/08/17 (1.78) - obsoleted use of the trailing 'float power=1.0f' parameter for DragFloat(), DragFloat2(), DragFloat3(), DragFloat4(), DragFloatRange2(), DragScalar(), DragScalarN(), SliderFloat(), SliderFloat2(), SliderFloat3(), SliderFloat4(), SliderScalar(), SliderScalarN(), VSliderFloat() and VSliderScalar().
471 replaced the 'float power=1.0f' argument with integer-based flags defaulting to 0 (as with all our flags).
472 worked out a backward-compatibility scheme so hopefully most C++ codebase should not be affected. in short, when calling those functions:
473 - if you omitted the 'power' parameter (likely!), you are not affected.
474 - if you set the 'power' parameter to 1.0f (same as previous default value): 1/ your compiler may warn on float>int conversion, 2/ everything else will work. 3/ you can replace the 1.0f value with 0 to fix the warning, and be technically correct.
475 - if you set the 'power' parameter to >1.0f (to enable non-linear editing): 1/ your compiler may warn on float>int conversion, 2/ code will assert at runtime, 3/ in case asserts are disabled, the code will not crash and enable the _Logarithmic flag. 4/ you can replace the >1.0f value with ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic to fix the warning/assert and get a _similar_ effect as previous uses of power >1.0f.
476 see https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/3361 for all details.
477 kept inline redirection functions (will obsolete) apart for: DragFloatRange2(), VSliderFloat(), VSliderScalar(). For those three the 'float power=1.0f' version was removed directly as they were most unlikely ever used.
478 for shared code, you can version check at compile-time with `#if IMGUI_VERSION_NUM >= 17704`.
479 - obsoleted use of v_min > v_max in DragInt, DragFloat, DragScalar to lock edits (introduced in 1.73, was not demoed nor documented very), will be replaced by a more generic ReadOnly feature. You may use the ImGuiSliderFlags_ReadOnly internal flag in the meantime.
480 - 2020/06/23 (1.77) - removed BeginPopupContextWindow(const char*, int mouse_button, bool also_over_items) in favor of BeginPopupContextWindow(const char*, ImGuiPopupFlags flags) with ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOverItems.
481 - 2020/06/15 (1.77) - renamed OpenPopupOnItemClick() to OpenPopupContextItem(). Kept inline redirection function (will obsolete). [NOTE: THIS WAS REVERTED IN 1.79]
482 - 2020/06/15 (1.77) - removed CalcItemRectClosestPoint() entry point which was made obsolete and asserting in December 2017.
483 - 2020/04/23 (1.77) - removed unnecessary ID (first arg) of ImFontAtlas::AddCustomRectRegular().
484 - 2020/01/22 (1.75) - ImDrawList::AddCircle()/AddCircleFilled() functions don't accept negative radius any more.
485 - 2019/12/17 (1.75) - [undid this change in 1.76] made Columns() limited to 64 columns by asserting above that limit. While the current code technically supports it, future code may not so we're putting the restriction ahead.
486 - 2019/12/13 (1.75) - [imgui_internal.h] changed ImRect() default constructor initializes all fields to 0.0f instead of (FLT_MAX,FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX). If you used ImRect::Add() to create bounding boxes by adding multiple points into it, you may need to fix your initial value.
487 - 2019/12/08 (1.75) - removed redirecting functions/enums that were marked obsolete in 1.53 (December 2017):
488 - ShowTestWindow() -> use ShowDemoWindow()
489 - IsRootWindowFocused() -> use IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow)
490 - IsRootWindowOrAnyChildFocused() -> use IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootAndChildWindows)
491 - SetNextWindowContentWidth(w) -> use SetNextWindowContentSize(ImVec2(w, 0.0f)
492 - GetItemsLineHeightWithSpacing() -> use GetFrameHeightWithSpacing()
493 - ImGuiCol_ChildWindowBg -> use ImGuiCol_ChildBg
494 - ImGuiStyleVar_ChildWindowRounding -> use ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding
495 - ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_AllowOverlapMode -> use ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_AllowItemOverlap
496 - IMGUI_DISABLE_TEST_WINDOWS -> use IMGUI_DISABLE_DEMO_WINDOWS
497 - 2019/12/08 (1.75) - obsoleted calling ImDrawList::PrimReserve() with a negative count (which was vaguely documented and rarely if ever used). Instead, we added an explicit PrimUnreserve() API.
498 - 2019/12/06 (1.75) - removed implicit default parameter to IsMouseDragging(int button = 0) to be consistent with other mouse functions (none of the other functions have it).
499 - 2019/11/21 (1.74) - ImFontAtlas::AddCustomRectRegular() now requires an ID larger than 0x110000 (instead of 0x10000) to conform with supporting Unicode planes 1-16 in a future update. ID below 0x110000 will now assert.
500 - 2019/11/19 (1.74) - renamed IMGUI_DISABLE_FORMAT_STRING_FUNCTIONS to IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_FORMAT_FUNCTIONS for consistency.
501 - 2019/11/19 (1.74) - renamed IMGUI_DISABLE_MATH_FUNCTIONS to IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_MATH_FUNCTIONS for consistency.
502 - 2019/10/22 (1.74) - removed redirecting functions/enums that were marked obsolete in 1.52 (October 2017):
503 - Begin() [old 5 args version] -> use Begin() [3 args], use SetNextWindowSize() SetNextWindowBgAlpha() if needed
504 - IsRootWindowOrAnyChildHovered() -> use IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootAndChildWindows)
505 - AlignFirstTextHeightToWidgets() -> use AlignTextToFramePadding()
506 - SetNextWindowPosCenter() -> use SetNextWindowPos() with a pivot of (0.5f, 0.5f)
507 - ImFont::Glyph -> use ImFontGlyph
508 - 2019/10/14 (1.74) - inputs: Fixed a miscalculation in the keyboard/mouse "typematic" repeat delay/rate calculation, used by keys and e.g. repeating mouse buttons as well as the GetKeyPressedAmount() function.
509 if you were using a non-default value for io.KeyRepeatRate (previous default was 0.250), you can add +io.KeyRepeatDelay to it to compensate for the fix.
510 The function was triggering on: 0.0 and (delay+rate*N) where (N>=1). Fixed formula responds to (N>=0). Effectively it made io.KeyRepeatRate behave like it was set to (io.KeyRepeatRate + io.KeyRepeatDelay).
511 If you never altered io.KeyRepeatRate nor used GetKeyPressedAmount() this won't affect you.
512 - 2019/07/15 (1.72) - removed TreeAdvanceToLabelPos() which is rarely used and only does SetCursorPosX(GetCursorPosX() + GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing()). Kept redirection function (will obsolete).
513 - 2019/07/12 (1.72) - renamed ImFontAtlas::CustomRect to ImFontAtlasCustomRect. Kept redirection typedef (will obsolete).
514 - 2019/06/14 (1.72) - removed redirecting functions/enums names that were marked obsolete in 1.51 (June 2017): ImGuiCol_Column*, ImGuiSetCond_*, IsItemHoveredRect(), IsPosHoveringAnyWindow(), IsMouseHoveringAnyWindow(), IsMouseHoveringWindow(), IMGUI_ONCE_UPON_A_FRAME. Grep this log for details and new names, or see how they were implemented until 1.71.
515 - 2019/06/07 (1.71) - rendering of child window outer decorations (bg color, border, scrollbars) is now performed as part of the parent window. If you have
516 overlapping child windows in a same parent, and relied on their relative z-order to be mapped to their submission order, this will affect your rendering.
517 This optimization is disabled if the parent window has no visual output, because it appears to be the most common situation leading to the creation of overlapping child windows.
518 Please reach out if you are affected.
519 - 2019/05/13 (1.71) - renamed SetNextTreeNodeOpen() to SetNextItemOpen(). Kept inline redirection function (will obsolete).
520 - 2019/05/11 (1.71) - changed io.AddInputCharacter(unsigned short c) signature to io.AddInputCharacter(unsigned int c).
521 - 2019/04/29 (1.70) - improved ImDrawList thick strokes (>1.0f) preserving correct thickness up to 90 degrees angles (e.g. rectangles). If you have custom rendering using thick lines, they will appear thicker now.
522 - 2019/04/29 (1.70) - removed GetContentRegionAvailWidth(), use GetContentRegionAvail().x instead. Kept inline redirection function (will obsolete).
523 - 2019/03/04 (1.69) - renamed GetOverlayDrawList() to GetForegroundDrawList(). Kept redirection function (will obsolete).
524 - 2019/02/26 (1.69) - renamed ImGuiColorEditFlags_RGB/ImGuiColorEditFlags_HSV/ImGuiColorEditFlags_HEX to ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB/ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV/ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex. Kept redirection enums (will obsolete).
525 - 2019/02/14 (1.68) - made it illegal/assert when io.DisplayTime == 0.0f (with an exception for the first frame). If for some reason your time step calculation gives you a zero value, replace it with an arbitrarily small value!
526 - 2019/02/01 (1.68) - removed io.DisplayVisibleMin/DisplayVisibleMax (which were marked obsolete and removed from viewport/docking branch already).
527 - 2019/01/06 (1.67) - renamed io.InputCharacters[], marked internal as was always intended. Please don't access directly, and use AddInputCharacter() instead!
528 - 2019/01/06 (1.67) - renamed ImFontAtlas::GlyphRangesBuilder to ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder. Kept redirection typedef (will obsolete).
529 - 2018/12/20 (1.67) - made it illegal to call Begin("") with an empty string. This somehow half-worked before but had various undesirable side-effects.
530 - 2018/12/10 (1.67) - renamed io.ConfigResizeWindowsFromEdges to io.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges as we are doing a large pass on configuration flags.
531 - 2018/10/12 (1.66) - renamed misc/stl/imgui_stl.* to misc/cpp/imgui_stdlib.* in prevision for other C++ helper files.
532 - 2018/09/28 (1.66) - renamed SetScrollHere() to SetScrollHereY(). Kept redirection function (will obsolete).
533 - 2018/09/06 (1.65) - renamed stb_truetype.h to imstb_truetype.h, stb_textedit.h to imstb_textedit.h, and stb_rect_pack.h to imstb_rectpack.h.
534 If you were conveniently using the imgui copy of those STB headers in your project you will have to update your include paths.
535 - 2018/09/05 (1.65) - renamed io.OptCursorBlink/io.ConfigCursorBlink to io.ConfigInputTextCursorBlink. (#1427)
536 - 2018/08/31 (1.64) - added imgui_widgets.cpp file, extracted and moved widgets code out of imgui.cpp into imgui_widgets.cpp. Re-ordered some of the code remaining in imgui.cpp.
537 NONE OF THE FUNCTIONS HAVE CHANGED. THE CODE IS SEMANTICALLY 100% IDENTICAL, BUT _EVERY_ FUNCTION HAS BEEN MOVED.
538 Because of this, any local modifications to imgui.cpp will likely conflict when you update. Read docs/CHANGELOG.txt for suggestions.
539 - 2018/08/22 (1.63) - renamed IsItemDeactivatedAfterChange() to IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit() for consistency with new IsItemEdited() API. Kept redirection function (will obsolete soonish as IsItemDeactivatedAfterChange() is very recent).
540 - 2018/08/21 (1.63) - renamed ImGuiTextEditCallback to ImGuiInputTextCallback, ImGuiTextEditCallbackData to ImGuiInputTextCallbackData for consistency. Kept redirection types (will obsolete).
541 - 2018/08/21 (1.63) - removed ImGuiInputTextCallbackData::ReadOnly since it is a duplication of (ImGuiInputTextCallbackData::Flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly).
542 - 2018/08/01 (1.63) - removed per-window ImGuiWindowFlags_ResizeFromAnySide beta flag in favor of a global io.ConfigResizeWindowsFromEdges [update 1.67 renamed to ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges] to enable the feature.
543 - 2018/08/01 (1.63) - renamed io.OptCursorBlink to io.ConfigCursorBlink [-> io.ConfigInputTextCursorBlink in 1.65], io.OptMacOSXBehaviors to ConfigMacOSXBehaviors for consistency.
544 - 2018/07/22 (1.63) - changed ImGui::GetTime() return value from float to double to avoid accumulating floating point imprecisions over time.
545 - 2018/07/08 (1.63) - style: renamed ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDarkening to ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg for consistency with other features. Kept redirection enum (will obsolete).
546 - 2018/06/08 (1.62) - examples: the imgui_impl_XXX files have been split to separate platform (Win32, GLFW, SDL2, etc.) from renderer (DX11, OpenGL, Vulkan, etc.).
547 old backends will still work as is, however prefer using the separated backends as they will be updated to support multi-viewports.
548 when adopting new backends follow the main.cpp code of your preferred examples/ folder to know which functions to call.
549 in particular, note that old backends called ImGui::NewFrame() at the end of their ImGui_ImplXXXX_NewFrame() function.
550 - 2018/06/06 (1.62) - renamed GetGlyphRangesChinese() to GetGlyphRangesChineseFull() to distinguish other variants and discourage using the full set.
551 - 2018/06/06 (1.62) - TreeNodeEx()/TreeNodeBehavior(): the ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_CollapsingHeader helper now include the ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen flag. See Changelog for details.
552 - 2018/05/03 (1.61) - DragInt(): the default compile-time format string has been changed from "%.0f" to "%d", as we are not using integers internally any more.
553 If you used DragInt() with custom format strings, make sure you change them to use %d or an integer-compatible format.
554 To honor backward-compatibility, the DragInt() code will currently parse and modify format strings to replace %*f with %d, giving time to users to upgrade their code.
555 If you have IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS enabled, the code will instead assert! You may run a reg-exp search on your codebase for e.g. "DragInt.*%f" to help you find them.
556 - 2018/04/28 (1.61) - obsoleted InputFloat() functions taking an optional "int decimal_precision" in favor of an equivalent and more flexible "const char* format",
557 consistent with other functions. Kept redirection functions (will obsolete).
558 - 2018/04/09 (1.61) - IM_DELETE() helper function added in 1.60 doesn't clear the input _pointer_ reference, more consistent with expectation and allows passing r-value.
559 - 2018/03/20 (1.60) - renamed io.WantMoveMouse to io.WantSetMousePos for consistency and ease of understanding (was added in 1.52, _not_ used by core and only honored by some backend ahead of merging the Nav branch).
560 - 2018/03/12 (1.60) - removed ImGuiCol_CloseButton, ImGuiCol_CloseButtonActive, ImGuiCol_CloseButtonHovered as the closing cross uses regular button colors now.
561 - 2018/03/08 (1.60) - changed ImFont::DisplayOffset.y to default to 0 instead of +1. Fixed rounding of Ascent/Descent to match TrueType renderer. If you were adding or subtracting to ImFont::DisplayOffset check if your fonts are correctly aligned vertically.
562 - 2018/03/03 (1.60) - renamed ImGuiStyleVar_Count_ to ImGuiStyleVar_COUNT and ImGuiMouseCursor_Count_ to ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT for consistency with other public enums.
563 - 2018/02/18 (1.60) - BeginDragDropSource(): temporarily removed the optional mouse_button=0 parameter because it is not really usable in many situations at the moment.
564 - 2018/02/16 (1.60) - obsoleted the io.RenderDrawListsFn callback, you can call your graphics engine render function after ImGui::Render(). Use ImGui::GetDrawData() to retrieve the ImDrawData* to display.
565 - 2018/02/07 (1.60) - reorganized context handling to be more explicit,
566 - YOU NOW NEED TO CALL ImGui::CreateContext() AT THE BEGINNING OF YOUR APP, AND CALL ImGui::DestroyContext() AT THE END.
567 - removed Shutdown() function, as DestroyContext() serve this purpose.
568 - you may pass a ImFontAtlas* pointer to CreateContext() to share a font atlas between contexts. Otherwise CreateContext() will create its own font atlas instance.
569 - removed allocator parameters from CreateContext(), they are now setup with SetAllocatorFunctions(), and shared by all contexts.
570 - removed the default global context and font atlas instance, which were confusing for users of DLL reloading and users of multiple contexts.
571 - 2018/01/31 (1.60) - moved sample TTF files from extra_fonts/ to misc/fonts/. If you loaded files directly from the imgui repo you may need to update your paths.
572 - 2018/01/11 (1.60) - obsoleted IsAnyWindowHovered() in favor of IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow). Kept redirection function (will obsolete).
573 - 2018/01/11 (1.60) - obsoleted IsAnyWindowFocused() in favor of IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags_AnyWindow). Kept redirection function (will obsolete).
574 - 2018/01/03 (1.60) - renamed ImGuiSizeConstraintCallback to ImGuiSizeCallback, ImGuiSizeConstraintCallbackData to ImGuiSizeCallbackData.
575 - 2017/12/29 (1.60) - removed CalcItemRectClosestPoint() which was weird and not really used by anyone except demo code. If you need it it's easy to replicate on your side.
576 - 2017/12/24 (1.53) - renamed the emblematic ShowTestWindow() function to ShowDemoWindow(). Kept redirection function (will obsolete).
577 - 2017/12/21 (1.53) - ImDrawList: renamed style.AntiAliasedShapes to style.AntiAliasedFill for consistency and as a way to explicitly break code that manipulate those flag at runtime. You can now manipulate ImDrawList::Flags
578 - 2017/12/21 (1.53) - ImDrawList: removed 'bool anti_aliased = true' final parameter of ImDrawList::AddPolyline() and ImDrawList::AddConvexPolyFilled(). Prefer manipulating ImDrawList::Flags if you need to toggle them during the frame.
579 - 2017/12/14 (1.53) - using the ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse flag on a child window forwards the mouse wheel event to the parent window, unless either ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs or ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar are also set.
580 - 2017/12/13 (1.53) - renamed GetItemsLineHeightWithSpacing() to GetFrameHeightWithSpacing(). Kept redirection function (will obsolete).
581 - 2017/12/13 (1.53) - obsoleted IsRootWindowFocused() in favor of using IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow). Kept redirection function (will obsolete).
582 - obsoleted IsRootWindowOrAnyChildFocused() in favor of using IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootAndChildWindows). Kept redirection function (will obsolete).
583 - 2017/12/12 (1.53) - renamed ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_AllowOverlapMode to ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_AllowItemOverlap. Kept redirection enum (will obsolete).
584 - 2017/12/10 (1.53) - removed SetNextWindowContentWidth(), prefer using SetNextWindowContentSize(). Kept redirection function (will obsolete).
585 - 2017/11/27 (1.53) - renamed ImGuiTextBuffer::append() helper to appendf(), appendv() to appendfv(). If you copied the 'Log' demo in your code, it uses appendv() so that needs to be renamed.
586 - 2017/11/18 (1.53) - Style, Begin: removed ImGuiWindowFlags_ShowBorders window flag. Borders are now fully set up in the ImGuiStyle structure (see e.g. style.FrameBorderSize, style.WindowBorderSize). Use ImGui::ShowStyleEditor() to look them up.
587 Please note that the style system will keep evolving (hopefully stabilizing in Q1 2018), and so custom styles will probably subtly break over time. It is recommended you use the StyleColorsClassic(), StyleColorsDark(), StyleColorsLight() functions.
588 - 2017/11/18 (1.53) - Style: removed ImGuiCol_ComboBg in favor of combo boxes using ImGuiCol_PopupBg for consistency.
589 - 2017/11/18 (1.53) - Style: renamed ImGuiCol_ChildWindowBg to ImGuiCol_ChildBg.
590 - 2017/11/18 (1.53) - Style: renamed style.ChildWindowRounding to style.ChildRounding, ImGuiStyleVar_ChildWindowRounding to ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding.
591 - 2017/11/02 (1.53) - obsoleted IsRootWindowOrAnyChildHovered() in favor of using IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootAndChildWindows);
592 - 2017/10/24 (1.52) - renamed IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_CLIPBOARD_FUNCS/IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_IME_FUNCS to IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_CLIPBOARD_FUNCTIONS/IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_IME_FUNCTIONS for consistency.
593 - 2017/10/20 (1.52) - changed IsWindowHovered() default parameters behavior to return false if an item is active in another window (e.g. click-dragging item from another window to this window). You can use the newly introduced IsWindowHovered() flags to requests this specific behavior if you need it.
594 - 2017/10/20 (1.52) - marked IsItemHoveredRect()/IsMouseHoveringWindow() as obsolete, in favor of using the newly introduced flags for IsItemHovered() and IsWindowHovered(). See https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/1382 for details.
595 removed the IsItemRectHovered()/IsWindowRectHovered() names introduced in 1.51 since they were merely more consistent names for the two functions we are now obsoleting.
596 IsItemHoveredRect() --> IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_RectOnly)
597 IsMouseHoveringAnyWindow() --> IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow)
598 IsMouseHoveringWindow() --> IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup | ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem) [weird, old behavior]
599 - 2017/10/17 (1.52) - marked the old 5-parameters version of Begin() as obsolete (still available). Use SetNextWindowSize()+Begin() instead!
600 - 2017/10/11 (1.52) - renamed AlignFirstTextHeightToWidgets() to AlignTextToFramePadding(). Kept inline redirection function (will obsolete).
601 - 2017/09/26 (1.52) - renamed ImFont::Glyph to ImFontGlyph. Kept redirection typedef (will obsolete).
602 - 2017/09/25 (1.52) - removed SetNextWindowPosCenter() because SetNextWindowPos() now has the optional pivot information to do the same and more. Kept redirection function (will obsolete).
603 - 2017/08/25 (1.52) - io.MousePos needs to be set to ImVec2(-FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX) when mouse is unavailable/missing. Previously ImVec2(-1,-1) was enough but we now accept negative mouse coordinates. In your backend if you need to support unavailable mouse, make sure to replace "io.MousePos = ImVec2(-1,-1)" with "io.MousePos = ImVec2(-FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX)".
604 - 2017/08/22 (1.51) - renamed IsItemHoveredRect() to IsItemRectHovered(). Kept inline redirection function (will obsolete). -> (1.52) use IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_RectOnly)!
605 - renamed IsMouseHoveringAnyWindow() to IsAnyWindowHovered() for consistency. Kept inline redirection function (will obsolete).
606 - renamed IsMouseHoveringWindow() to IsWindowRectHovered() for consistency. Kept inline redirection function (will obsolete).
607 - 2017/08/20 (1.51) - renamed GetStyleColName() to GetStyleColorName() for consistency.
608 - 2017/08/20 (1.51) - added PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol idx, ImU32 col) overload, which _might_ cause an "ambiguous call" compilation error if you are using ImColor() with implicit cast. Cast to ImU32 or ImVec4 explicily to fix.
609 - 2017/08/15 (1.51) - marked the weird IMGUI_ONCE_UPON_A_FRAME helper macro as obsolete. prefer using the more explicit ImGuiOnceUponAFrame type.
610 - 2017/08/15 (1.51) - changed parameter order for BeginPopupContextWindow() from (const char*,int buttons,bool also_over_items) to (const char*,int buttons,bool also_over_items). Note that most calls relied on default parameters completely.
611 - 2017/08/13 (1.51) - renamed ImGuiCol_Column to ImGuiCol_Separator, ImGuiCol_ColumnHovered to ImGuiCol_SeparatorHovered, ImGuiCol_ColumnActive to ImGuiCol_SeparatorActive. Kept redirection enums (will obsolete).
612 - 2017/08/11 (1.51) - renamed ImGuiSetCond_Always to ImGuiCond_Always, ImGuiSetCond_Once to ImGuiCond_Once, ImGuiSetCond_FirstUseEver to ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver, ImGuiSetCond_Appearing to ImGuiCond_Appearing. Kept redirection enums (will obsolete).
613 - 2017/08/09 (1.51) - removed ValueColor() helpers, they are equivalent to calling Text(label) + SameLine() + ColorButton().
614 - 2017/08/08 (1.51) - removed ColorEditMode() and ImGuiColorEditMode in favor of ImGuiColorEditFlags and parameters to the various Color*() functions. The SetColorEditOptions() allows to initialize default but the user can still change them with right-click context menu.
615 - changed prototype of 'ColorEdit4(const char* label, float col[4], bool show_alpha = true)' to 'ColorEdit4(const char* label, float col[4], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags = 0)', where passing flags = 0x01 is a safe no-op (hello dodgy backward compatibility!). - check and run the demo window, under "Color/Picker Widgets", to understand the various new options.
616 - changed prototype of rarely used 'ColorButton(ImVec4 col, bool small_height = false, bool outline_border = true)' to 'ColorButton(const char* desc_id, ImVec4 col, ImGuiColorEditFlags flags = 0, ImVec2 size = ImVec2(0, 0))'
617 - 2017/07/20 (1.51) - removed IsPosHoveringAnyWindow(ImVec2), which was partly broken and misleading. ASSERT + redirect user to io.WantCaptureMouse
618 - 2017/05/26 (1.50) - removed ImFontConfig::MergeGlyphCenterV in favor of a more multipurpose ImFontConfig::GlyphOffset.
619 - 2017/05/01 (1.50) - renamed ImDrawList::PathFill() (rarely used directly) to ImDrawList::PathFillConvex() for clarity.
620 - 2016/11/06 (1.50) - BeginChild(const char*) now applies the stack id to the provided label, consistently with other functions as it should always have been. It shouldn't affect you unless (extremely unlikely) you were appending multiple times to a same child from different locations of the stack id. If that's the case, generate an id with GetID() and use it instead of passing string to BeginChild().
621 - 2016/10/15 (1.50) - avoid 'void* user_data' parameter to io.SetClipboardTextFn/io.GetClipboardTextFn pointers. We pass io.ClipboardUserData to it.
622 - 2016/09/25 (1.50) - style.WindowTitleAlign is now a ImVec2 (ImGuiAlign enum was removed). set to (0.5f,0.5f) for horizontal+vertical centering, (0.0f,0.0f) for upper-left, etc.
623 - 2016/07/30 (1.50) - SameLine(x) with x>0.0f is now relative to left of column/group if any, and not always to left of window. This was sort of always the intent and hopefully, breakage should be minimal.
624 - 2016/05/12 (1.49) - title bar (using ImGuiCol_TitleBg/ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive colors) isn't rendered over a window background (ImGuiCol_WindowBg color) anymore.
625 If your TitleBg/TitleBgActive alpha was 1.0f or you are using the default theme it will not affect you, otherwise if <1.0f you need to tweak your custom theme to readjust for the fact that we don't draw a WindowBg background behind the title bar.
626 This helper function will convert an old TitleBg/TitleBgActive color into a new one with the same visual output, given the OLD color and the OLD WindowBg color:
627 ImVec4 ConvertTitleBgCol(const ImVec4& win_bg_col, const ImVec4& title_bg_col) { float new_a = 1.0f - ((1.0f - win_bg_col.w) * (1.0f - title_bg_col.w)), k = title_bg_col.w / new_a; return ImVec4((win_bg_col.x * win_bg_col.w + title_bg_col.x) * k, (win_bg_col.y * win_bg_col.w + title_bg_col.y) * k, (win_bg_col.z * win_bg_col.w + title_bg_col.z) * k, new_a); }
628 If this is confusing, pick the RGB value from title bar from an old screenshot and apply this as TitleBg/TitleBgActive. Or you may just create TitleBgActive from a tweaked TitleBg color.
629 - 2016/05/07 (1.49) - removed confusing set of GetInternalState(), GetInternalStateSize(), SetInternalState() functions. Now using CreateContext(), DestroyContext(), GetCurrentContext(), SetCurrentContext().
630 - 2016/05/02 (1.49) - renamed SetNextTreeNodeOpened() to SetNextTreeNodeOpen(), no redirection.
631 - 2016/05/01 (1.49) - obsoleted old signature of CollapsingHeader(const char* label, const char* str_id = NULL, bool display_frame = true, bool default_open = false) as extra parameters were badly designed and rarely used. You can replace the "default_open = true" flag in new API with CollapsingHeader(label, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen).
632 - 2016/04/26 (1.49) - changed ImDrawList::PushClipRect(ImVec4 rect) to ImDrawList::PushClipRect(Imvec2 min,ImVec2 max,bool intersect_with_current_clip_rect=false). Note that higher-level ImGui::PushClipRect() is preferable because it will clip at logic/widget level, whereas ImDrawList::PushClipRect() only affect your renderer.
633 - 2016/04/03 (1.48) - removed style.WindowFillAlphaDefault setting which was redundant. Bake default BG alpha inside style.Colors[ImGuiCol_WindowBg] and all other Bg color values. (ref GitHub issue #337).
634 - 2016/04/03 (1.48) - renamed ImGuiCol_TooltipBg to ImGuiCol_PopupBg, used by popups/menus and tooltips. popups/menus were previously using ImGuiCol_WindowBg. (ref github issue #337)
635 - 2016/03/21 (1.48) - renamed GetWindowFont() to GetFont(), GetWindowFontSize() to GetFontSize(). Kept inline redirection function (will obsolete).
636 - 2016/03/02 (1.48) - InputText() completion/history/always callbacks: if you modify the text buffer manually (without using DeleteChars()/InsertChars() helper) you need to maintain the BufTextLen field. added an assert.
637 - 2016/01/23 (1.48) - fixed not honoring exact width passed to PushItemWidth(), previously it would add extra FramePadding.x*2 over that width. if you had manual pixel-perfect alignment in place it might affect you.
638 - 2015/12/27 (1.48) - fixed ImDrawList::AddRect() which used to render a rectangle 1 px too large on each axis.
639 - 2015/12/04 (1.47) - renamed Color() helpers to ValueColor() - dangerously named, rarely used and probably to be made obsolete.
640 - 2015/08/29 (1.45) - with the addition of horizontal scrollbar we made various fixes to inconsistencies with dealing with cursor position.
641 GetCursorPos()/SetCursorPos() functions now include the scrolled amount. It shouldn't affect the majority of users, but take note that SetCursorPosX(100.0f) puts you at +100 from the starting x position which may include scrolling, not at +100 from the window left side.
642 GetContentRegionMax()/GetWindowContentRegionMin()/GetWindowContentRegionMax() functions allow include the scrolled amount. Typically those were used in cases where no scrolling would happen so it may not be a problem, but watch out!
643 - 2015/08/29 (1.45) - renamed style.ScrollbarWidth to style.ScrollbarSize
644 - 2015/08/05 (1.44) - split imgui.cpp into extra files: imgui_demo.cpp imgui_draw.cpp imgui_internal.h that you need to add to your project.
645 - 2015/07/18 (1.44) - fixed angles in ImDrawList::PathArcTo(), PathArcToFast() (introduced in 1.43) being off by an extra PI for no justifiable reason
646 - 2015/07/14 (1.43) - add new ImFontAtlas::AddFont() API. For the old AddFont***, moved the 'font_no' parameter of ImFontAtlas::AddFont** functions to the ImFontConfig structure.
647 you need to render your textured triangles with bilinear filtering to benefit from sub-pixel positioning of text.
648 - 2015/07/08 (1.43) - switched rendering data to use indexed rendering. this is saving a fair amount of CPU/GPU and enables us to get anti-aliasing for a marginal cost.
649 this necessary change will break your rendering function! the fix should be very easy. sorry for that :(
650 - if you are using a vanilla copy of one of the imgui_impl_XXX.cpp provided in the example, you just need to update your copy and you can ignore the rest.
651 - the signature of the io.RenderDrawListsFn handler has changed!
652 old: ImGui_XXXX_RenderDrawLists(ImDrawList** const cmd_lists, int cmd_lists_count)
653 new: ImGui_XXXX_RenderDrawLists(ImDrawData* draw_data).
654 parameters: 'cmd_lists' becomes 'draw_data->CmdLists', 'cmd_lists_count' becomes 'draw_data->CmdListsCount'
655 ImDrawList: 'commands' becomes 'CmdBuffer', 'vtx_buffer' becomes 'VtxBuffer', 'IdxBuffer' is new.
656 ImDrawCmd: 'vtx_count' becomes 'ElemCount', 'clip_rect' becomes 'ClipRect', 'user_callback' becomes 'UserCallback', 'texture_id' becomes 'TextureId'.
657 - each ImDrawList now contains both a vertex buffer and an index buffer. For each command, render ElemCount/3 triangles using indices from the index buffer.
658 - if you REALLY cannot render indexed primitives, you can call the draw_data->DeIndexAllBuffers() method to de-index the buffers. This is slow and a waste of CPU/GPU. Prefer using indexed rendering!
659 - refer to code in the examples/ folder or ask on the GitHub if you are unsure of how to upgrade. please upgrade!
660 - 2015/07/10 (1.43) - changed SameLine() parameters from int to float.
661 - 2015/07/02 (1.42) - renamed SetScrollPosHere() to SetScrollFromCursorPos(). Kept inline redirection function (will obsolete).
662 - 2015/07/02 (1.42) - renamed GetScrollPosY() to GetScrollY(). Necessary to reduce confusion along with other scrolling functions, because positions (e.g. cursor position) are not equivalent to scrolling amount.
663 - 2015/06/14 (1.41) - changed ImageButton() default bg_col parameter from (0,0,0,1) (black) to (0,0,0,0) (transparent) - makes a difference when texture have transparence
664 - 2015/06/14 (1.41) - changed Selectable() API from (label, selected, size) to (label, selected, flags, size). Size override should have been rarely used. Sorry!
665 - 2015/05/31 (1.40) - renamed GetWindowCollapsed() to IsWindowCollapsed() for consistency. Kept inline redirection function (will obsolete).
666 - 2015/05/31 (1.40) - renamed IsRectClipped() to IsRectVisible() for consistency. Note that return value is opposite! Kept inline redirection function (will obsolete).
667 - 2015/05/27 (1.40) - removed the third 'repeat_if_held' parameter from Button() - sorry! it was rarely used and inconsistent. Use PushButtonRepeat(true) / PopButtonRepeat() to enable repeat on desired buttons.
668 - 2015/05/11 (1.40) - changed BeginPopup() API, takes a string identifier instead of a bool. ImGui needs to manage the open/closed state of popups. Call OpenPopup() to actually set the "open" state of a popup. BeginPopup() returns true if the popup is opened.
669 - 2015/05/03 (1.40) - removed style.AutoFitPadding, using style.WindowPadding makes more sense (the default values were already the same).
670 - 2015/04/13 (1.38) - renamed IsClipped() to IsRectClipped(). Kept inline redirection function until 1.50.
671 - 2015/04/09 (1.38) - renamed ImDrawList::AddArc() to ImDrawList::AddArcFast() for compatibility with future API
672 - 2015/04/03 (1.38) - removed ImGuiCol_CheckHovered, ImGuiCol_CheckActive, replaced with the more general ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered, ImGuiCol_FrameBgActive.
673 - 2014/04/03 (1.38) - removed support for passing -FLT_MAX..+FLT_MAX as the range for a SliderFloat(). Use DragFloat() or Inputfloat() instead.
674 - 2015/03/17 (1.36) - renamed GetItemBoxMin()/GetItemBoxMax()/IsMouseHoveringBox() to GetItemRectMin()/GetItemRectMax()/IsMouseHoveringRect(). Kept inline redirection function until 1.50.
675 - 2015/03/15 (1.36) - renamed style.TreeNodeSpacing to style.IndentSpacing, ImGuiStyleVar_TreeNodeSpacing to ImGuiStyleVar_IndentSpacing
676 - 2015/03/13 (1.36) - renamed GetWindowIsFocused() to IsWindowFocused(). Kept inline redirection function until 1.50.
677 - 2015/03/08 (1.35) - renamed style.ScrollBarWidth to style.ScrollbarWidth (casing)
678 - 2015/02/27 (1.34) - renamed OpenNextNode(bool) to SetNextTreeNodeOpened(bool, ImGuiSetCond). Kept inline redirection function until 1.50.
679 - 2015/02/27 (1.34) - renamed ImGuiSetCondition_*** to ImGuiSetCond_***, and _FirstUseThisSession becomes _Once.
680 - 2015/02/11 (1.32) - changed text input callback ImGuiTextEditCallback return type from void-->int. reserved for future use, return 0 for now.
681 - 2015/02/10 (1.32) - renamed GetItemWidth() to CalcItemWidth() to clarify its evolving behavior
682 - 2015/02/08 (1.31) - renamed GetTextLineSpacing() to GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing()
683 - 2015/02/01 (1.31) - removed IO.MemReallocFn (unused)
684 - 2015/01/19 (1.30) - renamed ImGuiStorage::GetIntPtr()/GetFloatPtr() to GetIntRef()/GetIntRef() because Ptr was conflicting with actual pointer storage functions.
685 - 2015/01/11 (1.30) - big font/image API change! now loads TTF file. allow for multiple fonts. no need for a PNG loader.
686 - 2015/01/11 (1.30) - removed GetDefaultFontData(). uses io.Fonts->GetTextureData*() API to retrieve uncompressed pixels.
687 - old: const void* png_data; unsigned int png_size; ImGui::GetDefaultFontData(NULL, NULL, &png_data, &png_size); [..Upload texture to GPU..];
688 - new: unsigned char* pixels; int width, height; io.Fonts->GetTexDataAsRGBA32(&pixels, &width, &height); [..Upload texture to GPU..]; io.Fonts->SetTexID(YourTexIdentifier);
689 you now have more flexibility to load multiple TTF fonts and manage the texture buffer for internal needs. It is now recommended that you sample the font texture with bilinear interpolation.
690 - 2015/01/11 (1.30) - added texture identifier in ImDrawCmd passed to your render function (we can now render images). make sure to call io.Fonts->SetTexID()
691 - 2015/01/11 (1.30) - removed IO.PixelCenterOffset (unnecessary, can be handled in user projection matrix)
692 - 2015/01/11 (1.30) - removed ImGui::IsItemFocused() in favor of ImGui::IsItemActive() which handles all widgets
693 - 2014/12/10 (1.18) - removed SetNewWindowDefaultPos() in favor of new generic API SetNextWindowPos(pos, ImGuiSetCondition_FirstUseEver)
694 - 2014/11/28 (1.17) - moved IO.Font*** options to inside the IO.Font-> structure (FontYOffset, FontTexUvForWhite, FontBaseScale, FontFallbackGlyph)
695 - 2014/11/26 (1.17) - reworked syntax of IMGUI_ONCE_UPON_A_FRAME helper macro to increase compiler compatibility
696 - 2014/11/07 (1.15) - renamed IsHovered() to IsItemHovered()
697 - 2014/10/02 (1.14) - renamed IMGUI_INCLUDE_IMGUI_USER_CPP to IMGUI_INCLUDE_IMGUI_USER_INL and imgui_user.cpp to imgui_user.inl (more IDE friendly)
698 - 2014/09/25 (1.13) - removed 'text_end' parameter from IO.SetClipboardTextFn (the string is now always zero-terminated for simplicity)
699 - 2014/09/24 (1.12) - renamed SetFontScale() to SetWindowFontScale()
700 - 2014/09/24 (1.12) - moved IM_MALLOC/IM_REALLOC/IM_FREE preprocessor defines to IO.MemAllocFn/IO.MemReallocFn/IO.MemFreeFn
701 - 2014/08/30 (1.09) - removed IO.FontHeight (now computed automatically)
702 - 2014/08/30 (1.09) - moved IMGUI_FONT_TEX_UV_FOR_WHITE preprocessor define to IO.FontTexUvForWhite
703 - 2014/08/28 (1.09) - changed the behavior of IO.PixelCenterOffset following various rendering fixes
704
705
706 FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS (FAQ)
707 ================================
708
709 Read all answers online:
710 https://www.dearimgui.org/faq or https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md (same url)
711 Read all answers locally (with a text editor or ideally a Markdown viewer):
712 docs/FAQ.md
713 Some answers are copied down here to facilitate searching in code.
714
715 Q&A: Basics
716 ===========
717
718 Q: Where is the documentation?
719 A: This library is poorly documented at the moment and expects the user to be acquainted with C/C++.
720 - Run the examples/ and explore them.
721 - See demo code in imgui_demo.cpp and particularly the ImGui::ShowDemoWindow() function.
722 - The demo covers most features of Dear ImGui, so you can read the code and see its output.
723 - See documentation and comments at the top of imgui.cpp + effectively imgui.h.
724 - Dozens of standalone example applications using e.g. OpenGL/DirectX are provided in the
725 examples/ folder to explain how to integrate Dear ImGui with your own engine/application.
726 - The Wiki (https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki) has many resources and links.
727 - The Glossary (https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Glossary) page also may be useful.
728 - Your programming IDE is your friend, find the type or function declaration to find comments
729 associated with it.
730
731 Q: What is this library called?
732 Q: Which version should I get?
733 >> This library is called "Dear ImGui", please don't call it "ImGui" :)
734 >> See https://www.dearimgui.org/faq for details.
735
736 Q&A: Integration
737 ================
738
739 Q: How to get started?
740 A: Read 'PROGRAMMER GUIDE' above. Read examples/README.txt.
741
742 Q: How can I tell whether to dispatch mouse/keyboard to Dear ImGui or my application?
743 A: You should read the 'io.WantCaptureMouse', 'io.WantCaptureKeyboard' and 'io.WantTextInput' flags!
744 >> See https://www.dearimgui.org/faq for a fully detailed answer. You really want to read this.
745
746 Q. How can I enable keyboard controls?
747 Q: How can I use this without a mouse, without a keyboard or without a screen? (gamepad, input share, remote display)
748 Q: I integrated Dear ImGui in my engine and little squares are showing instead of text...
749 Q: I integrated Dear ImGui in my engine and some elements are clipping or disappearing when I move windows around...
750 Q: I integrated Dear ImGui in my engine and some elements are displaying outside their expected windows boundaries...
751 >> See https://www.dearimgui.org/faq
752
753 Q&A: Usage
754 ----------
755
756 Q: About the ID Stack system..
757 - Why is my widget not reacting when I click on it?
758 - How can I have widgets with an empty label?
759 - How can I have multiple widgets with the same label?
760 - How can I have multiple windows with the same label?
761 Q: How can I display an image? What is ImTextureID, how does it works?
762 Q: How can I use my own math types instead of ImVec2/ImVec4?
763 Q: How can I interact with standard C++ types (such as std::string and std::vector)?
764 Q: How can I display custom shapes? (using low-level ImDrawList API)
765 >> See https://www.dearimgui.org/faq
766
767 Q&A: Fonts, Text
768 ================
769
770 Q: How should I handle DPI in my application?
771 Q: How can I load a different font than the default?
772 Q: How can I easily use icons in my application?
773 Q: How can I load multiple fonts?
774 Q: How can I display and input non-Latin characters such as Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Cyrillic?
775 >> See https://www.dearimgui.org/faq and https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/edit/master/docs/FONTS.md
776
777 Q&A: Concerns
778 =============
779
780 Q: Who uses Dear ImGui?
781 Q: Can you create elaborate/serious tools with Dear ImGui?
782 Q: Can you reskin the look of Dear ImGui?
783 Q: Why using C++ (as opposed to C)?
784 >> See https://www.dearimgui.org/faq
785
786 Q&A: Community
787 ==============
788
789 Q: How can I help?
790 A: - Businesses: please reach out to "contact AT dearimgui.com" if you work in a place using Dear ImGui!
791 We can discuss ways for your company to fund development via invoiced technical support, maintenance or sponsoring contacts.
792 This is among the most useful thing you can do for Dear ImGui. With increased funding, we can hire more people working on this project.
793 - Individuals: you can support continued development via PayPal donations. See README.
794 - If you are experienced with Dear ImGui and C++, look at the GitHub issues, look at the Wiki, read docs/TODO.txt
795 and see how you want to help and can help!
796 - Disclose your usage of Dear ImGui via a dev blog post, a tweet, a screenshot, a mention somewhere etc.
797 You may post screenshot or links in the gallery threads. Visuals are ideal as they inspire other programmers.
798 But even without visuals, disclosing your use of dear imgui helps the library grow credibility, and help other teams and programmers with taking decisions.
799 - If you have issues or if you need to hack into the library, even if you don't expect any support it is useful that you share your issues (on GitHub or privately).
800
801*/
802
803//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
804// [SECTION] INCLUDES
805//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
806
807#if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(_CRT_SECURE_NO_WARNINGS)
808#define _CRT_SECURE_NO_WARNINGS
809#endif
810
811#include "imgui.h"
812#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE
813
814#ifndef IMGUI_DEFINE_MATH_OPERATORS
815#define IMGUI_DEFINE_MATH_OPERATORS
816#endif
817#include "imgui_internal.h"
818
819// System includes
820#include <ctype.h> // toupper
821#include <stdio.h> // vsnprintf, sscanf, printf
822#if defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER <= 1500 // MSVC 2008 or earlier
823#include <stddef.h> // intptr_t
824#else
825#include <stdint.h> // intptr_t
826#endif
827
828// [Windows] On non-Visual Studio compilers, we default to IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_IME_FUNCTIONS unless explicitly enabled
829#if defined(_WIN32) && !defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(IMGUI_ENABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_IME_FUNCTIONS) && !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_IME_FUNCTIONS)
830#define IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_IME_FUNCTIONS
831#endif
832
833// [Windows] OS specific includes (optional)
834#if defined(_WIN32) && defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_FILE_FUNCTIONS) && defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_CLIPBOARD_FUNCTIONS) && defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_IME_FUNCTIONS) && !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_FUNCTIONS)
835#define IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_FUNCTIONS
836#endif
837#if defined(_WIN32) && !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_FUNCTIONS)
838#ifndef WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN
839#define WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN
840#endif
841#ifndef NOMINMAX
842#define NOMINMAX
843#endif
844#ifndef __MINGW32__
845#include <Windows.h> // _wfopen, OpenClipboard
846#else
847#include <windows.h>
848#endif
849#if defined(WINAPI_FAMILY) && (WINAPI_FAMILY == WINAPI_FAMILY_APP) // UWP doesn't have all Win32 functions
850#define IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_CLIPBOARD_FUNCTIONS
851#define IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_IME_FUNCTIONS
852#endif
853#endif
854
855// [Apple] OS specific includes
856#if defined(__APPLE__)
857#include <TargetConditionals.h>
858#endif
859
860// Visual Studio warnings
861#ifdef _MSC_VER
862#pragma warning (disable: 4127) // condition expression is constant
863#pragma warning (disable: 4996) // 'This function or variable may be unsafe': strcpy, strdup, sprintf, vsnprintf, sscanf, fopen
864#if defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER >= 1922 // MSVC 2019 16.2 or later
865#pragma warning (disable: 5054) // operator '|': deprecated between enumerations of different types
866#endif
867#pragma warning (disable: 26451) // [Static Analyzer] Arithmetic overflow : Using operator 'xxx' on a 4 byte value and then casting the result to a 8 byte value. Cast the value to the wider type before calling operator 'xxx' to avoid overflow(io.2).
868#pragma warning (disable: 26495) // [Static Analyzer] Variable 'XXX' is uninitialized. Always initialize a member variable (type.6).
869#pragma warning (disable: 26812) // [Static Analyzer] The enum type 'xxx' is unscoped. Prefer 'enum class' over 'enum' (Enum.3).
870#endif
871
872// Clang/GCC warnings with -Weverything
873#if defined(__clang__)
874#if __has_warning("-Wunknown-warning-option")
875#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunknown-warning-option" // warning: unknown warning group 'xxx' // not all warnings are known by all Clang versions and they tend to be rename-happy.. so ignoring warnings triggers new warnings on some configuration. Great!
876#endif
877#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunknown-pragmas" // warning: unknown warning group 'xxx'
878#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wold-style-cast" // warning: use of old-style cast // yes, they are more terse.
