2690 if (is_nav_request && (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Tabbing) && g.NavTabbingDir == -1)
2691 data->Ranges.push_back(ImGuiListClipperRange::FromIndices(ItemsCount - 1, ItemsCount));
2692
2693 // Add focused/active item
2694 ImRect nav_rect_abs = ImGui::WindowRectRelToAbs(window, window->NavRectRel[0]);
2695 if (g.NavId != 0 && window->NavLastIds[0] == g.NavId)
2696 data->Ranges.push_back(ImGuiListClipperRange::FromPositions(nav_rect_abs.Min.y, nav_rect_abs.Max.y, 0, 0));
2697
2698 // Add visible range
2699 const int off_min = (is_nav_request && g.NavMoveClipDir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? -1 : 0;
2700 const int off_max = (is_nav_request && g.NavMoveClipDir == ImGuiDir_Down) ? 1 : 0;
2701 data->Ranges.push_back(ImGuiListClipperRange::FromPositions(window->ClipRect.Min.y, window->ClipRect.Max.y, off_min, off_max));
2702 }
2703
2704 // Convert position ranges to item index ranges
2705 // - Very important: when a starting position is after our maximum item, we set Min to (ItemsCount - 1). This allows us to handle most forms of wrapping.
2706 // - Due to how Selectable extra padding they tend to be "unaligned" with exact unit in the item list,
2707 // which with the flooring/ceiling tend to lead to 2 items instead of one being submitted.
2708 for (int i = 0; i < data->Ranges.Size; i++)
2709 if (data->Ranges[i].PosToIndexConvert)
2710 {
2711 int m1 = (int)(((double)data->Ranges[i].Min - window->DC.CursorPos.y - data->LossynessOffset) / ItemsHeight);
2712 int m2 = (int)((((double)data->Ranges[i].Max - window->DC.CursorPos.y - data->LossynessOffset) / ItemsHeight) + 0.999999f);
2713 data->Ranges[i].Min = ImClamp(already_submitted + m1 + data->Ranges[i].PosToIndexOffsetMin, already_submitted, ItemsCount - 1);
2714 data->Ranges[i].Max = ImClamp(already_submitted + m2 + data->Ranges[i].PosToIndexOffsetMax, data->Ranges[i].Min + 1, ItemsCount);
2715 data->Ranges[i].PosToIndexConvert = false;
2716 }
2717 ImGuiListClipper_SortAndFuseRanges(data->Ranges, data->StepNo);
2718 }
2719
2720 // Step 0+ (if item height is given in advance) or 1+: Display the next range in line.
2721 if (data->StepNo < data->Ranges.Size)
2722 {
2723 DisplayStart = ImMax(data->Ranges[data->StepNo].Min, already_submitted);
2724 DisplayEnd = ImMin(data->Ranges[data->StepNo].Max, ItemsCount);
2725 if (DisplayStart > already_submitted) //-V1051
2726 ImGuiListClipper_SeekCursorForItem(this, DisplayStart);
2727 data->StepNo++;
2728 return true;
2729 }
2730
2731 // After the last step: Let the clipper validate that we have reached the expected Y position (corresponding to element DisplayEnd),
2732 // Advance the cursor to the end of the list and then returns 'false' to end the loop.
2733 if (ItemsCount < INT_MAX)
2734 ImGuiListClipper_SeekCursorForItem(this, ItemsCount);
2735 ItemsCount = -1;
2736
2737 return false;
2738}
2739
2740//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2741// [SECTION] STYLING
2742//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2743
2744ImGuiStyle& ImGui::GetStyle()
2745{
2746 IM_ASSERT(GImGui != NULL && "No current context. Did you call ImGui::CreateContext() and ImGui::SetCurrentContext() ?");
2747 return GImGui->Style;
2748}
2749
2750ImU32 ImGui::GetColorU32(ImGuiCol idx, float alpha_mul)
2751{
2752 ImGuiStyle& style = GImGui->Style;
2753 ImVec4 c = style.Colors[idx];
2754 c.w *= style.Alpha * alpha_mul;
2755 return ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(c);
2756}
2757
2758ImU32 ImGui::GetColorU32(const ImVec4& col)
2759{
2760 ImGuiStyle& style = GImGui->Style;
2761 ImVec4 c = col;
2762 c.w *= style.Alpha;
2763 return ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(c);
2764}
2765
2766const ImVec4& ImGui::GetStyleColorVec4(ImGuiCol idx)
2767{
2768 ImGuiStyle& style = GImGui->Style;
2769 return style.Colors[idx];
2770}
2771
2772ImU32 ImGui::GetColorU32(ImU32 col)
2773{
2774 ImGuiStyle& style = GImGui->Style;
2775 if (style.Alpha >= 1.0f)
2776 return col;
2777 ImU32 a = (col & IM_COL32_A_MASK) >> IM_COL32_A_SHIFT;
2778 a = (ImU32)(a * style.Alpha); // We don't need to clamp 0..255 because Style.Alpha is in 0..1 range.
2779 return (col & ~IM_COL32_A_MASK) | (a << IM_COL32_A_SHIFT);
2780}
2781
2782// FIXME: This may incur a round-trip (if the end user got their data from a float4) but eventually we aim to store the in-flight colors as ImU32
2783void ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol idx, ImU32 col)
2784{
2785 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2786 ImGuiColorMod backup;
2787 backup.Col = idx;
2788 backup.BackupValue = g.Style.Colors[idx];
2789 g.ColorStack.push_back(backup);
2790 g.Style.Colors[idx] = ColorConvertU32ToFloat4(col);
2791}
2792
2793void ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol idx, const ImVec4& col)
2794{
2795 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2796 ImGuiColorMod backup;
2797 backup.Col = idx;
2798 backup.BackupValue = g.Style.Colors[idx];
2799 g.ColorStack.push_back(backup);
2800 g.Style.Colors[idx] = col;
2801}
2802
2803void ImGui::PopStyleColor(int count)
2804{
2805 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2806 while (count > 0)
2807 {
2808 ImGuiColorMod& backup = g.ColorStack.back();
2809 g.Style.Colors[backup.Col] = backup.BackupValue;
2810 g.ColorStack.pop_back();
2811 count--;
2812 }
2813}
2814
2815struct ImGuiStyleVarInfo
2816{
2817 ImGuiDataType Type;
2818 ImU32 Count;
2819 ImU32 Offset;
2820 void* GetVarPtr(ImGuiStyle* style) const { return (void*)((unsigned char*)style + Offset); }
2821};
2822
2823static const ImGuiCol GWindowDockStyleColors[ImGuiWindowDockStyleCol_COUNT] =
2824{
2825 ImGuiCol_Text, ImGuiCol_Tab, ImGuiCol_TabHovered, ImGuiCol_TabActive, ImGuiCol_TabUnfocused, ImGuiCol_TabUnfocusedActive
2826};
2827
2828static const ImGuiStyleVarInfo GStyleVarInfo[] =
2829{
2830 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, Alpha) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_Alpha
2831 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, DisabledAlpha) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_DisabledAlpha
2832 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, WindowPadding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding
2833 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, WindowRounding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_WindowRounding
2834 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, WindowBorderSize) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_WindowBorderSize
2835 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, WindowMinSize) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_WindowMinSize
2836 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, WindowTitleAlign) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_WindowTitleAlign
2837 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, ChildRounding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding
2838 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, ChildBorderSize) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_ChildBorderSize
2839 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, PopupRounding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_PopupRounding
2840 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, PopupBorderSize) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_PopupBorderSize
2841 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, FramePadding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding
2842 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, FrameRounding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_FrameRounding
2843 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, FrameBorderSize) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_FrameBorderSize
2844 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, ItemSpacing) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing
2845 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, ItemInnerSpacing) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_ItemInnerSpacing
2846 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, IndentSpacing) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_IndentSpacing
2847 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, CellPadding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_CellPadding
2848 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, ScrollbarSize) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_ScrollbarSize
2849 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, ScrollbarRounding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_ScrollbarRounding
2850 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, GrabMinSize) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_GrabMinSize
2851 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, GrabRounding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_GrabRounding
2852 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 1, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, TabRounding) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_TabRounding
2853 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, ButtonTextAlign) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_ButtonTextAlign
2854 { ImGuiDataType_Float, 2, (ImU32)IM_OFFSETOF(ImGuiStyle, SelectableTextAlign) }, // ImGuiStyleVar_SelectableTextAlign
2855};
2856
2857static const ImGuiStyleVarInfo* GetStyleVarInfo(ImGuiStyleVar idx)
2858{
2859 IM_ASSERT(idx >= 0 && idx < ImGuiStyleVar_COUNT);
2860 IM_ASSERT(IM_ARRAYSIZE(GStyleVarInfo) == ImGuiStyleVar_COUNT);
2861 return &GStyleVarInfo[idx];
2862}
2863
2864void ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar idx, float val)
2865{
2866 const ImGuiStyleVarInfo* var_info = GetStyleVarInfo(idx);
2867 if (var_info->Type == ImGuiDataType_Float && var_info->Count == 1)
2868 {
2869 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2870 float* pvar = (float*)var_info->GetVarPtr(&g.Style);
2871 g.StyleVarStack.push_back(ImGuiStyleMod(idx, *pvar));
2872 *pvar = val;
2873 return;
2874 }
2875 IM_ASSERT(0 && "Called PushStyleVar() float variant but variable is not a float!");
2876}
2877
2878void ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar idx, const ImVec2& val)
2879{
2880 const ImGuiStyleVarInfo* var_info = GetStyleVarInfo(idx);
2881 if (var_info->Type == ImGuiDataType_Float && var_info->Count == 2)
2882 {
2883 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2884 ImVec2* pvar = (ImVec2*)var_info->GetVarPtr(&g.Style);
2885 g.StyleVarStack.push_back(ImGuiStyleMod(idx, *pvar));
2886 *pvar = val;
2887 return;
2888 }
2889 IM_ASSERT(0 && "Called PushStyleVar() ImVec2 variant but variable is not a ImVec2!");
2890}
2891
2892void ImGui::PopStyleVar(int count)
2893{
2894 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2895 while (count > 0)
2896 {
2897 // We avoid a generic memcpy(data, &backup.Backup.., GDataTypeSize[info->Type] * info->Count), the overhead in Debug is not worth it.
2898 ImGuiStyleMod& backup = g.StyleVarStack.back();
2899 const ImGuiStyleVarInfo* info = GetStyleVarInfo(backup.VarIdx);
2900 void* data = info->GetVarPtr(&g.Style);
2901 if (info->Type == ImGuiDataType_Float && info->Count == 1) { ((float*)data)[0] = backup.BackupFloat[0]; }
2902 else if (info->Type == ImGuiDataType_Float && info->Count == 2) { ((float*)data)[0] = backup.BackupFloat[0]; ((float*)data)[1] = backup.BackupFloat[1]; }
2903 g.StyleVarStack.pop_back();
2904 count--;
2905 }
2906}
2907
2908const char* ImGui::GetStyleColorName(ImGuiCol idx)
2909{
2910 // Create switch-case from enum with regexp: ImGuiCol_{.*}, --> case ImGuiCol_\1: return "\1";
2911 switch (idx)
2912 {
2913 case ImGuiCol_Text: return "Text";
2914 case ImGuiCol_TextDisabled: return "TextDisabled";
2915 case ImGuiCol_WindowBg: return "WindowBg";
2916 case ImGuiCol_ChildBg: return "ChildBg";
2917 case ImGuiCol_PopupBg: return "PopupBg";
2918 case ImGuiCol_Border: return "Border";
2919 case ImGuiCol_BorderShadow: return "BorderShadow";
2920 case ImGuiCol_FrameBg: return "FrameBg";
2921 case ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered: return "FrameBgHovered";
2922 case ImGuiCol_FrameBgActive: return "FrameBgActive";
2923 case ImGuiCol_TitleBg: return "TitleBg";
2924 case ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive: return "TitleBgActive";
2925 case ImGuiCol_TitleBgCollapsed: return "TitleBgCollapsed";
2926 case ImGuiCol_MenuBarBg: return "MenuBarBg";
2927 case ImGuiCol_ScrollbarBg: return "ScrollbarBg";
2928 case ImGuiCol_ScrollbarGrab: return "ScrollbarGrab";
2929 case ImGuiCol_ScrollbarGrabHovered: return "ScrollbarGrabHovered";
2930 case ImGuiCol_ScrollbarGrabActive: return "ScrollbarGrabActive";
2931 case ImGuiCol_CheckMark: return "CheckMark";
2932 case ImGuiCol_SliderGrab: return "SliderGrab";
2933 case ImGuiCol_SliderGrabActive: return "SliderGrabActive";
2934 case ImGuiCol_Button: return "Button";
2935 case ImGuiCol_ButtonHovered: return "ButtonHovered";
2936 case ImGuiCol_ButtonActive: return "ButtonActive";
2937 case ImGuiCol_Header: return "Header";
2938 case ImGuiCol_HeaderHovered: return "HeaderHovered";
2939 case ImGuiCol_HeaderActive: return "HeaderActive";
2940 case ImGuiCol_Separator: return "Separator";
2941 case ImGuiCol_SeparatorHovered: return "SeparatorHovered";
2942 case ImGuiCol_SeparatorActive: return "SeparatorActive";
2943 case ImGuiCol_ResizeGrip: return "ResizeGrip";
2944 case ImGuiCol_ResizeGripHovered: return "ResizeGripHovered";
2945 case ImGuiCol_ResizeGripActive: return "ResizeGripActive";
2946 case ImGuiCol_Tab: return "Tab";
2947 case ImGuiCol_TabHovered: return "TabHovered";
2948 case ImGuiCol_TabActive: return "TabActive";
2949 case ImGuiCol_TabUnfocused: return "TabUnfocused";
2950 case ImGuiCol_TabUnfocusedActive: return "TabUnfocusedActive";
2951 case ImGuiCol_DockingPreview: return "DockingPreview";
2952 case ImGuiCol_DockingEmptyBg: return "DockingEmptyBg";
2953 case ImGuiCol_PlotLines: return "PlotLines";
2954 case ImGuiCol_PlotLinesHovered: return "PlotLinesHovered";
2955 case ImGuiCol_PlotHistogram: return "PlotHistogram";
2956 case ImGuiCol_PlotHistogramHovered: return "PlotHistogramHovered";
2957 case ImGuiCol_TableHeaderBg: return "TableHeaderBg";
2958 case ImGuiCol_TableBorderStrong: return "TableBorderStrong";
2959 case ImGuiCol_TableBorderLight: return "TableBorderLight";
2960 case ImGuiCol_TableRowBg: return "TableRowBg";
2961 case ImGuiCol_TableRowBgAlt: return "TableRowBgAlt";
2962 case ImGuiCol_TextSelectedBg: return "TextSelectedBg";
2963 case ImGuiCol_DragDropTarget: return "DragDropTarget";
2964 case ImGuiCol_NavHighlight: return "NavHighlight";
2965 case ImGuiCol_NavWindowingHighlight: return "NavWindowingHighlight";
2966 case ImGuiCol_NavWindowingDimBg: return "NavWindowingDimBg";
2967 case ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg: return "ModalWindowDimBg";
2968 }
2969 IM_ASSERT(0);
2970 return "Unknown";
2971}
2972
2973
2974//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2975// [SECTION] RENDER HELPERS
2976// Some of those (internal) functions are currently quite a legacy mess - their signature and behavior will change,
2977// we need a nicer separation between low-level functions and high-level functions relying on the ImGui context.
2978// Also see imgui_draw.cpp for some more which have been reworked to not rely on ImGui:: context.
2979//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2980
2981const char* ImGui::FindRenderedTextEnd(const char* text, const char* text_end)
2982{
2983 const char* text_display_end = text;
2984 if (!text_end)
2985 text_end = (const char*)-1;
2986
2987 while (text_display_end < text_end && *text_display_end != '\0' && (text_display_end[0] != '#' || text_display_end[1] != '#'))
2988 text_display_end++;
2989 return text_display_end;
2990}
2991
2992// Internal ImGui functions to render text
2993// RenderText***() functions calls ImDrawList::AddText() calls ImBitmapFont::RenderText()
2994void ImGui::RenderText(ImVec2 pos, const char* text, const char* text_end, bool hide_text_after_hash)
2995{
2996 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2997 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
2998
2999 // Hide anything after a '##' string
3000 const char* text_display_end;
3001 if (hide_text_after_hash)
3002 {
3003 text_display_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(text, text_end);
3004 }
3005 else
3006 {
3007 if (!text_end)
3008 text_end = text + strlen(text); // FIXME-OPT
3009 text_display_end = text_end;
3010 }
3011
3012 if (text != text_display_end)
3013 {
3014 window->DrawList->AddText(g.Font, g.FontSize, pos, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), text, text_display_end);
3015 if (g.LogEnabled)
3016 LogRenderedText(&pos, text, text_display_end);
3017 }
3018}
3019
3020void ImGui::RenderTextWrapped(ImVec2 pos, const char* text, const char* text_end, float wrap_width)
3021{
3022 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3023 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3024
3025 if (!text_end)
3026 text_end = text + strlen(text); // FIXME-OPT
3027
3028 if (text != text_end)
3029 {
3030 window->DrawList->AddText(g.Font, g.FontSize, pos, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), text, text_end, wrap_width);
3031 if (g.LogEnabled)
3032 LogRenderedText(&pos, text, text_end);
3033 }
3034}
3035
3036// Default clip_rect uses (pos_min,pos_max)
3037// Handle clipping on CPU immediately (vs typically let the GPU clip the triangles that are overlapping the clipping rectangle edges)
3038void ImGui::RenderTextClippedEx(ImDrawList* draw_list, const ImVec2& pos_min, const ImVec2& pos_max, const char* text, const char* text_display_end, const ImVec2* text_size_if_known, const ImVec2& align, const ImRect* clip_rect)
3039{
3040 // Perform CPU side clipping for single clipped element to avoid using scissor state
3041 ImVec2 pos = pos_min;
3042 const ImVec2 text_size = text_size_if_known ? *text_size_if_known : CalcTextSize(text, text_display_end, false, 0.0f);
3043
3044 const ImVec2* clip_min = clip_rect ? &clip_rect->Min : &pos_min;
3045 const ImVec2* clip_max = clip_rect ? &clip_rect->Max : &pos_max;
3046 bool need_clipping = (pos.x + text_size.x >= clip_max->x) || (pos.y + text_size.y >= clip_max->y);
3047 if (clip_rect) // If we had no explicit clipping rectangle then pos==clip_min
3048 need_clipping |= (pos.x < clip_min->x) || (pos.y < clip_min->y);
3049
3050 // Align whole block. We should defer that to the better rendering function when we'll have support for individual line alignment.
3051 if (align.x > 0.0f) pos.x = ImMax(pos.x, pos.x + (pos_max.x - pos.x - text_size.x) * align.x);
3052 if (align.y > 0.0f) pos.y = ImMax(pos.y, pos.y + (pos_max.y - pos.y - text_size.y) * align.y);
3053
3054 // Render
3055 if (need_clipping)
3056 {
3057 ImVec4 fine_clip_rect(clip_min->x, clip_min->y, clip_max->x, clip_max->y);
3058 draw_list->AddText(NULL, 0.0f, pos, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), text, text_display_end, 0.0f, &fine_clip_rect);
3059 }
3060 else
3061 {
3062 draw_list->AddText(NULL, 0.0f, pos, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), text, text_display_end, 0.0f, NULL);
3063 }
3064}
3065
3066void ImGui::RenderTextClipped(const ImVec2& pos_min, const ImVec2& pos_max, const char* text, const char* text_end, const ImVec2* text_size_if_known, const ImVec2& align, const ImRect* clip_rect)
3067{
3068 // Hide anything after a '##' string
3069 const char* text_display_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(text, text_end);
3070 const int text_len = (int)(text_display_end - text);
3071 if (text_len == 0)
3072 return;
3073
3074 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3075 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3076 RenderTextClippedEx(window->DrawList, pos_min, pos_max, text, text_display_end, text_size_if_known, align, clip_rect);
3077 if (g.LogEnabled)
3078 LogRenderedText(&pos_min, text, text_display_end);
3079}
3080
3081
3082// Another overly complex function until we reorganize everything into a nice all-in-one helper.
3083// This is made more complex because we have dissociated the layout rectangle (pos_min..pos_max) which define _where_ the ellipsis is, from actual clipping of text and limit of the ellipsis display.
3084// This is because in the context of tabs we selectively hide part of the text when the Close Button appears, but we don't want the ellipsis to move.
3085void ImGui::RenderTextEllipsis(ImDrawList* draw_list, const ImVec2& pos_min, const ImVec2& pos_max, float clip_max_x, float ellipsis_max_x, const char* text, const char* text_end_full, const ImVec2* text_size_if_known)
3086{
3087 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3088 if (text_end_full == NULL)
3089 text_end_full = FindRenderedTextEnd(text);
3090 const ImVec2 text_size = text_size_if_known ? *text_size_if_known : CalcTextSize(text, text_end_full, false, 0.0f);
3091
3092 //draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(pos_max.x, pos_min.y - 4), ImVec2(pos_max.x, pos_max.y + 4), IM_COL32(0, 0, 255, 255));
3093 //draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(ellipsis_max_x, pos_min.y-2), ImVec2(ellipsis_max_x, pos_max.y+2), IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255));
3094 //draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(clip_max_x, pos_min.y), ImVec2(clip_max_x, pos_max.y), IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255));
3095 // FIXME: We could technically remove (last_glyph->AdvanceX - last_glyph->X1) from text_size.x here and save a few pixels.
3096 if (text_size.x > pos_max.x - pos_min.x)
3097 {
3098 // Hello wo...
3099 // | | |
3100 // min max ellipsis_max
3101 // <-> this is generally some padding value
3102
3103 const ImFont* font = draw_list->_Data->Font;
3104 const float font_size = draw_list->_Data->FontSize;
3105 const char* text_end_ellipsis = NULL;
3106
3107 ImWchar ellipsis_char = font->EllipsisChar;
3108 int ellipsis_char_count = 1;
3109 if (ellipsis_char == (ImWchar)-1)
3110 {
3111 ellipsis_char = font->DotChar;
3112 ellipsis_char_count = 3;
3113 }
3114 const ImFontGlyph* glyph = font->FindGlyph(ellipsis_char);
3115
3116 float ellipsis_glyph_width = glyph->X1; // Width of the glyph with no padding on either side
3117 float ellipsis_total_width = ellipsis_glyph_width; // Full width of entire ellipsis
3118
3119 if (ellipsis_char_count > 1)
3120 {
3121 // Full ellipsis size without free spacing after it.
3122 const float spacing_between_dots = 1.0f * (draw_list->_Data->FontSize / font->FontSize);
3123 ellipsis_glyph_width = glyph->X1 - glyph->X0 + spacing_between_dots;
3124 ellipsis_total_width = ellipsis_glyph_width * (float)ellipsis_char_count - spacing_between_dots;
3125 }
3126
3127 // We can now claim the space between pos_max.x and ellipsis_max.x
3128 const float text_avail_width = ImMax((ImMax(pos_max.x, ellipsis_max_x) - ellipsis_total_width) - pos_min.x, 1.0f);
3129 float text_size_clipped_x = font->CalcTextSizeA(font_size, text_avail_width, 0.0f, text, text_end_full, &text_end_ellipsis).x;
3130 if (text == text_end_ellipsis && text_end_ellipsis < text_end_full)
3131 {
3132 // Always display at least 1 character if there's no room for character + ellipsis
3133 text_end_ellipsis = text + ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromChar(text, text_end_full);
3134 text_size_clipped_x = font->CalcTextSizeA(font_size, FLT_MAX, 0.0f, text, text_end_ellipsis).x;
3135 }
3136 while (text_end_ellipsis > text && ImCharIsBlankA(text_end_ellipsis[-1]))
3137 {
3138 // Trim trailing space before ellipsis (FIXME: Supporting non-ascii blanks would be nice, for this we need a function to backtrack in UTF-8 text)
3139 text_end_ellipsis--;
3140 text_size_clipped_x -= font->CalcTextSizeA(font_size, FLT_MAX, 0.0f, text_end_ellipsis, text_end_ellipsis + 1).x; // Ascii blanks are always 1 byte
3141 }
3142
3143 // Render text, render ellipsis
3144 RenderTextClippedEx(draw_list, pos_min, ImVec2(clip_max_x, pos_max.y), text, text_end_ellipsis, &text_size, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f));
3145 float ellipsis_x = pos_min.x + text_size_clipped_x;
3146 if (ellipsis_x + ellipsis_total_width <= ellipsis_max_x)
3147 for (int i = 0; i < ellipsis_char_count; i++)
3148 {
3149 font->RenderChar(draw_list, font_size, ImVec2(ellipsis_x, pos_min.y), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), ellipsis_char);
3150 ellipsis_x += ellipsis_glyph_width;
3151 }
3152 }
3153 else
3154 {
3155 RenderTextClippedEx(draw_list, pos_min, ImVec2(clip_max_x, pos_max.y), text, text_end_full, &text_size, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f));
3156 }
3157
3158 if (g.LogEnabled)
3159 LogRenderedText(&pos_min, text, text_end_full);
3160}
3161
3162// Render a rectangle shaped with optional rounding and borders
3163void ImGui::RenderFrame(ImVec2 p_min, ImVec2 p_max, ImU32 fill_col, bool border, float rounding)
3164{
3165 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3166 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3167 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(p_min, p_max, fill_col, rounding);
3168 const float border_size = g.Style.FrameBorderSize;
3169 if (border && border_size > 0.0f)
3170 {
3171 window->DrawList->AddRect(p_min + ImVec2(1, 1), p_max + ImVec2(1, 1), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_BorderShadow), rounding, 0, border_size);
3172 window->DrawList->AddRect(p_min, p_max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), rounding, 0, border_size);
3173 }
3174}
3175
3176void ImGui::RenderFrameBorder(ImVec2 p_min, ImVec2 p_max, float rounding)
3177{
3178 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3179 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3180 const float border_size = g.Style.FrameBorderSize;
3181 if (border_size > 0.0f)
3182 {
3183 window->DrawList->AddRect(p_min + ImVec2(1, 1), p_max + ImVec2(1, 1), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_BorderShadow), rounding, 0, border_size);
3184 window->DrawList->AddRect(p_min, p_max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), rounding, 0, border_size);
3185 }
3186}
3187
3188void ImGui::RenderNavHighlight(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id, ImGuiNavHighlightFlags flags)
3189{
3190 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3191 if (id != g.NavId)
3192 return;
3193 if (g.NavDisableHighlight && !(flags & ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_AlwaysDraw))
3194 return;
3195 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3196 if (window->DC.NavHideHighlightOneFrame)
3197 return;
3198
3199 float rounding = (flags & ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_NoRounding) ? 0.0f : g.Style.FrameRounding;
3200 ImRect display_rect = bb;
3201 display_rect.ClipWith(window->ClipRect);
3202 if (flags & ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_TypeDefault)
3203 {
3204 const float THICKNESS = 2.0f;
3205 const float DISTANCE = 3.0f + THICKNESS * 0.5f;
3206 display_rect.Expand(ImVec2(DISTANCE, DISTANCE));
3207 bool fully_visible = window->ClipRect.Contains(display_rect);
3208 if (!fully_visible)
3209 window->DrawList->PushClipRect(display_rect.Min, display_rect.Max);
3210 window->DrawList->AddRect(display_rect.Min + ImVec2(THICKNESS * 0.5f, THICKNESS * 0.5f), display_rect.Max - ImVec2(THICKNESS * 0.5f, THICKNESS * 0.5f), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavHighlight), rounding, 0, THICKNESS);
3211 if (!fully_visible)
3212 window->DrawList->PopClipRect();
3213 }
3214 if (flags & ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_TypeThin)
3215 {
3216 window->DrawList->AddRect(display_rect.Min, display_rect.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavHighlight), rounding, 0, 1.0f);
3217 }
3218}
3219
3220//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3221// [SECTION] MAIN CODE (most of the code! lots of stuff, needs tidying up!)
3222//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3223
3224// ImGuiWindow is mostly a dumb struct. It merely has a constructor and a few helper methods
3225ImGuiWindow::ImGuiWindow(ImGuiContext* context, const char* name) : DrawListInst(NULL)
3226{
3227 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
3228 Name = ImStrdup(name);
3229 NameBufLen = (int)strlen(name) + 1;
3230 ID = ImHashStr(name);
3231 IDStack.push_back(ID);
3232 ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend = -1;
3233 ViewportPos = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
3234 MoveId = GetID("#MOVE");
3235 ScrollTarget = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
3236 ScrollTargetCenterRatio = ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f);
3237 AutoFitFramesX = AutoFitFramesY = -1;
3238 AutoPosLastDirection = ImGuiDir_None;
3239 SetWindowPosAllowFlags = SetWindowSizeAllowFlags = SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags = SetWindowDockAllowFlags = ImGuiCond_Always | ImGuiCond_Once | ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver | ImGuiCond_Appearing;
3240 SetWindowPosVal = SetWindowPosPivot = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
3241 LastFrameActive = -1;
3242 LastFrameJustFocused = -1;
3243 LastTimeActive = -1.0f;
3244 FontWindowScale = FontDpiScale = 1.0f;
3245 SettingsOffset = -1;
3246 DockOrder = -1;
3247 DrawList = &DrawListInst;
3248 DrawList->_Data = &context->DrawListSharedData;
3249 DrawList->_OwnerName = Name;
3250 IM_PLACEMENT_NEW(&WindowClass) ImGuiWindowClass();
3251}
3252
3253ImGuiWindow::~ImGuiWindow()
3254{
3255 IM_ASSERT(DrawList == &DrawListInst);
3256 IM_DELETE(Name);
3257 ColumnsStorage.clear_destruct();
3258}
3259
3260ImGuiID ImGuiWindow::GetID(const char* str, const char* str_end)
3261{
3262 ImGuiID seed = IDStack.back();
3263 ImGuiID id = ImHashStr(str, str_end ? (str_end - str) : 0, seed);
3264 ImGui::KeepAliveID(id);
3265 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3266 if (g.DebugHookIdInfo == id)
3267 ImGui::DebugHookIdInfo(id, ImGuiDataType_String, str, str_end);
3268 return id;
3269}
3270
3271ImGuiID ImGuiWindow::GetID(const void* ptr)
3272{
3273 ImGuiID seed = IDStack.back();
3274 ImGuiID id = ImHashData(&ptr, sizeof(void*), seed);
3275 ImGui::KeepAliveID(id);
3276 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3277 if (g.DebugHookIdInfo == id)
3278 ImGui::DebugHookIdInfo(id, ImGuiDataType_Pointer, ptr, NULL);
3279 return id;
3280}
3281
3282ImGuiID ImGuiWindow::GetID(int n)
3283{
3284 ImGuiID seed = IDStack.back();
3285 ImGuiID id = ImHashData(&n, sizeof(n), seed);
3286 ImGui::KeepAliveID(id);
3287 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3288 if (g.DebugHookIdInfo == id)
3289 ImGui::DebugHookIdInfo(id, ImGuiDataType_S32, (void*)(intptr_t)n, NULL);
3290 return id;
3291}
3292
3293ImGuiID ImGuiWindow::GetIDNoKeepAlive(const char* str, const char* str_end)
3294{
3295 ImGuiID seed = IDStack.back();
3296 ImGuiID id = ImHashStr(str, str_end ? (str_end - str) : 0, seed);
3297 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3298 if (g.DebugHookIdInfo == id)
3299 ImGui::DebugHookIdInfo(id, ImGuiDataType_String, str, str_end);
3300 return id;
3301}
3302
3303ImGuiID ImGuiWindow::GetIDNoKeepAlive(const void* ptr)
3304{
3305 ImGuiID seed = IDStack.back();
3306 ImGuiID id = ImHashData(&ptr, sizeof(void*), seed);
3307 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3308 if (g.DebugHookIdInfo == id)
3309 ImGui::DebugHookIdInfo(id, ImGuiDataType_Pointer, ptr, NULL);
3310 return id;
3311}
3312
3313ImGuiID ImGuiWindow::GetIDNoKeepAlive(int n)
3314{
3315 ImGuiID seed = IDStack.back();
3316 ImGuiID id = ImHashData(&n, sizeof(n), seed);
3317 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3318 if (g.DebugHookIdInfo == id)
3319 ImGui::DebugHookIdInfo(id, ImGuiDataType_S32, (void*)(intptr_t)n, NULL);
3320 return id;
3321}
3322
3323// This is only used in rare/specific situations to manufacture an ID out of nowhere.
3324ImGuiID ImGuiWindow::GetIDFromRectangle(const ImRect& r_abs)
3325{
3326 ImGuiID seed = IDStack.back();
3327 ImRect r_rel = ImGui::WindowRectAbsToRel(this, r_abs);
3328 ImGuiID id = ImHashData(&r_rel, sizeof(r_rel), seed);
3329 ImGui::KeepAliveID(id);
3330 return id;
3331}
3332
3333static void SetCurrentWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
3334{
3335 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3336 g.CurrentWindow = window;
3337 g.CurrentTable = window && window->DC.CurrentTableIdx != -1 ? g.Tables.GetByIndex(window->DC.CurrentTableIdx) : NULL;
3338 if (window)
3339 g.FontSize = g.DrawListSharedData.FontSize = window->CalcFontSize();
3340}
3341
3342void ImGui::GcCompactTransientMiscBuffers()
3343{
3344 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3345 g.ItemFlagsStack.clear();
3346 g.GroupStack.clear();
3347 TableGcCompactSettings();
3348}
3349
3350// Free up/compact internal window buffers, we can use this when a window becomes unused.
3351// Not freed:
3352// - ImGuiWindow, ImGuiWindowSettings, Name, StateStorage, ColumnsStorage (may hold useful data)
3353// This should have no noticeable visual effect. When the window reappear however, expect new allocation/buffer growth/copy cost.
3354void ImGui::GcCompactTransientWindowBuffers(ImGuiWindow* window)
3355{
3356 window->MemoryCompacted = true;
3357 window->MemoryDrawListIdxCapacity = window->DrawList->IdxBuffer.Capacity;
3358 window->MemoryDrawListVtxCapacity = window->DrawList->VtxBuffer.Capacity;
3359 window->IDStack.clear();
3360 window->DrawList->_ClearFreeMemory();
3361 window->DC.ChildWindows.clear();
3362 window->DC.ItemWidthStack.clear();
3363 window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.clear();
3364}
3365
3366void ImGui::GcAwakeTransientWindowBuffers(ImGuiWindow* window)
3367{
3368 // We stored capacity of the ImDrawList buffer to reduce growth-caused allocation/copy when awakening.
3369 // The other buffers tends to amortize much faster.
3370 window->MemoryCompacted = false;
3371 window->DrawList->IdxBuffer.reserve(window->MemoryDrawListIdxCapacity);
3372 window->DrawList->VtxBuffer.reserve(window->MemoryDrawListVtxCapacity);
3373 window->MemoryDrawListIdxCapacity = window->MemoryDrawListVtxCapacity = 0;
3374}
3375
3376void ImGui::SetActiveID(ImGuiID id, ImGuiWindow* window)
3377{
3378 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3379 g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated = (g.ActiveId != id);
3380 if (g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated)
3381 {
3382 g.ActiveIdTimer = 0.0f;
3383 g.ActiveIdHasBeenPressedBefore = false;
3384 g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore = false;
3385 g.ActiveIdMouseButton = -1;
3386 if (id != 0)
3387 {
3388 g.LastActiveId = id;
3389 g.LastActiveIdTimer = 0.0f;
3390 }
3391 }
3392 g.ActiveId = id;
3393 g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = false;
3394 g.ActiveIdNoClearOnFocusLoss = false;
3395 g.ActiveIdWindow = window;
3396 g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedThisFrame = false;
3397 if (id)
3398 {
3399 g.ActiveIdIsAlive = id;
3400 g.ActiveIdSource = (g.NavActivateId == id || g.NavActivateInputId == id || g.NavJustMovedToId == id) ? ImGuiInputSource_Nav : ImGuiInputSource_Mouse;
3401 }
3402
3403 // Clear declaration of inputs claimed by the widget
3404 // (Please note that this is WIP and not all keys/inputs are thoroughly declared by all widgets yet)
3405 g.ActiveIdUsingMouseWheel = false;
3406 g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask = 0x00;
3407 g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask = 0x00;
3408 g.ActiveIdUsingKeyInputMask.ClearAllBits();
3409}
3410
3411void ImGui::ClearActiveID()
3412{
3413 SetActiveID(0, NULL); // g.ActiveId = 0;
3414}
3415
3416void ImGui::SetHoveredID(ImGuiID id)
3417{
3418 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3419 g.HoveredId = id;
3420 g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap = false;
3421 g.HoveredIdUsingMouseWheel = false;
3422 if (id != 0 && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame != id)
3423 g.HoveredIdTimer = g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer = 0.0f;
3424}
3425
3426ImGuiID ImGui::GetHoveredID()
3427{
3428 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3429 return g.HoveredId ? g.HoveredId : g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame;
3430}
3431
3432void ImGui::KeepAliveID(ImGuiID id)
3433{
3434 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3435 if (g.ActiveId == id)
3436 g.ActiveIdIsAlive = id;
3437 if (g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame == id)
3438 g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive = true;
3439}
3440
3441void ImGui::MarkItemEdited(ImGuiID id)
3442{
3443 // This marking is solely to be able to provide info for IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit().
3444 // ActiveId might have been released by the time we call this (as in the typical press/release button behavior) but still need need to fill the data.
3445 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3446 IM_ASSERT(g.ActiveId == id || g.ActiveId == 0 || g.DragDropActive);
3447 IM_UNUSED(id); // Avoid unused variable warnings when asserts are compiled out.
3448 //IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindow->DC.LastItemId == id);
3449 g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedThisFrame = true;
3450 g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore = true;
3451 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Edited;
3452}
3453
3454static inline bool IsWindowContentHoverable(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiHoveredFlags flags)
3455{
3456 // An active popup disable hovering on other windows (apart from its own children)
3457 // FIXME-OPT: This could be cached/stored within the window.
3458 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3459 if (g.NavWindow)
3460 if (ImGuiWindow* focused_root_window = g.NavWindow->RootWindowDockTree)
3461 if (focused_root_window->WasActive && focused_root_window != window->RootWindowDockTree)
3462 {
3463 // For the purpose of those flags we differentiate "standard popup" from "modal popup"
3464 // NB: The order of those two tests is important because Modal windows are also Popups.
3465 if (focused_root_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)
3466 return false;
3467 if ((focused_root_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup))
3468 return false;
3469 }
3470
3471 // Filter by viewport
3472 if (window->Viewport != g.MouseViewport)
3473 if (g.MovingWindow == NULL || window->RootWindowDockTree != g.MovingWindow->RootWindowDockTree)
3474 return false;
3475
3476 return true;
3477}
3478
3479// This is roughly matching the behavior of internal-facing ItemHoverable()
3480// - we allow hovering to be true when ActiveId==window->MoveID, so that clicking on non-interactive items such as a Text() item still returns true with IsItemHovered()
3481// - this should work even for non-interactive items that have no ID, so we cannot use LastItemId
3482bool ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags flags)
3483{
3484 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3485 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3486 if (g.NavDisableMouseHover && !g.NavDisableHighlight)
3487 {
3488 if ((g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled) && !(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenDisabled))
3489 return false;
3490 if (!IsItemFocused())
3491 return false;
3492 }
3493 else
3494 {
3495 // Test for bounding box overlap, as updated as ItemAdd()
3496 ImGuiItemStatusFlags status_flags = g.LastItemData.StatusFlags;
3497 if (!(status_flags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect))
3498 return false;
3499 IM_ASSERT((flags & (ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow | ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows | ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoPopupHierarchy | ImGuiHoveredFlags_DockHierarchy)) == 0); // Flags not supported by this function
3500
3501 // Test if we are hovering the right window (our window could be behind another window)
3502 // [2021/03/02] Reworked / reverted the revert, finally. Note we want e.g. BeginGroup/ItemAdd/EndGroup to work as well. (#3851)
3503 // [2017/10/16] Reverted commit 344d48be3 and testing RootWindow instead. I believe it is correct to NOT test for RootWindow but this leaves us unable
3504 // to use IsItemHovered() after EndChild() itself. Until a solution is found I believe reverting to the test from 2017/09/27 is safe since this was
3505 // the test that has been running for a long while.
3506 if (g.HoveredWindow != window && (status_flags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredWindow) == 0)
3507 if ((flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped) == 0)
3508 return false;
3509
3510 // Test if another item is active (e.g. being dragged)
3511 if ((flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem) == 0)
3512 if (g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveId != g.LastItemData.ID && !g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap && g.ActiveId != window->MoveId)
3513 return false;
3514
3515 // Test if interactions on this window are blocked by an active popup or modal.
3516 // The ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup flag will be tested here.
3517 if (!IsWindowContentHoverable(window, flags))
3518 return false;
3519
3520 // Test if the item is disabled
3521 if ((g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled) && !(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenDisabled))
3522 return false;
3523
3524 // Special handling for calling after Begin() which represent the title bar or tab.
3525 // When the window is collapsed (SkipItems==true) that last item will never be overwritten so we need to detect the case.
3526 if ((g.LastItemData.ID == window->ID || g.LastItemData.ID == window->MoveId) && window->WriteAccessed)
3527 return false;
3528 }
3529
3530 return true;
3531}
3532
3533// Internal facing ItemHoverable() used when submitting widgets. Differs slightly from IsItemHovered().
3534bool ImGui::ItemHoverable(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id)
3535{
3536 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3537 if (g.HoveredId != 0 && g.HoveredId != id && !g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap)
3538 return false;
3539
3540 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3541 if (g.HoveredWindow != window)
3542 return false;
3543 if (g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveId != id && !g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap)
3544 return false;
3545 if (!IsMouseHoveringRect(bb.Min, bb.Max))
3546 return false;
3547 if (g.NavDisableMouseHover)
3548 return false;
3549 if (!IsWindowContentHoverable(window, ImGuiHoveredFlags_None))
3550 {
3551 g.HoveredIdDisabled = true;
3552 return false;
3553 }
3554
3555 // We exceptionally allow this function to be called with id==0 to allow using it for easy high-level
3556 // hover test in widgets code. We could also decide to split this function is two.
3557 if (id != 0)
3558 SetHoveredID(id);
3559
3560 // When disabled we'll return false but still set HoveredId
3561 ImGuiItemFlags item_flags = (g.LastItemData.ID == id ? g.LastItemData.InFlags : g.CurrentItemFlags);
3562 if (item_flags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled)
3563 {
3564 // Release active id if turning disabled
3565 if (g.ActiveId == id)
3566 ClearActiveID();
3567 g.HoveredIdDisabled = true;
3568 return false;
3569 }
3570
3571 if (id != 0)
3572 {
3573 // [DEBUG] Item Picker tool!
3574 // We perform the check here because SetHoveredID() is not frequently called (1~ time a frame), making
3575 // the cost of this tool near-zero. We can get slightly better call-stack and support picking non-hovered
3576 // items if we perform the test in ItemAdd(), but that would incur a small runtime cost.
3577 // #define IMGUI_DEBUG_TOOL_ITEM_PICKER_EX in imconfig.h if you want this check to also be performed in ItemAdd().
3578 if (g.DebugItemPickerActive && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame == id)
3579 GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
3580 if (g.DebugItemPickerBreakId == id)
3581 IM_DEBUG_BREAK();
3582 }
3583
3584 return true;
3585}
3586
3587bool ImGui::IsClippedEx(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id)
3588{
3589 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3590 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3591 if (!bb.Overlaps(window->ClipRect))
3592 if (id == 0 || (id != g.ActiveId && id != g.NavId))
3593 if (!g.LogEnabled)
3594 return true;
3595 return false;
3596}
3597
3598// This is also inlined in ItemAdd()
3599// Note: if ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDisplayRect is set, user needs to set window->DC.LastItemDisplayRect!
3600void ImGui::SetLastItemData(ImGuiID item_id, ImGuiItemFlags in_flags, ImGuiItemStatusFlags item_flags, const ImRect& item_rect)
3601{
3602 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3603 g.LastItemData.ID = item_id;
3604 g.LastItemData.InFlags = in_flags;
3605 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags = item_flags;
3606 g.LastItemData.Rect = item_rect;
3607}
3608
3609float ImGui::CalcWrapWidthForPos(const ImVec2& pos, float wrap_pos_x)
3610{
3611 if (wrap_pos_x < 0.0f)
3612 return 0.0f;
3613
3614 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3615 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3616 if (wrap_pos_x == 0.0f)
3617 {
3618 // We could decide to setup a default wrapping max point for auto-resizing windows,
3619 // or have auto-wrap (with unspecified wrapping pos) behave as a ContentSize extending function?
3620 //if (window->Hidden && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
3621 // wrap_pos_x = ImMax(window->WorkRect.Min.x + g.FontSize * 10.0f, window->WorkRect.Max.x);
3622 //else
3623 wrap_pos_x = window->WorkRect.Max.x;
3624 }
3625 else if (wrap_pos_x > 0.0f)
3626 {
3627 wrap_pos_x += window->Pos.x - window->Scroll.x; // wrap_pos_x is provided is window local space
3628 }
3629
3630 return ImMax(wrap_pos_x - pos.x, 1.0f);
3631}
3632
3633// IM_ALLOC() == ImGui::MemAlloc()
3634void* ImGui::MemAlloc(size_t size)
3635{
3636 if (ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui)
3637 ctx->IO.MetricsActiveAllocations++;
3638 return (*GImAllocatorAllocFunc)(size, GImAllocatorUserData);
3639}
3640
3641// IM_FREE() == ImGui::MemFree()
3642void ImGui::MemFree(void* ptr)
3643{
3644 if (ptr)
3645 if (ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui)
3646 ctx->IO.MetricsActiveAllocations--;
3647 return (*GImAllocatorFreeFunc)(ptr, GImAllocatorUserData);
3648}
3649
3650const char* ImGui::GetClipboardText()
3651{
3652 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3653 return g.IO.GetClipboardTextFn ? g.IO.GetClipboardTextFn(g.IO.ClipboardUserData) : "";
3654}
3655
3656void ImGui::SetClipboardText(const char* text)
3657{
3658 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3659 if (g.IO.SetClipboardTextFn)
3660 g.IO.SetClipboardTextFn(g.IO.ClipboardUserData, text);
3661}
3662
3663const char* ImGui::GetVersion()
3664{
3665 return IMGUI_VERSION;
3666}
3667
3668// Internal state access - if you want to share Dear ImGui state between modules (e.g. DLL) or allocate it yourself
3669// Note that we still point to some static data and members (such as GFontAtlas), so the state instance you end up using will point to the static data within its module
3670ImGuiContext* ImGui::GetCurrentContext()
3671{
3672 return GImGui;
3673}
3674
3675void ImGui::SetCurrentContext(ImGuiContext* ctx)
3676{
3677#ifdef IMGUI_SET_CURRENT_CONTEXT_FUNC
3678 IMGUI_SET_CURRENT_CONTEXT_FUNC(ctx); // For custom thread-based hackery you may want to have control over this.
3679#else
3680 GImGui = ctx;
3681#endif
3682}
3683
3684void ImGui::SetAllocatorFunctions(ImGuiMemAllocFunc alloc_func, ImGuiMemFreeFunc free_func, void* user_data)
3685{
3686 GImAllocatorAllocFunc = alloc_func;
3687 GImAllocatorFreeFunc = free_func;
3688 GImAllocatorUserData = user_data;
3689}
3690
3691// This is provided to facilitate copying allocators from one static/DLL boundary to another (e.g. retrieve default allocator of your executable address space)
3692void ImGui::GetAllocatorFunctions(ImGuiMemAllocFunc* p_alloc_func, ImGuiMemFreeFunc* p_free_func, void** p_user_data)
3693{
3694 *p_alloc_func = GImAllocatorAllocFunc;
3695 *p_free_func = GImAllocatorFreeFunc;
3696 *p_user_data = GImAllocatorUserData;
3697}
3698
3699ImGuiContext* ImGui::CreateContext(ImFontAtlas* shared_font_atlas)
3700{
3701 ImGuiContext* ctx = IM_NEW(ImGuiContext)(shared_font_atlas);
3702 if (GImGui == NULL)
3703 SetCurrentContext(ctx);
3704 Initialize(ctx);
3705 return ctx;
3706}
3707
3708void ImGui::DestroyContext(ImGuiContext* ctx)
3709{
3710 if (ctx == NULL)
3711 ctx = GImGui;
3712 Shutdown(ctx);
3713 if (GImGui == ctx)
3714 SetCurrentContext(NULL);
3715 IM_DELETE(ctx);
3716}
3717
3718// No specific ordering/dependency support, will see as needed
3719ImGuiID ImGui::AddContextHook(ImGuiContext* ctx, const ImGuiContextHook* hook)
3720{
3721 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
3722 IM_ASSERT(hook->Callback != NULL && hook->HookId == 0 && hook->Type != ImGuiContextHookType_PendingRemoval_);
3723 g.Hooks.push_back(*hook);
3724 g.Hooks.back().HookId = ++g.HookIdNext;
3725 return g.HookIdNext;
3726}
3727
3728// Deferred removal, avoiding issue with changing vector while iterating it
3729void ImGui::RemoveContextHook(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiID hook_id)
3730{
3731 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
3732 IM_ASSERT(hook_id != 0);
3733 for (int n = 0; n < g.Hooks.Size; n++)
3734 if (g.Hooks[n].HookId == hook_id)
3735 g.Hooks[n].Type = ImGuiContextHookType_PendingRemoval_;
3736}
3737
3738// Call context hooks (used by e.g. test engine)
3739// We assume a small number of hooks so all stored in same array
3740void ImGui::CallContextHooks(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiContextHookType hook_type)
3741{
3742 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
3743 for (int n = 0; n < g.Hooks.Size; n++)
3744 if (g.Hooks[n].Type == hook_type)
3745 g.Hooks[n].Callback(&g, &g.Hooks[n]);
3746}
3747
3748ImGuiIO& ImGui::GetIO()
3749{
3750 IM_ASSERT(GImGui != NULL && "No current context. Did you call ImGui::CreateContext() and ImGui::SetCurrentContext() ?");
3751 return GImGui->IO;
3752}
3753
3754ImGuiPlatformIO& ImGui::GetPlatformIO()
3755{
3756 IM_ASSERT(GImGui != NULL && "No current context. Did you call ImGui::CreateContext() or ImGui::SetCurrentContext()?");
3757 return GImGui->PlatformIO;
3758}
3759
3760// Pass this to your backend rendering function! Valid after Render() and until the next call to NewFrame()
3761ImDrawData* ImGui::GetDrawData()
3762{
3763 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3764 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[0];
3765 return viewport->DrawDataP.Valid ? &viewport->DrawDataP : NULL;
3766}
3767
3768double ImGui::GetTime()
3769{
3770 return GImGui->Time;
3771}
3772
3773int ImGui::GetFrameCount()
3774{
3775 return GImGui->FrameCount;
3776}
3777
3778static ImDrawList* GetViewportDrawList(ImGuiViewportP* viewport, size_t drawlist_no, const char* drawlist_name)
3779{
3780 // Create the draw list on demand, because they are not frequently used for all viewports
3781 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3782 IM_ASSERT(drawlist_no < IM_ARRAYSIZE(viewport->DrawLists));
3783 ImDrawList* draw_list = viewport->DrawLists[drawlist_no];
3784 if (draw_list == NULL)
3785 {
3786 draw_list = IM_NEW(ImDrawList)(&g.DrawListSharedData);
3787 draw_list->_OwnerName = drawlist_name;
3788 viewport->DrawLists[drawlist_no] = draw_list;
3789 }
3790
3791 // Our ImDrawList system requires that there is always a command
3792 if (viewport->DrawListsLastFrame[drawlist_no] != g.FrameCount)
3793 {
3794 draw_list->_ResetForNewFrame();
3795 draw_list->PushTextureID(g.IO.Fonts->TexID);
3796 draw_list->PushClipRect(viewport->Pos, viewport->Pos + viewport->Size, false);
3797 viewport->DrawListsLastFrame[drawlist_no] = g.FrameCount;
3798 }
3799 return draw_list;
3800}
3801
3802ImDrawList* ImGui::GetBackgroundDrawList(ImGuiViewport* viewport)
3803{
3804 return GetViewportDrawList((ImGuiViewportP*)viewport, 0, "##Background");
3805}
3806
3807ImDrawList* ImGui::GetBackgroundDrawList()
3808{
3809 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3810 return GetBackgroundDrawList(g.CurrentWindow->Viewport);
3811}
3812
3813ImDrawList* ImGui::GetForegroundDrawList(ImGuiViewport* viewport)
3814{
3815 return GetViewportDrawList((ImGuiViewportP*)viewport, 1, "##Foreground");
3816}
3817
3818ImDrawList* ImGui::GetForegroundDrawList()
3819{
3820 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3821 return GetForegroundDrawList(g.CurrentWindow->Viewport);
3822}
3823
3824ImDrawListSharedData* ImGui::GetDrawListSharedData()
3825{
3826 return &GImGui->DrawListSharedData;
3827}
3828
3829void ImGui::StartMouseMovingWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
3830{
3831 // Set ActiveId even if the _NoMove flag is set. Without it, dragging away from a window with _NoMove would activate hover on other windows.
3832 // We _also_ call this when clicking in a window empty space when io.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly is set, but clear g.MovingWindow afterward.
3833 // This is because we want ActiveId to be set even when the window is not permitted to move.
3834 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3835 FocusWindow(window);
3836 SetActiveID(window->MoveId, window);
3837 g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
3838 g.ActiveIdClickOffset = g.IO.MouseClickedPos[0] - window->RootWindowDockTree->Pos;
3839 g.ActiveIdNoClearOnFocusLoss = true;
3840 SetActiveIdUsingNavAndKeys();
3841
3842 bool can_move_window = true;
3843 if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove) || (window->RootWindowDockTree->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove))
3844 can_move_window = false;
3845 if (ImGuiDockNode* node = window->DockNodeAsHost)
3846 if (node->VisibleWindow && (node->VisibleWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove))
3847 can_move_window = false;
3848 if (can_move_window)
3849 g.MovingWindow = window;
3850}
3851
3852// We use 'undock_floating_node == false' when dragging from title bar to allow moving groups of floating nodes without undocking them.
3853// - undock_floating_node == true: when dragging from a floating node within a hierarchy, always undock the node.
3854// - undock_floating_node == false: when dragging from a floating node within a hierarchy, move root window.
3855void ImGui::StartMouseMovingWindowOrNode(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiDockNode* node, bool undock_floating_node)
3856{
3857 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3858 bool can_undock_node = false;
3859 if (node != NULL && node->VisibleWindow && (node->VisibleWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove) == 0)
3860 {
3861 // Can undock if:
3862 // - part of a floating node hierarchy with more than one visible node (if only one is visible, we'll just move the whole hierarchy)
3863 // - part of a dockspace node hierarchy (trivia: undocking from a fixed/central node will create a new node and copy windows)
3864 ImGuiDockNode* root_node = DockNodeGetRootNode(node);
3865 if (root_node->OnlyNodeWithWindows != node || root_node->CentralNode != NULL) // -V1051 PVS-Studio thinks node should be root_node and is wrong about that.
3866 if (undock_floating_node || root_node->IsDockSpace())
3867 can_undock_node = true;
3868 }
3869
3870 const bool clicked = IsMouseClicked(0);
3871 const bool dragging = IsMouseDragging(0, g.IO.MouseDragThreshold * 1.70f);
3872 if (can_undock_node && dragging)
3873 DockContextQueueUndockNode(&g, node); // Will lead to DockNodeStartMouseMovingWindow() -> StartMouseMovingWindow() being called next frame
3874 else if (!can_undock_node && (clicked || dragging) && g.MovingWindow != window)
3875 StartMouseMovingWindow(window);
3876}
3877
3878// Handle mouse moving window
3879// Note: moving window with the navigation keys (Square + d-pad / CTRL+TAB + Arrows) are processed in NavUpdateWindowing()
3880// FIXME: We don't have strong guarantee that g.MovingWindow stay synched with g.ActiveId == g.MovingWindow->MoveId.
3881// This is currently enforced by the fact that BeginDragDropSource() is setting all g.ActiveIdUsingXXXX flags to inhibit navigation inputs,
3882// but if we should more thoroughly test cases where g.ActiveId or g.MovingWindow gets changed and not the other.
3883void ImGui::UpdateMouseMovingWindowNewFrame()
3884{
3885 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3886 if (g.MovingWindow != NULL)
3887 {
3888 // We actually want to move the root window. g.MovingWindow == window we clicked on (could be a child window).
3889 // We track it to preserve Focus and so that generally ActiveIdWindow == MovingWindow and ActiveId == MovingWindow->MoveId for consistency.
3890 KeepAliveID(g.ActiveId);
3891 IM_ASSERT(g.MovingWindow && g.MovingWindow->RootWindowDockTree);
3892 ImGuiWindow* moving_window = g.MovingWindow->RootWindowDockTree;
3893
3894 // When a window stop being submitted while being dragged, it may will its viewport until next Begin()
3895 const bool window_disappared = (!moving_window->WasActive || moving_window->Viewport == NULL);
3896 if (g.IO.MouseDown[0] && IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) && !window_disappared)
3897 {
3898 ImVec2 pos = g.IO.MousePos - g.ActiveIdClickOffset;
3899 if (moving_window->Pos.x != pos.x || moving_window->Pos.y != pos.y)
3900 {
3901 MarkIniSettingsDirty(moving_window);
3902 SetWindowPos(moving_window, pos, ImGuiCond_Always);
3903 if (moving_window->ViewportOwned) // Synchronize viewport immediately because some overlays may relies on clipping rectangle before we Begin() into the window.
3904 {
3905 moving_window->Viewport->Pos = pos;
3906 moving_window->Viewport->UpdateWorkRect();
3907 }
3908 }
3909 FocusWindow(g.MovingWindow);
3910 }
3911 else
3912 {
3913 if (!window_disappared)
3914 {
3915 // Try to merge the window back into the main viewport.
3916 // This works because MouseViewport should be != MovingWindow->Viewport on release (as per code in UpdateViewports)
3917 if (g.ConfigFlagsCurrFrame & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable)
3918 UpdateTryMergeWindowIntoHostViewport(moving_window, g.MouseViewport);
3919
3920 // Restore the mouse viewport so that we don't hover the viewport _under_ the moved window during the frame we released the mouse button.
3921 if (!IsDragDropPayloadBeingAccepted())
3922 g.MouseViewport = moving_window->Viewport;
3923
3924 // Clear the NoInput window flag set by the Viewport system
3925 moving_window->Viewport->Flags &= ~ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs; // FIXME-VIEWPORT: Test engine managed to crash here because Viewport was NULL.
3926 }
3927
3928 g.MovingWindow = NULL;
3929 ClearActiveID();
3930 }
3931 }
3932 else
3933 {
3934 // When clicking/dragging from a window that has the _NoMove flag, we still set the ActiveId in order to prevent hovering others.
3935 if (g.ActiveIdWindow && g.ActiveIdWindow->MoveId == g.ActiveId)
3936 {
3937 KeepAliveID(g.ActiveId);
3938 if (!g.IO.MouseDown[0])
3939 ClearActiveID();
3940 }
3941 }
3942}
3943
3944// Initiate moving window when clicking on empty space or title bar.
3945// Handle left-click and right-click focus.
3946void ImGui::UpdateMouseMovingWindowEndFrame()
3947{
3948 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3949 if (g.ActiveId != 0 || g.HoveredId != 0)
3950 return;
3951
3952 // Unless we just made a window/popup appear
3953 if (g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow->Appearing)
3954 return;
3955
3956 // Click on empty space to focus window and start moving
3957 // (after we're done with all our widgets, so e.g. clicking on docking tab-bar which have set HoveredId already and not get us here!)
3958 if (g.IO.MouseClicked[0])
3959 {
3960 // Handle the edge case of a popup being closed while clicking in its empty space.
3961 // If we try to focus it, FocusWindow() > ClosePopupsOverWindow() will accidentally close any parent popups because they are not linked together any more.
3962 ImGuiWindow* root_window = g.HoveredWindow ? g.HoveredWindow->RootWindow : NULL;
3963 const bool is_closed_popup = root_window && (root_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !IsPopupOpen(root_window->PopupId, ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel);
3964
3965 if (root_window != NULL && !is_closed_popup)
3966 {
3967 StartMouseMovingWindow(g.HoveredWindow); //-V595
3968
3969 // Cancel moving if clicked outside of title bar
3970 if (g.IO.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly)
3971 if (!(root_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) || root_window->DockIsActive)
3972 if (!root_window->TitleBarRect().Contains(g.IO.MouseClickedPos[0]))
3973 g.MovingWindow = NULL;
3974
3975 // Cancel moving if clicked over an item which was disabled or inhibited by popups (note that we know HoveredId == 0 already)
3976 if (g.HoveredIdDisabled)
3977 g.MovingWindow = NULL;
3978 }
3979 else if (root_window == NULL && g.NavWindow != NULL && GetTopMostPopupModal() == NULL)
3980 {
3981 // Clicking on void disable focus
3982 FocusWindow(NULL);
3983 }
3984 }
3985
3986 // With right mouse button we close popups without changing focus based on where the mouse is aimed
3987 // Instead, focus will be restored to the window under the bottom-most closed popup.
3988 // (The left mouse button path calls FocusWindow on the hovered window, which will lead NewFrame->ClosePopupsOverWindow to trigger)
3989 if (g.IO.MouseClicked[1])
3990 {
3991 // Find the top-most window between HoveredWindow and the top-most Modal Window.
3992 // This is where we can trim the popup stack.
3993 ImGuiWindow* modal = GetTopMostPopupModal();
3994 bool hovered_window_above_modal = g.HoveredWindow && (modal == NULL || IsWindowAbove(g.HoveredWindow, modal));
3995 ClosePopupsOverWindow(hovered_window_above_modal ? g.HoveredWindow : modal, true);
3996 }
3997}
3998
3999static void TranslateWindow(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& delta)
4000{
4001 window->Pos += delta;
4002 window->ClipRect.Translate(delta);
4003 window->OuterRectClipped.Translate(delta);
4004 window->InnerRect.Translate(delta);
4005 window->DC.CursorPos += delta;
4006 window->DC.CursorStartPos += delta;
4007 window->DC.CursorMaxPos += delta;
4008}
4009
4010static void ScaleWindow(ImGuiWindow* window, float scale)
4011{
4012 ImVec2 origin = window->Viewport->Pos;
4013 window->Pos = ImFloor((window->Pos - origin) * scale + origin);
4014 window->Size = ImFloor(window->Size * scale);
4015 window->SizeFull = ImFloor(window->SizeFull * scale);
4016 window->ContentSize = ImFloor(window->ContentSize * scale);
4017}
4018
4019static bool IsWindowActiveAndVisible(ImGuiWindow* window)
4020{
4021 return (window->Active) && (!window->Hidden);
4022}
4023
4024static void ImGui::UpdateKeyboardInputs()
4025{
4026 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4027 ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
4028
4029 // Synchronize io.KeyMods with individual modifiers io.KeyXXX bools
4030 io.KeyMods = GetMergedKeyModFlags();
4031
4032 // Import legacy keys or verify they are not used
4033#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_KEYIO
4034 if (io.BackendUsingLegacyKeyArrays == 0)
4035 {
4036 // Backend used new io.AddKeyEvent() API: Good! Verify that old arrays are never written too.
4037 for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.KeysDown); n++)
4038 IM_ASSERT(io.KeysDown[n] == false && "Backend needs to either only use io.AddKeyEvent(), either only fill legacy io.KeysDown[] + io.KeyMap[]. Not both!");
4039 }
4040 else
4041 {
4042 if (g.FrameCount == 0)
4043 for (int n = ImGuiKey_LegacyNativeKey_BEGIN; n < ImGuiKey_LegacyNativeKey_END; n++)
4044 IM_ASSERT(g.IO.KeyMap[n] == -1 && "Backend is not allowed to write to io.KeyMap[0..511]!");
4045
4046 // Build reverse KeyMap (Named -> Legacy)
4047 for (int n = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN; n < ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END; n++)
4048 if (io.KeyMap[n] != -1)
4049 {
4050 IM_ASSERT(IsLegacyKey((ImGuiKey)io.KeyMap[n]));
4051 io.KeyMap[io.KeyMap[n]] = n;
4052 }
4053
4054 // Import legacy keys into new ones
4055 for (int n = ImGuiKey_LegacyNativeKey_BEGIN; n < ImGuiKey_LegacyNativeKey_END; n++)
4056 if (io.KeysDown[n] || io.BackendUsingLegacyKeyArrays == 1)
4057 {
4058 const ImGuiKey key = (ImGuiKey)(io.KeyMap[n] != -1 ? io.KeyMap[n] : n);
4059 IM_ASSERT(io.KeyMap[n] == -1 || IsNamedKey(key));
4060 io.KeysData[key].Down = io.KeysDown[n];
4061 io.BackendUsingLegacyKeyArrays = 1;
4062 }
4063 }
4064#endif
4065
4066 // Update keys
4067 for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.KeysData); i++)
4068 {
4069 ImGuiKeyData& key_data = io.KeysData[i];
4070 key_data.DownDurationPrev = key_data.DownDuration;
4071 key_data.DownDuration = key_data.Down ? (key_data.DownDuration < 0.0f ? 0.0f : key_data.DownDuration + io.DeltaTime) : -1.0f;
4072 }
4073}
4074
4075static void ImGui::UpdateMouseInputs()
4076{
4077 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4078 ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
4079
4080 // Round mouse position to avoid spreading non-rounded position (e.g. UpdateManualResize doesn't support them well)
4081 if (IsMousePosValid(&io.MousePos))
4082 io.MousePos = g.MouseLastValidPos = ImFloorSigned(io.MousePos);
4083
4084 // If mouse just appeared or disappeared (usually denoted by -FLT_MAX components) we cancel out movement in MouseDelta
4085 if (IsMousePosValid(&io.MousePos) && IsMousePosValid(&io.MousePosPrev))
4086 io.MouseDelta = io.MousePos - io.MousePosPrev;
4087 else
4088 io.MouseDelta = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
4089
4090 // If mouse moved we re-enable mouse hovering in case it was disabled by gamepad/keyboard. In theory should use a >0.0f threshold but would need to reset in everywhere we set this to true.
4091 if (io.MouseDelta.x != 0.0f || io.MouseDelta.y != 0.0f)
4092 g.NavDisableMouseHover = false;
4093
4094 io.MousePosPrev = io.MousePos;
4095 for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.MouseDown); i++)
4096 {
4097 io.MouseClicked[i] = io.MouseDown[i] && io.MouseDownDuration[i] < 0.0f;
4098 io.MouseClickedCount[i] = 0; // Will be filled below
4099 io.MouseReleased[i] = !io.MouseDown[i] && io.MouseDownDuration[i] >= 0.0f;
4100 io.MouseDownDurationPrev[i] = io.MouseDownDuration[i];
4101 io.MouseDownDuration[i] = io.MouseDown[i] ? (io.MouseDownDuration[i] < 0.0f ? 0.0f : io.MouseDownDuration[i] + io.DeltaTime) : -1.0f;
4102 if (io.MouseClicked[i])
4103 {
4104 bool is_repeated_click = false;
4105 if ((float)(g.Time - io.MouseClickedTime[i]) < io.MouseDoubleClickTime)
4106 {
4107 ImVec2 delta_from_click_pos = IsMousePosValid(&io.MousePos) ? (io.MousePos - io.MouseClickedPos[i]) : ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
4108 if (ImLengthSqr(delta_from_click_pos) < io.MouseDoubleClickMaxDist * io.MouseDoubleClickMaxDist)
4109 is_repeated_click = true;
4110 }
4111 if (is_repeated_click)
4112 io.MouseClickedLastCount[i]++;
4113 else
4114 io.MouseClickedLastCount[i] = 1;
4115 io.MouseClickedTime[i] = g.Time;
4116 io.MouseClickedPos[i] = io.MousePos;
4117 io.MouseClickedCount[i] = io.MouseClickedLastCount[i];
4118 io.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[i] = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
4119 io.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[i] = 0.0f;
4120 }
4121 else if (io.MouseDown[i])
4122 {
4123 // Maintain the maximum distance we reaching from the initial click position, which is used with dragging threshold
4124 ImVec2 delta_from_click_pos = IsMousePosValid(&io.MousePos) ? (io.MousePos - io.MouseClickedPos[i]) : ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
4125 io.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[i] = ImMax(io.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[i], ImLengthSqr(delta_from_click_pos));
4126 io.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[i].x = ImMax(io.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[i].x, delta_from_click_pos.x < 0.0f ? -delta_from_click_pos.x : delta_from_click_pos.x);
4127 io.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[i].y = ImMax(io.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[i].y, delta_from_click_pos.y < 0.0f ? -delta_from_click_pos.y : delta_from_click_pos.y);
4128 }
4129
4130 // We provide io.MouseDoubleClicked[] as a legacy service
4131 io.MouseDoubleClicked[i] = (io.MouseClickedCount[i] == 2);
4132
4133 // Clicking any mouse button reactivate mouse hovering which may have been deactivated by gamepad/keyboard navigation
4134 if (io.MouseClicked[i])
4135 g.NavDisableMouseHover = false;
4136 }
4137}
4138
4139static void StartLockWheelingWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
4140{
4141 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4142 if (g.WheelingWindow == window)
4143 return;
4144 g.WheelingWindow = window;
4145 g.WheelingWindowRefMousePos = g.IO.MousePos;
4146 g.WheelingWindowTimer = WINDOWS_MOUSE_WHEEL_SCROLL_LOCK_TIMER;
4147}
4148
4149void ImGui::UpdateMouseWheel()
4150{
4151 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4152
4153 // Reset the locked window if we move the mouse or after the timer elapses
4154 if (g.WheelingWindow != NULL)
4155 {
4156 g.WheelingWindowTimer -= g.IO.DeltaTime;
4157 if (IsMousePosValid() && ImLengthSqr(g.IO.MousePos - g.WheelingWindowRefMousePos) > g.IO.MouseDragThreshold * g.IO.MouseDragThreshold)
4158 g.WheelingWindowTimer = 0.0f;
4159 if (g.WheelingWindowTimer <= 0.0f)
4160 {
4161 g.WheelingWindow = NULL;
4162 g.WheelingWindowTimer = 0.0f;
4163 }
4164 }
4165
4166 if (g.IO.MouseWheel == 0.0f && g.IO.MouseWheelH == 0.0f)
4167 return;
4168
4169 if ((g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveIdUsingMouseWheel) || (g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame != 0 && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrameUsingMouseWheel))
4170 return;
4171
4172 ImGuiWindow* window = g.WheelingWindow ? g.WheelingWindow : g.HoveredWindow;
4173 if (!window || window->Collapsed)
4174 return;
4175
4176 // Zoom / Scale window
4177 // FIXME-OBSOLETE: This is an old feature, it still works but pretty much nobody is using it and may be best redesigned.
4178 if (g.IO.MouseWheel != 0.0f && g.IO.KeyCtrl && g.IO.FontAllowUserScaling)
4179 {
4180 StartLockWheelingWindow(window);
4181 const float new_font_scale = ImClamp(window->FontWindowScale + g.IO.MouseWheel * 0.10f, 0.50f, 2.50f);
4182 const float scale = new_font_scale / window->FontWindowScale;
4183 window->FontWindowScale = new_font_scale;
4184 if (window == window->RootWindow)
4185 {
4186 const ImVec2 offset = window->Size * (1.0f - scale) * (g.IO.MousePos - window->Pos) / window->Size;
4187 SetWindowPos(window, window->Pos + offset, 0);
4188 window->Size = ImFloor(window->Size * scale);
4189 window->SizeFull = ImFloor(window->SizeFull * scale);
4190 }
4191 return;
4192 }
4193
4194 // Mouse wheel scrolling
4195 // If a child window has the ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse flag, we give a chance to scroll its parent
4196 if (g.IO.KeyCtrl)
4197 return;
4198
4199 // As a standard behavior holding SHIFT while using Vertical Mouse Wheel triggers Horizontal scroll instead
4200 // (we avoid doing it on OSX as it the OS input layer handles this already)
4201 const bool swap_axis = g.IO.KeyShift && !g.IO.ConfigMacOSXBehaviors;
4202 const float wheel_y = swap_axis ? 0.0f : g.IO.MouseWheel;
4203 const float wheel_x = swap_axis ? g.IO.MouseWheel : g.IO.MouseWheelH;
4204
4205 // Vertical Mouse Wheel scrolling
4206 if (wheel_y != 0.0f)
4207 {
4208 StartLockWheelingWindow(window);
4209 while ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && ((window->ScrollMax.y == 0.0f) || ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))))
4210 window = window->ParentWindow;
4211 if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))
4212 {
4213 float max_step = window->InnerRect.GetHeight() * 0.67f;
4214 float scroll_step = ImFloor(ImMin(5 * window->CalcFontSize(), max_step));
4215 SetScrollY(window, window->Scroll.y - wheel_y * scroll_step);
4216 }
4217 }
4218
4219 // Horizontal Mouse Wheel scrolling, or Vertical Mouse Wheel w/ Shift held
4220 if (wheel_x != 0.0f)
4221 {
4222 StartLockWheelingWindow(window);
4223 while ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && ((window->ScrollMax.x == 0.0f) || ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))))
4224 window = window->ParentWindow;
4225 if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))
4226 {
4227 float max_step = window->InnerRect.GetWidth() * 0.67f;
4228 float scroll_step = ImFloor(ImMin(2 * window->CalcFontSize(), max_step));
4229 SetScrollX(window, window->Scroll.x - wheel_x * scroll_step);
4230 }
4231 }
4232}
4233
4234// The reason this is exposed in imgui_internal.h is: on touch-based system that don't have hovering, we want to dispatch inputs to the right target (imgui vs imgui+app)
4235void ImGui::UpdateHoveredWindowAndCaptureFlags()
4236{
4237 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4238 ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
4239 g.WindowsHoverPadding = ImMax(g.Style.TouchExtraPadding, ImVec2(WINDOWS_HOVER_PADDING, WINDOWS_HOVER_PADDING));
4240
4241 // Find the window hovered by mouse:
4242 // - Child windows can extend beyond the limit of their parent so we need to derive HoveredRootWindow from HoveredWindow.
4243 // - When moving a window we can skip the search, which also conveniently bypasses the fact that window->WindowRectClipped is lagging as this point of the frame.
4244 // - We also support the moved window toggling the NoInputs flag after moving has started in order to be able to detect windows below it, which is useful for e.g. docking mechanisms.
4245 bool clear_hovered_windows = false;
4246 FindHoveredWindow();
4247 IM_ASSERT(g.HoveredWindow == NULL || g.HoveredWindow == g.MovingWindow || g.HoveredWindow->Viewport == g.MouseViewport);
4248
4249 // Modal windows prevents mouse from hovering behind them.
4250 ImGuiWindow* modal_window = GetTopMostPopupModal();
4251 if (modal_window && g.HoveredWindow && !IsWindowWithinBeginStackOf(g.HoveredWindow->RootWindow, modal_window)) // FIXME-MERGE: RootWindowDockTree ?
4252 clear_hovered_windows = true;
4253
4254 // Disabled mouse?
4255 if (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouse)
4256 clear_hovered_windows = true;
4257
4258 // We track click ownership. When clicked outside of a window the click is owned by the application and
4259 // won't report hovering nor request capture even while dragging over our windows afterward.
4260 const bool has_open_popup = (g.OpenPopupStack.Size > 0);
4261 const bool has_open_modal = (modal_window != NULL);
4262 int mouse_earliest_down = -1;
4263 bool mouse_any_down = false;
4264 for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.MouseDown); i++)
4265 {
4266 if (io.MouseClicked[i])
4267 {
4268 io.MouseDownOwned[i] = (g.HoveredWindow != NULL) || has_open_popup;
4269 io.MouseDownOwnedUnlessPopupClose[i] = (g.HoveredWindow != NULL) || has_open_modal;
4270 }
4271 mouse_any_down |= io.MouseDown[i];
4272 if (io.MouseDown[i])
4273 if (mouse_earliest_down == -1 || io.MouseClickedTime[i] < io.MouseClickedTime[mouse_earliest_down])
4274 mouse_earliest_down = i;
4275 }
4276 const bool mouse_avail = (mouse_earliest_down == -1) || io.MouseDownOwned[mouse_earliest_down];
4277 const bool mouse_avail_unless_popup_close = (mouse_earliest_down == -1) || io.MouseDownOwnedUnlessPopupClose[mouse_earliest_down];
4278
4279 // If mouse was first clicked outside of ImGui bounds we also cancel out hovering.
4280 // FIXME: For patterns of drag and drop across OS windows, we may need to rework/remove this test (first committed 311c0ca9 on 2015/02)
4281 const bool mouse_dragging_extern_payload = g.DragDropActive && (g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceExtern) != 0;
4282 if (!mouse_avail && !mouse_dragging_extern_payload)
4283 clear_hovered_windows = true;
4284
4285 if (clear_hovered_windows)
4286 g.HoveredWindow = g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow = NULL;
4287
4288 // Update io.WantCaptureMouse for the user application (true = dispatch mouse info to Dear ImGui only, false = dispatch mouse to Dear ImGui + underlying app)
4289 // Update io.WantCaptureMouseAllowPopupClose (experimental) to give a chance for app to react to popup closure with a drag
4290 if (g.WantCaptureMouseNextFrame != -1)
4291 {
4292 io.WantCaptureMouse = io.WantCaptureMouseUnlessPopupClose = (g.WantCaptureMouseNextFrame != 0);
4293 }
4294 else
4295 {
4296 io.WantCaptureMouse = (mouse_avail && (g.HoveredWindow != NULL || mouse_any_down)) || has_open_popup;
4297 io.WantCaptureMouseUnlessPopupClose = (mouse_avail_unless_popup_close && (g.HoveredWindow != NULL || mouse_any_down)) || has_open_modal;
4298 }
4299
4300 // Update io.WantCaptureKeyboard for the user application (true = dispatch keyboard info to Dear ImGui only, false = dispatch keyboard info to Dear ImGui + underlying app)
4301 if (g.WantCaptureKeyboardNextFrame != -1)
4302 io.WantCaptureKeyboard = (g.WantCaptureKeyboardNextFrame != 0);
4303 else
4304 io.WantCaptureKeyboard = (g.ActiveId != 0) || (modal_window != NULL);
4305 if (io.NavActive && (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard) && !(io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavNoCaptureKeyboard))
4306 io.WantCaptureKeyboard = true;
4307
4308 // Update io.WantTextInput flag, this is to allow systems without a keyboard (e.g. mobile, hand-held) to show a software keyboard if possible
4309 io.WantTextInput = (g.WantTextInputNextFrame != -1) ? (g.WantTextInputNextFrame != 0) : false;
4310}
4311
4312ImGuiKeyModFlags ImGui::GetMergedKeyModFlags()
4313{
4314 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4315 ImGuiKeyModFlags key_mod_flags = ImGuiKeyModFlags_None;
4316 if (g.IO.KeyCtrl) { key_mod_flags |= ImGuiKeyModFlags_Ctrl; }
4317 if (g.IO.KeyShift) { key_mod_flags |= ImGuiKeyModFlags_Shift; }
4318 if (g.IO.KeyAlt) { key_mod_flags |= ImGuiKeyModFlags_Alt; }
4319 if (g.IO.KeySuper) { key_mod_flags |= ImGuiKeyModFlags_Super; }
4320 return key_mod_flags;
4321}
4322
4323void ImGui::NewFrame()
4324{
4325 IM_ASSERT(GImGui != NULL && "No current context. Did you call ImGui::CreateContext() and ImGui::SetCurrentContext() ?");
4326 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4327
4328 // Remove pending delete hooks before frame start.
4329 // This deferred removal avoid issues of removal while iterating the hook vector
4330 for (int n = g.Hooks.Size - 1; n >= 0; n--)
4331 if (g.Hooks[n].Type == ImGuiContextHookType_PendingRemoval_)
4332 g.Hooks.erase(&g.Hooks[n]);
4333
4334 CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_NewFramePre);
4335
4336 // Check and assert for various common IO and Configuration mistakes
4337 g.ConfigFlagsLastFrame = g.ConfigFlagsCurrFrame;
4338 ErrorCheckNewFrameSanityChecks();
4339 g.ConfigFlagsCurrFrame = g.IO.ConfigFlags;
4340
4341 // Load settings on first frame, save settings when modified (after a delay)
4342 UpdateSettings();
4343
4344 g.Time += g.IO.DeltaTime;
4345 g.WithinFrameScope = true;
4346 g.FrameCount += 1;
4347 g.TooltipOverrideCount = 0;
4348 g.WindowsActiveCount = 0;
4349 g.MenusIdSubmittedThisFrame.resize(0);
4350
4351 // Calculate frame-rate for the user, as a purely luxurious feature
4352 g.FramerateSecPerFrameAccum += g.IO.DeltaTime - g.FramerateSecPerFrame[g.FramerateSecPerFrameIdx];
4353 g.FramerateSecPerFrame[g.FramerateSecPerFrameIdx] = g.IO.DeltaTime;
4354 g.FramerateSecPerFrameIdx = (g.FramerateSecPerFrameIdx + 1) % IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.FramerateSecPerFrame);
4355 g.FramerateSecPerFrameCount = ImMin(g.FramerateSecPerFrameCount + 1, IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.FramerateSecPerFrame));
4356 g.IO.Framerate = (g.FramerateSecPerFrameAccum > 0.0f) ? (1.0f / (g.FramerateSecPerFrameAccum / (float)g.FramerateSecPerFrameCount)) : FLT_MAX;
4357
4358 UpdateViewportsNewFrame();
4359
4360 // Setup current font and draw list shared data
4361 // FIXME-VIEWPORT: the concept of a single ClipRectFullscreen is not ideal!
4362 g.IO.Fonts->Locked = true;
4363 SetCurrentFont(GetDefaultFont());
4364 IM_ASSERT(g.Font->IsLoaded());
4365 ImRect virtual_space(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX);
4366 for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
4367 virtual_space.Add(g.Viewports[n]->GetMainRect());
4368 g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen = virtual_space.ToVec4();
4369 g.DrawListSharedData.CurveTessellationTol = g.Style.CurveTessellationTol;
4370 g.DrawListSharedData.SetCircleTessellationMaxError(g.Style.CircleTessellationMaxError);
4371 g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags = ImDrawListFlags_None;
4372 if (g.Style.AntiAliasedLines)
4373 g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags |= ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLines;
4374 if (g.Style.AntiAliasedLinesUseTex && !(g.Font->ContainerAtlas->Flags & ImFontAtlasFlags_NoBakedLines))
4375 g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags |= ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLinesUseTex;
4376 if (g.Style.AntiAliasedFill)
4377 g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags |= ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedFill;
4378 if (g.IO.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset)
4379 g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags |= ImDrawListFlags_AllowVtxOffset;
4380
4381 // Mark rendering data as invalid to prevent user who may have a handle on it to use it.
4382 for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
4383 {
4384 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
4385 viewport->DrawData = NULL;
4386 viewport->DrawDataP.Clear();
4387 }
4388
4389 // Drag and drop keep the source ID alive so even if the source disappear our state is consistent
4390 if (g.DragDropActive && g.DragDropPayload.SourceId == g.ActiveId)
4391 KeepAliveID(g.DragDropPayload.SourceId);
4392
4393 // Update HoveredId data
4394 if (!g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame)
4395 g.HoveredIdTimer = 0.0f;
4396 if (!g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame || (g.HoveredId && g.ActiveId == g.HoveredId))
4397 g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer = 0.0f;
4398 if (g.HoveredId)
4399 g.HoveredIdTimer += g.IO.DeltaTime;
4400 if (g.HoveredId && g.ActiveId != g.HoveredId)
4401 g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer += g.IO.DeltaTime;
4402 g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame = g.HoveredId;
4403 g.HoveredIdPreviousFrameUsingMouseWheel = g.HoveredIdUsingMouseWheel;
4404 g.HoveredId = 0;
4405 g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap = false;
4406 g.HoveredIdUsingMouseWheel = false;
4407 g.HoveredIdDisabled = false;
4408
4409 // Update ActiveId data (clear reference to active widget if the widget isn't alive anymore)
4410 if (g.ActiveIdIsAlive != g.ActiveId && g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame == g.ActiveId && g.ActiveId != 0)
4411 ClearActiveID();
4412 if (g.ActiveId)
4413 g.ActiveIdTimer += g.IO.DeltaTime;
4414 g.LastActiveIdTimer += g.IO.DeltaTime;
4415 g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame = g.ActiveId;
4416 g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameWindow = g.ActiveIdWindow;
4417 g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameHasBeenEditedBefore = g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore;
4418 g.ActiveIdIsAlive = 0;
4419 g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedThisFrame = false;
4420 g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive = false;
4421 g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated = false;
4422 if (g.TempInputId != 0 && g.ActiveId != g.TempInputId)
4423 g.TempInputId = 0;
4424 if (g.ActiveId == 0)
4425 {
4426 g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask = 0x00;
4427 g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask = 0x00;
4428 g.ActiveIdUsingKeyInputMask.ClearAllBits();
4429 }
4430
4431 // Drag and drop
4432 g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev = g.DragDropAcceptIdCurr;
4433 g.DragDropAcceptIdCurr = 0;
4434 g.DragDropAcceptIdCurrRectSurface = FLT_MAX;
4435 g.DragDropWithinSource = false;
4436 g.DragDropWithinTarget = false;
4437 g.DragDropHoldJustPressedId = 0;
4438
4439 // Close popups on focus lost (currently wip/opt-in)
4440 //if (g.IO.AppFocusLost)
4441 // ClosePopupsExceptModals();
4442
4443 // Process input queue (trickle as many events as possible)
4444 g.InputEventsTrail.resize(0);
4445 UpdateInputEvents(g.IO.ConfigInputEventQueue);
4446
4447 // Update keyboard input state
4448 UpdateKeyboardInputs();
4449
4450 // Update gamepad/keyboard navigation
4451 NavUpdate();
4452
4453 // Update mouse input state
4454 UpdateMouseInputs();
4455
4456 // Undocking
4457 // (needs to be before UpdateMouseMovingWindowNewFrame so the window is already offset and following the mouse on the detaching frame)
4458 DockContextNewFrameUpdateUndocking(&g);
4459
4460 // Find hovered window
4461 // (needs to be before UpdateMouseMovingWindowNewFrame so we fill g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow on the mouse release frame)
4462 UpdateHoveredWindowAndCaptureFlags();
4463
4464 // Handle user moving window with mouse (at the beginning of the frame to avoid input lag or sheering)
4465 UpdateMouseMovingWindowNewFrame();
4466
4467 // Background darkening/whitening
4468 if (GetTopMostPopupModal() != NULL || (g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL && g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha > 0.0f))
4469 g.DimBgRatio = ImMin(g.DimBgRatio + g.IO.DeltaTime * 6.0f, 1.0f);
4470 else
4471 g.DimBgRatio = ImMax(g.DimBgRatio - g.IO.DeltaTime * 10.0f, 0.0f);
4472
