4473 g.MouseCursor = ImGuiMouseCursor_Arrow;
4474 g.WantCaptureMouseNextFrame = g.WantCaptureKeyboardNextFrame = g.WantTextInputNextFrame = -1;
4475
4476 // Platform IME data: reset for the frame
4477 g.PlatformImeDataPrev = g.PlatformImeData;
4478 g.PlatformImeData.WantVisible = false;
4479
4480 // Mouse wheel scrolling, scale
4481 UpdateMouseWheel();
4482
4483 // Mark all windows as not visible and compact unused memory.
4484 IM_ASSERT(g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size <= g.Windows.Size);
4485 const float memory_compact_start_time = (g.GcCompactAll || g.IO.ConfigMemoryCompactTimer < 0.0f) ? FLT_MAX : (float)g.Time - g.IO.ConfigMemoryCompactTimer;
4486 for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
4487 {
4488 ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[i];
4489 window->WasActive = window->Active;
4490 window->BeginCount = 0;
4491 window->Active = false;
4492 window->WriteAccessed = false;
4493
4494 // Garbage collect transient buffers of recently unused windows
4495 if (!window->WasActive && !window->MemoryCompacted && window->LastTimeActive < memory_compact_start_time)
4496 GcCompactTransientWindowBuffers(window);
4497 }
4498
4499 // Garbage collect transient buffers of recently unused tables
4500 for (int i = 0; i < g.TablesLastTimeActive.Size; i++)
4501 if (g.TablesLastTimeActive[i] >= 0.0f && g.TablesLastTimeActive[i] < memory_compact_start_time)
4502 TableGcCompactTransientBuffers(g.Tables.GetByIndex(i));
4503 for (int i = 0; i < g.TablesTempData.Size; i++)
4504 if (g.TablesTempData[i].LastTimeActive >= 0.0f && g.TablesTempData[i].LastTimeActive < memory_compact_start_time)
4505 TableGcCompactTransientBuffers(&g.TablesTempData[i]);
4506 if (g.GcCompactAll)
4507 GcCompactTransientMiscBuffers();
4508 g.GcCompactAll = false;
4509
4510 // Closing the focused window restore focus to the first active root window in descending z-order
4511 if (g.NavWindow && !g.NavWindow->WasActive)
4512 FocusTopMostWindowUnderOne(NULL, NULL);
4513
4514 // No window should be open at the beginning of the frame.
4515 // But in order to allow the user to call NewFrame() multiple times without calling Render(), we are doing an explicit clear.
4516 g.CurrentWindowStack.resize(0);
4517 g.BeginPopupStack.resize(0);
4518 g.ItemFlagsStack.resize(0);
4519 g.ItemFlagsStack.push_back(ImGuiItemFlags_None);
4520 g.GroupStack.resize(0);
4521
4522 // Docking
4523 DockContextNewFrameUpdateDocking(&g);
4524
4525 // [DEBUG] Update debug features
4526 UpdateDebugToolItemPicker();
4527 UpdateDebugToolStackQueries();
4528
4529 // Create implicit/fallback window - which we will only render it if the user has added something to it.
4530 // We don't use "Debug" to avoid colliding with user trying to create a "Debug" window with custom flags.
4531 // This fallback is particularly important as it avoid ImGui:: calls from crashing.
4532 g.WithinFrameScopeWithImplicitWindow = true;
4533 SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(400, 400), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
4534 Begin("Debug##Default");
4535 IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindow->IsFallbackWindow == true);
4536
4537 CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_NewFramePost);
4538}
4539
4540void ImGui::Initialize(ImGuiContext* context)
4541{
4542 ImGuiContext& g = *context;
4543 IM_ASSERT(!g.Initialized && !g.SettingsLoaded);
4544
4545 // Add .ini handle for ImGuiWindow type
4546 {
4547 ImGuiSettingsHandler ini_handler;
4548 ini_handler.TypeName = "Window";
4549 ini_handler.TypeHash = ImHashStr("Window");
4550 ini_handler.ClearAllFn = WindowSettingsHandler_ClearAll;
4551 ini_handler.ReadOpenFn = WindowSettingsHandler_ReadOpen;
4552 ini_handler.ReadLineFn = WindowSettingsHandler_ReadLine;
4553 ini_handler.ApplyAllFn = WindowSettingsHandler_ApplyAll;
4554 ini_handler.WriteAllFn = WindowSettingsHandler_WriteAll;
4555 g.SettingsHandlers.push_back(ini_handler);
4556 }
4557
4558 // Add .ini handle for ImGuiTable type
4559 TableSettingsInstallHandler(context);
4560
4561 // Create default viewport
4562 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = IM_NEW(ImGuiViewportP)();
4563 viewport->ID = IMGUI_VIEWPORT_DEFAULT_ID;
4564 viewport->Idx = 0;
4565 viewport->PlatformWindowCreated = true;
4566 viewport->Flags = ImGuiViewportFlags_OwnedByApp;
4567 g.Viewports.push_back(viewport);
4568 g.PlatformIO.Viewports.push_back(g.Viewports[0]);
4569
4570#ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
4571 // Initialize Docking
4572 DockContextInitialize(&g);
4573#endif
4574
4575 g.Initialized = true;
4576}
4577
4578// This function is merely here to free heap allocations.
4579void ImGui::Shutdown(ImGuiContext* context)
4580{
4581 // The fonts atlas can be used prior to calling NewFrame(), so we clear it even if g.Initialized is FALSE (which would happen if we never called NewFrame)
4582 ImGuiContext& g = *context;
4583 if (g.IO.Fonts && g.FontAtlasOwnedByContext)
4584 {
4585 g.IO.Fonts->Locked = false;
4586 IM_DELETE(g.IO.Fonts);
4587 }
4588 g.IO.Fonts = NULL;
4589
4590 // Cleanup of other data are conditional on actually having initialized Dear ImGui.
4591 if (!g.Initialized)
4592 return;
4593
4594 // Save settings (unless we haven't attempted to load them: CreateContext/DestroyContext without a call to NewFrame shouldn't save an empty file)
4595 if (g.SettingsLoaded && g.IO.IniFilename != NULL)
4596 {
4597 ImGuiContext* backup_context = GImGui;
4598 SetCurrentContext(&g);
4599 SaveIniSettingsToDisk(g.IO.IniFilename);
4600 SetCurrentContext(backup_context);
4601 }
4602
4603 // Destroy platform windows
4604 ImGuiContext* backup_context = ImGui::GetCurrentContext();
4605 SetCurrentContext(context);
4606 DestroyPlatformWindows();
4607 SetCurrentContext(backup_context);
4608
4609 // Shutdown extensions
4610 DockContextShutdown(&g);
4611
4612 CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_Shutdown);
4613
4614 // Clear everything else
4615 g.Windows.clear_delete();
4616 g.WindowsFocusOrder.clear();
4617 g.WindowsTempSortBuffer.clear();
4618 g.CurrentWindow = NULL;
4619 g.CurrentWindowStack.clear();
4620 g.WindowsById.Clear();
4621 g.NavWindow = NULL;
4622 g.HoveredWindow = g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow = NULL;
4623 g.ActiveIdWindow = g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameWindow = NULL;
4624 g.MovingWindow = NULL;
4625 g.ColorStack.clear();
4626 g.StyleVarStack.clear();
4627 g.FontStack.clear();
4628 g.OpenPopupStack.clear();
4629 g.BeginPopupStack.clear();
4630
4631 g.CurrentViewport = g.MouseViewport = g.MouseLastHoveredViewport = NULL;
4632 g.Viewports.clear_delete();
4633
4634 g.TabBars.Clear();
4635 g.CurrentTabBarStack.clear();
4636 g.ShrinkWidthBuffer.clear();
4637
4638 g.ClipperTempData.clear_destruct();
4639
4640 g.Tables.Clear();
4641 g.TablesTempData.clear_destruct();
4642 g.DrawChannelsTempMergeBuffer.clear();
4643
4644 g.ClipboardHandlerData.clear();
4645 g.MenusIdSubmittedThisFrame.clear();
4646 g.InputTextState.ClearFreeMemory();
4647
4648 g.SettingsWindows.clear();
4649 g.SettingsHandlers.clear();
4650
4651 if (g.LogFile)
4652 {
4653#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS
4654 if (g.LogFile != stdout)
4655#endif
4656 ImFileClose(g.LogFile);
4657 g.LogFile = NULL;
4658 }
4659 g.LogBuffer.clear();
4660
4661 g.Initialized = false;
4662}
4663
4664// FIXME: Add a more explicit sort order in the window structure.
4665static int IMGUI_CDECL ChildWindowComparer(const void* lhs, const void* rhs)
4666{
4667 const ImGuiWindow* const a = *(const ImGuiWindow* const *)lhs;
4668 const ImGuiWindow* const b = *(const ImGuiWindow* const *)rhs;
4669 if (int d = (a->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) - (b->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup))
4670 return d;
4671 if (int d = (a->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) - (b->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip))
4672 return d;
4673 return (a->BeginOrderWithinParent - b->BeginOrderWithinParent);
4674}
4675
4676static void AddWindowToSortBuffer(ImVector<ImGuiWindow*>* out_sorted_windows, ImGuiWindow* window)
4677{
4678 out_sorted_windows->push_back(window);
4679 if (window->Active)
4680 {
4681 int count = window->DC.ChildWindows.Size;
4682 ImQsort(window->DC.ChildWindows.Data, (size_t)count, sizeof(ImGuiWindow*), ChildWindowComparer);
4683 for (int i = 0; i < count; i++)
4684 {
4685 ImGuiWindow* child = window->DC.ChildWindows[i];
4686 if (child->Active)
4687 AddWindowToSortBuffer(out_sorted_windows, child);
4688 }
4689 }
4690}
4691
4692static void AddDrawListToDrawData(ImVector<ImDrawList*>* out_list, ImDrawList* draw_list)
4693{
4694 // Remove trailing command if unused.
4695 // Technically we could return directly instead of popping, but this make things looks neat in Metrics/Debugger window as well.
4696 draw_list->_PopUnusedDrawCmd();
4697 if (draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size == 0)
4698 return;
4699
4700 // Draw list sanity check. Detect mismatch between PrimReserve() calls and incrementing _VtxCurrentIdx, _VtxWritePtr etc.
4701 // May trigger for you if you are using PrimXXX functions incorrectly.
4702 IM_ASSERT(draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size == 0 || draw_list->_VtxWritePtr == draw_list->VtxBuffer.Data + draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size);
4703 IM_ASSERT(draw_list->IdxBuffer.Size == 0 || draw_list->_IdxWritePtr == draw_list->IdxBuffer.Data + draw_list->IdxBuffer.Size);
4704 if (!(draw_list->Flags & ImDrawListFlags_AllowVtxOffset))
4705 IM_ASSERT((int)draw_list->_VtxCurrentIdx == draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size);
4706
4707 // Check that draw_list doesn't use more vertices than indexable (default ImDrawIdx = unsigned short = 2 bytes = 64K vertices per ImDrawList = per window)
4708 // If this assert triggers because you are drawing lots of stuff manually:
4709 // - First, make sure you are coarse clipping yourself and not trying to draw many things outside visible bounds.
4710 // Be mindful that the ImDrawList API doesn't filter vertices. Use the Metrics/Debugger window to inspect draw list contents.
4711 // - If you want large meshes with more than 64K vertices, you can either:
4712 // (A) Handle the ImDrawCmd::VtxOffset value in your renderer backend, and set 'io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset'.
4713 // Most example backends already support this from 1.71. Pre-1.71 backends won't.
4714 // Some graphics API such as GL ES 1/2 don't have a way to offset the starting vertex so it is not supported for them.
4715 // (B) Or handle 32-bit indices in your renderer backend, and uncomment '#define ImDrawIdx unsigned int' line in imconfig.h.
4716 // Most example backends already support this. For example, the OpenGL example code detect index size at compile-time:
4717 // glDrawElements(GL_TRIANGLES, (GLsizei)pcmd->ElemCount, sizeof(ImDrawIdx) == 2 ? GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT : GL_UNSIGNED_INT, idx_buffer_offset);
4718 // Your own engine or render API may use different parameters or function calls to specify index sizes.
4719 // 2 and 4 bytes indices are generally supported by most graphics API.
4720 // - If for some reason neither of those solutions works for you, a workaround is to call BeginChild()/EndChild() before reaching
4721 // the 64K limit to split your draw commands in multiple draw lists.
4722 if (sizeof(ImDrawIdx) == 2)
4723 IM_ASSERT(draw_list->_VtxCurrentIdx < (1 << 16) && "Too many vertices in ImDrawList using 16-bit indices. Read comment above");
4724
4725 out_list->push_back(draw_list);
4726}
4727
4728static void AddWindowToDrawData(ImGuiWindow* window, int layer)
4729{
4730 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4731 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = window->Viewport;
4732 g.IO.MetricsRenderWindows++;
4733 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost)
4734 window->DrawList->ChannelsMerge();
4735 AddDrawListToDrawData(&viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[layer], window->DrawList);
4736 for (int i = 0; i < window->DC.ChildWindows.Size; i++)
4737 {
4738 ImGuiWindow* child = window->DC.ChildWindows[i];
4739 if (IsWindowActiveAndVisible(child)) // Clipped children may have been marked not active
4740 AddWindowToDrawData(child, layer);
4741 }
4742}
4743
4744static inline int GetWindowDisplayLayer(ImGuiWindow* window)
4745{
4746 return (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) ? 1 : 0;
4747}
4748
4749// Layer is locked for the root window, however child windows may use a different viewport (e.g. extruding menu)
4750static inline void AddRootWindowToDrawData(ImGuiWindow* window)
4751{
4752 AddWindowToDrawData(window, GetWindowDisplayLayer(window));
4753}
4754
4755void ImDrawDataBuilder::FlattenIntoSingleLayer()
4756{
4757 int n = Layers[0].Size;
4758 int size = n;
4759 for (int i = 1; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(Layers); i++)
4760 size += Layers[i].Size;
4761 Layers[0].resize(size);
4762 for (int layer_n = 1; layer_n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(Layers); layer_n++)
4763 {
4764 ImVector<ImDrawList*>& layer = Layers[layer_n];
4765 if (layer.empty())
4766 continue;
4767 memcpy(&Layers[0][n], &layer[0], layer.Size * sizeof(ImDrawList*));
4768 n += layer.Size;
4769 layer.resize(0);
4770 }
4771}
4772
4773static void SetupViewportDrawData(ImGuiViewportP* viewport, ImVector<ImDrawList*>* draw_lists)
4774{
4775 // When minimized, we report draw_data->DisplaySize as zero to be consistent with non-viewport mode,
4776 // and to allow applications/backends to easily skip rendering.
4777 // FIXME: Note that we however do NOT attempt to report "zero drawlist / vertices" into the ImDrawData structure.
4778 // This is because the work has been done already, and its wasted! We should fix that and add optimizations for
4779 // it earlier in the pipeline, rather than pretend to hide the data at the end of the pipeline.
4780 const bool is_minimized = (viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized) != 0;
4781
4782 ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
4783 ImDrawData* draw_data = &viewport->DrawDataP;
4784 viewport->DrawData = draw_data; // Make publicly accessible
4785 draw_data->Valid = true;
4786 draw_data->CmdLists = (draw_lists->Size > 0) ? draw_lists->Data : NULL;
4787 draw_data->CmdListsCount = draw_lists->Size;
4788 draw_data->TotalVtxCount = draw_data->TotalIdxCount = 0;
4789 draw_data->DisplayPos = viewport->Pos;
4790 draw_data->DisplaySize = is_minimized ? ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f) : viewport->Size;
4791 draw_data->FramebufferScale = io.DisplayFramebufferScale; // FIXME-VIEWPORT: This may vary on a per-monitor/viewport basis?
4792 draw_data->OwnerViewport = viewport;
4793 for (int n = 0; n < draw_lists->Size; n++)
4794 {
4795 draw_data->TotalVtxCount += draw_lists->Data[n]->VtxBuffer.Size;
4796 draw_data->TotalIdxCount += draw_lists->Data[n]->IdxBuffer.Size;
4797 }
4798}
4799
4800// Push a clipping rectangle for both ImGui logic (hit-testing etc.) and low-level ImDrawList rendering.
4801// - When using this function it is sane to ensure that float are perfectly rounded to integer values,
4802// so that e.g. (int)(max.x-min.x) in user's render produce correct result.
4803// - If the code here changes, may need to update code of functions like NextColumn() and PushColumnClipRect():
4804// some frequently called functions which to modify both channels and clipping simultaneously tend to use the
4805// more specialized SetWindowClipRectBeforeSetChannel() to avoid extraneous updates of underlying ImDrawCmds.
4806void ImGui::PushClipRect(const ImVec2& clip_rect_min, const ImVec2& clip_rect_max, bool intersect_with_current_clip_rect)
4807{
4808 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
4809 window->DrawList->PushClipRect(clip_rect_min, clip_rect_max, intersect_with_current_clip_rect);
4810 window->ClipRect = window->DrawList->_ClipRectStack.back();
4811}
4812
4813void ImGui::PopClipRect()
4814{
4815 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
4816 window->DrawList->PopClipRect();
4817 window->ClipRect = window->DrawList->_ClipRectStack.back();
4818}
4819
4820static ImGuiWindow* FindFrontMostVisibleChildWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
4821{
4822 for (int n = window->DC.ChildWindows.Size - 1; n >= 0; n--)
4823 if (IsWindowActiveAndVisible(window->DC.ChildWindows[n]))
4824 return FindFrontMostVisibleChildWindow(window->DC.ChildWindows[n]);
4825 return window;
4826}
4827
4828static void ImGui::RenderDimmedBackgroundBehindWindow(ImGuiWindow* window, ImU32 col)
4829{
4830 if ((col & IM_COL32_A_MASK) == 0)
4831 return;
4832
4833 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = window->Viewport;
4834 ImRect viewport_rect = viewport->GetMainRect();
4835
4836 // Draw behind window by moving the draw command at the FRONT of the draw list
4837 {
4838 // We've already called AddWindowToDrawData() which called DrawList->ChannelsMerge() on DockNodeHost windows,
4839 // and draw list have been trimmed already, hence the explicit recreation of a draw command if missing.
4840 ImDrawList* draw_list = window->RootWindowDockTree->DrawList;
4841 if (draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size == 0)
4842 draw_list->AddDrawCmd();
4843 draw_list->PushClipRect(viewport_rect.Min - ImVec2(1, 1), viewport_rect.Max + ImVec2(1, 1), false); // Ensure ImDrawCmd are not merged
4844 draw_list->AddRectFilled(viewport_rect.Min, viewport_rect.Max, col);
4845 ImDrawCmd cmd = draw_list->CmdBuffer.back();
4846 IM_ASSERT(cmd.ElemCount == 6);
4847 draw_list->CmdBuffer.pop_back();
4848 draw_list->CmdBuffer.push_front(cmd);
4849 draw_list->PopClipRect();
4850 draw_list->_PopUnusedDrawCmd(); // Since are past the calls to AddDrawListToDrawData() we don't have a _PopUnusedDrawCmd() running on commands.
4851 }
4852
4853 // Draw over sibling docking nodes in a same docking tree
4854 if (window->RootWindow->DockIsActive)
4855 {
4856 ImDrawList* draw_list = FindFrontMostVisibleChildWindow(window->RootWindowDockTree)->DrawList;
4857 draw_list->PushClipRect(viewport_rect.Min, viewport_rect.Max, false);
4858 RenderRectFilledWithHole(draw_list, window->RootWindowDockTree->Rect(), window->RootWindow->Rect(), col, 0.0f);// window->RootWindowDockTree->WindowRounding);
4859 draw_list->PopClipRect();
4860 draw_list->_PopUnusedDrawCmd();
4861 }
4862}
4863
4864ImGuiWindow* ImGui::FindBottomMostVisibleWindowWithinBeginStack(ImGuiWindow* parent_window)
4865{
4866 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4867 ImGuiWindow* bottom_most_visible_window = parent_window;
4868 for (int i = FindWindowDisplayIndex(parent_window); i >= 0; i--)
4869 {
4870 ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[i];
4871 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
4872 continue;
4873 if (!IsWindowWithinBeginStackOf(window, parent_window))
4874 break;
4875 if (IsWindowActiveAndVisible(window) && GetWindowDisplayLayer(window) <= GetWindowDisplayLayer(parent_window))
4876 bottom_most_visible_window = window;
4877 }
4878 return bottom_most_visible_window;
4879}
4880
4881static void ImGui::RenderDimmedBackgrounds()
4882{
4883 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4884 ImGuiWindow* modal_window = GetTopMostAndVisiblePopupModal();
4885 const bool dim_bg_for_modal = (modal_window != NULL);
4886 const bool dim_bg_for_window_list = (g.NavWindowingTargetAnim != NULL && g.NavWindowingTargetAnim->Active);
4887 if (!dim_bg_for_modal && !dim_bg_for_window_list)
4888 return;
4889
4890 ImGuiViewport* viewports_already_dimmed[2] = { NULL, NULL };
4891 if (dim_bg_for_modal)
4892 {
4893 // Draw dimming behind modal or a begin stack child, whichever comes first in draw order.
4894 ImGuiWindow* dim_behind_window = FindBottomMostVisibleWindowWithinBeginStack(modal_window);
4895 RenderDimmedBackgroundBehindWindow(dim_behind_window, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg, g.DimBgRatio));
4896 viewports_already_dimmed[0] = modal_window->Viewport;
4897 }
4898 else if (dim_bg_for_window_list)
4899 {
4900 // Draw dimming behind CTRL+Tab target window and behind CTRL+Tab UI window
4901 RenderDimmedBackgroundBehindWindow(g.NavWindowingTargetAnim, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavWindowingDimBg, g.DimBgRatio));
4902 if (g.NavWindowingListWindow != NULL && g.NavWindowingListWindow->Viewport && g.NavWindowingListWindow->Viewport != g.NavWindowingTargetAnim->Viewport)
4903 RenderDimmedBackgroundBehindWindow(g.NavWindowingListWindow, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavWindowingDimBg, g.DimBgRatio));
4904 viewports_already_dimmed[0] = g.NavWindowingTargetAnim->Viewport;
4905 viewports_already_dimmed[1] = g.NavWindowingListWindow ? g.NavWindowingListWindow->Viewport : NULL;
4906
4907 // Draw border around CTRL+Tab target window
4908 ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindowingTargetAnim;
4909 ImGuiViewport* viewport = window->Viewport;
4910 float distance = g.FontSize;
4911 ImRect bb = window->Rect();
4912 bb.Expand(distance);
4913 if (bb.GetWidth() >= viewport->Size.x && bb.GetHeight() >= viewport->Size.y)
4914 bb.Expand(-distance - 1.0f); // If a window fits the entire viewport, adjust its highlight inward
4915 if (window->DrawList->CmdBuffer.Size == 0)
4916 window->DrawList->AddDrawCmd();
4917 window->DrawList->PushClipRect(viewport->Pos, viewport->Pos + viewport->Size);
4918 window->DrawList->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavWindowingHighlight, g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha), window->WindowRounding, 0, 3.0f);
4919 window->DrawList->PopClipRect();
4920 window->DrawList->_PopUnusedDrawCmd(); // Since are past the calls to AddDrawListToDrawData() we don't have a _PopUnusedDrawCmd() running on commands.
4921 }
4922
4923 // Draw dimming background on _other_ viewports than the ones our windows are in
4924 for (int viewport_n = 0; viewport_n < g.Viewports.Size; viewport_n++)
4925 {
4926 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[viewport_n];
4927 if (viewport == viewports_already_dimmed[0] || viewport == viewports_already_dimmed[1])
4928 continue;
4929 if (modal_window && viewport->Window && IsWindowAbove(viewport->Window, modal_window))
4930 continue;
4931 ImDrawList* draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(viewport);
4932 const ImU32 dim_bg_col = GetColorU32(dim_bg_for_modal ? ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg : ImGuiCol_NavWindowingDimBg, g.DimBgRatio);
4933 draw_list->AddRectFilled(viewport->Pos, viewport->Pos + viewport->Size, dim_bg_col);
4934 draw_list->_PopUnusedDrawCmd();
4935 }
4936}
4937
4938// This is normally called by Render(). You may want to call it directly if you want to avoid calling Render() but the gain will be very minimal.
4939void ImGui::EndFrame()
4940{
4941 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4942 IM_ASSERT(g.Initialized);
4943
4944 // Don't process EndFrame() multiple times.
4945 if (g.FrameCountEnded == g.FrameCount)
4946 return;
4947 IM_ASSERT(g.WithinFrameScope && "Forgot to call ImGui::NewFrame()?");
4948
4949 CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_EndFramePre);
4950
4951 ErrorCheckEndFrameSanityChecks();
4952
4953 // Notify Platform/OS when our Input Method Editor cursor has moved (e.g. CJK inputs using Microsoft IME)
4954 if (g.IO.SetPlatformImeDataFn && memcmp(&g.PlatformImeData, &g.PlatformImeDataPrev, sizeof(ImGuiPlatformImeData)) != 0)
4955 {
4956 ImGuiViewport* viewport = FindViewportByID(g.PlatformImeViewport);
4957 g.IO.SetPlatformImeDataFn(viewport ? viewport : GetMainViewport(), &g.PlatformImeData);
4958 }
4959
4960 // Hide implicit/fallback "Debug" window if it hasn't been used
4961 g.WithinFrameScopeWithImplicitWindow = false;
4962 if (g.CurrentWindow && !g.CurrentWindow->WriteAccessed)
4963 g.CurrentWindow->Active = false;
4964 End();
4965
4966 // Update navigation: CTRL+Tab, wrap-around requests
4967 NavEndFrame();
4968
4969 // Update docking
4970 DockContextEndFrame(&g);
4971
4972 SetCurrentViewport(NULL, NULL);
4973
4974 // Drag and Drop: Elapse payload (if delivered, or if source stops being submitted)
4975 if (g.DragDropActive)
4976 {
4977 bool is_delivered = g.DragDropPayload.Delivery;
4978 bool is_elapsed = (g.DragDropPayload.DataFrameCount + 1 < g.FrameCount) && ((g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAutoExpirePayload) || !IsMouseDown(g.DragDropMouseButton));
4979 if (is_delivered || is_elapsed)
4980 ClearDragDrop();
4981 }
4982
4983 // Drag and Drop: Fallback for source tooltip. This is not ideal but better than nothing.
4984 if (g.DragDropActive && g.DragDropSourceFrameCount < g.FrameCount && !(g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip))
4985 {
4986 g.DragDropWithinSource = true;
4987 SetTooltip("...");
4988 g.DragDropWithinSource = false;
4989 }
4990
4991 // End frame
4992 g.WithinFrameScope = false;
4993 g.FrameCountEnded = g.FrameCount;
4994
4995 // Initiate moving window + handle left-click and right-click focus
4996 UpdateMouseMovingWindowEndFrame();
4997
4998 // Update user-facing viewport list (g.Viewports -> g.PlatformIO.Viewports after filtering out some)
4999 UpdateViewportsEndFrame();
5000
5001 // Sort the window list so that all child windows are after their parent
5002 // We cannot do that on FocusWindow() because children may not exist yet
5003 g.WindowsTempSortBuffer.resize(0);
5004 g.WindowsTempSortBuffer.reserve(g.Windows.Size);
5005 for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
5006 {
5007 ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[i];
5008 if (window->Active && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)) // if a child is active its parent will add it
5009 continue;
5010 AddWindowToSortBuffer(&g.WindowsTempSortBuffer, window);
5011 }
5012
5013 // This usually assert if there is a mismatch between the ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow / ParentWindow values and DC.ChildWindows[] in parents, aka we've done something wrong.
5014 IM_ASSERT(g.Windows.Size == g.WindowsTempSortBuffer.Size);
5015 g.Windows.swap(g.WindowsTempSortBuffer);
5016 g.IO.MetricsActiveWindows = g.WindowsActiveCount;
5017
5018 // Unlock font atlas
5019 g.IO.Fonts->Locked = false;
5020
5021 // Clear Input data for next frame
5022 g.IO.MouseWheel = g.IO.MouseWheelH = 0.0f;
5023 g.IO.InputQueueCharacters.resize(0);
5024 g.IO.KeyModsPrev = g.IO.KeyMods; // doing it here is better than in NewFrame() as we'll tolerate backend writing to KeyMods. If we want to firmly disallow it we should detect it.
5025 memset(g.IO.NavInputs, 0, sizeof(g.IO.NavInputs));
5026
5027 CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_EndFramePost);
5028}
5029
5030// Prepare the data for rendering so you can call GetDrawData()
5031// (As with anything within the ImGui:: namspace this doesn't touch your GPU or graphics API at all:
5032// it is the role of the ImGui_ImplXXXX_RenderDrawData() function provided by the renderer backend)
5033void ImGui::Render()
5034{
5035 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5036 IM_ASSERT(g.Initialized);
5037
5038 if (g.FrameCountEnded != g.FrameCount)
5039 EndFrame();
5040 const bool first_render_of_frame = (g.FrameCountRendered != g.FrameCount);
5041 g.FrameCountRendered = g.FrameCount;
5042 g.IO.MetricsRenderWindows = 0;
5043
5044 CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_RenderPre);
5045
5046 // Add background ImDrawList (for each active viewport)
5047 for (int n = 0; n != g.Viewports.Size; n++)
5048 {
5049 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
5050 viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Clear();
5051 if (viewport->DrawLists[0] != NULL)
5052 AddDrawListToDrawData(&viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[0], GetBackgroundDrawList(viewport));
5053 }
5054
5055 // Add ImDrawList to render
5056 ImGuiWindow* windows_to_render_top_most[2];
5057 windows_to_render_top_most[0] = (g.NavWindowingTarget && !(g.NavWindowingTarget->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus)) ? g.NavWindowingTarget->RootWindowDockTree : NULL;
5058 windows_to_render_top_most[1] = (g.NavWindowingTarget ? g.NavWindowingListWindow : NULL);
5059 for (int n = 0; n != g.Windows.Size; n++)
5060 {
5061 ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[n];
5062 IM_MSVC_WARNING_SUPPRESS(6011); // Static Analysis false positive "warning C6011: Dereferencing NULL pointer 'window'"
5063 if (IsWindowActiveAndVisible(window) && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) == 0 && window != windows_to_render_top_most[0] && window != windows_to_render_top_most[1])
5064 AddRootWindowToDrawData(window);
5065 }
5066 for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(windows_to_render_top_most); n++)
5067 if (windows_to_render_top_most[n] && IsWindowActiveAndVisible(windows_to_render_top_most[n])) // NavWindowingTarget is always temporarily displayed as the top-most window
5068 AddRootWindowToDrawData(windows_to_render_top_most[n]);
5069
5070 // Draw modal/window whitening backgrounds
5071 if (first_render_of_frame)
5072 RenderDimmedBackgrounds();
5073
5074 ImVec2 mouse_cursor_offset, mouse_cursor_size, mouse_cursor_uv[4];
5075 if (g.IO.MouseDrawCursor && g.MouseCursor != ImGuiMouseCursor_None)
5076 g.IO.Fonts->GetMouseCursorTexData(g.MouseCursor, &mouse_cursor_offset, &mouse_cursor_size, &mouse_cursor_uv[0], &mouse_cursor_uv[2]);
5077
5078 // Setup ImDrawData structures for end-user
5079 g.IO.MetricsRenderVertices = g.IO.MetricsRenderIndices = 0;
5080 for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
5081 {
5082 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
5083 viewport->DrawDataBuilder.FlattenIntoSingleLayer();
5084
5085 // Draw software mouse cursor if requested by io.MouseDrawCursor flag
5086 // (note we scale cursor by current viewport/monitor, however Windows 10 for its own hardware cursor seems to be using a different scale factor)
5087 if (mouse_cursor_size.x > 0.0f && mouse_cursor_size.y > 0.0f && first_render_of_frame)
5088 {
5089 float scale = g.Style.MouseCursorScale * viewport->DpiScale;
5090 if (viewport->GetMainRect().Overlaps(ImRect(g.IO.MousePos, g.IO.MousePos + ImVec2(mouse_cursor_size.x + 2, mouse_cursor_size.y + 2) * scale)))
5091 RenderMouseCursor(GetForegroundDrawList(viewport), g.IO.MousePos, scale, g.MouseCursor, IM_COL32_WHITE, IM_COL32_BLACK, IM_COL32(0, 0, 0, 48));
5092 }
5093
5094 // Add foreground ImDrawList (for each active viewport)
5095 if (viewport->DrawLists[1] != NULL)
5096 AddDrawListToDrawData(&viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[0], GetForegroundDrawList(viewport));
5097
5098 SetupViewportDrawData(viewport, &viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[0]);
5099 ImDrawData* draw_data = viewport->DrawData;
5100 g.IO.MetricsRenderVertices += draw_data->TotalVtxCount;
5101 g.IO.MetricsRenderIndices += draw_data->TotalIdxCount;
5102 }
5103
5104 CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_RenderPost);
5105}
5106
5107// Calculate text size. Text can be multi-line. Optionally ignore text after a ## marker.
5108// CalcTextSize("") should return ImVec2(0.0f, g.FontSize)
5109ImVec2 ImGui::CalcTextSize(const char* text, const char* text_end, bool hide_text_after_double_hash, float wrap_width)
5110{
5111 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5112
5113 const char* text_display_end;
5114 if (hide_text_after_double_hash)
5115 text_display_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(text, text_end); // Hide anything after a '##' string
5116 else
5117 text_display_end = text_end;
5118
5119 ImFont* font = g.Font;
5120 const float font_size = g.FontSize;
5121 if (text == text_display_end)
5122 return ImVec2(0.0f, font_size);
5123 ImVec2 text_size = font->CalcTextSizeA(font_size, FLT_MAX, wrap_width, text, text_display_end, NULL);
5124
5125 // Round
5126 // FIXME: This has been here since Dec 2015 (7b0bf230) but down the line we want this out.
5127 // FIXME: Investigate using ceilf or e.g.
5128 // - https://git.musl-libc.org/cgit/musl/tree/src/math/ceilf.c
5129 // - https://embarkstudios.github.io/rust-gpu/api/src/libm/math/ceilf.rs.html
5130 text_size.x = IM_FLOOR(text_size.x + 0.99999f);
5131
5132 return text_size;
5133}
5134
5135// Find window given position, search front-to-back
5136// FIXME: Note that we have an inconsequential lag here: OuterRectClipped is updated in Begin(), so windows moved programmatically
5137// with SetWindowPos() and not SetNextWindowPos() will have that rectangle lagging by a frame at the time FindHoveredWindow() is
5138// called, aka before the next Begin(). Moving window isn't affected.
5139static void FindHoveredWindow()
5140{
5141 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5142
5143 // Special handling for the window being moved: Ignore the mouse viewport check (because it may reset/lose its viewport during the undocking frame)
5144 ImGuiViewportP* moving_window_viewport = g.MovingWindow ? g.MovingWindow->Viewport : NULL;
5145 if (g.MovingWindow)
5146 g.MovingWindow->Viewport = g.MouseViewport;
5147
5148 ImGuiWindow* hovered_window = NULL;
5149 ImGuiWindow* hovered_window_ignoring_moving_window = NULL;
5150 if (g.MovingWindow && !(g.MovingWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))
5151 hovered_window = g.MovingWindow;
5152
5153 ImVec2 padding_regular = g.Style.TouchExtraPadding;
5154 ImVec2 padding_for_resize = g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges ? g.WindowsHoverPadding : padding_regular;
5155 for (int i = g.Windows.Size - 1; i >= 0; i--)
5156 {
5157 ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[i];
5158 IM_MSVC_WARNING_SUPPRESS(28182); // [Static Analyzer] Dereferencing NULL pointer.
5159 if (!window->Active || window->Hidden)
5160 continue;
5161 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs)
5162 continue;
5163 IM_ASSERT(window->Viewport);
5164 if (window->Viewport != g.MouseViewport)
5165 continue;
5166
5167 // Using the clipped AABB, a child window will typically be clipped by its parent (not always)
5168 ImRect bb(window->OuterRectClipped);
5169 if (window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
5170 bb.Expand(padding_regular);
5171 else
5172 bb.Expand(padding_for_resize);
5173 if (!bb.Contains(g.IO.MousePos))
5174 continue;
5175
5176 // Support for one rectangular hole in any given window
5177 // FIXME: Consider generalizing hit-testing override (with more generic data, callback, etc.) (#1512)
5178 if (window->HitTestHoleSize.x != 0)
5179 {
5180 ImVec2 hole_pos(window->Pos.x + (float)window->HitTestHoleOffset.x, window->Pos.y + (float)window->HitTestHoleOffset.y);
5181 ImVec2 hole_size((float)window->HitTestHoleSize.x, (float)window->HitTestHoleSize.y);
5182 if (ImRect(hole_pos, hole_pos + hole_size).Contains(g.IO.MousePos))
5183 continue;
5184 }
5185
5186 if (hovered_window == NULL)
5187 hovered_window = window;
5188 IM_MSVC_WARNING_SUPPRESS(28182); // [Static Analyzer] Dereferencing NULL pointer.
5189 if (hovered_window_ignoring_moving_window == NULL && (!g.MovingWindow || window->RootWindowDockTree != g.MovingWindow->RootWindowDockTree))
5190 hovered_window_ignoring_moving_window = window;
5191 if (hovered_window && hovered_window_ignoring_moving_window)
5192 break;
5193 }
5194
5195 g.HoveredWindow = hovered_window;
5196 g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow = hovered_window_ignoring_moving_window;
5197
5198 if (g.MovingWindow)
5199 g.MovingWindow->Viewport = moving_window_viewport;
5200}
5201
5202bool ImGui::IsItemActive()
5203{
5204 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5205 if (g.ActiveId)
5206 return g.ActiveId == g.LastItemData.ID;
5207 return false;
5208}
5209
5210bool ImGui::IsItemActivated()
5211{
5212 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5213 if (g.ActiveId)
5214 if (g.ActiveId == g.LastItemData.ID && g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame != g.LastItemData.ID)
5215 return true;
5216 return false;
5217}
5218
5219bool ImGui::IsItemDeactivated()
5220{
5221 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5222 if (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDeactivated)
5223 return (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Deactivated) != 0;
5224 return (g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame == g.LastItemData.ID && g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame != 0 && g.ActiveId != g.LastItemData.ID);
5225}
5226
5227bool ImGui::IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit()
5228{
5229 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5230 return IsItemDeactivated() && (g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameHasBeenEditedBefore || (g.ActiveId == 0 && g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore));
5231}
5232
5233// == GetItemID() == GetFocusID()
5234bool ImGui::IsItemFocused()
5235{
5236 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5237 if (g.NavId != g.LastItemData.ID || g.NavId == 0)
5238 return false;
5239
5240 // Special handling for the dummy item after Begin() which represent the title bar or tab.
5241 // When the window is collapsed (SkipItems==true) that last item will never be overwritten so we need to detect the case.
5242 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
5243 if (g.LastItemData.ID == window->ID && window->WriteAccessed)
5244 return false;
5245
5246 return true;
5247}
5248
5249// Important: this can be useful but it is NOT equivalent to the behavior of e.g.Button()!
5250// Most widgets have specific reactions based on mouse-up/down state, mouse position etc.
5251bool ImGui::IsItemClicked(ImGuiMouseButton mouse_button)
5252{
5253 return IsMouseClicked(mouse_button) && IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_None);
5254}
5255
5256bool ImGui::IsItemToggledOpen()
5257{
5258 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5259 return (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledOpen) ? true : false;
5260}
5261
5262bool ImGui::IsItemToggledSelection()
5263{
5264 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5265 return (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledSelection) ? true : false;
5266}
5267
5268bool ImGui::IsAnyItemHovered()
5269{
5270 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5271 return g.HoveredId != 0 || g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame != 0;
5272}
5273
5274bool ImGui::IsAnyItemActive()
5275{
5276 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5277 return g.ActiveId != 0;
5278}
5279
5280bool ImGui::IsAnyItemFocused()
5281{
5282 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5283 return g.NavId != 0 && !g.NavDisableHighlight;
5284}
5285
5286bool ImGui::IsItemVisible()
5287{
5288 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5289 return g.CurrentWindow->ClipRect.Overlaps(g.LastItemData.Rect);
5290}
5291
5292bool ImGui::IsItemEdited()
5293{
5294 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5295 return (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Edited) != 0;
5296}
5297
5298// Allow last item to be overlapped by a subsequent item. Both may be activated during the same frame before the later one takes priority.
5299// FIXME: Although this is exposed, its interaction and ideal idiom with using ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowItemOverlap flag are extremely confusing, need rework.
5300void ImGui::SetItemAllowOverlap()
5301{
5302 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5303 ImGuiID id = g.LastItemData.ID;
5304 if (g.HoveredId == id)
5305 g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap = true;
5306 if (g.ActiveId == id)
5307 g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = true;
5308}
5309
5310void ImGui::SetItemUsingMouseWheel()
5311{
5312 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5313 ImGuiID id = g.LastItemData.ID;
5314 if (g.HoveredId == id)
5315 g.HoveredIdUsingMouseWheel = true;
5316 if (g.ActiveId == id)
5317 g.ActiveIdUsingMouseWheel = true;
5318}
5319
5320void ImGui::SetActiveIdUsingNavAndKeys()
5321{
5322 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5323 IM_ASSERT(g.ActiveId != 0);
5324 g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask = ~(ImU32)0;
5325 g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask = ~(ImU32)0;
5326 g.ActiveIdUsingKeyInputMask.SetAllBits();
5327 NavMoveRequestCancel();
5328}
5329
5330ImVec2 ImGui::GetItemRectMin()
5331{
5332 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5333 return g.LastItemData.Rect.Min;
5334}
5335
5336ImVec2 ImGui::GetItemRectMax()
5337{
5338 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5339 return g.LastItemData.Rect.Max;
5340}
5341
5342ImVec2 ImGui::GetItemRectSize()
5343{
5344 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5345 return g.LastItemData.Rect.GetSize();
5346}
5347
5348bool ImGui::BeginChildEx(const char* name, ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& size_arg, bool border, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
5349{
5350 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5351 ImGuiWindow* parent_window = g.CurrentWindow;
5352
5353 flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking;
5354 flags |= (parent_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove); // Inherit the NoMove flag
5355
5356 // Size
5357 const ImVec2 content_avail = GetContentRegionAvail();
5358 ImVec2 size = ImFloor(size_arg);
5359 const int auto_fit_axises = ((size.x == 0.0f) ? (1 << ImGuiAxis_X) : 0x00) | ((size.y == 0.0f) ? (1 << ImGuiAxis_Y) : 0x00);
5360 if (size.x <= 0.0f)
5361 size.x = ImMax(content_avail.x + size.x, 4.0f); // Arbitrary minimum child size (0.0f causing too much issues)
5362 if (size.y <= 0.0f)
5363 size.y = ImMax(content_avail.y + size.y, 4.0f);
5364 SetNextWindowSize(size);
5365
5366 // Build up name. If you need to append to a same child from multiple location in the ID stack, use BeginChild(ImGuiID id) with a stable value.
5367 if (name)
5368 ImFormatString(g.TempBuffer, IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.TempBuffer), "%s/%s_%08X", parent_window->Name, name, id);
5369 else
5370 ImFormatString(g.TempBuffer, IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.TempBuffer), "%s/%08X", parent_window->Name, id);
5371
5372 const float backup_border_size = g.Style.ChildBorderSize;
5373 if (!border)
5374 g.Style.ChildBorderSize = 0.0f;
5375 bool ret = Begin(g.TempBuffer, NULL, flags);
5376 g.Style.ChildBorderSize = backup_border_size;
5377
5378 ImGuiWindow* child_window = g.CurrentWindow;
5379 child_window->ChildId = id;
5380 child_window->AutoFitChildAxises = (ImS8)auto_fit_axises;
5381
5382 // Set the cursor to handle case where the user called SetNextWindowPos()+BeginChild() manually.
5383 // While this is not really documented/defined, it seems that the expected thing to do.
5384 if (child_window->BeginCount == 1)
5385 parent_window->DC.CursorPos = child_window->Pos;
5386
5387 // Process navigation-in immediately so NavInit can run on first frame
5388 if (g.NavActivateId == id && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened) && (child_window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask != 0 || child_window->DC.NavHasScroll))
5389 {
5390 FocusWindow(child_window);
5391 NavInitWindow(child_window, false);
5392 SetActiveID(id + 1, child_window); // Steal ActiveId with another arbitrary id so that key-press won't activate child item
5393 g.ActiveIdSource = ImGuiInputSource_Nav;
5394 }
5395 return ret;
5396}
5397
5398bool ImGui::BeginChild(const char* str_id, const ImVec2& size_arg, bool border, ImGuiWindowFlags extra_flags)
5399{
5400 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
5401 return BeginChildEx(str_id, window->GetID(str_id), size_arg, border, extra_flags);
5402}
5403
5404bool ImGui::BeginChild(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& size_arg, bool border, ImGuiWindowFlags extra_flags)
5405{
5406 IM_ASSERT(id != 0);
5407 return BeginChildEx(NULL, id, size_arg, border, extra_flags);
5408}
5409
5410void ImGui::EndChild()
5411{
5412 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5413 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
5414
5415 IM_ASSERT(g.WithinEndChild == false);
5416 IM_ASSERT(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow); // Mismatched BeginChild()/EndChild() calls
5417
5418 g.WithinEndChild = true;
5419 if (window->BeginCount > 1)
5420 {
5421 End();
5422 }
5423 else
5424 {
5425 ImVec2 sz = window->Size;
5426 if (window->AutoFitChildAxises & (1 << ImGuiAxis_X)) // Arbitrary minimum zero-ish child size of 4.0f causes less trouble than a 0.0f
5427 sz.x = ImMax(4.0f, sz.x);
5428 if (window->AutoFitChildAxises & (1 << ImGuiAxis_Y))
5429 sz.y = ImMax(4.0f, sz.y);
5430 End();
5431
5432 ImGuiWindow* parent_window = g.CurrentWindow;
5433 ImRect bb(parent_window->DC.CursorPos, parent_window->DC.CursorPos + sz);
5434 ItemSize(sz);
5435 if ((window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask != 0 || window->DC.NavHasScroll) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened))
5436 {
5437 ItemAdd(bb, window->ChildId);
5438 RenderNavHighlight(bb, window->ChildId);
5439
5440 // When browsing a window that has no activable items (scroll only) we keep a highlight on the child (pass g.NavId to trick into always displaying)
5441 if (window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask == 0 && window == g.NavWindow)
5442 RenderNavHighlight(ImRect(bb.Min - ImVec2(2, 2), bb.Max + ImVec2(2, 2)), g.NavId, ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_TypeThin);
5443 }
5444 else
5445 {
5446 // Not navigable into
5447 ItemAdd(bb, 0);
5448 }
5449 if (g.HoveredWindow == window)
5450 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredWindow;
5451 }
5452 g.WithinEndChild = false;
5453 g.LogLinePosY = -FLT_MAX; // To enforce a carriage return
5454}
5455
5456// Helper to create a child window / scrolling region that looks like a normal widget frame.
5457bool ImGui::BeginChildFrame(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiWindowFlags extra_flags)
5458{
5459 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5460 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
5461 PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ChildBg, style.Colors[ImGuiCol_FrameBg]);
5462 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding, style.FrameRounding);
5463 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildBorderSize, style.FrameBorderSize);
5464 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, style.FramePadding);
5465 bool ret = BeginChild(id, size, true, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysUseWindowPadding | extra_flags);
5466 PopStyleVar(3);
5467 PopStyleColor();
5468 return ret;
5469}
5470
5471void ImGui::EndChildFrame()
5472{
5473 EndChild();
5474}
5475
5476static void SetWindowConditionAllowFlags(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiCond flags, bool enabled)
5477{
5478 window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags = enabled ? (window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags | flags) : (window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags & ~flags);
5479 window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags = enabled ? (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags | flags) : (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags & ~flags);
5480 window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags = enabled ? (window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags | flags) : (window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags & ~flags);
5481 window->SetWindowDockAllowFlags = enabled ? (window->SetWindowDockAllowFlags | flags) : (window->SetWindowDockAllowFlags & ~flags);
5482}
5483
5484ImGuiWindow* ImGui::FindWindowByID(ImGuiID id)
5485{
5486 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5487 return (ImGuiWindow*)g.WindowsById.GetVoidPtr(id);
5488}
5489
5490ImGuiWindow* ImGui::FindWindowByName(const char* name)
5491{
5492 ImGuiID id = ImHashStr(name);
5493 return FindWindowByID(id);
5494}
5495
5496static void ApplyWindowSettings(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiWindowSettings* settings)
5497{
5498 const ImGuiViewport* main_viewport = ImGui::GetMainViewport();
5499 window->ViewportPos = main_viewport->Pos;
5500 if (settings->ViewportId)
5501 {
5502 window->ViewportId = settings->ViewportId;
5503 window->ViewportPos = ImVec2(settings->ViewportPos.x, settings->ViewportPos.y);
5504 }
5505 window->Pos = ImFloor(ImVec2(settings->Pos.x + window->ViewportPos.x, settings->Pos.y + window->ViewportPos.y));
5506 if (settings->Size.x > 0 && settings->Size.y > 0)
5507 window->Size = window->SizeFull = ImFloor(ImVec2(settings->Size.x, settings->Size.y));
5508 window->Collapsed = settings->Collapsed;
5509 window->DockId = settings->DockId;
5510 window->DockOrder = settings->DockOrder;
5511}
5512
5513static void UpdateWindowInFocusOrderList(ImGuiWindow* window, bool just_created, ImGuiWindowFlags new_flags)
5514{
5515 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5516
5517 const bool new_is_explicit_child = (new_flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) != 0;
5518 const bool child_flag_changed = new_is_explicit_child != window->IsExplicitChild;
5519 if ((just_created || child_flag_changed) && !new_is_explicit_child)
5520 {
5521 IM_ASSERT(!g.WindowsFocusOrder.contains(window));
5522 g.WindowsFocusOrder.push_back(window);
5523 window->FocusOrder = (short)(g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1);
5524 }
5525 else if (!just_created && child_flag_changed && new_is_explicit_child)
5526 {
5527 IM_ASSERT(g.WindowsFocusOrder[window->FocusOrder] == window);
5528 for (int n = window->FocusOrder + 1; n < g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size; n++)
5529 g.WindowsFocusOrder[n]->FocusOrder--;
5530 g.WindowsFocusOrder.erase(g.WindowsFocusOrder.Data + window->FocusOrder);
5531 window->FocusOrder = -1;
5532 }
5533 window->IsExplicitChild = new_is_explicit_child;
5534}
5535
5536static ImGuiWindow* CreateNewWindow(const char* name, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
5537{
5538 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5539 //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("CreateNewWindow '%s', flags = 0x%08X\n", name, flags);
5540
5541 // Create window the first time
5542 ImGuiWindow* window = IM_NEW(ImGuiWindow)(&g, name);
5543 window->Flags = flags;
5544 g.WindowsById.SetVoidPtr(window->ID, window);
5545
5546 // Default/arbitrary window position. Use SetNextWindowPos() with the appropriate condition flag to change the initial position of a window.
5547 const ImGuiViewport* main_viewport = ImGui::GetMainViewport();
5548 window->Pos = main_viewport->Pos + ImVec2(60, 60);
5549 window->ViewportPos = main_viewport->Pos;
5550
5551 // User can disable loading and saving of settings. Tooltip and child windows also don't store settings.
5552 if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings))
5553 if (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = ImGui::FindWindowSettings(window->ID))
5554 {
5555 // Retrieve settings from .ini file
5556 window->SettingsOffset = g.SettingsWindows.offset_from_ptr(settings);
5557 SetWindowConditionAllowFlags(window, ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver, false);
5558 ApplyWindowSettings(window, settings);
5559 }
5560 window->DC.CursorStartPos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos = window->Pos; // So first call to CalcContentSize() doesn't return crazy values
5561
5562 if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) != 0)
5563 {
5564 window->AutoFitFramesX = window->AutoFitFramesY = 2;
5565 window->AutoFitOnlyGrows = false;
5566 }
5567 else
5568 {
5569 if (window->Size.x <= 0.0f)
5570 window->AutoFitFramesX = 2;
5571 if (window->Size.y <= 0.0f)
5572 window->AutoFitFramesY = 2;
5573 window->AutoFitOnlyGrows = (window->AutoFitFramesX > 0) || (window->AutoFitFramesY > 0);
5574 }
5575
5576 if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus)
5577 g.Windows.push_front(window); // Quite slow but rare and only once
5578 else
5579 g.Windows.push_back(window);
5580 UpdateWindowInFocusOrderList(window, true, window->Flags);
5581
5582 return window;
5583}
5584
5585static ImGuiWindow* GetWindowForTitleDisplay(ImGuiWindow* window)
5586{
5587 return window->DockNodeAsHost ? window->DockNodeAsHost->VisibleWindow : window;
5588}
5589
5590static ImGuiWindow* GetWindowForTitleAndMenuHeight(ImGuiWindow* window)
5591{
5592 return (window->DockNodeAsHost && window->DockNodeAsHost->VisibleWindow) ? window->DockNodeAsHost->VisibleWindow : window;
5593}
5594
5595static ImVec2 CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& size_desired)
5596{
5597 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5598 ImVec2 new_size = size_desired;
5599 if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSizeConstraint)
5600 {
5601 // Using -1,-1 on either X/Y axis to preserve the current size.
5602 ImRect cr = g.NextWindowData.SizeConstraintRect;
5603 new_size.x = (cr.Min.x >= 0 && cr.Max.x >= 0) ? ImClamp(new_size.x, cr.Min.x, cr.Max.x) : window->SizeFull.x;
5604 new_size.y = (cr.Min.y >= 0 && cr.Max.y >= 0) ? ImClamp(new_size.y, cr.Min.y, cr.Max.y) : window->SizeFull.y;
5605 if (g.NextWindowData.SizeCallback)
5606 {
5607 ImGuiSizeCallbackData data;
5608 data.UserData = g.NextWindowData.SizeCallbackUserData;
5609 data.Pos = window->Pos;
5610 data.CurrentSize = window->SizeFull;
5611 data.DesiredSize = new_size;
5612 g.NextWindowData.SizeCallback(&data);
5613 new_size = data.DesiredSize;
5614 }
5615 new_size.x = IM_FLOOR(new_size.x);
5616 new_size.y = IM_FLOOR(new_size.y);
5617 }
5618
5619 // Minimum size
5620 if (!(window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize)))
5621 {
5622 ImGuiWindow* window_for_height = GetWindowForTitleAndMenuHeight(window);
5623 const float decoration_up_height = window_for_height->TitleBarHeight() + window_for_height->MenuBarHeight();
5624 new_size = ImMax(new_size, g.Style.WindowMinSize);
5625 new_size.y = ImMax(new_size.y, decoration_up_height + ImMax(0.0f, g.Style.WindowRounding - 1.0f)); // Reduce artifacts with very small windows
5626 }
5627 return new_size;
5628}
5629
5630static void CalcWindowContentSizes(ImGuiWindow* window, ImVec2* content_size_current, ImVec2* content_size_ideal)
5631{
5632 bool preserve_old_content_sizes = false;
5633 if (window->Collapsed && window->AutoFitFramesX <= 0 && window->AutoFitFramesY <= 0)
5634 preserve_old_content_sizes = true;
5635 else if (window->Hidden && window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems == 0 && window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems > 0)
5636 preserve_old_content_sizes = true;
5637 if (preserve_old_content_sizes)
5638 {
5639 *content_size_current = window->ContentSize;
5640 *content_size_ideal = window->ContentSizeIdeal;
5641 return;
5642 }
5643
5644 content_size_current->x = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.x != 0.0f) ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.x : IM_FLOOR(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x - window->DC.CursorStartPos.x);
5645 content_size_current->y = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.y != 0.0f) ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.y : IM_FLOOR(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y - window->DC.CursorStartPos.y);
5646 content_size_ideal->x = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.x != 0.0f) ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.x : IM_FLOOR(ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x, window->DC.IdealMaxPos.x) - window->DC.CursorStartPos.x);
5647 content_size_ideal->y = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.y != 0.0f) ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.y : IM_FLOOR(ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y, window->DC.IdealMaxPos.y) - window->DC.CursorStartPos.y);
5648}
5649
5650static ImVec2 CalcWindowAutoFitSize(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& size_contents)
5651{
5652 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5653 ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
5654 const float decoration_up_height = window->TitleBarHeight() + window->MenuBarHeight();
5655 ImVec2 size_pad = window->WindowPadding * 2.0f;
5656 ImVec2 size_desired = size_contents + size_pad + ImVec2(0.0f, decoration_up_height);
5657 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)
5658 {
5659 // Tooltip always resize
5660 return size_desired;
5661 }
5662 else
5663 {
5664 // Maximum window size is determined by the viewport size or monitor size
5665 const bool is_popup = (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) != 0;
5666 const bool is_menu = (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu) != 0;
5667 ImVec2 size_min = style.WindowMinSize;
5668 if (is_popup || is_menu) // Popups and menus bypass style.WindowMinSize by default, but we give then a non-zero minimum size to facilitate understanding problematic cases (e.g. empty popups)
5669 size_min = ImMin(size_min, ImVec2(4.0f, 4.0f));
5670
5671 // FIXME-VIEWPORT-WORKAREA: May want to use GetWorkSize() instead of Size depending on the type of windows?
5672 ImVec2 avail_size = window->Viewport->Size;
5673 if (window->ViewportOwned)
5674 avail_size = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
5675 const int monitor_idx = window->ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend;
5676 if (monitor_idx >= 0 && monitor_idx < g.PlatformIO.Monitors.Size)
5677 avail_size = g.PlatformIO.Monitors[monitor_idx].WorkSize;
5678 ImVec2 size_auto_fit = ImClamp(size_desired, size_min, ImMax(size_min, avail_size - style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding * 2.0f));
5679
5680 // When the window cannot fit all contents (either because of constraints, either because screen is too small),
5681 // we are growing the size on the other axis to compensate for expected scrollbar. FIXME: Might turn bigger than ViewportSize-WindowPadding.
5682 ImVec2 size_auto_fit_after_constraint = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, size_auto_fit);
5683 bool will_have_scrollbar_x = (size_auto_fit_after_constraint.x - size_pad.x - 0.0f < size_contents.x && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar) && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar)) || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysHorizontalScrollbar);
5684 bool will_have_scrollbar_y = (size_auto_fit_after_constraint.y - size_pad.y - decoration_up_height < size_contents.y && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar)) || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysVerticalScrollbar);
5685 if (will_have_scrollbar_x)
5686 size_auto_fit.y += style.ScrollbarSize;
5687 if (will_have_scrollbar_y)
5688 size_auto_fit.x += style.ScrollbarSize;
5689 return size_auto_fit;
5690 }
5691}
5692
5693ImVec2 ImGui::CalcWindowNextAutoFitSize(ImGuiWindow* window)
5694{
5695 ImVec2 size_contents_current;
5696 ImVec2 size_contents_ideal;
5697 CalcWindowContentSizes(window, &size_contents_current, &size_contents_ideal);
5698 ImVec2 size_auto_fit = CalcWindowAutoFitSize(window, size_contents_ideal);
5699 ImVec2 size_final = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, size_auto_fit);
5700 return size_final;
5701}
5702
5703static ImGuiCol GetWindowBgColorIdx(ImGuiWindow* window)
5704{
5705 if (window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup))
5706 return ImGuiCol_PopupBg;
5707 if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !window->DockIsActive)
5708 return ImGuiCol_ChildBg;
5709 return ImGuiCol_WindowBg;
5710}
5711
5712static void CalcResizePosSizeFromAnyCorner(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& corner_target, const ImVec2& corner_norm, ImVec2* out_pos, ImVec2* out_size)
5713{
5714 ImVec2 pos_min = ImLerp(corner_target, window->Pos, corner_norm); // Expected window upper-left
5715 ImVec2 pos_max = ImLerp(window->Pos + window->Size, corner_target, corner_norm); // Expected window lower-right
5716 ImVec2 size_expected = pos_max - pos_min;
5717 ImVec2 size_constrained = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, size_expected);
5718 *out_pos = pos_min;
5719 if (corner_norm.x == 0.0f)
5720 out_pos->x -= (size_constrained.x - size_expected.x);
5721 if (corner_norm.y == 0.0f)
5722 out_pos->y -= (size_constrained.y - size_expected.y);
5723 *out_size = size_constrained;
5724}
5725
5726// Data for resizing from corner
5727struct ImGuiResizeGripDef
5728{
5729 ImVec2 CornerPosN;
5730 ImVec2 InnerDir;
5731 int AngleMin12, AngleMax12;
5732};
5733static const ImGuiResizeGripDef resize_grip_def[4] =
5734{
5735 { ImVec2(1, 1), ImVec2(-1, -1), 0, 3 }, // Lower-right
5736 { ImVec2(0, 1), ImVec2(+1, -1), 3, 6 }, // Lower-left
5737 { ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(+1, +1), 6, 9 }, // Upper-left (Unused)
5738 { ImVec2(1, 0), ImVec2(-1, +1), 9, 12 } // Upper-right (Unused)
5739};
5740
5741// Data for resizing from borders
5742struct ImGuiResizeBorderDef
5743{
5744 ImVec2 InnerDir;
5745 ImVec2 SegmentN1, SegmentN2;
5746 float OuterAngle;
5747};
5748static const ImGuiResizeBorderDef resize_border_def[4] =
5749{
5750 { ImVec2(+1, 0), ImVec2(0, 1), ImVec2(0, 0), IM_PI * 1.00f }, // Left
5751 { ImVec2(-1, 0), ImVec2(1, 0), ImVec2(1, 1), IM_PI * 0.00f }, // Right
5752 { ImVec2(0, +1), ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(1, 0), IM_PI * 1.50f }, // Up
5753 { ImVec2(0, -1), ImVec2(1, 1), ImVec2(0, 1), IM_PI * 0.50f } // Down
5754};
5755
5756static ImRect GetResizeBorderRect(ImGuiWindow* window, int border_n, float perp_padding, float thickness)
5757{
5758 ImRect rect = window->Rect();
5759 if (thickness == 0.0f)
5760 rect.Max -= ImVec2(1, 1);
5761 if (border_n == ImGuiDir_Left) { return ImRect(rect.Min.x - thickness, rect.Min.y + perp_padding, rect.Min.x + thickness, rect.Max.y - perp_padding); }
5762 if (border_n == ImGuiDir_Right) { return ImRect(rect.Max.x - thickness, rect.Min.y + perp_padding, rect.Max.x + thickness, rect.Max.y - perp_padding); }
5763 if (border_n == ImGuiDir_Up) { return ImRect(rect.Min.x + perp_padding, rect.Min.y - thickness, rect.Max.x - perp_padding, rect.Min.y + thickness); }
5764 if (border_n == ImGuiDir_Down) { return ImRect(rect.Min.x + perp_padding, rect.Max.y - thickness, rect.Max.x - perp_padding, rect.Max.y + thickness); }
5765 IM_ASSERT(0);
5766 return ImRect();
5767}
5768
5769// 0..3: corners (Lower-right, Lower-left, Unused, Unused)
5770ImGuiID ImGui::GetWindowResizeCornerID(ImGuiWindow* window, int n)
5771{
5772 IM_ASSERT(n >= 0 && n < 4);
5773 ImGuiID id = window->DockIsActive ? window->DockNode->HostWindow->ID : window->ID;
5774 id = ImHashStr("#RESIZE", 0, id);
5775 id = ImHashData(&n, sizeof(int), id);
5776 return id;
5777}
5778
5779// Borders (Left, Right, Up, Down)
5780ImGuiID ImGui::GetWindowResizeBorderID(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiDir dir)
5781{
5782 IM_ASSERT(dir >= 0 && dir < 4);
5783 int n = (int)dir + 4;
5784 ImGuiID id = window->DockIsActive ? window->DockNode->HostWindow->ID : window->ID;
5785 id = ImHashStr("#RESIZE", 0, id);
5786 id = ImHashData(&n, sizeof(int), id);
5787 return id;
5788}
5789
5790// Handle resize for: Resize Grips, Borders, Gamepad
5791// Return true when using auto-fit (double click on resize grip)
5792static bool ImGui::UpdateWindowManualResize(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& size_auto_fit, int* border_held, int resize_grip_count, ImU32 resize_grip_col[4], const ImRect& visibility_rect)
5793{
5794 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5795 ImGuiWindowFlags flags = window->Flags;
5796
5797 if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize) || (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) || window->AutoFitFramesX > 0 || window->AutoFitFramesY > 0)
5798 return false;
5799 if (window->WasActive == false) // Early out to avoid running this code for e.g. an hidden implicit/fallback Debug window.
5800 return false;
5801
5802 bool ret_auto_fit = false;
5803 const int resize_border_count = g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges ? 4 : 0;
5804 const float grip_draw_size = IM_FLOOR(ImMax(g.FontSize * 1.35f, window->WindowRounding + 1.0f + g.FontSize * 0.2f));
5805 const float grip_hover_inner_size = IM_FLOOR(grip_draw_size * 0.75f);
5806 const float grip_hover_outer_size = g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges ? WINDOWS_HOVER_PADDING : 0.0f;
5807
5808 ImVec2 pos_target(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
5809 ImVec2 size_target(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
5810
5811 // Clip mouse interaction rectangles within the viewport rectangle (in practice the narrowing is going to happen most of the time).
5812 // - Not narrowing would mostly benefit the situation where OS windows _without_ decoration have a threshold for hovering when outside their limits.
5813 // This is however not the case with current backends under Win32, but a custom borderless window implementation would benefit from it.
5814 // - When decoration are enabled we typically benefit from that distance, but then our resize elements would be conflicting with OS resize elements, so we also narrow.
5815 // - Note that we are unable to tell if the platform setup allows hovering with a distance threshold (on Win32, decorated window have such threshold).
5816 // We only clip interaction so we overwrite window->ClipRect, cannot call PushClipRect() yet as DrawList is not yet setup.
5817 const bool clip_with_viewport_rect = !(g.IO.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport) || (g.IO.MouseHoveredViewport != window->ViewportId) || !(window->Viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_NoDecoration);
5818 if (clip_with_viewport_rect)
5819 window->ClipRect = window->Viewport->GetMainRect();
5820
5821 // Resize grips and borders are on layer 1
5822 window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
5823
5824 // Manual resize grips
5825 PushID("#RESIZE");
5826 for (int resize_grip_n = 0; resize_grip_n < resize_grip_count; resize_grip_n++)
5827 {
5828 const ImGuiResizeGripDef& def = resize_grip_def[resize_grip_n];
5829 const ImVec2 corner = ImLerp(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, def.CornerPosN);
5830
5831 // Using the FlattenChilds button flag we make the resize button accessible even if we are hovering over a child window
5832 bool hovered, held;
5833 ImRect resize_rect(corner - def.InnerDir * grip_hover_outer_size, corner + def.InnerDir * grip_hover_inner_size);
5834 if (resize_rect.Min.x > resize_rect.Max.x) ImSwap(resize_rect.Min.x, resize_rect.Max.x);
5835 if (resize_rect.Min.y > resize_rect.Max.y) ImSwap(resize_rect.Min.y, resize_rect.Max.y);
5836 ImGuiID resize_grip_id = window->GetID(resize_grip_n); // == GetWindowResizeCornerID()
5837 ButtonBehavior(resize_rect, resize_grip_id, &hovered, &held, ImGuiButtonFlags_FlattenChildren | ImGuiButtonFlags_NoNavFocus);
5838 //GetForegroundDrawList(window)->AddRect(resize_rect.Min, resize_rect.Max, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
5839 if (hovered || held)
5840 g.MouseCursor = (resize_grip_n & 1) ? ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNESW : ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNWSE;
5841
5842 if (held && g.IO.MouseClickedCount[0] == 2 && resize_grip_n == 0)
5843 {
5844 // Manual auto-fit when double-clicking
5845 size_target = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, size_auto_fit);
5846 ret_auto_fit = true;
5847 ClearActiveID();
5848 }
5849 else if (held)
5850 {
5851 // Resize from any of the four corners
5852 // We don't use an incremental MouseDelta but rather compute an absolute target size based on mouse position
5853 ImVec2 clamp_min = ImVec2(def.CornerPosN.x == 1.0f ? visibility_rect.Min.x : -FLT_MAX, def.CornerPosN.y == 1.0f ? visibility_rect.Min.y : -FLT_MAX);
5854 ImVec2 clamp_max = ImVec2(def.CornerPosN.x == 0.0f ? visibility_rect.Max.x : +FLT_MAX, def.CornerPosN.y == 0.0f ? visibility_rect.Max.y : +FLT_MAX);
5855 ImVec2 corner_target = g.IO.MousePos - g.ActiveIdClickOffset + ImLerp(def.InnerDir * grip_hover_outer_size, def.InnerDir * -grip_hover_inner_size, def.CornerPosN); // Corner of the window corresponding to our corner grip
5856 corner_target = ImClamp(corner_target, clamp_min, clamp_max);
5857 CalcResizePosSizeFromAnyCorner(window, corner_target, def.CornerPosN, &pos_target, &size_target);
5858 }
5859
5860 // Only lower-left grip is visible before hovering/activating
5861 if (resize_grip_n == 0 || held || hovered)
5862 resize_grip_col[resize_grip_n] = GetColorU32(held ? ImGuiCol_ResizeGripActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_ResizeGripHovered : ImGuiCol_ResizeGrip);
5863 }
5864 for (int border_n = 0; border_n < resize_border_count; border_n++)
5865 {
5866 const ImGuiResizeBorderDef& def = resize_border_def[border_n];
5867 const ImGuiAxis axis = (border_n == ImGuiDir_Left || border_n == ImGuiDir_Right) ? ImGuiAxis_X : ImGuiAxis_Y;
5868
5869 bool hovered, held;
5870 ImRect border_rect = GetResizeBorderRect(window, border_n, grip_hover_inner_size, WINDOWS_HOVER_PADDING);
5871 ImGuiID border_id = window->GetID(border_n + 4); // == GetWindowResizeBorderID()
5872 ButtonBehavior(border_rect, border_id, &hovered, &held, ImGuiButtonFlags_FlattenChildren | ImGuiButtonFlags_NoNavFocus);
5873 //GetForegroundDrawLists(window)->AddRect(border_rect.Min, border_rect.Max, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
5874 if ((hovered && g.HoveredIdTimer > WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_FEEDBACK_TIMER) || held)
5875 {
5876 g.MouseCursor = (axis == ImGuiAxis_X) ? ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeEW : ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNS;
5877 if (held)
5878 *border_held = border_n;
5879 }
5880 if (held)
5881 {
5882 ImVec2 clamp_min(border_n == ImGuiDir_Right ? visibility_rect.Min.x : -FLT_MAX, border_n == ImGuiDir_Down ? visibility_rect.Min.y : -FLT_MAX);
5883 ImVec2 clamp_max(border_n == ImGuiDir_Left ? visibility_rect.Max.x : +FLT_MAX, border_n == ImGuiDir_Up ? visibility_rect.Max.y : +FLT_MAX);
5884 ImVec2 border_target = window->Pos;
5885 border_target[axis] = g.IO.MousePos[axis] - g.ActiveIdClickOffset[axis] + WINDOWS_HOVER_PADDING;
5886 border_target = ImClamp(border_target, clamp_min, clamp_max);
5887 CalcResizePosSizeFromAnyCorner(window, border_target, ImMin(def.SegmentN1, def.SegmentN2), &pos_target, &size_target);
5888 }
5889 }
5890 PopID();
5891
5892 // Restore nav layer
5893 window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
5894
5895 // Navigation resize (keyboard/gamepad)
5896 if (g.NavWindowingTarget && g.NavWindowingTarget->RootWindowDockTree == window)
5897 {
5898 ImVec2 nav_resize_delta;
5899 if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard && g.IO.KeyShift)
5900 nav_resize_delta = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_RawKeyboard, ImGuiInputReadMode_Down);
5901 if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad)
5902 nav_resize_delta = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadDPad, ImGuiInputReadMode_Down);
5903 if (nav_resize_delta.x != 0.0f || nav_resize_delta.y != 0.0f)
5904 {
5905 const float NAV_RESIZE_SPEED = 600.0f;
5906 nav_resize_delta *= ImFloor(NAV_RESIZE_SPEED * g.IO.DeltaTime * ImMin(g.IO.DisplayFramebufferScale.x, g.IO.DisplayFramebufferScale.y));
5907 nav_resize_delta = ImMax(nav_resize_delta, visibility_rect.Min - window->Pos - window->Size);
5908 g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = false;
5909 g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
5910 resize_grip_col[0] = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_ResizeGripActive);
5911 // FIXME-NAV: Should store and accumulate into a separate size buffer to handle sizing constraints properly, right now a constraint will make us stuck.
5912 size_target = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, window->SizeFull + nav_resize_delta);
5913 }
5914 }
5915
5916 // Apply back modified position/size to window
5917 if (size_target.x != FLT_MAX)
5918 {
5919 window->SizeFull = size_target;
5920 MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
5921 }
5922 if (pos_target.x != FLT_MAX)
5923 {
5924 window->Pos = ImFloor(pos_target);
5925 MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
5926 }
5927
5928 window->Size = window->SizeFull;
5929 return ret_auto_fit;
5930}
5931
5932static inline void ClampWindowRect(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImRect& visibility_rect)
5933{
5934 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5935 ImVec2 size_for_clamping = window->Size;
5936 if (g.IO.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
5937 size_for_clamping.y = window->TitleBarHeight();
5938 window->Pos = ImClamp(window->Pos, visibility_rect.Min - size_for_clamping, visibility_rect.Max);
5939}
5940
5941static void ImGui::RenderWindowOuterBorders(ImGuiWindow* window)
5942{
5943 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5944 float rounding = window->WindowRounding;
5945 float border_size = window->WindowBorderSize;
5946 if (border_size > 0.0f && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground))
5947 window->DrawList->AddRect(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), rounding, 0, border_size);
5948
5949 int border_held = window->ResizeBorderHeld;
5950 if (border_held != -1)
5951 {
5952 const ImGuiResizeBorderDef& def = resize_border_def[border_held];
5953 ImRect border_r = GetResizeBorderRect(window, border_held, rounding, 0.0f);
5954 window->DrawList->PathArcTo(ImLerp(border_r.Min, border_r.Max, def.SegmentN1) + ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f) + def.InnerDir * rounding, rounding, def.OuterAngle - IM_PI * 0.25f, def.OuterAngle);
5955 window->DrawList->PathArcTo(ImLerp(border_r.Min, border_r.Max, def.SegmentN2) + ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f) + def.InnerDir * rounding, rounding, def.OuterAngle, def.OuterAngle + IM_PI * 0.25f);
5956 window->DrawList->PathStroke(GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_SeparatorActive), 0, ImMax(2.0f, border_size)); // Thicker than usual
5957 }
5958 if (g.Style.FrameBorderSize > 0 && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) && !window->DockIsActive)
5959 {
5960 float y = window->Pos.y + window->TitleBarHeight() - 1;
5961 window->DrawList->AddLine(ImVec2(window->Pos.x + border_size, y), ImVec2(window->Pos.x + window->Size.x - border_size, y), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), g.Style.FrameBorderSize);
5962 }
5963}
5964
5965// Draw background and borders
5966// Draw and handle scrollbars
5967void ImGui::RenderWindowDecorations(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImRect& title_bar_rect, bool title_bar_is_highlight, bool handle_borders_and_resize_grips, int resize_grip_count, const ImU32 resize_grip_col[4], float resize_grip_draw_size)
5968{
5969 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5970 ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
5971 ImGuiWindowFlags flags = window->Flags;
5972
5973 // Ensure that ScrollBar doesn't read last frame's SkipItems
5974 IM_ASSERT(window->BeginCount == 0);
5975 window->SkipItems = false;
5976
5977 // Draw window + handle manual resize
5978 // As we highlight the title bar when want_focus is set, multiple reappearing windows will have have their title bar highlighted on their reappearing frame.
5979 const float window_rounding = window->WindowRounding;
5980 const float window_border_size = window->WindowBorderSize;
5981 if (window->Collapsed)
5982 {
5983 // Title bar only
5984 float backup_border_size = style.FrameBorderSize;
5985 g.Style.FrameBorderSize = window->WindowBorderSize;
5986 ImU32 title_bar_col = GetColorU32((title_bar_is_highlight && !g.NavDisableHighlight) ? ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive : ImGuiCol_TitleBgCollapsed);
5987 RenderFrame(title_bar_rect.Min, title_bar_rect.Max, title_bar_col, true, window_rounding);
5988 g.Style.FrameBorderSize = backup_border_size;
5989 }
5990 else
5991 {
5992 // Window background
5993 if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground))
5994 {
5995 bool is_docking_transparent_payload = false;
5996 if (g.DragDropActive && (g.FrameCount - g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount) <= 1 && g.IO.ConfigDockingTransparentPayload)
5997 if (g.DragDropPayload.IsDataType(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_WINDOW) && *(ImGuiWindow**)g.DragDropPayload.Data == window)
5998 is_docking_transparent_payload = true;
5999
6000 ImU32 bg_col = GetColorU32(GetWindowBgColorIdx(window));
6001 if (window->ViewportOwned)
6002 {
6003 // No alpha
6004 bg_col = (bg_col | IM_COL32_A_MASK);
6005 if (is_docking_transparent_payload)
6006 window->Viewport->Alpha *= DOCKING_TRANSPARENT_PAYLOAD_ALPHA;
6007 }
6008 else
6009 {
6010 // Adjust alpha. For docking
6011 bool override_alpha = false;
6012 float alpha = 1.0f;
6013 if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasBgAlpha)
6014 {
6015 alpha = g.NextWindowData.BgAlphaVal;
6016 override_alpha = true;
6017 }
6018 if (is_docking_transparent_payload)
6019 {
6020 alpha *= DOCKING_TRANSPARENT_PAYLOAD_ALPHA; // FIXME-DOCK: Should that be an override?
6021 override_alpha = true;
6022 }
6023 if (override_alpha)
6024 bg_col = (bg_col & ~IM_COL32_A_MASK) | (IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(alpha) << IM_COL32_A_SHIFT);
6025 }
6026
6027 // Render, for docked windows and host windows we ensure bg goes before decorations
6028 ImDrawList* bg_draw_list = window->DockIsActive ? window->DockNode->HostWindow->DrawList : window->DrawList;
6029 if (window->DockIsActive || (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost))
6030 bg_draw_list->ChannelsSetCurrent(0);
6031 if (window->DockIsActive)
6032 window->DockNode->LastBgColor = bg_col;
6033
6034 bg_draw_list->AddRectFilled(window->Pos + ImVec2(0, window->TitleBarHeight()), window->Pos + window->Size, bg_col, window_rounding, (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) ? 0 : ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottom);
6035
6036 if (window->DockIsActive || (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost))
6037 bg_draw_list->ChannelsSetCurrent(1);
6038 }
6039 if (window->DockIsActive)
6040 window->DockNode->IsBgDrawnThisFrame = true;
6041
6042 // Title bar
6043 // (when docked, DockNode are drawing their own title bar. Individual windows however do NOT set the _NoTitleBar flag,
6044 // in order for their pos/size to be matching their undocking state.)
6045 if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) && !window->DockIsActive)
6046 {
6047 ImU32 title_bar_col = GetColorU32(title_bar_is_highlight ? ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive : ImGuiCol_TitleBg);
6048 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(title_bar_rect.Min, title_bar_rect.Max, title_bar_col, window_rounding, ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTop);
6049 }
6050
6051 // Menu bar
6052 if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar)
6053 {
6054 ImRect menu_bar_rect = window->MenuBarRect();
6055 menu_bar_rect.ClipWith(window->Rect()); // Soft clipping, in particular child window don't have minimum size covering the menu bar so this is useful for them.
6056 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(menu_bar_rect.Min + ImVec2(window_border_size, 0), menu_bar_rect.Max - ImVec2(window_border_size, 0), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_MenuBarBg), (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) ? window_rounding : 0.0f, ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTop);
6057 if (style.FrameBorderSize > 0.0f && menu_bar_rect.Max.y < window->Pos.y + window->Size.y)
6058 window->DrawList->AddLine(menu_bar_rect.GetBL(), menu_bar_rect.GetBR(), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), style.FrameBorderSize);
6059 }
6060
6061 // Docking: Unhide tab bar (small triangle in the corner), drag from small triangle to quickly undock
6062 ImGuiDockNode* node = window->DockNode;
6063 if (window->DockIsActive && node->IsHiddenTabBar() && !node->IsNoTabBar())
6064 {
6065 float unhide_sz_draw = ImFloor(g.FontSize * 0.70f);
6066 float unhide_sz_hit = ImFloor(g.FontSize * 0.55f);
6067 ImVec2 p = node->Pos;
6068 ImRect r(p, p + ImVec2(unhide_sz_hit, unhide_sz_hit));
6069 bool hovered, held;
6070 if (ButtonBehavior(r, window->GetID("#UNHIDE"), &hovered, &held, ImGuiButtonFlags_FlattenChildren))
6071 node->WantHiddenTabBarToggle = true;
6072 else if (held && IsMouseDragging(0))
6073 StartMouseMovingWindowOrNode(window, node, true);
6074
6075 // FIXME-DOCK: Ideally we'd use ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive/ImGuiCol_TitleBg here, but neither is guaranteed to be visible enough at this sort of size..
6076 ImU32 col = GetColorU32(((held && hovered) || (node->IsFocused && !hovered)) ? ImGuiCol_ButtonActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_ButtonHovered : ImGuiCol_Button);
6077 window->DrawList->AddTriangleFilled(p, p + ImVec2(unhide_sz_draw, 0.0f), p + ImVec2(0.0f, unhide_sz_draw), col);
6078 }
6079
6080 // Scrollbars
6081 if (window->ScrollbarX)
6082 Scrollbar(ImGuiAxis_X);
6083 if (window->ScrollbarY)
6084 Scrollbar(ImGuiAxis_Y);
6085
6086 // Render resize grips (after their input handling so we don't have a frame of latency)
6087 if (handle_borders_and_resize_grips && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize))
6088 {
6089 for (int resize_grip_n = 0; resize_grip_n < resize_grip_count; resize_grip_n++)
6090 {
6091 const ImGuiResizeGripDef& grip = resize_grip_def[resize_grip_n];
6092 const ImVec2 corner = ImLerp(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, grip.CornerPosN);
6093 window->DrawList->PathLineTo(corner + grip.InnerDir * ((resize_grip_n & 1) ? ImVec2(window_border_size, resize_grip_draw_size) : ImVec2(resize_grip_draw_size, window_border_size)));
6094 window->DrawList->PathLineTo(corner + grip.InnerDir * ((resize_grip_n & 1) ? ImVec2(resize_grip_draw_size, window_border_size) : ImVec2(window_border_size, resize_grip_draw_size)));
6095 window->DrawList->PathArcToFast(ImVec2(corner.x + grip.InnerDir.x * (window_rounding + window_border_size), corner.y + grip.InnerDir.y * (window_rounding + window_border_size)), window_rounding, grip.AngleMin12, grip.AngleMax12);
6096 window->DrawList->PathFillConvex(resize_grip_col[resize_grip_n]);
6097 }
6098 }
6099
6100 // Borders (for dock node host they will be rendered over after the tab bar)
6101 if (handle_borders_and_resize_grips && !window->DockNodeAsHost)
6102 RenderWindowOuterBorders(window);
6103 }
6104}
6105
6106// Render title text, collapse button, close button
6107// When inside a dock node, this is handled in DockNodeCalcTabBarLayout() instead.
6108void ImGui::RenderWindowTitleBarContents(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImRect& title_bar_rect, const char* name, bool* p_open)
6109{
6110 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6111 ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
6112 ImGuiWindowFlags flags = window->Flags;
6113
6114 const bool has_close_button = (p_open != NULL);
6115 const bool has_collapse_button = !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse) && (style.WindowMenuButtonPosition != ImGuiDir_None);
6116
6117 // Close & Collapse button are on the Menu NavLayer and don't default focus (unless there's nothing else on that layer)
6118 // FIXME-NAV: Might want (or not?) to set the equivalent of ImGuiButtonFlags_NoNavFocus so that mouse clicks on standard title bar items don't necessarily set nav/keyboard ref?
6119 const ImGuiItemFlags item_flags_backup = g.CurrentItemFlags;
6120 g.CurrentItemFlags |= ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus;
6121 window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
6122
6123 // Layout buttons
6124 // FIXME: Would be nice to generalize the subtleties expressed here into reusable code.
6125 float pad_l = style.FramePadding.x;
6126 float pad_r = style.FramePadding.x;
6127 float button_sz = g.FontSize;
6128 ImVec2 close_button_pos;
6129 ImVec2 collapse_button_pos;
6130 if (has_close_button)
6131 {
6132 pad_r += button_sz;
6133 close_button_pos = ImVec2(title_bar_rect.Max.x - pad_r - style.FramePadding.x, title_bar_rect.Min.y);
6134 }
6135 if (has_collapse_button && style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Right)
6136 {
6137 pad_r += button_sz;
6138 collapse_button_pos = ImVec2(title_bar_rect.Max.x - pad_r - style.FramePadding.x, title_bar_rect.Min.y);
6139 }
6140 if (has_collapse_button && style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Left)
6141 {
6142 collapse_button_pos = ImVec2(title_bar_rect.Min.x + pad_l - style.FramePadding.x, title_bar_rect.Min.y);
6143 pad_l += button_sz;
6144 }
6145
6146 // Collapse button (submitting first so it gets priority when choosing a navigation init fallback)
6147 if (has_collapse_button)
6148 if (CollapseButton(window->GetID("#COLLAPSE"), collapse_button_pos, NULL))
6149 window->WantCollapseToggle = true; // Defer actual collapsing to next frame as we are too far in the Begin() function
6150
6151 // Close button
6152 if (has_close_button)
6153 if (CloseButton(window->GetID("#CLOSE"), close_button_pos))
6154 *p_open = false;
6155
6156 window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
6157 g.CurrentItemFlags = item_flags_backup;
6158
6159 // Title bar text (with: horizontal alignment, avoiding collapse/close button, optional "unsaved document" marker)
