6160 // FIXME: Refactor text alignment facilities along with RenderText helpers, this is WAY too much messy code..
6161 const float marker_size_x = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument) ? button_sz * 0.80f : 0.0f;
6162 const ImVec2 text_size = CalcTextSize(name, NULL, true) + ImVec2(marker_size_x, 0.0f);
6163
6164 // As a nice touch we try to ensure that centered title text doesn't get affected by visibility of Close/Collapse button,
6165 // while uncentered title text will still reach edges correctly.
6166 if (pad_l > style.FramePadding.x)
6167 pad_l += g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
6168 if (pad_r > style.FramePadding.x)
6169 pad_r += g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
6170 if (style.WindowTitleAlign.x > 0.0f && style.WindowTitleAlign.x < 1.0f)
6171 {
6172 float centerness = ImSaturate(1.0f - ImFabs(style.WindowTitleAlign.x - 0.5f) * 2.0f); // 0.0f on either edges, 1.0f on center
6173 float pad_extend = ImMin(ImMax(pad_l, pad_r), title_bar_rect.GetWidth() - pad_l - pad_r - text_size.x);
6174 pad_l = ImMax(pad_l, pad_extend * centerness);
6175 pad_r = ImMax(pad_r, pad_extend * centerness);
6176 }
6177
6178 ImRect layout_r(title_bar_rect.Min.x + pad_l, title_bar_rect.Min.y, title_bar_rect.Max.x - pad_r, title_bar_rect.Max.y);
6179 ImRect clip_r(layout_r.Min.x, layout_r.Min.y, ImMin(layout_r.Max.x + g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, title_bar_rect.Max.x), layout_r.Max.y);
6180 if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument)
6181 {
6182 ImVec2 marker_pos;
6183 marker_pos.x = ImClamp(layout_r.Min.x + (layout_r.GetWidth() - text_size.x) * style.WindowTitleAlign.x + text_size.x, layout_r.Min.x, layout_r.Max.x);
6184 marker_pos.y = (layout_r.Min.y + layout_r.Max.y) * 0.5f;
6185 if (marker_pos.x > layout_r.Min.x)
6186 {
6187 RenderBullet(window->DrawList, marker_pos, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text));
6188 clip_r.Max.x = ImMin(clip_r.Max.x, marker_pos.x - (int)(marker_size_x * 0.5f));
6189 }
6190 }
6191 //if (g.IO.KeyShift) window->DrawList->AddRect(layout_r.Min, layout_r.Max, IM_COL32(255, 128, 0, 255)); // [DEBUG]
6192 //if (g.IO.KeyCtrl) window->DrawList->AddRect(clip_r.Min, clip_r.Max, IM_COL32(255, 128, 0, 255)); // [DEBUG]
6193 RenderTextClipped(layout_r.Min, layout_r.Max, name, NULL, &text_size, style.WindowTitleAlign, &clip_r);
6194}
6195
6196void ImGui::UpdateWindowParentAndRootLinks(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiWindowFlags flags, ImGuiWindow* parent_window)
6197{
6198 window->ParentWindow = parent_window;
6199 window->RootWindow = window->RootWindowPopupTree = window->RootWindowDockTree = window->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight = window->RootWindowForNav = window;
6200 if (parent_window && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip))
6201 {
6202 window->RootWindowDockTree = parent_window->RootWindowDockTree;
6203 if (!window->DockIsActive && !(parent_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost))
6204 window->RootWindow = parent_window->RootWindow;
6205 }
6206 if (parent_window && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup))
6207 window->RootWindowPopupTree = parent_window->RootWindowPopupTree;
6208 if (parent_window && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal) && (flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)))
6209 window->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight = parent_window->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight;
6210 while (window->RootWindowForNav->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened)
6211 {
6212 IM_ASSERT(window->RootWindowForNav->ParentWindow != NULL);
6213 window->RootWindowForNav = window->RootWindowForNav->ParentWindow;
6214 }
6215}
6216
6217// When a modal popup is open, newly created windows that want focus (i.e. are not popups and do not specify ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing)
6218// should be positioned behind that modal window, unless the window was created inside the modal begin-stack.
6219// In case of multiple stacked modals newly created window honors begin stack order and does not go below its own modal parent.
6220// - Window // FindBlockingModal() returns Modal1
6221// - Window // .. returns Modal1
6222// - Modal1 // .. returns Modal2
6223// - Window // .. returns Modal2
6224// - Window // .. returns Modal2
6225// - Modal2 // .. returns Modal2
6226static ImGuiWindow* ImGui::FindBlockingModal(ImGuiWindow* window)
6227{
6228 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6229 if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size <= 0)
6230 return NULL;
6231
6232 // Find a modal that has common parent with specified window. Specified window should be positioned behind that modal.
6233 for (int i = g.OpenPopupStack.Size - 1; i >= 0; i--)
6234 {
6235 ImGuiWindow* popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack.Data[i].Window;
6236 if (popup_window == NULL || !popup_window->WasActive || !(popup_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)) // Check WasActive, because this code may run before popup renders on current frame.
6237 continue;
6238 if (IsWindowWithinBeginStackOf(window, popup_window)) // Window is rendered over last modal, no render order change needed.
6239 break;
6240 for (ImGuiWindow* parent = popup_window->ParentWindowInBeginStack->RootWindow; parent != NULL; parent = parent->ParentWindowInBeginStack->RootWindow)
6241 if (IsWindowWithinBeginStackOf(window, parent))
6242 return popup_window; // Place window above its begin stack parent.
6243 }
6244 return NULL;
6245}
6246
6247// Push a new Dear ImGui window to add widgets to.
6248// - A default window called "Debug" is automatically stacked at the beginning of every frame so you can use widgets without explicitly calling a Begin/End pair.
6249// - Begin/End can be called multiple times during the frame with the same window name to append content.
6250// - The window name is used as a unique identifier to preserve window information across frames (and save rudimentary information to the .ini file).
6251// You can use the "##" or "###" markers to use the same label with different id, or same id with different label. See documentation at the top of this file.
6252// - Return false when window is collapsed, so you can early out in your code. You always need to call ImGui::End() even if false is returned.
6253// - Passing 'bool* p_open' displays a Close button on the upper-right corner of the window, the pointed value will be set to false when the button is pressed.
6254bool ImGui::Begin(const char* name, bool* p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
6255{
6256 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6257 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
6258 IM_ASSERT(name != NULL && name[0] != '\0'); // Window name required
6259 IM_ASSERT(g.WithinFrameScope); // Forgot to call ImGui::NewFrame()
6260 IM_ASSERT(g.FrameCountEnded != g.FrameCount); // Called ImGui::Render() or ImGui::EndFrame() and haven't called ImGui::NewFrame() again yet
6261
6262 // Find or create
6263 ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByName(name);
6264 const bool window_just_created = (window == NULL);
6265 if (window_just_created)
6266 window = CreateNewWindow(name, flags);
6267 else
6268 UpdateWindowInFocusOrderList(window, window_just_created, flags);
6269
6270 // Automatically disable manual moving/resizing when NoInputs is set
6271 if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs) == ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs)
6272 flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize;
6273
6274 if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened)
6275 IM_ASSERT(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow);
6276
6277 const int current_frame = g.FrameCount;
6278 const bool first_begin_of_the_frame = (window->LastFrameActive != current_frame);
6279 window->IsFallbackWindow = (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size == 0 && g.WithinFrameScopeWithImplicitWindow);
6280
6281 // Update the Appearing flag (note: the BeginDocked() path may also set this to true later)
6282 bool window_just_activated_by_user = (window->LastFrameActive < current_frame - 1); // Not using !WasActive because the implicit "Debug" window would always toggle off->on
6283 if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
6284 {
6285 ImGuiPopupData& popup_ref = g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size];
6286 window_just_activated_by_user |= (window->PopupId != popup_ref.PopupId); // We recycle popups so treat window as activated if popup id changed
6287 window_just_activated_by_user |= (window != popup_ref.Window);
6288 }
6289
6290 // Update Flags, LastFrameActive, BeginOrderXXX fields
6291 const bool window_was_appearing = window->Appearing;
6292 if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
6293 {
6294 window->Appearing = window_just_activated_by_user;
6295 if (window->Appearing)
6296 SetWindowConditionAllowFlags(window, ImGuiCond_Appearing, true);
6297
6298 window->FlagsPreviousFrame = window->Flags;
6299 window->Flags = (ImGuiWindowFlags)flags;
6300 window->LastFrameActive = current_frame;
6301 window->LastTimeActive = (float)g.Time;
6302 window->BeginOrderWithinParent = 0;
6303 window->BeginOrderWithinContext = (short)(g.WindowsActiveCount++);
6304 }
6305 else
6306 {
6307 flags = window->Flags;
6308 }
6309
6310 // Docking
6311 // (NB: during the frame dock nodes are created, it is possible that (window->DockIsActive == false) even though (window->DockNode->Windows.Size > 1)
6312 IM_ASSERT(window->DockNode == NULL || window->DockNodeAsHost == NULL); // Cannot be both
6313 if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasDock)
6314 SetWindowDock(window, g.NextWindowData.DockId, g.NextWindowData.DockCond);
6315 if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
6316 {
6317 bool has_dock_node = (window->DockId != 0 || window->DockNode != NULL);
6318 bool new_auto_dock_node = !has_dock_node && GetWindowAlwaysWantOwnTabBar(window);
6319 bool dock_node_was_visible = window->DockNodeIsVisible;
6320 bool dock_tab_was_visible = window->DockTabIsVisible;
6321 if (has_dock_node || new_auto_dock_node)
6322 {
6323 BeginDocked(window, p_open);
6324 flags = window->Flags;
6325 if (window->DockIsActive)
6326 IM_ASSERT(window->DockNode != NULL);
6327
6328 // Docking currently override constraints
6329 g.NextWindowData.Flags &= ~ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSizeConstraint;
6330
6331 // Amend the Appearing flag
6332 if (window->DockTabIsVisible && !dock_tab_was_visible && dock_node_was_visible && !window->Appearing && !window_was_appearing)
6333 {
6334 window->Appearing = true;
6335 SetWindowConditionAllowFlags(window, ImGuiCond_Appearing, true);
6336 }
6337 }
6338 else
6339 {
6340 window->DockIsActive = window->DockNodeIsVisible = window->DockTabIsVisible = false;
6341 }
6342 }
6343
6344 // Parent window is latched only on the first call to Begin() of the frame, so further append-calls can be done from a different window stack
6345 ImGuiWindow* parent_window_in_stack = window->DockIsActive ? window->DockNode->HostWindow : g.CurrentWindowStack.empty() ? NULL : g.CurrentWindowStack.back().Window;
6346 ImGuiWindow* parent_window = first_begin_of_the_frame ? ((flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)) ? parent_window_in_stack : NULL) : window->ParentWindow;
6347 IM_ASSERT(parent_window != NULL || !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow));
6348
6349 // We allow window memory to be compacted so recreate the base stack when needed.
6350 if (window->IDStack.Size == 0)
6351 window->IDStack.push_back(window->ID);
6352
6353 // Add to stack
6354 // We intentionally set g.CurrentWindow to NULL to prevent usage until when the viewport is set, then will call SetCurrentWindow()
6355 g.CurrentWindow = window;
6356 ImGuiWindowStackData window_stack_data;
6357 window_stack_data.Window = window;
6358 window_stack_data.ParentLastItemDataBackup = g.LastItemData;
6359 window_stack_data.StackSizesOnBegin.SetToCurrentState();
6360 g.CurrentWindowStack.push_back(window_stack_data);
6361 g.CurrentWindow = NULL;
6362 if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)
6363 g.BeginMenuCount++;
6364
6365 if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
6366 {
6367 ImGuiPopupData& popup_ref = g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size];
6368 popup_ref.Window = window;
6369 g.BeginPopupStack.push_back(popup_ref);
6370 window->PopupId = popup_ref.PopupId;
6371 }
6372
6373 // Update ->RootWindow and others pointers (before any possible call to FocusWindow)
6374 if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
6375 {
6376 UpdateWindowParentAndRootLinks(window, flags, parent_window);
6377 window->ParentWindowInBeginStack = parent_window_in_stack;
6378 }
6379
6380 // Process SetNextWindow***() calls
6381 // (FIXME: Consider splitting the HasXXX flags into X/Y components
6382 bool window_pos_set_by_api = false;
6383 bool window_size_x_set_by_api = false, window_size_y_set_by_api = false;
6384 if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasPos)
6385 {
6386 window_pos_set_by_api = (window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags & g.NextWindowData.PosCond) != 0;
6387 if (window_pos_set_by_api && ImLengthSqr(g.NextWindowData.PosPivotVal) > 0.00001f)
6388 {
6389 // May be processed on the next frame if this is our first frame and we are measuring size
6390 // FIXME: Look into removing the branch so everything can go through this same code path for consistency.
6391 window->SetWindowPosVal = g.NextWindowData.PosVal;
6392 window->SetWindowPosPivot = g.NextWindowData.PosPivotVal;
6393 window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags &= ~(ImGuiCond_Once | ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver | ImGuiCond_Appearing);
6394 }
6395 else
6396 {
6397 SetWindowPos(window, g.NextWindowData.PosVal, g.NextWindowData.PosCond);
6398 }
6399 }
6400 if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSize)
6401 {
6402 window_size_x_set_by_api = (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags & g.NextWindowData.SizeCond) != 0 && (g.NextWindowData.SizeVal.x > 0.0f);
6403 window_size_y_set_by_api = (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags & g.NextWindowData.SizeCond) != 0 && (g.NextWindowData.SizeVal.y > 0.0f);
6404 SetWindowSize(window, g.NextWindowData.SizeVal, g.NextWindowData.SizeCond);
6405 }
6406 if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasScroll)
6407 {
6408 if (g.NextWindowData.ScrollVal.x >= 0.0f)
6409 {
6410 window->ScrollTarget.x = g.NextWindowData.ScrollVal.x;
6411 window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.x = 0.0f;
6412 }
6413 if (g.NextWindowData.ScrollVal.y >= 0.0f)
6414 {
6415 window->ScrollTarget.y = g.NextWindowData.ScrollVal.y;
6416 window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.y = 0.0f;
6417 }
6418 }
6419 if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasContentSize)
6420 window->ContentSizeExplicit = g.NextWindowData.ContentSizeVal;
6421 else if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
6422 window->ContentSizeExplicit = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
6423 if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasWindowClass)
6424 window->WindowClass = g.NextWindowData.WindowClass;
6425 if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasCollapsed)
6426 SetWindowCollapsed(window, g.NextWindowData.CollapsedVal, g.NextWindowData.CollapsedCond);
6427 if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasFocus)
6428 FocusWindow(window);
6429 if (window->Appearing)
6430 SetWindowConditionAllowFlags(window, ImGuiCond_Appearing, false);
6431
6432 // When reusing window again multiple times a frame, just append content (don't need to setup again)
6433 if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
6434 {
6435 // Initialize
6436 const bool window_is_child_tooltip = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip); // FIXME-WIP: Undocumented behavior of Child+Tooltip for pinned tooltip (#1345)
6437 window->Active = true;
6438 window->HasCloseButton = (p_open != NULL);
6439 window->ClipRect = ImVec4(-FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX, +FLT_MAX, +FLT_MAX);
6440 window->IDStack.resize(1);
6441 window->DrawList->_ResetForNewFrame();
6442 window->DC.CurrentTableIdx = -1;
6443 if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost)
6444 {
6445 window->DrawList->ChannelsSplit(2);
6446 window->DrawList->ChannelsSetCurrent(1); // Render decorations on channel 1 as we will render the backgrounds manually later
6447 }
6448
6449 // Restore buffer capacity when woken from a compacted state, to avoid
6450 if (window->MemoryCompacted)
6451 GcAwakeTransientWindowBuffers(window);
6452
6453 // Update stored window name when it changes (which can _only_ happen with the "###" operator, so the ID would stay unchanged).
6454 // The title bar always display the 'name' parameter, so we only update the string storage if it needs to be visible to the end-user elsewhere.
6455 bool window_title_visible_elsewhere = false;
6456 if ((window->Viewport && window->Viewport->Window == window) || (window->DockIsActive))
6457 window_title_visible_elsewhere = true;
6458 else if (g.NavWindowingListWindow != NULL && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus) == 0) // Window titles visible when using CTRL+TAB
6459 window_title_visible_elsewhere = true;
6460 if (window_title_visible_elsewhere && !window_just_created && strcmp(name, window->Name) != 0)
6461 {
6462 size_t buf_len = (size_t)window->NameBufLen;
6463 window->Name = ImStrdupcpy(window->Name, &buf_len, name);
6464 window->NameBufLen = (int)buf_len;
6465 }
6466
6467 // UPDATE CONTENTS SIZE, UPDATE HIDDEN STATUS
6468
6469 // Update contents size from last frame for auto-fitting (or use explicit size)
6470 const bool window_just_appearing_after_hidden_for_resize = (window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems > 0);
6471 CalcWindowContentSizes(window, &window->ContentSize, &window->ContentSizeIdeal);
6472
6473 // FIXME: These flags are decremented before they are used. This means that in order to have these fields produce their intended behaviors
6474 // for one frame we must set them to at least 2, which is counter-intuitive. HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems is a more complicated case because
6475 // it has a single usage before this code block and may be set below before it is finally checked.
6476 if (window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems > 0)
6477 window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems--;
6478 if (window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems > 0)
6479 window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems--;
6480 if (window->HiddenFramesForRenderOnly > 0)
6481 window->HiddenFramesForRenderOnly--;
6482
6483 // Hide new windows for one frame until they calculate their size
6484 if (window_just_created && (!window_size_x_set_by_api || !window_size_y_set_by_api))
6485 window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems = 1;
6486
6487 // Hide popup/tooltip window when re-opening while we measure size (because we recycle the windows)
6488 // We reset Size/ContentSize for reappearing popups/tooltips early in this function, so further code won't be tempted to use the old size.
6489 if (window_just_activated_by_user && (flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)) != 0)
6490 {
6491 window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems = 1;
6492 if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize)
6493 {
6494 if (!window_size_x_set_by_api)
6495 window->Size.x = window->SizeFull.x = 0.f;
6496 if (!window_size_y_set_by_api)
6497 window->Size.y = window->SizeFull.y = 0.f;
6498 window->ContentSize = window->ContentSizeIdeal = ImVec2(0.f, 0.f);
6499 }
6500 }
6501
6502 // SELECT VIEWPORT
6503 // We need to do this before using any style/font sizes, as viewport with a different DPI may affect font sizes.
6504
6505 WindowSelectViewport(window);
6506 SetCurrentViewport(window, window->Viewport);
6507 window->FontDpiScale = (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_DpiEnableScaleFonts) ? window->Viewport->DpiScale : 1.0f;
6508 SetCurrentWindow(window);
6509 flags = window->Flags;
6510
6511 // LOCK BORDER SIZE AND PADDING FOR THE FRAME (so that altering them doesn't cause inconsistencies)
6512 // We read Style data after the call to UpdateSelectWindowViewport() which might be swapping the style.
6513
6514 if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
6515 window->WindowBorderSize = style.ChildBorderSize;
6516 else
6517 window->WindowBorderSize = ((flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)) ? style.PopupBorderSize : style.WindowBorderSize;
6518 if (!window->DockIsActive && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !(flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysUseWindowPadding | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)) && window->WindowBorderSize == 0.0f)
6519 window->WindowPadding = ImVec2(0.0f, (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar) ? style.WindowPadding.y : 0.0f);
6520 else
6521 window->WindowPadding = style.WindowPadding;
6522
6523 // Lock menu offset so size calculation can use it as menu-bar windows need a minimum size.
6524 window->DC.MenuBarOffset.x = ImMax(ImMax(window->WindowPadding.x, style.ItemSpacing.x), g.NextWindowData.MenuBarOffsetMinVal.x);
6525 window->DC.MenuBarOffset.y = g.NextWindowData.MenuBarOffsetMinVal.y;
6526
6527 // Collapse window by double-clicking on title bar
6528 // At this point we don't have a clipping rectangle setup yet, so we can use the title bar area for hit detection and drawing
6529 if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse) && !window->DockIsActive)
6530 {
6531 // We don't use a regular button+id to test for double-click on title bar (mostly due to legacy reason, could be fixed), so verify that we don't have items over the title bar.
6532 ImRect title_bar_rect = window->TitleBarRect();
6533 if (g.HoveredWindow == window && g.HoveredId == 0 && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame == 0 && IsMouseHoveringRect(title_bar_rect.Min, title_bar_rect.Max) && g.IO.MouseClickedCount[0] == 2)
6534 window->WantCollapseToggle = true;
6535 if (window->WantCollapseToggle)
6536 {
6537 window->Collapsed = !window->Collapsed;
6538 MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
6539 }
6540 }
6541 else
6542 {
6543 window->Collapsed = false;
6544 }
6545 window->WantCollapseToggle = false;
6546
6547 // SIZE
6548
6549 // Calculate auto-fit size, handle automatic resize
6550 const ImVec2 size_auto_fit = CalcWindowAutoFitSize(window, window->ContentSizeIdeal);
6551 bool use_current_size_for_scrollbar_x = window_just_created;
6552 bool use_current_size_for_scrollbar_y = window_just_created;
6553 if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) && !window->Collapsed)
6554 {
6555 // Using SetNextWindowSize() overrides ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize, so it can be used on tooltips/popups, etc.
6556 if (!window_size_x_set_by_api)
6557 {
6558 window->SizeFull.x = size_auto_fit.x;
6559 use_current_size_for_scrollbar_x = true;
6560 }
6561 if (!window_size_y_set_by_api)
6562 {
6563 window->SizeFull.y = size_auto_fit.y;
6564 use_current_size_for_scrollbar_y = true;
6565 }
6566 }
6567 else if (window->AutoFitFramesX > 0 || window->AutoFitFramesY > 0)
6568 {
6569 // Auto-fit may only grow window during the first few frames
6570 // We still process initial auto-fit on collapsed windows to get a window width, but otherwise don't honor ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize when collapsed.
6571 if (!window_size_x_set_by_api && window->AutoFitFramesX > 0)
6572 {
6573 window->SizeFull.x = window->AutoFitOnlyGrows ? ImMax(window->SizeFull.x, size_auto_fit.x) : size_auto_fit.x;
6574 use_current_size_for_scrollbar_x = true;
6575 }
6576 if (!window_size_y_set_by_api && window->AutoFitFramesY > 0)
6577 {
6578 window->SizeFull.y = window->AutoFitOnlyGrows ? ImMax(window->SizeFull.y, size_auto_fit.y) : size_auto_fit.y;
6579 use_current_size_for_scrollbar_y = true;
6580 }
6581 if (!window->Collapsed)
6582 MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
6583 }
6584
6585 // Apply minimum/maximum window size constraints and final size
6586 window->SizeFull = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, window->SizeFull);
6587 window->Size = window->Collapsed && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) ? window->TitleBarRect().GetSize() : window->SizeFull;
6588
6589 // Decoration size
6590 const float decoration_up_height = window->TitleBarHeight() + window->MenuBarHeight();
6591
6592 // POSITION
6593
6594 // Popup latch its initial position, will position itself when it appears next frame
6595 if (window_just_activated_by_user)
6596 {
6597 window->AutoPosLastDirection = ImGuiDir_None;
6598 if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) != 0 && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal) && !window_pos_set_by_api) // FIXME: BeginPopup() could use SetNextWindowPos()
6599 window->Pos = g.BeginPopupStack.back().OpenPopupPos;
6600 }
6601
6602 // Position child window
6603 if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
6604 {
6605 IM_ASSERT(parent_window && parent_window->Active);
6606 window->BeginOrderWithinParent = (short)parent_window->DC.ChildWindows.Size;
6607 parent_window->DC.ChildWindows.push_back(window);
6608 if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !window_pos_set_by_api && !window_is_child_tooltip)
6609 window->Pos = parent_window->DC.CursorPos;
6610 }
6611
6612 const bool window_pos_with_pivot = (window->SetWindowPosVal.x != FLT_MAX && window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems == 0);
6613 if (window_pos_with_pivot)
6614 SetWindowPos(window, window->SetWindowPosVal - window->Size * window->SetWindowPosPivot, 0); // Position given a pivot (e.g. for centering)
6615 else if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu) != 0)
6616 window->Pos = FindBestWindowPosForPopup(window);
6617 else if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) != 0 && !window_pos_set_by_api && window_just_appearing_after_hidden_for_resize)
6618 window->Pos = FindBestWindowPosForPopup(window);
6619 else if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) != 0 && !window_pos_set_by_api && !window_is_child_tooltip)
6620 window->Pos = FindBestWindowPosForPopup(window);
6621
6622 // Late create viewport if we don't fit within our current host viewport.
6623 if (window->ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend >= 0 && !window->ViewportOwned && !(window->Viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized))
6624 if (!window->Viewport->GetMainRect().Contains(window->Rect()))
6625 {
6626 // This is based on the assumption that the DPI will be known ahead (same as the DPI of the selection done in UpdateSelectWindowViewport)
6627 //ImGuiViewport* old_viewport = window->Viewport;
6628 window->Viewport = AddUpdateViewport(window, window->ID, window->Pos, window->Size, ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing);
6629
6630 // FIXME-DPI
6631 //IM_ASSERT(old_viewport->DpiScale == window->Viewport->DpiScale); // FIXME-DPI: Something went wrong
6632 SetCurrentViewport(window, window->Viewport);
6633 window->FontDpiScale = (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_DpiEnableScaleFonts) ? window->Viewport->DpiScale : 1.0f;
6634 SetCurrentWindow(window);
6635 }
6636
6637 if (window->ViewportOwned)
6638 WindowSyncOwnedViewport(window, parent_window_in_stack);
6639
6640 // Calculate the range of allowed position for that window (to be movable and visible past safe area padding)
6641 // When clamping to stay visible, we will enforce that window->Pos stays inside of visibility_rect.
6642 ImRect viewport_rect(window->Viewport->GetMainRect());
6643 ImRect viewport_work_rect(window->Viewport->GetWorkRect());
6644 ImVec2 visibility_padding = ImMax(style.DisplayWindowPadding, style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding);
6645 ImRect visibility_rect(viewport_work_rect.Min + visibility_padding, viewport_work_rect.Max - visibility_padding);
6646
6647 // Clamp position/size so window stays visible within its viewport or monitor
6648 // Ignore zero-sized display explicitly to avoid losing positions if a window manager reports zero-sized window when initializing or minimizing.
6649 // FIXME: Similar to code in GetWindowAllowedExtentRect()
6650 if (!window_pos_set_by_api && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && window->AutoFitFramesX <= 0 && window->AutoFitFramesY <= 0)
6651 {
6652 if (!window->ViewportOwned && viewport_rect.GetWidth() > 0 && viewport_rect.GetHeight() > 0.0f)
6653 {
6654 ClampWindowRect(window, visibility_rect);
6655 }
6656 else if (window->ViewportOwned && g.PlatformIO.Monitors.Size > 0)
6657 {
6658 // Lost windows (e.g. a monitor disconnected) will naturally moved to the fallback/dummy monitor aka the main viewport.
6659 const ImGuiPlatformMonitor* monitor = GetViewportPlatformMonitor(window->Viewport);
6660 visibility_rect.Min = monitor->WorkPos + visibility_padding;
6661 visibility_rect.Max = monitor->WorkPos + monitor->WorkSize - visibility_padding;
6662 ClampWindowRect(window, visibility_rect);
6663 }
6664 }
6665 window->Pos = ImFloor(window->Pos);
6666
6667 // Lock window rounding for the frame (so that altering them doesn't cause inconsistencies)
6668 // Large values tend to lead to variety of artifacts and are not recommended.
6669 if (window->ViewportOwned || window->DockIsActive)
6670 window->WindowRounding = 0.0f;
6671 else
6672 window->WindowRounding = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) ? style.ChildRounding : ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)) ? style.PopupRounding : style.WindowRounding;
6673
6674 // For windows with title bar or menu bar, we clamp to FrameHeight(FontSize + FramePadding.y * 2.0f) to completely hide artifacts.
6675 //if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar) || !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
6676 // window->WindowRounding = ImMin(window->WindowRounding, g.FontSize + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f);
6677
6678 // Apply window focus (new and reactivated windows are moved to front)
6679 bool want_focus = false;
6680 if (window_just_activated_by_user && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing))
6681 {
6682 if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
6683 want_focus = true;
6684 else if ((window->DockIsActive || (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) == 0) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip))
6685 want_focus = true;
6686
6687 ImGuiWindow* modal = GetTopMostPopupModal();
6688 if (modal != NULL && !IsWindowWithinBeginStackOf(window, modal))
6689 {
6690 // Avoid focusing a window that is created outside of active modal. This will prevent active modal from being closed.
6691 // Since window is not focused it would reappear at the same display position like the last time it was visible.
6692 // In case of completely new windows it would go to the top (over current modal), but input to such window would still be blocked by modal.
6693 // Position window behind a modal that is not a begin-parent of this window.
6694 want_focus = false;
6695 if (window == window->RootWindow)
6696 {
6697 ImGuiWindow* blocking_modal = FindBlockingModal(window);
6698 IM_ASSERT(blocking_modal != NULL);
6699 BringWindowToDisplayBehind(window, blocking_modal);
6700 }
6701 }
6702 }
6703
6704 // Decide if we are going to handle borders and resize grips
6705 const bool handle_borders_and_resize_grips = (window->DockNodeAsHost || !window->DockIsActive);
6706
6707 // Handle manual resize: Resize Grips, Borders, Gamepad
6708 int border_held = -1;
6709 ImU32 resize_grip_col[4] = {};
6710 const int resize_grip_count = g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges ? 2 : 1; // Allow resize from lower-left if we have the mouse cursor feedback for it.
6711 const float resize_grip_draw_size = IM_FLOOR(ImMax(g.FontSize * 1.10f, window->WindowRounding + 1.0f + g.FontSize * 0.2f));
6712 if (handle_borders_and_resize_grips && !window->Collapsed)
6713 if (UpdateWindowManualResize(window, size_auto_fit, &border_held, resize_grip_count, &resize_grip_col[0], visibility_rect))
6714 use_current_size_for_scrollbar_x = use_current_size_for_scrollbar_y = true;
6715 window->ResizeBorderHeld = (signed char)border_held;
6716
6717 // Synchronize window --> viewport again and one last time (clamping and manual resize may have affected either)
6718 if (window->ViewportOwned)
6719 {
6720 if (!window->Viewport->PlatformRequestMove)
6721 window->Viewport->Pos = window->Pos;
6722 if (!window->Viewport->PlatformRequestResize)
6723 window->Viewport->Size = window->Size;
6724 window->Viewport->UpdateWorkRect();
6725 viewport_rect = window->Viewport->GetMainRect();
6726 }
6727
6728 // Save last known viewport position within the window itself (so it can be saved in .ini file and restored)
6729 window->ViewportPos = window->Viewport->Pos;
6730
6731 // SCROLLBAR VISIBILITY
6732
6733 // Update scrollbar visibility (based on the Size that was effective during last frame or the auto-resized Size).
6734 if (!window->Collapsed)
6735 {
6736 // When reading the current size we need to read it after size constraints have been applied.
6737 // When we use InnerRect here we are intentionally reading last frame size, same for ScrollbarSizes values before we set them again.
6738 ImVec2 avail_size_from_current_frame = ImVec2(window->SizeFull.x, window->SizeFull.y - decoration_up_height);
6739 ImVec2 avail_size_from_last_frame = window->InnerRect.GetSize() + window->ScrollbarSizes;
6740 ImVec2 needed_size_from_last_frame = window_just_created ? ImVec2(0, 0) : window->ContentSize + window->WindowPadding * 2.0f;
6741 float size_x_for_scrollbars = use_current_size_for_scrollbar_x ? avail_size_from_current_frame.x : avail_size_from_last_frame.x;
6742 float size_y_for_scrollbars = use_current_size_for_scrollbar_y ? avail_size_from_current_frame.y : avail_size_from_last_frame.y;
6743 //bool scrollbar_y_from_last_frame = window->ScrollbarY; // FIXME: May want to use that in the ScrollbarX expression? How many pros vs cons?
6744 window->ScrollbarY = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysVerticalScrollbar) || ((needed_size_from_last_frame.y > size_y_for_scrollbars) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar));
6745 window->ScrollbarX = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysHorizontalScrollbar) || ((needed_size_from_last_frame.x > size_x_for_scrollbars - (window->ScrollbarY ? style.ScrollbarSize : 0.0f)) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar) && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar));
6746 if (window->ScrollbarX && !window->ScrollbarY)
6747 window->ScrollbarY = (needed_size_from_last_frame.y > size_y_for_scrollbars) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar);
6748 window->ScrollbarSizes = ImVec2(window->ScrollbarY ? style.ScrollbarSize : 0.0f, window->ScrollbarX ? style.ScrollbarSize : 0.0f);
6749 }
6750
6751 // UPDATE RECTANGLES (1- THOSE NOT AFFECTED BY SCROLLING)
6752 // Update various regions. Variables they depends on should be set above in this function.
6753 // We set this up after processing the resize grip so that our rectangles doesn't lag by a frame.
6754
6755 // Outer rectangle
6756 // Not affected by window border size. Used by:
6757 // - FindHoveredWindow() (w/ extra padding when border resize is enabled)
6758 // - Begin() initial clipping rect for drawing window background and borders.
6759 // - Begin() clipping whole child
6760 const ImRect host_rect = ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !window_is_child_tooltip) ? parent_window->ClipRect : viewport_rect;
6761 const ImRect outer_rect = window->Rect();
6762 const ImRect title_bar_rect = window->TitleBarRect();
6763 window->OuterRectClipped = outer_rect;
6764 if (window->DockIsActive)
6765 window->OuterRectClipped.Min.y += window->TitleBarHeight();
6766 window->OuterRectClipped.ClipWith(host_rect);
6767
6768 // Inner rectangle
6769 // Not affected by window border size. Used by:
6770 // - InnerClipRect
6771 // - ScrollToRectEx()
6772 // - NavUpdatePageUpPageDown()
6773 // - Scrollbar()
6774 window->InnerRect.Min.x = window->Pos.x;
6775 window->InnerRect.Min.y = window->Pos.y + decoration_up_height;
6776 window->InnerRect.Max.x = window->Pos.x + window->Size.x - window->ScrollbarSizes.x;
6777 window->InnerRect.Max.y = window->Pos.y + window->Size.y - window->ScrollbarSizes.y;
6778
6779 // Inner clipping rectangle.
6780 // Will extend a little bit outside the normal work region.
6781 // This is to allow e.g. Selectable or CollapsingHeader or some separators to cover that space.
6782 // Force round operator last to ensure that e.g. (int)(max.x-min.x) in user's render code produce correct result.
6783 // Note that if our window is collapsed we will end up with an inverted (~null) clipping rectangle which is the correct behavior.
6784 // Affected by window/frame border size. Used by:
6785 // - Begin() initial clip rect
6786 float top_border_size = (((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar) || !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar)) ? style.FrameBorderSize : window->WindowBorderSize);
6787 window->InnerClipRect.Min.x = ImFloor(0.5f + window->InnerRect.Min.x + ImMax(ImFloor(window->WindowPadding.x * 0.5f), window->WindowBorderSize));
6788 window->InnerClipRect.Min.y = ImFloor(0.5f + window->InnerRect.Min.y + top_border_size);
6789 window->InnerClipRect.Max.x = ImFloor(0.5f + window->InnerRect.Max.x - ImMax(ImFloor(window->WindowPadding.x * 0.5f), window->WindowBorderSize));
6790 window->InnerClipRect.Max.y = ImFloor(0.5f + window->InnerRect.Max.y - window->WindowBorderSize);
6791 window->InnerClipRect.ClipWithFull(host_rect);
6792
6793 // Default item width. Make it proportional to window size if window manually resizes
6794 if (window->Size.x > 0.0f && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
6795 window->ItemWidthDefault = ImFloor(window->Size.x * 0.65f);
6796 else
6797 window->ItemWidthDefault = ImFloor(g.FontSize * 16.0f);
6798
6799 // SCROLLING
6800
6801 // Lock down maximum scrolling
6802 // The value of ScrollMax are ahead from ScrollbarX/ScrollbarY which is intentionally using InnerRect from previous rect in order to accommodate
6803 // for right/bottom aligned items without creating a scrollbar.
6804 window->ScrollMax.x = ImMax(0.0f, window->ContentSize.x + window->WindowPadding.x * 2.0f - window->InnerRect.GetWidth());
6805 window->ScrollMax.y = ImMax(0.0f, window->ContentSize.y + window->WindowPadding.y * 2.0f - window->InnerRect.GetHeight());
6806
6807 // Apply scrolling
6808 window->Scroll = CalcNextScrollFromScrollTargetAndClamp(window);
6809 window->ScrollTarget = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
6810
6811 // DRAWING
6812
6813 // Setup draw list and outer clipping rectangle
6814 IM_ASSERT(window->DrawList->CmdBuffer.Size == 1 && window->DrawList->CmdBuffer[0].ElemCount == 0);
6815 window->DrawList->PushTextureID(g.Font->ContainerAtlas->TexID);
6816 PushClipRect(host_rect.Min, host_rect.Max, false);
6817
6818 // Child windows can render their decoration (bg color, border, scrollbars, etc.) within their parent to save a draw call (since 1.71)
6819 // When using overlapping child windows, this will break the assumption that child z-order is mapped to submission order.
6820 // FIXME: User code may rely on explicit sorting of overlapping child window and would need to disable this somehow. Please get in contact if you are affected (github #4493)
6821 const bool is_undocked_or_docked_visible = !window->DockIsActive || window->DockTabIsVisible;
6822 if (is_undocked_or_docked_visible)
6823 {
6824 bool render_decorations_in_parent = false;
6825 if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !window_is_child_tooltip)
6826 {
6827 // - We test overlap with the previous child window only (testing all would end up being O(log N) not a good investment here)
6828 // - We disable this when the parent window has zero vertices, which is a common pattern leading to laying out multiple overlapping childs
6829 ImGuiWindow* previous_child = parent_window->DC.ChildWindows.Size >= 2 ? parent_window->DC.ChildWindows[parent_window->DC.ChildWindows.Size - 2] : NULL;
6830 bool previous_child_overlapping = previous_child ? previous_child->Rect().Overlaps(window->Rect()) : false;
6831 bool parent_is_empty = parent_window->DrawList->VtxBuffer.Size > 0;
6832 if (window->DrawList->CmdBuffer.back().ElemCount == 0 && parent_is_empty && !previous_child_overlapping)
6833 render_decorations_in_parent = true;
6834 }
6835 if (render_decorations_in_parent)
6836 window->DrawList = parent_window->DrawList;
6837
6838 // Handle title bar, scrollbar, resize grips and resize borders
6839 const ImGuiWindow* window_to_highlight = g.NavWindowingTarget ? g.NavWindowingTarget : g.NavWindow;
6840 const bool title_bar_is_highlight = want_focus || (window_to_highlight && (window->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight == window_to_highlight->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight || (window->DockNode && window->DockNode == window_to_highlight->DockNode)));
6841 RenderWindowDecorations(window, title_bar_rect, title_bar_is_highlight, handle_borders_and_resize_grips, resize_grip_count, resize_grip_col, resize_grip_draw_size);
6842
6843 if (render_decorations_in_parent)
6844 window->DrawList = &window->DrawListInst;
6845 }
6846
6847 // UPDATE RECTANGLES (2- THOSE AFFECTED BY SCROLLING)
6848
6849 // Work rectangle.
6850 // Affected by window padding and border size. Used by:
6851 // - Columns() for right-most edge
6852 // - TreeNode(), CollapsingHeader() for right-most edge
6853 // - BeginTabBar() for right-most edge
6854 const bool allow_scrollbar_x = !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar) && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar);
6855 const bool allow_scrollbar_y = !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar);
6856 const float work_rect_size_x = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.x != 0.0f ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.x : ImMax(allow_scrollbar_x ? window->ContentSize.x : 0.0f, window->Size.x - window->WindowPadding.x * 2.0f - window->ScrollbarSizes.x));
6857 const float work_rect_size_y = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.y != 0.0f ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.y : ImMax(allow_scrollbar_y ? window->ContentSize.y : 0.0f, window->Size.y - window->WindowPadding.y * 2.0f - decoration_up_height - window->ScrollbarSizes.y));
6858 window->WorkRect.Min.x = ImFloor(window->InnerRect.Min.x - window->Scroll.x + ImMax(window->WindowPadding.x, window->WindowBorderSize));
6859 window->WorkRect.Min.y = ImFloor(window->InnerRect.Min.y - window->Scroll.y + ImMax(window->WindowPadding.y, window->WindowBorderSize));
6860 window->WorkRect.Max.x = window->WorkRect.Min.x + work_rect_size_x;
6861 window->WorkRect.Max.y = window->WorkRect.Min.y + work_rect_size_y;
6862 window->ParentWorkRect = window->WorkRect;
6863
6864 // [LEGACY] Content Region
6865 // FIXME-OBSOLETE: window->ContentRegionRect.Max is currently very misleading / partly faulty, but some BeginChild() patterns relies on it.
6866 // Used by:
6867 // - Mouse wheel scrolling + many other things
6868 window->ContentRegionRect.Min.x = window->Pos.x - window->Scroll.x + window->WindowPadding.x;
6869 window->ContentRegionRect.Min.y = window->Pos.y - window->Scroll.y + window->WindowPadding.y + decoration_up_height;
6870 window->ContentRegionRect.Max.x = window->ContentRegionRect.Min.x + (window->ContentSizeExplicit.x != 0.0f ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.x : (window->Size.x - window->WindowPadding.x * 2.0f - window->ScrollbarSizes.x));
6871 window->ContentRegionRect.Max.y = window->ContentRegionRect.Min.y + (window->ContentSizeExplicit.y != 0.0f ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.y : (window->Size.y - window->WindowPadding.y * 2.0f - decoration_up_height - window->ScrollbarSizes.y));
6872
6873 // Setup drawing context
6874 // (NB: That term "drawing context / DC" lost its meaning a long time ago. Initially was meant to hold transient data only. Nowadays difference between window-> and window->DC-> is dubious.)
6875 window->DC.Indent.x = 0.0f + window->WindowPadding.x - window->Scroll.x;
6876 window->DC.GroupOffset.x = 0.0f;
6877 window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x = 0.0f;
6878
6879 // Record the loss of precision of CursorStartPos which can happen due to really large scrolling amount.
6880 // This is used by clipper to compensate and fix the most common use case of large scroll area. Easy and cheap, next best thing compared to switching everything to double or ImU64.
6881 double start_pos_highp_x = (double)window->Pos.x + window->WindowPadding.x - (double)window->Scroll.x + window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x;
6882 double start_pos_highp_y = (double)window->Pos.y + window->WindowPadding.y - (double)window->Scroll.y + decoration_up_height;
6883 window->DC.CursorStartPos = ImVec2((float)start_pos_highp_x, (float)start_pos_highp_y);
6884 window->DC.CursorStartPosLossyness = ImVec2((float)(start_pos_highp_x - window->DC.CursorStartPos.x), (float)(start_pos_highp_y - window->DC.CursorStartPos.y));
6885 window->DC.CursorPos = window->DC.CursorStartPos;
6886 window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine = window->DC.CursorPos;
6887 window->DC.CursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorStartPos;
6888 window->DC.IdealMaxPos = window->DC.CursorStartPos;
6889 window->DC.CurrLineSize = window->DC.PrevLineSize = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
6890 window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset = 0.0f;
6891
6892 window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
6893 window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask = window->DC.NavLayersActiveMaskNext;
6894 window->DC.NavLayersActiveMaskNext = 0x00;
6895 window->DC.NavHideHighlightOneFrame = false;
6896 window->DC.NavHasScroll = (window->ScrollMax.y > 0.0f);
6897
6898 window->DC.MenuBarAppending = false;
6899 window->DC.MenuColumns.Update(style.ItemSpacing.x, window_just_activated_by_user);
6900 window->DC.TreeDepth = 0;
6901 window->DC.TreeJumpToParentOnPopMask = 0x00;
6902 window->DC.ChildWindows.resize(0);
6903 window->DC.StateStorage = &window->StateStorage;
6904 window->DC.CurrentColumns = NULL;
6905 window->DC.LayoutType = ImGuiLayoutType_Vertical;
6906 window->DC.ParentLayoutType = parent_window ? parent_window->DC.LayoutType : ImGuiLayoutType_Vertical;
6907
6908 window->DC.ItemWidth = window->ItemWidthDefault;
6909 window->DC.TextWrapPos = -1.0f; // disabled
6910 window->DC.ItemWidthStack.resize(0);
6911 window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.resize(0);
6912
6913 if (window->AutoFitFramesX > 0)
6914 window->AutoFitFramesX--;
6915 if (window->AutoFitFramesY > 0)
6916 window->AutoFitFramesY--;
6917
6918 // Apply focus (we need to call FocusWindow() AFTER setting DC.CursorStartPos so our initial navigation reference rectangle can start around there)
6919 if (want_focus)
6920 {
6921 FocusWindow(window);
6922 NavInitWindow(window, false); // <-- this is in the way for us to be able to defer and sort reappearing FocusWindow() calls
6923 }
6924
6925 // Close requested by platform window
6926 if (p_open != NULL && window->Viewport->PlatformRequestClose && window->Viewport != GetMainViewport())
6927 {
6928 if (!window->DockIsActive || window->DockTabIsVisible)
6929 {
6930 window->Viewport->PlatformRequestClose = false;
6931 g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = false; // Assume user mapped PlatformRequestClose on ALT-F4 so we disable ALT for menu toggle. False positive not an issue.
6932 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_VIEWPORT("Window '%s' PlatformRequestClose\n", window->Name);
6933 *p_open = false;
6934 }
6935 }
6936
6937 // Title bar
6938 if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) && !window->DockIsActive)
6939 RenderWindowTitleBarContents(window, ImRect(title_bar_rect.Min.x + window->WindowBorderSize, title_bar_rect.Min.y, title_bar_rect.Max.x - window->WindowBorderSize, title_bar_rect.Max.y), name, p_open);
6940
6941 // Clear hit test shape every frame
6942 window->HitTestHoleSize.x = window->HitTestHoleSize.y = 0;
6943
6944 // Pressing CTRL+C while holding on a window copy its content to the clipboard
6945 // This works but 1. doesn't handle multiple Begin/End pairs, 2. recursing into another Begin/End pair - so we need to work that out and add better logging scope.
6946 // Maybe we can support CTRL+C on every element?
6947 /*
6948 //if (g.NavWindow == window && g.ActiveId == 0)
6949 if (g.ActiveId == window->MoveId)
6950 if (g.IO.KeyCtrl && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_C))
6951 LogToClipboard();
6952 */
6953
6954 if (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable)
6955 {
6956 // Docking: Dragging a dockable window (or any of its child) turns it into a drag and drop source.
6957 // We need to do this _before_ we overwrite window->DC.LastItemId below because BeginDockableDragDropSource() also overwrites it.
6958 if ((g.MovingWindow == window) && (g.IO.ConfigDockingWithShift == g.IO.KeyShift))
6959 if ((window->RootWindowDockTree->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking) == 0)
6960 BeginDockableDragDropSource(window);
6961
6962 // Docking: Any dockable window can act as a target. For dock node hosts we call BeginDockableDragDropTarget() in DockNodeUpdate() instead.
6963 if (g.DragDropActive && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking))
6964 if (g.MovingWindow == NULL || g.MovingWindow->RootWindowDockTree != window)
6965 if ((window == window->RootWindowDockTree) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost))
6966 BeginDockableDragDropTarget(window);
6967 }
6968
6969 // We fill last item data based on Title Bar/Tab, in order for IsItemHovered() and IsItemActive() to be usable after Begin().
6970 // This is useful to allow creating context menus on title bar only, etc.
6971 if (window->DockIsActive)
6972 SetLastItemData(window->ID, g.CurrentItemFlags, window->DockTabItemStatusFlags, window->DockTabItemRect);
6973 else
6974 SetLastItemData(window->MoveId, g.CurrentItemFlags, IsMouseHoveringRect(title_bar_rect.Min, title_bar_rect.Max, false) ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect : 0, title_bar_rect);
6975
6976#ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
6977 if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
6978 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_ADD(g.LastItemData.Rect, g.LastItemData.ID);
6979#endif
6980 }
6981 else
6982 {
6983 // Append
6984 SetCurrentViewport(window, window->Viewport);
6985 SetCurrentWindow(window);
6986 }
6987
6988 // Pull/inherit current state
6989 window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) ? parent_window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent : window->GetID("#FOCUSSCOPE"); // Inherit from parent only // -V595
6990
6991 if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost))
6992 PushClipRect(window->InnerClipRect.Min, window->InnerClipRect.Max, true);
6993
6994 // Clear 'accessed' flag last thing (After PushClipRect which will set the flag. We want the flag to stay false when the default "Debug" window is unused)
6995 window->WriteAccessed = false;
6996 window->BeginCount++;
6997 g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags();
6998
6999 // Update visibility
7000 if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
7001 {
7002 // When we are about to select this tab (which will only be visible on the _next frame_), flag it with a non-zero HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems.
7003 // This will have the important effect of actually returning true in Begin() and not setting SkipItems, allowing an earlier submission of the window contents.
7004 // This is analogous to regular windows being hidden from one frame.
7005 // It is especially important as e.g. nested TabBars would otherwise generate flicker in the form of one empty frame, or focus requests won't be processed.
7006 if (window->DockIsActive && !window->DockTabIsVisible)
7007 {
7008 if (window->LastFrameJustFocused == g.FrameCount)
7009 window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems = 1;
7010 else
7011 window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1;
7012 }
7013
7014 if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
7015 {
7016 // Child window can be out of sight and have "negative" clip windows.
7017 // Mark them as collapsed so commands are skipped earlier (we can't manually collapse them because they have no title bar).
7018 IM_ASSERT((flags& ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) != 0 || (window->DockIsActive));
7019 if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) && window->AutoFitFramesX <= 0 && window->AutoFitFramesY <= 0) // FIXME: Doesn't make sense for ChildWindow??
7020 {
7021 const bool nav_request = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened) && (g.NavAnyRequest && g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow->RootWindowForNav == window->RootWindowForNav);
7022 if (!g.LogEnabled && !nav_request)
7023 if (window->OuterRectClipped.Min.x >= window->OuterRectClipped.Max.x || window->OuterRectClipped.Min.y >= window->OuterRectClipped.Max.y)
7024 window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1;
7025 }
7026
7027 // Hide along with parent or if parent is collapsed
7028 if (parent_window && (parent_window->Collapsed || parent_window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems > 0))
7029 window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1;
7030 if (parent_window && (parent_window->Collapsed || parent_window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems > 0))
7031 window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems = 1;
7032 }
7033
7034 // Don't render if style alpha is 0.0 at the time of Begin(). This is arbitrary and inconsistent but has been there for a long while (may remove at some point)
7035 if (style.Alpha <= 0.0f)
7036 window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1;
7037
7038 // Update the Hidden flag
7039 bool hidden_regular = (window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems > 0) || (window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems > 0);
7040 window->Hidden = hidden_regular || (window->HiddenFramesForRenderOnly > 0);
7041
7042 // Disable inputs for requested number of frames
7043 if (window->DisableInputsFrames > 0)
7044 {
7045 window->DisableInputsFrames--;
7046 window->Flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs;
7047 }
7048
7049 // Update the SkipItems flag, used to early out of all items functions (no layout required)
7050 bool skip_items = false;
7051 if (window->Collapsed || !window->Active || hidden_regular)
7052 if (window->AutoFitFramesX <= 0 && window->AutoFitFramesY <= 0 && window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems <= 0)
7053 skip_items = true;
7054 window->SkipItems = skip_items;
7055
7056 // Sanity check: there are two spots which can set Appearing = true
7057 // - when 'window_just_activated_by_user' is set -> HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems is set -> SkipItems always false
7058 // - in BeginDocked() path when DockNodeIsVisible == DockTabIsVisible == true -> hidden _should_ be all zero // FIXME: Not formally proven, hence the assert.
7059 if (window->SkipItems && !window->Appearing)
7060 IM_ASSERT(window->Appearing == false); // Please report on GitHub if this triggers: https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/4177
7061 }
7062
7063 return !window->SkipItems;
7064}
7065
7066void ImGui::End()
7067{
7068 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7069 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7070
7071 // Error checking: verify that user hasn't called End() too many times!
7072 if (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size <= 1 && g.WithinFrameScopeWithImplicitWindow)
7073 {
7074 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.CurrentWindowStack.Size > 1, "Calling End() too many times!");
7075 return;
7076 }
7077 IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindowStack.Size > 0);
7078
7079 // Error checking: verify that user doesn't directly call End() on a child window.
7080 if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost) && !window->DockIsActive)
7081 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.WithinEndChild, "Must call EndChild() and not End()!");
7082
7083 // Close anything that is open
7084 if (window->DC.CurrentColumns)
7085 EndColumns();
7086 if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost)) // Pop inner window clip rectangle
7087 PopClipRect();
7088
7089 // Stop logging
7090 if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)) // FIXME: add more options for scope of logging
7091 LogFinish();
7092
7093 // Docking: report contents sizes to parent to allow for auto-resize
7094 if (window->DockNode && window->DockTabIsVisible)
7095 if (ImGuiWindow* host_window = window->DockNode->HostWindow) // FIXME-DOCK
7096 host_window->DC.CursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos + window->WindowPadding - host_window->WindowPadding;
7097
7098 // Pop from window stack
7099 g.LastItemData = g.CurrentWindowStack.back().ParentLastItemDataBackup;
7100 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)
7101 g.BeginMenuCount--;
7102 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
7103 g.BeginPopupStack.pop_back();
7104 g.CurrentWindowStack.back().StackSizesOnBegin.CompareWithCurrentState();
7105 g.CurrentWindowStack.pop_back();
7106 SetCurrentWindow(g.CurrentWindowStack.Size == 0 ? NULL : g.CurrentWindowStack.back().Window);
7107 if (g.CurrentWindow)
7108 SetCurrentViewport(g.CurrentWindow, g.CurrentWindow->Viewport);
7109}
7110
7111void ImGui::BringWindowToFocusFront(ImGuiWindow* window)
7112{
7113 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7114 IM_ASSERT(window == window->RootWindow);
7115
7116 const int cur_order = window->FocusOrder;
7117 IM_ASSERT(g.WindowsFocusOrder[cur_order] == window);
7118 if (g.WindowsFocusOrder.back() == window)
7119 return;
7120
7121 const int new_order = g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1;
7122 for (int n = cur_order; n < new_order; n++)
7123 {
7124 g.WindowsFocusOrder[n] = g.WindowsFocusOrder[n + 1];
7125 g.WindowsFocusOrder[n]->FocusOrder--;
7126 IM_ASSERT(g.WindowsFocusOrder[n]->FocusOrder == n);
7127 }
7128 g.WindowsFocusOrder[new_order] = window;
7129 window->FocusOrder = (short)new_order;
7130}
7131
7132void ImGui::BringWindowToDisplayFront(ImGuiWindow* window)
7133{
7134 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7135 ImGuiWindow* current_front_window = g.Windows.back();
7136 if (current_front_window == window || current_front_window->RootWindowDockTree == window) // Cheap early out (could be better)
7137 return;
7138 for (int i = g.Windows.Size - 2; i >= 0; i--) // We can ignore the top-most window
7139 if (g.Windows[i] == window)
7140 {
7141 memmove(&g.Windows[i], &g.Windows[i + 1], (size_t)(g.Windows.Size - i - 1) * sizeof(ImGuiWindow*));
7142 g.Windows[g.Windows.Size - 1] = window;
7143 break;
7144 }
7145}
7146
7147void ImGui::BringWindowToDisplayBack(ImGuiWindow* window)
7148{
7149 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7150 if (g.Windows[0] == window)
7151 return;
7152 for (int i = 0; i < g.Windows.Size; i++)
7153 if (g.Windows[i] == window)
7154 {
7155 memmove(&g.Windows[1], &g.Windows[0], (size_t)i * sizeof(ImGuiWindow*));
7156 g.Windows[0] = window;
7157 break;
7158 }
7159}
7160
7161void ImGui::BringWindowToDisplayBehind(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiWindow* behind_window)
7162{
7163 IM_ASSERT(window != NULL && behind_window != NULL);
7164 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7165 window = window->RootWindow;
7166 behind_window = behind_window->RootWindow;
7167 int pos_wnd = FindWindowDisplayIndex(window);
7168 int pos_beh = FindWindowDisplayIndex(behind_window);
7169 if (pos_wnd < pos_beh)
7170 {
7171 size_t copy_bytes = (pos_beh - pos_wnd - 1) * sizeof(ImGuiWindow*);
7172 memmove(&g.Windows.Data[pos_wnd], &g.Windows.Data[pos_wnd + 1], copy_bytes);
7173 g.Windows[pos_beh - 1] = window;
7174 }
7175 else
7176 {
7177 size_t copy_bytes = (pos_wnd - pos_beh) * sizeof(ImGuiWindow*);
7178 memmove(&g.Windows.Data[pos_beh + 1], &g.Windows.Data[pos_beh], copy_bytes);
7179 g.Windows[pos_beh] = window;
7180 }
7181}
7182
7183int ImGui::FindWindowDisplayIndex(ImGuiWindow* window)
7184{
7185 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7186 return g.Windows.index_from_ptr(g.Windows.find(window));
7187}
7188
7189// Moving window to front of display and set focus (which happens to be back of our sorted list)
7190void ImGui::FocusWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
7191{
7192 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7193
7194 if (g.NavWindow != window)
7195 {
7196 g.NavWindow = window;
7197 if (window && g.NavDisableMouseHover)
7198 g.NavMousePosDirty = true;
7199 g.NavId = window ? window->NavLastIds[0] : 0; // Restore NavId
7200 g.NavFocusScopeId = 0;
7201 g.NavIdIsAlive = false;
7202 g.NavLayer = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
7203 g.NavInitRequest = g.NavMoveSubmitted = g.NavMoveScoringItems = false;
7204 NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
7205 //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("FocusWindow(\"%s\")\n", window ? window->Name : NULL);
7206 }
7207
7208 // Close popups if any
7209 ClosePopupsOverWindow(window, false);
7210
7211 // Move the root window to the top of the pile
7212 IM_ASSERT(window == NULL || window->RootWindowDockTree != NULL);
7213 ImGuiWindow* focus_front_window = window ? window->RootWindow : NULL;
7214 ImGuiWindow* display_front_window = window ? window->RootWindowDockTree : NULL;
7215 ImGuiDockNode* dock_node = window ? window->DockNode : NULL;
7216 bool active_id_window_is_dock_node_host = (g.ActiveIdWindow && dock_node && dock_node->HostWindow == g.ActiveIdWindow);
7217
7218 // Steal active widgets. Some of the cases it triggers includes:
7219 // - Focus a window while an InputText in another window is active, if focus happens before the old InputText can run.
7220 // - When using Nav to activate menu items (due to timing of activating on press->new window appears->losing ActiveId)
7221 // - Using dock host items (tab, collapse button) can trigger this before we redirect the ActiveIdWindow toward the child window.
7222 if (g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveIdWindow && g.ActiveIdWindow->RootWindow != focus_front_window)
7223 if (!g.ActiveIdNoClearOnFocusLoss && !active_id_window_is_dock_node_host)
7224 ClearActiveID();
7225
7226 // Passing NULL allow to disable keyboard focus
7227 if (!window)
7228 return;
7229 window->LastFrameJustFocused = g.FrameCount;
7230
7231 // Select in dock node
7232 if (dock_node && dock_node->TabBar)
7233 dock_node->TabBar->SelectedTabId = dock_node->TabBar->NextSelectedTabId = window->ID;
7234
7235 // Bring to front
7236 BringWindowToFocusFront(focus_front_window);
7237 if (((window->Flags | focus_front_window->Flags | display_front_window->Flags) & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus) == 0)
7238 BringWindowToDisplayFront(display_front_window);
7239}
7240
7241void ImGui::FocusTopMostWindowUnderOne(ImGuiWindow* under_this_window, ImGuiWindow* ignore_window)
7242{
7243 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7244 int start_idx = g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1;
7245 if (under_this_window != NULL)
7246 {
7247 // Aim at root window behind us, if we are in a child window that's our own root (see #4640)
7248 int offset = -1;
7249 while (under_this_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
7250 {
7251 under_this_window = under_this_window->ParentWindow;
7252 offset = 0;
7253 }
7254 start_idx = FindWindowFocusIndex(under_this_window) + offset;
7255 }
7256 for (int i = start_idx; i >= 0; i--)
7257 {
7258 // We may later decide to test for different NoXXXInputs based on the active navigation input (mouse vs nav) but that may feel more confusing to the user.
7259 ImGuiWindow* window = g.WindowsFocusOrder[i];
7260 IM_ASSERT(window == window->RootWindow);
7261 if (window != ignore_window && window->WasActive)
7262 if ((window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs)) != (ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
7263 {
7264 // FIXME-DOCK: This is failing (lagging by one frame) for docked windows.
7265 // If A and B are docked into window and B disappear, at the NewFrame() call site window->NavLastChildNavWindow will still point to B.
7266 // We might leverage the tab order implicitly stored in window->DockNodeAsHost->TabBar (essentially the 'most_recently_selected_tab' code in tab bar will do that but on next update)
7267 // to tell which is the "previous" window. Or we may leverage 'LastFrameFocused/LastFrameJustFocused' and have this function handle child window itself?
7268 ImGuiWindow* focus_window = NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(window);
7269 FocusWindow(focus_window);
7270 return;
7271 }
7272 }
7273 FocusWindow(NULL);
7274}
7275
7276// Important: this alone doesn't alter current ImDrawList state. This is called by PushFont/PopFont only.
7277void ImGui::SetCurrentFont(ImFont* font)
7278{
7279 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7280 IM_ASSERT(font && font->IsLoaded()); // Font Atlas not created. Did you call io.Fonts->GetTexDataAsRGBA32 / GetTexDataAsAlpha8 ?
7281 IM_ASSERT(font->Scale > 0.0f);
7282 g.Font = font;
7283 g.FontBaseSize = ImMax(1.0f, g.IO.FontGlobalScale * g.Font->FontSize * g.Font->Scale);
7284 g.FontSize = g.CurrentWindow ? g.CurrentWindow->CalcFontSize() : 0.0f;
7285
7286 ImFontAtlas* atlas = g.Font->ContainerAtlas;
7287 g.DrawListSharedData.TexUvWhitePixel = atlas->TexUvWhitePixel;
7288 g.DrawListSharedData.TexUvLines = atlas->TexUvLines;
7289 g.DrawListSharedData.Font = g.Font;
7290 g.DrawListSharedData.FontSize = g.FontSize;
7291}
7292
7293void ImGui::PushFont(ImFont* font)
7294{
7295 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7296 if (!font)
7297 font = GetDefaultFont();
7298 SetCurrentFont(font);
7299 g.FontStack.push_back(font);
7300 g.CurrentWindow->DrawList->PushTextureID(font->ContainerAtlas->TexID);
7301}
7302
7303void ImGui::PopFont()
7304{
7305 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7306 g.CurrentWindow->DrawList->PopTextureID();
7307 g.FontStack.pop_back();
7308 SetCurrentFont(g.FontStack.empty() ? GetDefaultFont() : g.FontStack.back());
7309}
7310
7311void ImGui::PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags option, bool enabled)
7312{
7313 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7314 ImGuiItemFlags item_flags = g.CurrentItemFlags;
7315 IM_ASSERT(item_flags == g.ItemFlagsStack.back());
7316 if (enabled)
7317 item_flags |= option;
7318 else
7319 item_flags &= ~option;
7320 g.CurrentItemFlags = item_flags;
7321 g.ItemFlagsStack.push_back(item_flags);
7322}
7323
7324void ImGui::PopItemFlag()
7325{
7326 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7327 IM_ASSERT(g.ItemFlagsStack.Size > 1); // Too many calls to PopItemFlag() - we always leave a 0 at the bottom of the stack.
7328 g.ItemFlagsStack.pop_back();
7329 g.CurrentItemFlags = g.ItemFlagsStack.back();
7330}
7331
7332// BeginDisabled()/EndDisabled()
7333// - Those can be nested but it cannot be used to enable an already disabled section (a single BeginDisabled(true) in the stack is enough to keep everything disabled)
7334// - Visually this is currently altering alpha, but it is expected that in a future styling system this would work differently.
7335// - Feedback welcome at https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/211
7336// - BeginDisabled(false) essentially does nothing useful but is provided to facilitate use of boolean expressions. If you can avoid calling BeginDisabled(False)/EndDisabled() best to avoid it.
7337// - Optimized shortcuts instead of PushStyleVar() + PushItemFlag()
7338void ImGui::BeginDisabled(bool disabled)
7339{
7340 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7341 bool was_disabled = (g.CurrentItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled) != 0;
7342 if (!was_disabled && disabled)
7343 {
7344 g.DisabledAlphaBackup = g.Style.Alpha;
7345 g.Style.Alpha *= g.Style.DisabledAlpha; // PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_Alpha, g.Style.Alpha * g.Style.DisabledAlpha);
7346 }
7347 if (was_disabled || disabled)
7348 g.CurrentItemFlags |= ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled;
7349 g.ItemFlagsStack.push_back(g.CurrentItemFlags);
7350 g.DisabledStackSize++;
7351}
7352
7353void ImGui::EndDisabled()
7354{
7355 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7356 IM_ASSERT(g.DisabledStackSize > 0);
7357 g.DisabledStackSize--;
7358 bool was_disabled = (g.CurrentItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled) != 0;
7359 //PopItemFlag();
7360 g.ItemFlagsStack.pop_back();
7361 g.CurrentItemFlags = g.ItemFlagsStack.back();
7362 if (was_disabled && (g.CurrentItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled) == 0)
7363 g.Style.Alpha = g.DisabledAlphaBackup; //PopStyleVar();
7364}
7365
7366// FIXME: Look into renaming this once we have settled the new Focus/Activation/TabStop system.
7367void ImGui::PushAllowKeyboardFocus(bool allow_keyboard_focus)
7368{
7369 PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoTabStop, !allow_keyboard_focus);
7370}
7371
7372void ImGui::PopAllowKeyboardFocus()
7373{
7374 PopItemFlag();
7375}
7376
7377void ImGui::PushButtonRepeat(bool repeat)
7378{
7379 PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_ButtonRepeat, repeat);
7380}
7381
7382void ImGui::PopButtonRepeat()
7383{
7384 PopItemFlag();
7385}
7386
7387void ImGui::PushTextWrapPos(float wrap_pos_x)
7388{
7389 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7390 window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.push_back(window->DC.TextWrapPos);
7391 window->DC.TextWrapPos = wrap_pos_x;
7392}
7393
7394void ImGui::PopTextWrapPos()
7395{
7396 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7397 window->DC.TextWrapPos = window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.back();
7398 window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.pop_back();
7399}
7400
7401static ImGuiWindow* GetCombinedRootWindow(ImGuiWindow* window, bool popup_hierarchy, bool dock_hierarchy)
7402{
7403 ImGuiWindow* last_window = NULL;
7404 while (last_window != window)
7405 {
7406 last_window = window;
7407 window = window->RootWindow;
7408 if (popup_hierarchy)
7409 window = window->RootWindowPopupTree;
7410 if (dock_hierarchy)
7411 window = window->RootWindowDockTree;
7412 }
7413 return window;
7414}
7415
7416bool ImGui::IsWindowChildOf(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiWindow* potential_parent, bool popup_hierarchy, bool dock_hierarchy)
7417{
7418 ImGuiWindow* window_root = GetCombinedRootWindow(window, popup_hierarchy, dock_hierarchy);
7419 if (window_root == potential_parent)
7420 return true;
7421 while (window != NULL)
7422 {
7423 if (window == potential_parent)
7424 return true;
7425 if (window == window_root) // end of chain
7426 return false;
7427 window = window->ParentWindow;
7428 }
7429 return false;
7430}
7431
7432bool ImGui::IsWindowWithinBeginStackOf(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiWindow* potential_parent)
7433{
7434 if (window->RootWindow == potential_parent)
7435 return true;
7436 while (window != NULL)
7437 {
7438 if (window == potential_parent)
7439 return true;
7440 window = window->ParentWindowInBeginStack;
7441 }
7442 return false;
7443}
7444
7445bool ImGui::IsWindowAbove(ImGuiWindow* potential_above, ImGuiWindow* potential_below)
7446{
7447 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7448
7449 // It would be saner to ensure that display layer is always reflected in the g.Windows[] order, which would likely requires altering all manipulations of that array
7450 const int display_layer_delta = GetWindowDisplayLayer(potential_above) - GetWindowDisplayLayer(potential_below);
7451 if (display_layer_delta != 0)
7452 return display_layer_delta > 0;
7453
7454 for (int i = g.Windows.Size - 1; i >= 0; i--)
7455 {
7456 ImGuiWindow* candidate_window = g.Windows[i];
7457 if (candidate_window == potential_above)
7458 return true;
7459 if (candidate_window == potential_below)
7460 return false;
7461 }
7462 return false;
7463}
7464
7465bool ImGui::IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags flags)
7466{
7467 IM_ASSERT((flags & (ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped | ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenDisabled)) == 0); // Flags not supported by this function
7468 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7469 ImGuiWindow* ref_window = g.HoveredWindow;
7470 ImGuiWindow* cur_window = g.CurrentWindow;
7471 if (ref_window == NULL)
7472 return false;
7473
7474 if ((flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow) == 0)
7475 {
7476 IM_ASSERT(cur_window); // Not inside a Begin()/End()
7477 const bool popup_hierarchy = (flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoPopupHierarchy) == 0;
7478 const bool dock_hierarchy = (flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_DockHierarchy) != 0;
7479 if (flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow)
7480 cur_window = GetCombinedRootWindow(cur_window, popup_hierarchy, dock_hierarchy);
7481
7482 bool result;
7483 if (flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows)
7484 result = IsWindowChildOf(ref_window, cur_window, popup_hierarchy, dock_hierarchy);
7485 else
7486 result = (ref_window == cur_window);
7487 if (!result)
7488 return false;
7489 }
7490
7491 if (!IsWindowContentHoverable(ref_window, flags))
7492 return false;
7493 if (!(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem))
7494 if (g.ActiveId != 0 && !g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap && g.ActiveId != ref_window->MoveId)
7495 return false;
7496 return true;
7497}
7498
7499bool ImGui::IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags flags)
7500{
7501 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7502 ImGuiWindow* ref_window = g.NavWindow;
7503 ImGuiWindow* cur_window = g.CurrentWindow;
7504
7505 if (ref_window == NULL)
7506 return false;
7507 if (flags & ImGuiFocusedFlags_AnyWindow)
7508 return true;
7509
7510 IM_ASSERT(cur_window); // Not inside a Begin()/End()
7511 const bool popup_hierarchy = (flags & ImGuiFocusedFlags_NoPopupHierarchy) == 0;
7512 const bool dock_hierarchy = (flags & ImGuiFocusedFlags_DockHierarchy) != 0;
7513 if (flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow)
7514 cur_window = GetCombinedRootWindow(cur_window, popup_hierarchy, dock_hierarchy);
7515
7516 if (flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows)
7517 return IsWindowChildOf(ref_window, cur_window, popup_hierarchy, dock_hierarchy);
7518 else
7519 return (ref_window == cur_window);
7520}
7521
7522ImGuiID ImGui::GetWindowDockID()
7523{
7524 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7525 return g.CurrentWindow->DockId;
7526}
7527
7528bool ImGui::IsWindowDocked()
7529{
7530 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7531 return g.CurrentWindow->DockIsActive;
7532}
7533
7534// Can we focus this window with CTRL+TAB (or PadMenu + PadFocusPrev/PadFocusNext)
7535// Note that NoNavFocus makes the window not reachable with CTRL+TAB but it can still be focused with mouse or programmatically.
7536// If you want a window to never be focused, you may use the e.g. NoInputs flag.
7537bool ImGui::IsWindowNavFocusable(ImGuiWindow* window)
7538{
7539 return window->WasActive && window == window->RootWindow && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus);
7540}
7541
7542float ImGui::GetWindowWidth()
7543{
7544 ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7545 return window->Size.x;
7546}
7547
7548float ImGui::GetWindowHeight()
7549{
7550 ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7551 return window->Size.y;
7552}
7553
7554ImVec2 ImGui::GetWindowPos()
7555{
7556 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7557 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7558 return window->Pos;
7559}
7560
7561void ImGui::SetWindowPos(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& pos, ImGuiCond cond)
7562{
7563 // Test condition (NB: bit 0 is always true) and clear flags for next time
7564 if (cond && (window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags & cond) == 0)
7565 return;
7566
7567 IM_ASSERT(cond == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(cond)); // Make sure the user doesn't attempt to combine multiple condition flags.
7568 window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags &= ~(ImGuiCond_Once | ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver | ImGuiCond_Appearing);
7569 window->SetWindowPosVal = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
7570
7571 // Set
7572 const ImVec2 old_pos = window->Pos;
7573 window->Pos = ImFloor(pos);
7574 ImVec2 offset = window->Pos - old_pos;
7575 window->DC.CursorPos += offset; // As we happen to move the window while it is being appended to (which is a bad idea - will smear) let's at least offset the cursor
7576 window->DC.CursorMaxPos += offset; // And more importantly we need to offset CursorMaxPos/CursorStartPos this so ContentSize calculation doesn't get affected.
7577 window->DC.IdealMaxPos += offset;
7578 window->DC.CursorStartPos += offset;
7579}
7580
7581void ImGui::SetWindowPos(const ImVec2& pos, ImGuiCond cond)
7582{
7583 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
7584 SetWindowPos(window, pos, cond);
7585}
7586
7587void ImGui::SetWindowPos(const char* name, const ImVec2& pos, ImGuiCond cond)
7588{
7589 if (ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByName(name))
7590 SetWindowPos(window, pos, cond);
7591}
7592
7593ImVec2 ImGui::GetWindowSize()
7594{
7595 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
7596 return window->Size;
7597}
7598
7599void ImGui::SetWindowSize(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiCond cond)
7600{
7601 // Test condition (NB: bit 0 is always true) and clear flags for next time
7602 if (cond && (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags & cond) == 0)
7603 return;
7604
7605 IM_ASSERT(cond == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(cond)); // Make sure the user doesn't attempt to combine multiple condition flags.
7606 window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags &= ~(ImGuiCond_Once | ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver | ImGuiCond_Appearing);
7607
7608 // Set
7609 if (size.x > 0.0f)
7610 {
7611 window->AutoFitFramesX = 0;
7612 window->SizeFull.x = IM_FLOOR(size.x);
7613 }
7614 else
7615 {
7616 window->AutoFitFramesX = 2;
7617 window->AutoFitOnlyGrows = false;
7618 }
7619 if (size.y > 0.0f)
7620 {
7621 window->AutoFitFramesY = 0;
7622 window->SizeFull.y = IM_FLOOR(size.y);
7623 }
7624 else
7625 {
7626 window->AutoFitFramesY = 2;
7627 window->AutoFitOnlyGrows = false;
7628 }
7629}
7630
7631void ImGui::SetWindowSize(const ImVec2& size, ImGuiCond cond)
7632{
7633 SetWindowSize(GImGui->CurrentWindow, size, cond);
7634}
7635
7636void ImGui::SetWindowSize(const char* name, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiCond cond)
7637{
7638 if (ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByName(name))
7639 SetWindowSize(window, size, cond);
7640}
7641
7642void ImGui::SetWindowCollapsed(ImGuiWindow* window, bool collapsed, ImGuiCond cond)
7643{
7644 // Test condition (NB: bit 0 is always true) and clear flags for next time
7645 if (cond && (window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags & cond) == 0)
7646 return;
7647 window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags &= ~(ImGuiCond_Once | ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver | ImGuiCond_Appearing);
7648
7649 // Set
7650 window->Collapsed = collapsed;
7651}
7652
7653void ImGui::SetWindowHitTestHole(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& pos, const ImVec2& size)
7654{
7655 IM_ASSERT(window->HitTestHoleSize.x == 0); // We don't support multiple holes/hit test filters
7656 window->HitTestHoleSize = ImVec2ih(size);
7657 window->HitTestHoleOffset = ImVec2ih(pos - window->Pos);
7658}
7659
7660void ImGui::SetWindowCollapsed(bool collapsed, ImGuiCond cond)
7661{
7662 SetWindowCollapsed(GImGui->CurrentWindow, collapsed, cond);
7663}
7664
7665bool ImGui::IsWindowCollapsed()
7666{
7667 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
7668 return window->Collapsed;
7669}
7670
7671bool ImGui::IsWindowAppearing()
7672{
7673 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
7674 return window->Appearing;
7675}
7676
7677void ImGui::SetWindowCollapsed(const char* name, bool collapsed, ImGuiCond cond)
7678{
7679 if (ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByName(name))
7680 SetWindowCollapsed(window, collapsed, cond);
7681}
7682
7683void ImGui::SetWindowFocus()
7684{
7685 FocusWindow(GImGui->CurrentWindow);
7686}
7687
7688void ImGui::SetWindowFocus(const char* name)
7689{
7690 if (name)
7691 {
7692 if (ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByName(name))
7693 FocusWindow(window);
7694 }
7695 else
7696 {
7697 FocusWindow(NULL);
7698 }
7699}
7700
7701void ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(const ImVec2& pos, ImGuiCond cond, const ImVec2& pivot)
7702{
7703 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7704 IM_ASSERT(cond == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(cond)); // Make sure the user doesn't attempt to combine multiple condition flags.
7705 g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasPos;
7706 g.NextWindowData.PosVal = pos;
7707 g.NextWindowData.PosPivotVal = pivot;
7708 g.NextWindowData.PosCond = cond ? cond : ImGuiCond_Always;
7709 g.NextWindowData.PosUndock = true;
7710}
7711
7712void ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(const ImVec2& size, ImGuiCond cond)
7713{
7714 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7715 IM_ASSERT(cond == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(cond)); // Make sure the user doesn't attempt to combine multiple condition flags.
7716 g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSize;
7717 g.NextWindowData.SizeVal = size;
7718 g.NextWindowData.SizeCond = cond ? cond : ImGuiCond_Always;
7719}
7720
7721void ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(const ImVec2& size_min, const ImVec2& size_max, ImGuiSizeCallback custom_callback, void* custom_callback_user_data)
7722{
7723 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7724 g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSizeConstraint;
7725 g.NextWindowData.SizeConstraintRect = ImRect(size_min, size_max);
7726 g.NextWindowData.SizeCallback = custom_callback;
7727 g.NextWindowData.SizeCallbackUserData = custom_callback_user_data;
7728}
7729
7730// Content size = inner scrollable rectangle, padded with WindowPadding.
7731// SetNextWindowContentSize(ImVec2(100,100) + ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize will always allow submitting a 100x100 item.
7732void ImGui::SetNextWindowContentSize(const ImVec2& size)
7733{
7734 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7735 g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasContentSize;
7736 g.NextWindowData.ContentSizeVal = ImFloor(size);
7737}
7738
7739void ImGui::SetNextWindowScroll(const ImVec2& scroll)
7740{
7741 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7742 g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasScroll;
7743 g.NextWindowData.ScrollVal = scroll;
7744}
7745
7746void ImGui::SetNextWindowCollapsed(bool collapsed, ImGuiCond cond)
7747{
7748 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7749 IM_ASSERT(cond == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(cond)); // Make sure the user doesn't attempt to combine multiple condition flags.
7750 g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasCollapsed;
7751 g.NextWindowData.CollapsedVal = collapsed;
7752 g.NextWindowData.CollapsedCond = cond ? cond : ImGuiCond_Always;
7753}
7754
7755void ImGui::SetNextWindowFocus()
7756{
7757 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7758 g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasFocus;
7759}
7760
7761void ImGui::SetNextWindowBgAlpha(float alpha)
7762{
7763 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7764 g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasBgAlpha;
7765 g.NextWindowData.BgAlphaVal = alpha;
7766}
7767
7768void ImGui::SetNextWindowViewport(ImGuiID id)
7769{
7770 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7771 g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasViewport;
7772 g.NextWindowData.ViewportId = id;
7773}
7774
7775void ImGui::SetNextWindowDockID(ImGuiID id, ImGuiCond cond)
7776{
7777 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
