9552ImGuiWindow* ImGui::GetTopMostAndVisiblePopupModal()
9553{
9554 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9555 for (int n = g.OpenPopupStack.Size - 1; n >= 0; n--)
9556 if (ImGuiWindow* popup = g.OpenPopupStack.Data[n].Window)
9557 if ((popup->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal) && IsWindowActiveAndVisible(popup))
9558 return popup;
9559 return NULL;
9560}
9561
9562void ImGui::OpenPopup(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
9563{
9564 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9565 OpenPopupEx(g.CurrentWindow->GetID(str_id), popup_flags);
9566}
9567
9568void ImGui::OpenPopup(ImGuiID id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
9569{
9570 OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
9571}
9572
9573// Mark popup as open (toggle toward open state).
9574// Popups are closed when user click outside, or activate a pressable item, or CloseCurrentPopup() is called within a BeginPopup()/EndPopup() block.
9575// Popup identifiers are relative to the current ID-stack (so OpenPopup and BeginPopup needs to be at the same level).
9576// One open popup per level of the popup hierarchy (NB: when assigning we reset the Window member of ImGuiPopupRef to NULL)
9577void ImGui::OpenPopupEx(ImGuiID id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
9578{
9579 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9580 ImGuiWindow* parent_window = g.CurrentWindow;
9581 const int current_stack_size = g.BeginPopupStack.Size;
9582
9583 if (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverExistingPopup)
9584 if (IsPopupOpen(0u, ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId))
9585 return;
9586
9587 ImGuiPopupData popup_ref; // Tagged as new ref as Window will be set back to NULL if we write this into OpenPopupStack.
9588 popup_ref.PopupId = id;
9589 popup_ref.Window = NULL;
9590 popup_ref.SourceWindow = g.NavWindow;
9591 popup_ref.OpenFrameCount = g.FrameCount;
9592 popup_ref.OpenParentId = parent_window->IDStack.back();
9593 popup_ref.OpenPopupPos = NavCalcPreferredRefPos();
9594 popup_ref.OpenMousePos = IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) ? g.IO.MousePos : popup_ref.OpenPopupPos;
9595
9596 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_POPUP("OpenPopupEx(0x%08X)\n", id);
9597 if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size < current_stack_size + 1)
9598 {
9599 g.OpenPopupStack.push_back(popup_ref);
9600 }
9601 else
9602 {
9603 // Gently handle the user mistakenly calling OpenPopup() every frame. It is a programming mistake! However, if we were to run the regular code path, the ui
9604 // would become completely unusable because the popup will always be in hidden-while-calculating-size state _while_ claiming focus. Which would be a very confusing
9605 // situation for the programmer. Instead, we silently allow the popup to proceed, it will keep reappearing and the programming error will be more obvious to understand.
9606 if (g.OpenPopupStack[current_stack_size].PopupId == id && g.OpenPopupStack[current_stack_size].OpenFrameCount == g.FrameCount - 1)
9607 {
9608 g.OpenPopupStack[current_stack_size].OpenFrameCount = popup_ref.OpenFrameCount;
9609 }
9610 else
9611 {
9612 // Close child popups if any, then flag popup for open/reopen
9613 ClosePopupToLevel(current_stack_size, false);
9614 g.OpenPopupStack.push_back(popup_ref);
9615 }
9616
9617 // When reopening a popup we first refocus its parent, otherwise if its parent is itself a popup it would get closed by ClosePopupsOverWindow().
9618 // This is equivalent to what ClosePopupToLevel() does.
9619 //if (g.OpenPopupStack[current_stack_size].PopupId == id)
9620 // FocusWindow(parent_window);
9621 }
9622}
9623
9624// When popups are stacked, clicking on a lower level popups puts focus back to it and close popups above it.
9625// This function closes any popups that are over 'ref_window'.
9626void ImGui::ClosePopupsOverWindow(ImGuiWindow* ref_window, bool restore_focus_to_window_under_popup)
9627{
9628 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9629 if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size == 0)
9630 return;
9631
9632 // Don't close our own child popup windows.
9633 int popup_count_to_keep = 0;
9634 if (ref_window)
9635 {
9636 // Find the highest popup which is a descendant of the reference window (generally reference window = NavWindow)
9637 for (; popup_count_to_keep < g.OpenPopupStack.Size; popup_count_to_keep++)
9638 {
9639 ImGuiPopupData& popup = g.OpenPopupStack[popup_count_to_keep];
9640 if (!popup.Window)
9641 continue;
9642 IM_ASSERT((popup.Window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) != 0);
9643 if (popup.Window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
9644 continue;
9645
9646 // Trim the stack unless the popup is a direct parent of the reference window (the reference window is often the NavWindow)
9647 // - With this stack of window, clicking/focusing Popup1 will close Popup2 and Popup3:
9648 // Window -> Popup1 -> Popup2 -> Popup3
9649 // - Each popups may contain child windows, which is why we compare ->RootWindowDockTree!
9650 // Window -> Popup1 -> Popup1_Child -> Popup2 -> Popup2_Child
9651 bool ref_window_is_descendent_of_popup = false;
9652 for (int n = popup_count_to_keep; n < g.OpenPopupStack.Size; n++)
9653 if (ImGuiWindow* popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack[n].Window)
9654 //if (popup_window->RootWindowDockTree == ref_window->RootWindowDockTree) // FIXME-MERGE
9655 if (IsWindowWithinBeginStackOf(ref_window, popup_window))
9656 {
9657 ref_window_is_descendent_of_popup = true;
9658 break;
9659 }
9660 if (!ref_window_is_descendent_of_popup)
9661 break;
9662 }
9663 }
9664 if (popup_count_to_keep < g.OpenPopupStack.Size) // This test is not required but it allows to set a convenient breakpoint on the statement below
9665 {
9666 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_POPUP("ClosePopupsOverWindow(\"%s\") -> ClosePopupToLevel(%d)\n", ref_window->Name, popup_count_to_keep);
9667 ClosePopupToLevel(popup_count_to_keep, restore_focus_to_window_under_popup);
9668 }
9669}
9670
9671void ImGui::ClosePopupsExceptModals()
9672{
9673 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9674
9675 int popup_count_to_keep;
9676 for (popup_count_to_keep = g.OpenPopupStack.Size; popup_count_to_keep > 0; popup_count_to_keep--)
9677 {
9678 ImGuiWindow* window = g.OpenPopupStack[popup_count_to_keep - 1].Window;
9679 if (!window || window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)
9680 break;
9681 }
9682 if (popup_count_to_keep < g.OpenPopupStack.Size) // This test is not required but it allows to set a convenient breakpoint on the statement below
9683 ClosePopupToLevel(popup_count_to_keep, true);
9684}
9685
9686void ImGui::ClosePopupToLevel(int remaining, bool restore_focus_to_window_under_popup)
9687{
9688 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9689 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_POPUP("ClosePopupToLevel(%d), restore_focus_to_window_under_popup=%d\n", remaining, restore_focus_to_window_under_popup);
9690 IM_ASSERT(remaining >= 0 && remaining < g.OpenPopupStack.Size);
9691
9692 // Trim open popup stack
9693 ImGuiWindow* focus_window = g.OpenPopupStack[remaining].SourceWindow;
9694 ImGuiWindow* popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack[remaining].Window;
9695 g.OpenPopupStack.resize(remaining);
9696
9697 if (restore_focus_to_window_under_popup)
9698 {
9699 if (focus_window && !focus_window->WasActive && popup_window)
9700 {
9701 // Fallback
9702 FocusTopMostWindowUnderOne(popup_window, NULL);
9703 }
9704 else
9705 {
9706 if (g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main && focus_window)
9707 focus_window = NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(focus_window);
9708 FocusWindow(focus_window);
9709 }
9710 }
9711}
9712
9713// Close the popup we have begin-ed into.
9714void ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup()
9715{
9716 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9717 int popup_idx = g.BeginPopupStack.Size - 1;
9718 if (popup_idx < 0 || popup_idx >= g.OpenPopupStack.Size || g.BeginPopupStack[popup_idx].PopupId != g.OpenPopupStack[popup_idx].PopupId)
9719 return;
9720
9721 // Closing a menu closes its top-most parent popup (unless a modal)
9722 while (popup_idx > 0)
9723 {
9724 ImGuiWindow* popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack[popup_idx].Window;
9725 ImGuiWindow* parent_popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack[popup_idx - 1].Window;
9726 bool close_parent = false;
9727 if (popup_window && (popup_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
9728 if (parent_popup_window && !(parent_popup_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar))
9729 close_parent = true;
9730 if (!close_parent)
9731 break;
9732 popup_idx--;
9733 }
9734 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_POPUP("CloseCurrentPopup %d -> %d\n", g.BeginPopupStack.Size - 1, popup_idx);
9735 ClosePopupToLevel(popup_idx, true);
9736
9737 // A common pattern is to close a popup when selecting a menu item/selectable that will open another window.
9738 // To improve this usage pattern, we avoid nav highlight for a single frame in the parent window.
9739 // Similarly, we could avoid mouse hover highlight in this window but it is less visually problematic.
9740 if (ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow)
9741 window->DC.NavHideHighlightOneFrame = true;
9742}
9743
9744// Attention! BeginPopup() adds default flags which BeginPopupEx()!
9745bool ImGui::BeginPopupEx(ImGuiID id, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
9746{
9747 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9748 if (!IsPopupOpen(id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None))
9749 {
9750 g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
9751 return false;
9752 }
9753
9754 char name[20];
9755 if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)
9756 ImFormatString(name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name), "##Menu_%02d", g.BeginMenuCount); // Recycle windows based on depth
9757 else
9758 ImFormatString(name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name), "##Popup_%08x", id); // Not recycling, so we can close/open during the same frame
9759
9760 flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking;
9761 bool is_open = Begin(name, NULL, flags);
9762 if (!is_open) // NB: Begin can return false when the popup is completely clipped (e.g. zero size display)
9763 EndPopup();
9764
9765 return is_open;
9766}
9767
9768bool ImGui::BeginPopup(const char* str_id, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
9769{
9770 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9771 if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size <= g.BeginPopupStack.Size) // Early out for performance
9772 {
9773 g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
9774 return false;
9775 }
9776 flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings;
9777 return BeginPopupEx(g.CurrentWindow->GetID(str_id), flags);
9778}
9779
9780// If 'p_open' is specified for a modal popup window, the popup will have a regular close button which will close the popup.
9781// Note that popup visibility status is owned by Dear ImGui (and manipulated with e.g. OpenPopup) so the actual value of *p_open is meaningless here.
9782bool ImGui::BeginPopupModal(const char* name, bool* p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
9783{
9784 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9785 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9786 const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(name);
9787 if (!IsPopupOpen(id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None))
9788 {
9789 g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
9790 return false;
9791 }
9792
9793 // Center modal windows by default for increased visibility
9794 // (this won't really last as settings will kick in, and is mostly for backward compatibility. user may do the same themselves)
9795 // FIXME: Should test for (PosCond & window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags) with the upcoming window.
9796 if ((g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasPos) == 0)
9797 {
9798 const ImGuiViewport* viewport = window->WasActive ? window->Viewport : GetMainViewport(); // FIXME-VIEWPORT: What may be our reference viewport?
9799 SetNextWindowPos(viewport->GetCenter(), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
9800 }
9801
9802 flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking;
9803 const bool is_open = Begin(name, p_open, flags);
9804 if (!is_open || (p_open && !*p_open)) // NB: is_open can be 'false' when the popup is completely clipped (e.g. zero size display)
9805 {
9806 EndPopup();
9807 if (is_open)
9808 ClosePopupToLevel(g.BeginPopupStack.Size, true);
9809 return false;
9810 }
9811 return is_open;
9812}
9813
9814void ImGui::EndPopup()
9815{
9816 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9817 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9818 IM_ASSERT(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup); // Mismatched BeginPopup()/EndPopup() calls
9819 IM_ASSERT(g.BeginPopupStack.Size > 0);
9820
9821 // Make all menus and popups wrap around for now, may need to expose that policy (e.g. focus scope could include wrap/loop policy flags used by new move requests)
9822 if (g.NavWindow == window)
9823 NavMoveRequestTryWrapping(window, ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopY);
9824
9825 // Child-popups don't need to be laid out
9826 IM_ASSERT(g.WithinEndChild == false);
9827 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
9828 g.WithinEndChild = true;
9829 End();
9830 g.WithinEndChild = false;
9831}
9832
9833// Helper to open a popup if mouse button is released over the item
9834// - This is essentially the same as BeginPopupContextItem() but without the trailing BeginPopup()
9835void ImGui::OpenPopupOnItemClick(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
9836{
9837 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9838 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9839 int mouse_button = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_);
9840 if (IsMouseReleased(mouse_button) && IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup))
9841 {
9842 ImGuiID id = str_id ? window->GetID(str_id) : g.LastItemData.ID; // If user hasn't passed an ID, we can use the LastItemID. Using LastItemID as a Popup ID won't conflict!
9843 IM_ASSERT(id != 0); // You cannot pass a NULL str_id if the last item has no identifier (e.g. a Text() item)
9844 OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
9845 }
9846}
9847
9848// This is a helper to handle the simplest case of associating one named popup to one given widget.
9849// - To create a popup associated to the last item, you generally want to pass a NULL value to str_id.
9850// - To create a popup with a specific identifier, pass it in str_id.
9851// - This is useful when using using BeginPopupContextItem() on an item which doesn't have an identifier, e.g. a Text() call.
9852// - This is useful when multiple code locations may want to manipulate/open the same popup, given an explicit id.
9853// - You may want to handle the whole on user side if you have specific needs (e.g. tweaking IsItemHovered() parameters).
9854// This is essentially the same as:
9855// id = str_id ? GetID(str_id) : GetItemID();
9856// OpenPopupOnItemClick(str_id);
9857// return BeginPopup(id);
9858// Which is essentially the same as:
9859// id = str_id ? GetID(str_id) : GetItemID();
9860// if (IsItemHovered() && IsMouseReleased(ImGuiMouseButton_Right))
9861// OpenPopup(id);
9862// return BeginPopup(id);
9863// The main difference being that this is tweaked to avoid computing the ID twice.
9864bool ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
9865{
9866 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9867 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9868 if (window->SkipItems)
9869 return false;
9870 ImGuiID id = str_id ? window->GetID(str_id) : g.LastItemData.ID; // If user hasn't passed an ID, we can use the LastItemID. Using LastItemID as a Popup ID won't conflict!
9871 IM_ASSERT(id != 0); // You cannot pass a NULL str_id if the last item has no identifier (e.g. a Text() item)
9872 int mouse_button = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_);
9873 if (IsMouseReleased(mouse_button) && IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup))
9874 OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
9875 return BeginPopupEx(id, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings);
9876}
9877
9878bool ImGui::BeginPopupContextWindow(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
9879{
9880 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9881 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9882 if (!str_id)
9883 str_id = "window_context";
9884 ImGuiID id = window->GetID(str_id);
9885 int mouse_button = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_);
9886 if (IsMouseReleased(mouse_button) && IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup))
9887 if (!(popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverItems) || !IsAnyItemHovered())
9888 OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
9889 return BeginPopupEx(id, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings);
9890}
9891
9892bool ImGui::BeginPopupContextVoid(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
9893{
9894 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9895 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9896 if (!str_id)
9897 str_id = "void_context";
9898 ImGuiID id = window->GetID(str_id);
9899 int mouse_button = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_);
9900 if (IsMouseReleased(mouse_button) && !IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow))
9901 if (GetTopMostPopupModal() == NULL)
9902 OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
9903 return BeginPopupEx(id, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings);
9904}
9905
9906// r_avoid = the rectangle to avoid (e.g. for tooltip it is a rectangle around the mouse cursor which we want to avoid. for popups it's a small point around the cursor.)
9907// r_outer = the visible area rectangle, minus safe area padding. If our popup size won't fit because of safe area padding we ignore it.
9908// (r_outer is usually equivalent to the viewport rectangle minus padding, but when multi-viewports are enabled and monitor
9909// information are available, it may represent the entire platform monitor from the frame of reference of the current viewport.
9910// this allows us to have tooltips/popups displayed out of the parent viewport.)
9911ImVec2 ImGui::FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(const ImVec2& ref_pos, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiDir* last_dir, const ImRect& r_outer, const ImRect& r_avoid, ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy policy)
9912{
9913 ImVec2 base_pos_clamped = ImClamp(ref_pos, r_outer.Min, r_outer.Max - size);
9914 //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(r_avoid.Min, r_avoid.Max, IM_COL32(255,0,0,255));
9915 //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(r_outer.Min, r_outer.Max, IM_COL32(0,255,0,255));
9916
9917 // Combo Box policy (we want a connecting edge)
9918 if (policy == ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_ComboBox)
9919 {
9920 const ImGuiDir dir_prefered_order[ImGuiDir_COUNT] = { ImGuiDir_Down, ImGuiDir_Right, ImGuiDir_Left, ImGuiDir_Up };
9921 for (int n = (*last_dir != ImGuiDir_None) ? -1 : 0; n < ImGuiDir_COUNT; n++)
9922 {
9923 const ImGuiDir dir = (n == -1) ? *last_dir : dir_prefered_order[n];
9924 if (n != -1 && dir == *last_dir) // Already tried this direction?
9925 continue;
9926 ImVec2 pos;
9927 if (dir == ImGuiDir_Down) pos = ImVec2(r_avoid.Min.x, r_avoid.Max.y); // Below, Toward Right (default)
9928 if (dir == ImGuiDir_Right) pos = ImVec2(r_avoid.Min.x, r_avoid.Min.y - size.y); // Above, Toward Right
9929 if (dir == ImGuiDir_Left) pos = ImVec2(r_avoid.Max.x - size.x, r_avoid.Max.y); // Below, Toward Left
9930 if (dir == ImGuiDir_Up) pos = ImVec2(r_avoid.Max.x - size.x, r_avoid.Min.y - size.y); // Above, Toward Left
9931 if (!r_outer.Contains(ImRect(pos, pos + size)))
9932 continue;
9933 *last_dir = dir;
9934 return pos;
9935 }
9936 }
9937
9938 // Tooltip and Default popup policy
9939 // (Always first try the direction we used on the last frame, if any)
9940 if (policy == ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Tooltip || policy == ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Default)
9941 {
9942 const ImGuiDir dir_prefered_order[ImGuiDir_COUNT] = { ImGuiDir_Right, ImGuiDir_Down, ImGuiDir_Up, ImGuiDir_Left };
9943 for (int n = (*last_dir != ImGuiDir_None) ? -1 : 0; n < ImGuiDir_COUNT; n++)
9944 {
9945 const ImGuiDir dir = (n == -1) ? *last_dir : dir_prefered_order[n];
9946 if (n != -1 && dir == *last_dir) // Already tried this direction?
9947 continue;
9948
9949 const float avail_w = (dir == ImGuiDir_Left ? r_avoid.Min.x : r_outer.Max.x) - (dir == ImGuiDir_Right ? r_avoid.Max.x : r_outer.Min.x);
9950 const float avail_h = (dir == ImGuiDir_Up ? r_avoid.Min.y : r_outer.Max.y) - (dir == ImGuiDir_Down ? r_avoid.Max.y : r_outer.Min.y);
9951
9952 // If there not enough room on one axis, there's no point in positioning on a side on this axis (e.g. when not enough width, use a top/bottom position to maximize available width)
9953 if (avail_w < size.x && (dir == ImGuiDir_Left || dir == ImGuiDir_Right))
9954 continue;
9955 if (avail_h < size.y && (dir == ImGuiDir_Up || dir == ImGuiDir_Down))
9956 continue;
9957
9958 ImVec2 pos;
9959 pos.x = (dir == ImGuiDir_Left) ? r_avoid.Min.x - size.x : (dir == ImGuiDir_Right) ? r_avoid.Max.x : base_pos_clamped.x;
9960 pos.y = (dir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? r_avoid.Min.y - size.y : (dir == ImGuiDir_Down) ? r_avoid.Max.y : base_pos_clamped.y;
9961
9962 // Clamp top-left corner of popup
9963 pos.x = ImMax(pos.x, r_outer.Min.x);
9964 pos.y = ImMax(pos.y, r_outer.Min.y);
9965
9966 *last_dir = dir;
9967 return pos;
9968 }
9969 }
9970
9971 // Fallback when not enough room:
9972 *last_dir = ImGuiDir_None;
9973
9974 // For tooltip we prefer avoiding the cursor at all cost even if it means that part of the tooltip won't be visible.
9975 if (policy == ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Tooltip)
9976 return ref_pos + ImVec2(2, 2);
9977
9978 // Otherwise try to keep within display
9979 ImVec2 pos = ref_pos;
9980 pos.x = ImMax(ImMin(pos.x + size.x, r_outer.Max.x) - size.x, r_outer.Min.x);
9981 pos.y = ImMax(ImMin(pos.y + size.y, r_outer.Max.y) - size.y, r_outer.Min.y);
9982 return pos;
9983}
9984
9985// Note that this is used for popups, which can overlap the non work-area of individual viewports.
9986ImRect ImGui::GetPopupAllowedExtentRect(ImGuiWindow* window)
9987{
9988 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9989 ImRect r_screen;
9990 if (window->ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend >= 0)
9991 {
9992 // Extent with be in the frame of reference of the given viewport (so Min is likely to be negative here)
9993 const ImGuiPlatformMonitor& monitor = g.PlatformIO.Monitors[window->ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend];
9994 r_screen.Min = monitor.WorkPos;
9995 r_screen.Max = monitor.WorkPos + monitor.WorkSize;
9996 }
9997 else
9998 {
9999 // Use the full viewport area (not work area) for popups
10000 r_screen = window->Viewport->GetMainRect();
10001 }
10002 ImVec2 padding = g.Style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding;
10003 r_screen.Expand(ImVec2((r_screen.GetWidth() > padding.x * 2) ? -padding.x : 0.0f, (r_screen.GetHeight() > padding.y * 2) ? -padding.y : 0.0f));
10004 return r_screen;
10005}
10006
10007ImVec2 ImGui::FindBestWindowPosForPopup(ImGuiWindow* window)
10008{
10009 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10010
10011 ImRect r_outer = GetPopupAllowedExtentRect(window);
10012 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)
10013 {
10014 // Child menus typically request _any_ position within the parent menu item, and then we move the new menu outside the parent bounds.
10015 // This is how we end up with child menus appearing (most-commonly) on the right of the parent menu.
10016 ImGuiWindow* parent_window = window->ParentWindow;
10017 float horizontal_overlap = g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x; // We want some overlap to convey the relative depth of each menu (currently the amount of overlap is hard-coded to style.ItemSpacing.x).
10018 ImRect r_avoid;
10019 if (parent_window->DC.MenuBarAppending)
10020 r_avoid = ImRect(-FLT_MAX, parent_window->ClipRect.Min.y, FLT_MAX, parent_window->ClipRect.Max.y); // Avoid parent menu-bar. If we wanted multi-line menu-bar, we may instead want to have the calling window setup e.g. a NextWindowData.PosConstraintAvoidRect field
10021 else
10022 r_avoid = ImRect(parent_window->Pos.x + horizontal_overlap, -FLT_MAX, parent_window->Pos.x + parent_window->Size.x - horizontal_overlap - parent_window->ScrollbarSizes.x, FLT_MAX);
10023 return FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(window->Pos, window->Size, &window->AutoPosLastDirection, r_outer, r_avoid, ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Default);
10024 }
10025 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
10026 {
10027 ImRect r_avoid = ImRect(window->Pos.x - 1, window->Pos.y - 1, window->Pos.x + 1, window->Pos.y + 1);
10028 return FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(window->Pos, window->Size, &window->AutoPosLastDirection, r_outer, r_avoid, ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Default);
10029 }
10030 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)
10031 {
10032 // Position tooltip (always follows mouse)
10033 float sc = g.Style.MouseCursorScale;
10034 ImVec2 ref_pos = NavCalcPreferredRefPos();
10035 ImRect r_avoid;
10036 if (!g.NavDisableHighlight && g.NavDisableMouseHover && !(g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos))
10037 r_avoid = ImRect(ref_pos.x - 16, ref_pos.y - 8, ref_pos.x + 16, ref_pos.y + 8);
10038 else
10039 r_avoid = ImRect(ref_pos.x - 16, ref_pos.y - 8, ref_pos.x + 24 * sc, ref_pos.y + 24 * sc); // FIXME: Hard-coded based on mouse cursor shape expectation. Exact dimension not very important.
10040 return FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(ref_pos, window->Size, &window->AutoPosLastDirection, r_outer, r_avoid, ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Tooltip);
10041 }
10042 IM_ASSERT(0);
10043 return window->Pos;
10044}
10045
10046//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10047// [SECTION] KEYBOARD/GAMEPAD NAVIGATION
10048//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10049
10050// FIXME-NAV: The existence of SetNavID vs SetFocusID properly needs to be clarified/reworked.
10051// In our terminology those should be interchangeable. Those two functions are merely a legacy artifact, so at minimum naming should be clarified.
10052void ImGui::SetNavID(ImGuiID id, ImGuiNavLayer nav_layer, ImGuiID focus_scope_id, const ImRect& rect_rel)
10053{
10054 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10055 IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindow != NULL);
10056 IM_ASSERT(nav_layer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main || nav_layer == ImGuiNavLayer_Menu);
10057 g.NavId = id;
10058 g.NavLayer = nav_layer;
10059 g.NavFocusScopeId = focus_scope_id;
10060 g.NavWindow->NavLastIds[nav_layer] = id;
10061 g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[nav_layer] = rect_rel;
10062}
10063
10064void ImGui::SetFocusID(ImGuiID id, ImGuiWindow* window)
10065{
10066 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10067 IM_ASSERT(id != 0);
10068
10069 // Assume that SetFocusID() is called in the context where its window->DC.NavLayerCurrent and window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent are valid.
10070 // Note that window may be != g.CurrentWindow (e.g. SetFocusID call in InputTextEx for multi-line text)
10071 const ImGuiNavLayer nav_layer = window->DC.NavLayerCurrent;
10072 if (g.NavWindow != window)
10073 g.NavInitRequest = false;
10074 g.NavWindow = window;
10075 g.NavId = id;
10076 g.NavLayer = nav_layer;
10077 g.NavFocusScopeId = window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent;
10078 window->NavLastIds[nav_layer] = id;
10079 if (g.LastItemData.ID == id)
10080 window->NavRectRel[nav_layer] = WindowRectAbsToRel(window, g.LastItemData.NavRect);
10081
10082 if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Nav)
10083 g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
10084 else
10085 g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
10086}
10087
10088ImGuiDir ImGetDirQuadrantFromDelta(float dx, float dy)
10089{
10090 if (ImFabs(dx) > ImFabs(dy))
10091 return (dx > 0.0f) ? ImGuiDir_Right : ImGuiDir_Left;
10092 return (dy > 0.0f) ? ImGuiDir_Down : ImGuiDir_Up;
10093}
10094
10095static float inline NavScoreItemDistInterval(float a0, float a1, float b0, float b1)
10096{
10097 if (a1 < b0)
10098 return a1 - b0;
10099 if (b1 < a0)
10100 return a0 - b1;
10101 return 0.0f;
10102}
10103
10104static void inline NavClampRectToVisibleAreaForMoveDir(ImGuiDir move_dir, ImRect& r, const ImRect& clip_rect)
10105{
10106 if (move_dir == ImGuiDir_Left || move_dir == ImGuiDir_Right)
10107 {
10108 r.Min.y = ImClamp(r.Min.y, clip_rect.Min.y, clip_rect.Max.y);
10109 r.Max.y = ImClamp(r.Max.y, clip_rect.Min.y, clip_rect.Max.y);
10110 }
10111 else // FIXME: PageUp/PageDown are leaving move_dir == None
10112 {
10113 r.Min.x = ImClamp(r.Min.x, clip_rect.Min.x, clip_rect.Max.x);
10114 r.Max.x = ImClamp(r.Max.x, clip_rect.Min.x, clip_rect.Max.x);
10115 }
10116}
10117
10118// Scoring function for gamepad/keyboard directional navigation. Based on https://gist.github.com/rygorous/6981057
10119static bool ImGui::NavScoreItem(ImGuiNavItemData* result)
10120{
10121 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10122 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10123 if (g.NavLayer != window->DC.NavLayerCurrent)
10124 return false;
10125
10126 // FIXME: Those are not good variables names
10127 ImRect cand = g.LastItemData.NavRect; // Current item nav rectangle
10128 const ImRect curr = g.NavScoringRect; // Current modified source rect (NB: we've applied Max.x = Min.x in NavUpdate() to inhibit the effect of having varied item width)
10129 g.NavScoringDebugCount++;
10130
10131 // When entering through a NavFlattened border, we consider child window items as fully clipped for scoring
10132 if (window->ParentWindow == g.NavWindow)
10133 {
10134 IM_ASSERT((window->Flags | g.NavWindow->Flags) & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened);
10135 if (!window->ClipRect.Overlaps(cand))
10136 return false;
10137 cand.ClipWithFull(window->ClipRect); // This allows the scored item to not overlap other candidates in the parent window
10138 }
10139
10140 // We perform scoring on items bounding box clipped by the current clipping rectangle on the other axis (clipping on our movement axis would give us equal scores for all clipped items)
10141 // For example, this ensure that items in one column are not reached when moving vertically from items in another column.
10142 NavClampRectToVisibleAreaForMoveDir(g.NavMoveClipDir, cand, window->ClipRect);
10143
10144 // Compute distance between boxes
10145 // FIXME-NAV: Introducing biases for vertical navigation, needs to be removed.
10146 float dbx = NavScoreItemDistInterval(cand.Min.x, cand.Max.x, curr.Min.x, curr.Max.x);
10147 float dby = NavScoreItemDistInterval(ImLerp(cand.Min.y, cand.Max.y, 0.2f), ImLerp(cand.Min.y, cand.Max.y, 0.8f), ImLerp(curr.Min.y, curr.Max.y, 0.2f), ImLerp(curr.Min.y, curr.Max.y, 0.8f)); // Scale down on Y to keep using box-distance for vertically touching items
10148 if (dby != 0.0f && dbx != 0.0f)
10149 dbx = (dbx / 1000.0f) + ((dbx > 0.0f) ? +1.0f : -1.0f);
10150 float dist_box = ImFabs(dbx) + ImFabs(dby);
10151
10152 // Compute distance between centers (this is off by a factor of 2, but we only compare center distances with each other so it doesn't matter)
10153 float dcx = (cand.Min.x + cand.Max.x) - (curr.Min.x + curr.Max.x);
10154 float dcy = (cand.Min.y + cand.Max.y) - (curr.Min.y + curr.Max.y);
10155 float dist_center = ImFabs(dcx) + ImFabs(dcy); // L1 metric (need this for our connectedness guarantee)
10156
10157 // Determine which quadrant of 'curr' our candidate item 'cand' lies in based on distance
10158 ImGuiDir quadrant;
10159 float dax = 0.0f, day = 0.0f, dist_axial = 0.0f;
10160 if (dbx != 0.0f || dby != 0.0f)
10161 {
10162 // For non-overlapping boxes, use distance between boxes
10163 dax = dbx;
10164 day = dby;
10165 dist_axial = dist_box;
10166 quadrant = ImGetDirQuadrantFromDelta(dbx, dby);
10167 }
10168 else if (dcx != 0.0f || dcy != 0.0f)
10169 {
10170 // For overlapping boxes with different centers, use distance between centers
10171 dax = dcx;
10172 day = dcy;
10173 dist_axial = dist_center;
10174 quadrant = ImGetDirQuadrantFromDelta(dcx, dcy);
10175 }
10176 else
10177 {
10178 // Degenerate case: two overlapping buttons with same center, break ties arbitrarily (note that LastItemId here is really the _previous_ item order, but it doesn't matter)
10179 quadrant = (g.LastItemData.ID < g.NavId) ? ImGuiDir_Left : ImGuiDir_Right;
10180 }
10181
10182#if IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_SCORING
10183 char buf[128];
10184 if (IsMouseHoveringRect(cand.Min, cand.Max))
10185 {
10186 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "dbox (%.2f,%.2f->%.4f)\ndcen (%.2f,%.2f->%.4f)\nd (%.2f,%.2f->%.4f)\nnav %c, quadrant %c", dbx, dby, dist_box, dcx, dcy, dist_center, dax, day, dist_axial, "WENS"[g.NavMoveDir], "WENS"[quadrant]);
10187 ImDrawList* draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(window);
10188 draw_list->AddRect(curr.Min, curr.Max, IM_COL32(255,200,0,100));
10189 draw_list->AddRect(cand.Min, cand.Max, IM_COL32(255,255,0,200));
10190 draw_list->AddRectFilled(cand.Max - ImVec2(4, 4), cand.Max + CalcTextSize(buf) + ImVec2(4, 4), IM_COL32(40,0,0,150));
10191 draw_list->AddText(cand.Max, ~0U, buf);
10192 }
10193 else if (g.IO.KeyCtrl) // Hold to preview score in matching quadrant. Press C to rotate.
10194 {
10195 if (quadrant == g.NavMoveDir)
10196 {
10197 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "%.0f/%.0f", dist_box, dist_center);
10198 ImDrawList* draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(window);
10199 draw_list->AddRectFilled(cand.Min, cand.Max, IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 200));
10200 draw_list->AddText(cand.Min, IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 255), buf);
10201 }
10202 }
10203#endif
10204
10205 // Is it in the quadrant we're interesting in moving to?
10206 bool new_best = false;
10207 const ImGuiDir move_dir = g.NavMoveDir;
10208 if (quadrant == move_dir)
10209 {
10210 // Does it beat the current best candidate?
10211 if (dist_box < result->DistBox)
10212 {
10213 result->DistBox = dist_box;
10214 result->DistCenter = dist_center;
10215 return true;
10216 }
10217 if (dist_box == result->DistBox)
10218 {
10219 // Try using distance between center points to break ties
10220 if (dist_center < result->DistCenter)
10221 {
10222 result->DistCenter = dist_center;
10223 new_best = true;
10224 }
10225 else if (dist_center == result->DistCenter)
10226 {
10227 // Still tied! we need to be extra-careful to make sure everything gets linked properly. We consistently break ties by symbolically moving "later" items
10228 // (with higher index) to the right/downwards by an infinitesimal amount since we the current "best" button already (so it must have a lower index),
10229 // this is fairly easy. This rule ensures that all buttons with dx==dy==0 will end up being linked in order of appearance along the x axis.
10230 if (((move_dir == ImGuiDir_Up || move_dir == ImGuiDir_Down) ? dby : dbx) < 0.0f) // moving bj to the right/down decreases distance
10231 new_best = true;
10232 }
10233 }
10234 }
10235
10236 // Axial check: if 'curr' has no link at all in some direction and 'cand' lies roughly in that direction, add a tentative link. This will only be kept if no "real" matches
10237 // are found, so it only augments the graph produced by the above method using extra links. (important, since it doesn't guarantee strong connectedness)
10238 // This is just to avoid buttons having no links in a particular direction when there's a suitable neighbor. you get good graphs without this too.
10239 // 2017/09/29: FIXME: This now currently only enabled inside menu bars, ideally we'd disable it everywhere. Menus in particular need to catch failure. For general navigation it feels awkward.
10240 // Disabling it may lead to disconnected graphs when nodes are very spaced out on different axis. Perhaps consider offering this as an option?
10241 if (result->DistBox == FLT_MAX && dist_axial < result->DistAxial) // Check axial match
10242 if (g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Menu && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
10243 if ((move_dir == ImGuiDir_Left && dax < 0.0f) || (move_dir == ImGuiDir_Right && dax > 0.0f) || (move_dir == ImGuiDir_Up && day < 0.0f) || (move_dir == ImGuiDir_Down && day > 0.0f))
10244 {
10245 result->DistAxial = dist_axial;
10246 new_best = true;
10247 }
10248
10249 return new_best;
10250}
10251
10252static void ImGui::NavApplyItemToResult(ImGuiNavItemData* result)
10253{
10254 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10255 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10256 result->Window = window;
10257 result->ID = g.LastItemData.ID;
10258 result->FocusScopeId = window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent;
10259 result->InFlags = g.LastItemData.InFlags;
10260 result->RectRel = WindowRectAbsToRel(window, g.LastItemData.NavRect);
10261}
10262
10263// We get there when either NavId == id, or when g.NavAnyRequest is set (which is updated by NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag above)
10264// This is called after LastItemData is set.
10265static void ImGui::NavProcessItem()
10266{
10267 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10268 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10269 const ImGuiID id = g.LastItemData.ID;
10270 const ImRect nav_bb = g.LastItemData.NavRect;
10271 const ImGuiItemFlags item_flags = g.LastItemData.InFlags;
10272
10273 // Process Init Request
10274 if (g.NavInitRequest && g.NavLayer == window->DC.NavLayerCurrent)
10275 {
10276 // Even if 'ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus' is on (typically collapse/close button) we record the first ResultId so they can be used as a fallback
10277 const bool candidate_for_nav_default_focus = (item_flags & (ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus | ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled)) == 0;
10278 if (candidate_for_nav_default_focus || g.NavInitResultId == 0)
10279 {
10280 g.NavInitResultId = id;
10281 g.NavInitResultRectRel = WindowRectAbsToRel(window, nav_bb);
10282 }
10283 if (candidate_for_nav_default_focus)
10284 {
10285 g.NavInitRequest = false; // Found a match, clear request
10286 NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
10287 }
10288 }
10289
10290 // Process Move Request (scoring for navigation)
10291 // FIXME-NAV: Consider policy for double scoring (scoring from NavScoringRect + scoring from a rect wrapped according to current wrapping policy)
10292 if (g.NavMoveScoringItems)
10293 {
10294 const bool is_tab_stop = (item_flags & ImGuiItemFlags_Inputable) && (item_flags & (ImGuiItemFlags_NoTabStop | ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled)) == 0;
10295 const bool is_tabbing = (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Tabbing) != 0;
10296 if (is_tabbing)
10297 {
10298 if (is_tab_stop || (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_FocusApi))
10299 NavProcessItemForTabbingRequest(id);
10300 }
10301 else if ((g.NavId != id || (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId)) && !(item_flags & (ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled | ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav)))
10302 {
10303 ImGuiNavItemData* result = (window == g.NavWindow) ? &g.NavMoveResultLocal : &g.NavMoveResultOther;
10304 if (!is_tabbing)
10305 {
10306 if (NavScoreItem(result))
10307 NavApplyItemToResult(result);
10308
10309 // Features like PageUp/PageDown need to maintain a separate score for the visible set of items.
10310 const float VISIBLE_RATIO = 0.70f;
10311 if ((g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet) && window->ClipRect.Overlaps(nav_bb))
10312 if (ImClamp(nav_bb.Max.y, window->ClipRect.Min.y, window->ClipRect.Max.y) - ImClamp(nav_bb.Min.y, window->ClipRect.Min.y, window->ClipRect.Max.y) >= (nav_bb.Max.y - nav_bb.Min.y) * VISIBLE_RATIO)
10313 if (NavScoreItem(&g.NavMoveResultLocalVisible))
10314 NavApplyItemToResult(&g.NavMoveResultLocalVisible);
10315 }
10316 }
10317 }
10318
10319 // Update window-relative bounding box of navigated item
10320 if (g.NavId == id)
10321 {
10322 g.NavWindow = window; // Always refresh g.NavWindow, because some operations such as FocusItem() don't have a window.
10323 g.NavLayer = window->DC.NavLayerCurrent;
10324 g.NavFocusScopeId = window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent;
10325 g.NavIdIsAlive = true;
10326 window->NavRectRel[window->DC.NavLayerCurrent] = WindowRectAbsToRel(window, nav_bb); // Store item bounding box (relative to window position)
10327 }
10328}
10329
10330// Handle "scoring" of an item for a tabbing/focusing request initiated by NavUpdateCreateTabbingRequest().
10331// Note that SetKeyboardFocusHere() API calls are considered tabbing requests!
10332// - Case 1: no nav/active id: set result to first eligible item, stop storing.
10333// - Case 2: tab forward: on ref id set counter, on counter elapse store result
10334// - Case 3: tab forward wrap: set result to first eligible item (preemptively), on ref id set counter, on next frame if counter hasn't elapsed store result. // FIXME-TABBING: Could be done as a next-frame forwarded request
10335// - Case 4: tab backward: store all results, on ref id pick prev, stop storing
10336// - Case 5: tab backward wrap: store all results, on ref id if no result keep storing until last // FIXME-TABBING: Could be done as next-frame forwarded requested
10337void ImGui::NavProcessItemForTabbingRequest(ImGuiID id)
10338{
10339 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10340
10341 // Always store in NavMoveResultLocal (unlike directional request which uses NavMoveResultOther on sibling/flattened windows)
10342 ImGuiNavItemData* result = &g.NavMoveResultLocal;
10343 if (g.NavTabbingDir == +1)
10344 {
10345 // Tab Forward or SetKeyboardFocusHere() with >= 0
10346 if (g.NavTabbingResultFirst.ID == 0)
10347 NavApplyItemToResult(&g.NavTabbingResultFirst);
10348 if (--g.NavTabbingCounter == 0)
10349 NavMoveRequestResolveWithLastItem(result);
10350 else if (g.NavId == id)
10351 g.NavTabbingCounter = 1;
10352 }
10353 else if (g.NavTabbingDir == -1)
10354 {
10355 // Tab Backward
10356 if (g.NavId == id)
10357 {
10358 if (result->ID)
10359 {
10360 g.NavMoveScoringItems = false;
10361 NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
10362 }
10363 }
10364 else
10365 {
10366 NavApplyItemToResult(result);
10367 }
10368 }
10369 else if (g.NavTabbingDir == 0)
10370 {
10371 // Tab Init
10372 if (g.NavTabbingResultFirst.ID == 0)
10373 NavMoveRequestResolveWithLastItem(&g.NavTabbingResultFirst);
10374 }
10375}
10376
10377bool ImGui::NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet()
10378{
10379 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10380 return g.NavMoveScoringItems && g.NavMoveResultLocal.ID == 0 && g.NavMoveResultOther.ID == 0;
10381}
10382
10383// FIXME: ScoringRect is not set
10384void ImGui::NavMoveRequestSubmit(ImGuiDir move_dir, ImGuiDir clip_dir, ImGuiNavMoveFlags move_flags, ImGuiScrollFlags scroll_flags)
10385{
10386 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10387 IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindow != NULL);
10388
10389 if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Tabbing)
10390 move_flags |= ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId;
10391
10392 g.NavMoveSubmitted = g.NavMoveScoringItems = true;
10393 g.NavMoveDir = move_dir;
10394 g.NavMoveDirForDebug = move_dir;
10395 g.NavMoveClipDir = clip_dir;
10396 g.NavMoveFlags = move_flags;
10397 g.NavMoveScrollFlags = scroll_flags;
10398 g.NavMoveForwardToNextFrame = false;
10399 g.NavMoveKeyMods = g.IO.KeyMods;
10400 g.NavTabbingCounter = 0;
10401 g.NavMoveResultLocal.Clear();
10402 g.NavMoveResultLocalVisible.Clear();
10403 g.NavMoveResultOther.Clear();
10404 NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
10405}
10406
10407void ImGui::NavMoveRequestResolveWithLastItem(ImGuiNavItemData* result)
10408{
10409 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10410 g.NavMoveScoringItems = false; // Ensure request doesn't need more processing
10411 NavApplyItemToResult(result);
10412 NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
10413}
10414
10415void ImGui::NavMoveRequestCancel()
10416{
10417 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10418 g.NavMoveSubmitted = g.NavMoveScoringItems = false;
10419 NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
10420}
10421
10422// Forward will reuse the move request again on the next frame (generally with modifications done to it)
10423void ImGui::NavMoveRequestForward(ImGuiDir move_dir, ImGuiDir clip_dir, ImGuiNavMoveFlags move_flags, ImGuiScrollFlags scroll_flags)
10424{
10425 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10426 IM_ASSERT(g.NavMoveForwardToNextFrame == false);
10427 NavMoveRequestCancel();
10428 g.NavMoveForwardToNextFrame = true;
10429 g.NavMoveDir = move_dir;
10430 g.NavMoveClipDir = clip_dir;
10431 g.NavMoveFlags = move_flags | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Forwarded;
10432 g.NavMoveScrollFlags = scroll_flags;
10433}
10434
10435// Navigation wrap-around logic is delayed to the end of the frame because this operation is only valid after entire
10436// popup is assembled and in case of appended popups it is not clear which EndPopup() call is final.
10437void ImGui::NavMoveRequestTryWrapping(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiNavMoveFlags wrap_flags)
10438{
10439 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10440 IM_ASSERT(wrap_flags != 0); // Call with _WrapX, _WrapY, _LoopX, _LoopY
10441 // In theory we should test for NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet() but there's no point doing it, NavEndFrame() will do the same test
10442 if (g.NavWindow == window && g.NavMoveScoringItems && g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
10443 g.NavMoveFlags |= wrap_flags;
10444}
10445
10446// FIXME: This could be replaced by updating a frame number in each window when (window == NavWindow) and (NavLayer == 0).
10447// This way we could find the last focused window among our children. It would be much less confusing this way?
10448static void ImGui::NavSaveLastChildNavWindowIntoParent(ImGuiWindow* nav_window)
10449{
10450 ImGuiWindow* parent = nav_window;
10451 while (parent && parent->RootWindow != parent && (parent->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)) == 0)
10452 parent = parent->ParentWindow;
10453 if (parent && parent != nav_window)
10454 parent->NavLastChildNavWindow = nav_window;
10455}
10456
10457// Restore the last focused child.
10458// Call when we are expected to land on the Main Layer (0) after FocusWindow()
10459static ImGuiWindow* ImGui::NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
10460{
10461 if (window->NavLastChildNavWindow && window->NavLastChildNavWindow->WasActive)
10462 return window->NavLastChildNavWindow;
10463 if (window->DockNodeAsHost && window->DockNodeAsHost->TabBar)
10464 if (ImGuiTabItem* tab = TabBarFindMostRecentlySelectedTabForActiveWindow(window->DockNodeAsHost->TabBar))
10465 return tab->Window;
10466 return window;
10467}
10468
10469void ImGui::NavRestoreLayer(ImGuiNavLayer layer)
10470{
10471 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10472 if (layer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
10473 g.NavWindow = NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(g.NavWindow);
10474 ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
10475 if (window->NavLastIds[layer] != 0)
10476 {
10477 SetNavID(window->NavLastIds[layer], layer, 0, window->NavRectRel[layer]);
10478 }
10479 else
10480 {
10481 g.NavLayer = layer;
10482 NavInitWindow(window, true);
10483 }
10484}
10485
10486void ImGui::NavRestoreHighlightAfterMove()
10487{
10488 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10489 g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
10490 g.NavDisableMouseHover = g.NavMousePosDirty = true;
10491}
10492
10493static inline void ImGui::NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag()
10494{
10495 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10496 g.NavAnyRequest = g.NavMoveScoringItems || g.NavInitRequest || (IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_SCORING && g.NavWindow != NULL);
10497 if (g.NavAnyRequest)
10498 IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindow != NULL);
10499}
10500
10501// This needs to be called before we submit any widget (aka in or before Begin)
10502void ImGui::NavInitWindow(ImGuiWindow* window, bool force_reinit)
10503{
10504 // FIXME: ChildWindow test here is wrong for docking
10505 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10506 IM_ASSERT(window == g.NavWindow);
10507
10508 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs)
10509 {
10510 g.NavId = g.NavFocusScopeId = 0;
10511 return;
10512 }
10513
10514 bool init_for_nav = false;
10515 if (window == window->RootWindow || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) || (window->NavLastIds[0] == 0) || force_reinit)
10516 init_for_nav = true;
10517 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavInitRequest: from NavInitWindow(), init_for_nav=%d, window=\"%s\", layer=%d\n", init_for_nav, window->Name, g.NavLayer);
10518 if (init_for_nav)
10519 {
10520 SetNavID(0, g.NavLayer, 0, ImRect());
10521 g.NavInitRequest = true;
10522 g.NavInitRequestFromMove = false;
10523 g.NavInitResultId = 0;
10524 g.NavInitResultRectRel = ImRect();
10525 NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
10526 }
10527 else
10528 {
10529 g.NavId = window->NavLastIds[0];
10530 g.NavFocusScopeId = 0;
10531 }
10532}
10533
10534static ImVec2 ImGui::NavCalcPreferredRefPos()
10535{
10536 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10537 ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
10538 if (g.NavDisableHighlight || !g.NavDisableMouseHover || !window)
10539 {
10540 // Mouse (we need a fallback in case the mouse becomes invalid after being used)
10541 if (IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos))
10542 return g.IO.MousePos;
10543 return g.MouseLastValidPos;
10544 }
10545 else
10546 {
10547 // When navigation is active and mouse is disabled, pick a position around the bottom left of the currently navigated item
10548 // Take account of upcoming scrolling (maybe set mouse pos should be done in EndFrame?)
10549 ImRect rect_rel = WindowRectRelToAbs(window, window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer]);
10550 if (window->LastFrameActive != g.FrameCount && (window->ScrollTarget.x != FLT_MAX || window->ScrollTarget.y != FLT_MAX))
10551 {
10552 ImVec2 next_scroll = CalcNextScrollFromScrollTargetAndClamp(window);
10553 rect_rel.Translate(window->Scroll - next_scroll);
10554 }
10555 ImVec2 pos = ImVec2(rect_rel.Min.x + ImMin(g.Style.FramePadding.x * 4, rect_rel.GetWidth()), rect_rel.Max.y - ImMin(g.Style.FramePadding.y, rect_rel.GetHeight()));
10556 ImGuiViewport* viewport = window->Viewport;
10557 return ImFloor(ImClamp(pos, viewport->Pos, viewport->Pos + viewport->Size)); // ImFloor() is important because non-integer mouse position application in backend might be lossy and result in undesirable non-zero delta.
10558 }
10559}
10560
10561const char* ImGui::GetNavInputName(ImGuiNavInput n)
10562{
10563 static const char* names[] =
10564 {
10565 "Activate", "Cancel", "Input", "Menu", "DpadLeft", "DpadRight", "DpadUp", "DpadDown", "LStickLeft", "LStickRight", "LStickUp", "LStickDown",
10566 "FocusPrev", "FocusNext", "TweakSlow", "TweakFast", "KeyLeft", "KeyRight", "KeyUp", "KeyDown"
10567 };
10568 IM_ASSERT(IM_ARRAYSIZE(names) == ImGuiNavInput_COUNT);
10569 IM_ASSERT(n >= 0 && n < ImGuiNavInput_COUNT);
10570 return names[n];
10571}
10572
10573float ImGui::GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput n, ImGuiInputReadMode mode)
10574{
10575 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10576 if (mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_Down)
10577 return g.IO.NavInputs[n]; // Instant, read analog input (0.0f..1.0f, as provided by user)
10578
10579 const float t = g.IO.NavInputsDownDuration[n];
10580 if (t < 0.0f && mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_Released) // Return 1.0f when just released, no repeat, ignore analog input.
10581 return (g.IO.NavInputsDownDurationPrev[n] >= 0.0f ? 1.0f : 0.0f);
10582 if (t < 0.0f)
10583 return 0.0f;
10584 if (mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed) // Return 1.0f when just pressed, no repeat, ignore analog input.
10585 return (t == 0.0f) ? 1.0f : 0.0f;
10586 if (mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_Repeat)
10587 return (float)CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(t - g.IO.DeltaTime, t, g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay * 0.72f, g.IO.KeyRepeatRate * 0.80f);
10588 if (mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_RepeatSlow)
10589 return (float)CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(t - g.IO.DeltaTime, t, g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay * 1.25f, g.IO.KeyRepeatRate * 2.00f);
10590 if (mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_RepeatFast)
10591 return (float)CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(t - g.IO.DeltaTime, t, g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay * 0.72f, g.IO.KeyRepeatRate * 0.30f);
10592 return 0.0f;
10593}
10594
10595ImVec2 ImGui::GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags dir_sources, ImGuiInputReadMode mode, float slow_factor, float fast_factor)
10596{
10597 ImVec2 delta(0.0f, 0.0f);
10598 if (dir_sources & ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_RawKeyboard)
10599 delta += ImVec2((float)IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_RightArrow) - (float)IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_LeftArrow), (float)IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_DownArrow) - (float)IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_UpArrow));
10600 if (dir_sources & ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_Keyboard)
10601 delta += ImVec2(GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_KeyRight_, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_KeyLeft_, mode), GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_KeyDown_, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_KeyUp_, mode));
10602 if (dir_sources & ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadDPad)
10603 delta += ImVec2(GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_DpadRight, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_DpadLeft, mode), GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_DpadDown, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_DpadUp, mode));
10604 if (dir_sources & ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadLStick)
10605 delta += ImVec2(GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_LStickRight, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_LStickLeft, mode), GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_LStickDown, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_LStickUp, mode));
10606 if (slow_factor != 0.0f && IsNavInputDown(ImGuiNavInput_TweakSlow))
10607 delta *= slow_factor;
10608 if (fast_factor != 0.0f && IsNavInputDown(ImGuiNavInput_TweakFast))
10609 delta *= fast_factor;
10610 return delta;
10611}
10612
10613static void ImGui::NavUpdate()
10614{
10615 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10616 ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
10617
10618 io.WantSetMousePos = false;
10619 //if (g.NavScoringDebugCount > 0) IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("NavScoringDebugCount %d for '%s' layer %d (Init:%d, Move:%d)\n", g.NavScoringDebugCount, g.NavWindow ? g.NavWindow->Name : "NULL", g.NavLayer, g.NavInitRequest || g.NavInitResultId != 0, g.NavMoveRequest);
10620
10621 // Set input source as Gamepad when buttons are pressed (as some features differs when used with Gamepad vs Keyboard)
10622 // (do it before we map Keyboard input!)
10623 const bool nav_keyboard_active = (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard) != 0;
10624 const bool nav_gamepad_active = (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad) != 0 && (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad) != 0;
10625 if (nav_gamepad_active && g.NavInputSource != ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad)
10626 {
10627 if (io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_Activate] > 0.0f || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_Input] > 0.0f || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_Cancel] > 0.0f || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_Menu] > 0.0f
10628 || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_DpadLeft] > 0.0f || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_DpadRight] > 0.0f || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_DpadUp] > 0.0f || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_DpadDown] > 0.0f)
10629 g.NavInputSource = ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad;
10630 }
10631
10632 // Update Keyboard->Nav inputs mapping
10633 if (nav_keyboard_active)
10634 {
10635 #define NAV_MAP_KEY(_KEY, _NAV_INPUT) do { if (IsKeyDown(_KEY)) { io.NavInputs[_NAV_INPUT] = 1.0f; g.NavInputSource = ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard; } } while (0)
10636 NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_Space, ImGuiNavInput_Activate );
10637 NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_Enter, ImGuiNavInput_Input );
10638 NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_Escape, ImGuiNavInput_Cancel );
10639 NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_LeftArrow, ImGuiNavInput_KeyLeft_ );
10640 NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_RightArrow,ImGuiNavInput_KeyRight_);
10641 NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_UpArrow, ImGuiNavInput_KeyUp_ );
10642 NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_DownArrow, ImGuiNavInput_KeyDown_ );
10643 if (io.KeyCtrl)
10644 io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_TweakSlow] = 1.0f;
10645 if (io.KeyShift)
10646 io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_TweakFast] = 1.0f;
10647 #undef NAV_MAP_KEY
10648 }
10649 memcpy(io.NavInputsDownDurationPrev, io.NavInputsDownDuration, sizeof(io.NavInputsDownDuration));
10650 for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.NavInputs); i++)
10651 io.NavInputsDownDuration[i] = (io.NavInputs[i] > 0.0f) ? (io.NavInputsDownDuration[i] < 0.0f ? 0.0f : io.NavInputsDownDuration[i] + io.DeltaTime) : -1.0f;
10652
10653 // Process navigation init request (select first/default focus)
10654 if (g.NavInitResultId != 0)
10655 NavInitRequestApplyResult();
10656 g.NavInitRequest = false;
10657 g.NavInitRequestFromMove = false;
10658 g.NavInitResultId = 0;
10659 g.NavJustMovedToId = 0;
10660
10661 // Process navigation move request
10662 if (g.NavMoveSubmitted)
10663 NavMoveRequestApplyResult();
10664 g.NavTabbingCounter = 0;
10665 g.NavMoveSubmitted = g.NavMoveScoringItems = false;
10666
10667 // Schedule mouse position update (will be done at the bottom of this function, after 1) processing all move requests and 2) updating scrolling)
10668 bool set_mouse_pos = false;
10669 if (g.NavMousePosDirty && g.NavIdIsAlive)
10670 if (!g.NavDisableHighlight && g.NavDisableMouseHover && g.NavWindow)
10671 set_mouse_pos = true;
10672 g.NavMousePosDirty = false;
10673 IM_ASSERT(g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main || g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Menu);
10674
10675 // Store our return window (for returning from Menu Layer to Main Layer) and clear it as soon as we step back in our own Layer 0
10676 if (g.NavWindow)
10677 NavSaveLastChildNavWindowIntoParent(g.NavWindow);
10678 if (g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow->NavLastChildNavWindow != NULL && g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
10679 g.NavWindow->NavLastChildNavWindow = NULL;
10680
10681 // Update CTRL+TAB and Windowing features (hold Square to move/resize/etc.)
10682 NavUpdateWindowing();
10683
10684 // Set output flags for user application
10685 io.NavActive = (nav_keyboard_active || nav_gamepad_active) && g.NavWindow && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs);
10686 io.NavVisible = (io.NavActive && g.NavId != 0 && !g.NavDisableHighlight) || (g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL);
10687
10688 // Process NavCancel input (to close a popup, get back to parent, clear focus)
10689 NavUpdateCancelRequest();
10690
10691 // Process manual activation request
10692 g.NavActivateId = g.NavActivateDownId = g.NavActivatePressedId = g.NavActivateInputId = 0;
10693 g.NavActivateFlags = ImGuiActivateFlags_None;
10694 if (g.NavId != 0 && !g.NavDisableHighlight && !g.NavWindowingTarget && g.NavWindow && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
10695 {
10696 bool activate_down = IsNavInputDown(ImGuiNavInput_Activate);
10697 bool input_down = IsNavInputDown(ImGuiNavInput_Input);
10698 bool activate_pressed = activate_down && IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_Activate, ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed);
10699 bool input_pressed = input_down && IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_Input, ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed);
10700 if (g.ActiveId == 0 && activate_pressed)
10701 {
10702 g.NavActivateId = g.NavId;
10703 g.NavActivateFlags = ImGuiActivateFlags_PreferTweak;
10704 }
10705 if ((g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveId == g.NavId) && input_pressed)
10706 {
10707 g.NavActivateInputId = g.NavId;
10708 g.NavActivateFlags = ImGuiActivateFlags_PreferInput;
10709 }
10710 if ((g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveId == g.NavId) && activate_down)
10711 g.NavActivateDownId = g.NavId;
10712 if ((g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveId == g.NavId) && activate_pressed)
10713 g.NavActivatePressedId = g.NavId;
10714 }
10715 if (g.NavWindow && (g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
10716 g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
10717 if (g.NavActivateId != 0)
10718 IM_ASSERT(g.NavActivateDownId == g.NavActivateId);
10719
10720 // Process programmatic activation request
10721 // FIXME-NAV: Those should eventually be queued (unlike focus they don't cancel each others)
10722 if (g.NavNextActivateId != 0)
10723 {
10724 if (g.NavNextActivateFlags & ImGuiActivateFlags_PreferInput)
10725 g.NavActivateInputId = g.NavNextActivateId;
10726 else
10727 g.NavActivateId = g.NavActivateDownId = g.NavActivatePressedId = g.NavNextActivateId;
10728 g.NavActivateFlags = g.NavNextActivateFlags;
10729 }
10730 g.NavNextActivateId = 0;
10731
10732 // Process move requests
10733 NavUpdateCreateMoveRequest();
10734 if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_None)
10735 NavUpdateCreateTabbingRequest();
10736 NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
10737 g.NavIdIsAlive = false;
10738
10739 // Scrolling
10740 if (g.NavWindow && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs) && !g.NavWindowingTarget)
10741 {
10742 // *Fallback* manual-scroll with Nav directional keys when window has no navigable item
10743 ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
10744 const float scroll_speed = IM_ROUND(window->CalcFontSize() * 100 * io.DeltaTime); // We need round the scrolling speed because sub-pixel scroll isn't reliably supported.
10745 const ImGuiDir move_dir = g.NavMoveDir;
10746 if (window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask == 0x00 && window->DC.NavHasScroll && move_dir != ImGuiDir_None)
10747 {
10748 if (move_dir == ImGuiDir_Left || move_dir == ImGuiDir_Right)
10749 SetScrollX(window, ImFloor(window->Scroll.x + ((move_dir == ImGuiDir_Left) ? -1.0f : +1.0f) * scroll_speed));
10750 if (move_dir == ImGuiDir_Up || move_dir == ImGuiDir_Down)
10751 SetScrollY(window, ImFloor(window->Scroll.y + ((move_dir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? -1.0f : +1.0f) * scroll_speed));
10752 }
10753
10754 // *Normal* Manual scroll with NavScrollXXX keys
10755 // Next movement request will clamp the NavId reference rectangle to the visible area, so navigation will resume within those bounds.
10756 ImVec2 scroll_dir = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadLStick, ImGuiInputReadMode_Down, 1.0f / 10.0f, 10.0f);
10757 if (scroll_dir.x != 0.0f && window->ScrollbarX)
10758 SetScrollX(window, ImFloor(window->Scroll.x + scroll_dir.x * scroll_speed));
10759 if (scroll_dir.y != 0.0f)
10760 SetScrollY(window, ImFloor(window->Scroll.y + scroll_dir.y * scroll_speed));
10761 }
10762
10763 // Always prioritize mouse highlight if navigation is disabled
10764 if (!nav_keyboard_active && !nav_gamepad_active)
10765 {
10766 g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
10767 g.NavDisableMouseHover = set_mouse_pos = false;
10768 }
10769
10770 // Update mouse position if requested
10771 // (This will take into account the possibility that a Scroll was queued in the window to offset our absolute mouse position before scroll has been applied)
10772 if (set_mouse_pos && (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos) && (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasSetMousePos))
10773 {
10774 io.MousePos = io.MousePosPrev = NavCalcPreferredRefPos();
10775 io.WantSetMousePos = true;
10776 //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("SetMousePos: (%.1f,%.1f)\n", io.MousePos.x, io.MousePos.y);
10777 }
10778
10779 // [DEBUG]
10780 g.NavScoringDebugCount = 0;
10781#if IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_RECTS
10782 if (g.NavWindow)
10783 {
10784 ImDrawList* draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(g.NavWindow);
10785 if (1) { for (int layer = 0; layer < 2; layer++) { ImRect r = WindowRectRelToAbs(g.NavWindow, g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[layer]); draw_list->AddRect(r.Min, r.Max, IM_COL32(255,200,0,255)); } } // [DEBUG]
10786 if (1) { ImU32 col = (!g.NavWindow->Hidden) ? IM_COL32(255,0,255,255) : IM_COL32(255,0,0,255); ImVec2 p = NavCalcPreferredRefPos(); char buf[32]; ImFormatString(buf, 32, "%d", g.NavLayer); draw_list->AddCircleFilled(p, 3.0f, col); draw_list->AddText(NULL, 13.0f, p + ImVec2(8,-4), col, buf); }
10787 }
10788#endif
10789}
10790
10791void ImGui::NavInitRequestApplyResult()
10792{
10793 // In very rare cases g.NavWindow may be null (e.g. clearing focus after requesting an init request, which does happen when releasing Alt while clicking on void)
10794 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10795 if (!g.NavWindow)
10796 return;
10797
10798 // Apply result from previous navigation init request (will typically select the first item, unless SetItemDefaultFocus() has been called)
10799 // FIXME-NAV: On _NavFlattened windows, g.NavWindow will only be updated during subsequent frame. Not a problem currently.
10800 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavInitRequest: result NavID 0x%08X in Layer %d Window \"%s\"\n", g.NavInitResultId, g.NavLayer, g.NavWindow->Name);
10801 SetNavID(g.NavInitResultId, g.NavLayer, 0, g.NavInitResultRectRel);
10802 g.NavIdIsAlive = true; // Mark as alive from previous frame as we got a result
10803 if (g.NavInitRequestFromMove)
10804 NavRestoreHighlightAfterMove();
10805}
10806
10807void ImGui::NavUpdateCreateMoveRequest()
10808{
10809 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10810 ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
10811 ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
10812
10813 if (g.NavMoveForwardToNextFrame && window != NULL)
10814 {
10815 // Forwarding previous request (which has been modified, e.g. wrap around menus rewrite the requests with a starting rectangle at the other side of the window)
10816 // (preserve most state, which were already set by the NavMoveRequestForward() function)
10817 IM_ASSERT(g.NavMoveDir != ImGuiDir_None && g.NavMoveClipDir != ImGuiDir_None);
10818 IM_ASSERT(g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Forwarded);
10819 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavMoveRequestForward %d\n", g.NavMoveDir);
10820 }
10821 else
10822 {
10823 // Initiate directional inputs request
10824 g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_None;
10825 g.NavMoveFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_None;
10826 g.NavMoveScrollFlags = ImGuiScrollFlags_None;
10827 if (window && !g.NavWindowingTarget && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
10828 {
10829 const ImGuiInputReadMode read_mode = ImGuiInputReadMode_Repeat;
10830 if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir_Left) && (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_DpadLeft, read_mode) || IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_KeyLeft_, read_mode))) { g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Left; }
10831 if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir_Right) && (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_DpadRight, read_mode) || IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_KeyRight_, read_mode))) { g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Right; }
10832 if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir_Up) && (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_DpadUp, read_mode) || IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_KeyUp_, read_mode))) { g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Up; }
10833 if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir_Down) && (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_DpadDown, read_mode) || IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_KeyDown_, read_mode))) { g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Down; }
10834 }
10835 g.NavMoveClipDir = g.NavMoveDir;
10836 g.NavScoringNoClipRect = ImRect(+FLT_MAX, +FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX);
10837 }
10838
10839 // Update PageUp/PageDown/Home/End scroll
10840 // FIXME-NAV: Consider enabling those keys even without the master ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard flag?
10841 const bool nav_keyboard_active = (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard) != 0;
10842 float scoring_rect_offset_y = 0.0f;
10843 if (window && g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_None && nav_keyboard_active)
10844 scoring_rect_offset_y = NavUpdatePageUpPageDown();
10845 if (scoring_rect_offset_y != 0.0f)
10846 {
10847 g.NavScoringNoClipRect = window->InnerRect;
10848 g.NavScoringNoClipRect.TranslateY(scoring_rect_offset_y);
10849 }
10850
10851 // [DEBUG] Always send a request
10852#if IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_SCORING
10853 if (io.KeyCtrl && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_C))
10854 g.NavMoveDirForDebug = (ImGuiDir)((g.NavMoveDirForDebug + 1) & 3);
10855 if (io.KeyCtrl && g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_None)
10856 {
10857 g.NavMoveDir = g.NavMoveDirForDebug;
10858 g.NavMoveFlags |= ImGuiNavMoveFlags_DebugNoResult;
10859 }
10860#endif
10861
10862 // Submit
10863 g.NavMoveForwardToNextFrame = false;
10864 if (g.NavMoveDir != ImGuiDir_None)
10865 NavMoveRequestSubmit(g.NavMoveDir, g.NavMoveClipDir, g.NavMoveFlags, g.NavMoveScrollFlags);
10866
10867 // Moving with no reference triggers a init request (will be used as a fallback if the direction fails to find a match)
10868 if (g.NavMoveSubmitted && g.NavId == 0)
10869 {
10870 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavInitRequest: from move, window \"%s\", layer=%d\n", g.NavWindow->Name, g.NavLayer);
10871 g.NavInitRequest = g.NavInitRequestFromMove = true;
10872 g.NavInitResultId = 0;
10873 g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
10874 }
10875
10876 // When using gamepad, we project the reference nav bounding box into window visible area.
10877 // This is to allow resuming navigation inside the visible area after doing a large amount of scrolling, since with gamepad every movements are relative
10878 // (can't focus a visible object like we can with the mouse).
10879 if (g.NavMoveSubmitted && g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad && g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main && window != NULL)
10880 {
10881 ImRect window_rect_rel = WindowRectAbsToRel(window, ImRect(window->InnerRect.Min - ImVec2(1, 1), window->InnerRect.Max + ImVec2(1, 1)));
10882 if (!window_rect_rel.Contains(window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer]))
10883 {
10884 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavMoveRequest: clamp NavRectRel\n");
10885 float pad = window->CalcFontSize() * 0.5f;
10886 window_rect_rel.Expand(ImVec2(-ImMin(window_rect_rel.GetWidth(), pad), -ImMin(window_rect_rel.GetHeight(), pad))); // Terrible approximation for the intent of starting navigation from first fully visible item
10887 window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer].ClipWithFull(window_rect_rel);
10888 g.NavId = g.NavFocusScopeId = 0;
10889 }
10890 }
10891
10892 // For scoring we use a single segment on the left side our current item bounding box (not touching the edge to avoid box overlap with zero-spaced items)
10893 ImRect scoring_rect;
10894 if (window != NULL)
10895 {
10896 ImRect nav_rect_rel = !window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer].IsInverted() ? window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer] : ImRect(0, 0, 0, 0);
10897 scoring_rect = WindowRectRelToAbs(window, nav_rect_rel);
10898 scoring_rect.TranslateY(scoring_rect_offset_y);
10899 scoring_rect.Min.x = ImMin(scoring_rect.Min.x + 1.0f, scoring_rect.Max.x);
10900 scoring_rect.Max.x = scoring_rect.Min.x;
10901 IM_ASSERT(!scoring_rect.IsInverted()); // Ensure if we have a finite, non-inverted bounding box here will allows us to remove extraneous ImFabs() calls in NavScoreItem().
10902 //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(scoring_rect.Min, scoring_rect.Max, IM_COL32(255,200,0,255)); // [DEBUG]
10903 //if (!g.NavScoringNoClipRect.IsInverted()) { GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(g.NavScoringNoClipRect.Min, g.NavScoringNoClipRect.Max, IM_COL32(255, 200, 0, 255)); } // [DEBUG]
10904 }
10905 g.NavScoringRect = scoring_rect;
10906 g.NavScoringNoClipRect.Add(scoring_rect);
10907}
10908
10909void ImGui::NavUpdateCreateTabbingRequest()
10910{
10911 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10912 ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
10913 IM_ASSERT(g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_None);
10914 if (window == NULL || g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
10915 return;
10916
10917 const bool tab_pressed = IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Tab, true) && !IsActiveIdUsingKey(ImGuiKey_Tab) && !g.IO.KeyCtrl && !g.IO.KeyAlt;
10918 if (!tab_pressed)
10919 return;
10920
10921 // Initiate tabbing request
10922 // (this is ALWAYS ENABLED, regardless of ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard flag!)
10923 // Initially this was designed to use counters and modulo arithmetic, but that could not work with unsubmitted items (list clipper). Instead we use a strategy close to other move requests.
10924 // See NavProcessItemForTabbingRequest() for a description of the various forward/backward tabbing cases with and without wrapping.
10926 g.NavTabbingDir = g.IO.KeyShift ? -1 : (g.ActiveId == 0) ? 0 : +1;
10927 ImGuiScrollFlags scroll_flags = window->Appearing ? ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleEdgeX | ImGuiScrollFlags_AlwaysCenterY : ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleEdgeX | ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleEdgeY;
10928 ImGuiDir clip_dir = (g.NavTabbingDir < 0) ? ImGuiDir_Up : ImGuiDir_Down;
10929 NavMoveRequestSubmit(ImGuiDir_None, clip_dir, ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Tabbing, scroll_flags); // FIXME-NAV: Once we refactor tabbing, add LegacyApi flag to not activate non-inputable.
10930 g.NavTabbingResultFirst.Clear();
10931 g.NavTabbingCounter = -1;
10932}
10933
10934// Apply result from previous frame navigation directional move request. Always called from NavUpdate()
10935void ImGui::NavMoveRequestApplyResult()
10936{
10937 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10938#if IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_SCORING
10939 if (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_DebugNoResult) // [DEBUG] Scoring all items in NavWindow at all times
10940 return;
10941#endif
10942
10943 // Select which result to use
10944 ImGuiNavItemData* result = (g.NavMoveResultLocal.ID != 0) ? &g.NavMoveResultLocal : (g.NavMoveResultOther.ID != 0) ? &g.NavMoveResultOther : NULL;
10945
10946 // Tabbing forward wrap
10947 if (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Tabbing)
10948 if ((g.NavTabbingCounter == 1 || g.NavTabbingDir == 0) && g.NavTabbingResultFirst.ID)
10949 result = &g.NavTabbingResultFirst;
10950
10951 // In a situation when there is no results but NavId != 0, re-enable the Navigation highlight (because g.NavId is not considered as a possible result)
10952 if (result == NULL)
10953 {
10954 if (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Tabbing)
10955 g.NavMoveFlags |= ImGuiNavMoveFlags_DontSetNavHighlight;
10956 if (g.NavId != 0 && (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_DontSetNavHighlight) == 0)
10957 NavRestoreHighlightAfterMove();
10958 return;
10959 }
10960
10961 // PageUp/PageDown behavior first jumps to the bottom/top mostly visible item, _otherwise_ use the result from the previous/next page.
10962 if (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet)
10963 if (g.NavMoveResultLocalVisible.ID != 0 && g.NavMoveResultLocalVisible.ID != g.NavId)
10964 result = &g.NavMoveResultLocalVisible;
10965
10966 // Maybe entering a flattened child from the outside? In this case solve the tie using the regular scoring rules.
10967 if (result != &g.NavMoveResultOther && g.NavMoveResultOther.ID != 0 && g.NavMoveResultOther.Window->ParentWindow == g.NavWindow)
10968 if ((g.NavMoveResultOther.DistBox < result->DistBox) || (g.NavMoveResultOther.DistBox == result->DistBox && g.NavMoveResultOther.DistCenter < result->DistCenter))
10969 result = &g.NavMoveResultOther;
10970 IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindow && result->Window);
10971
10972 // Scroll to keep newly navigated item fully into view.
10973 if (g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
10974 {
10975 if (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdgeY)
10976 {
10977 // FIXME: Should remove this
10978 float scroll_target = (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? result->Window->ScrollMax.y : 0.0f;
10979 SetScrollY(result->Window, scroll_target);
10980 }
10981 else
10982 {
10983 ImRect rect_abs = WindowRectRelToAbs(result->Window, result->RectRel);
10984 ScrollToRectEx(result->Window, rect_abs, g.NavMoveScrollFlags);
10985 }
10986 }
10987
10988 g.NavWindow = result->Window;
10989 if (g.ActiveId != result->ID)
10990 ClearActiveID();
10991 if (g.NavId != result->ID)
10992 {
10993 // Don't set NavJustMovedToId if just landed on the same spot (which may happen with ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId)
10994 g.NavJustMovedToId = result->ID;
10995 g.NavJustMovedToFocusScopeId = result->FocusScopeId;
10996 g.NavJustMovedToKeyMods = g.NavMoveKeyMods;
10997 }
10998
10999 // Focus
11000 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavMoveRequest: result NavID 0x%08X in Layer %d Window \"%s\"\n", result->ID, g.NavLayer, g.NavWindow->Name);
11001 SetNavID(result->ID, g.NavLayer, result->FocusScopeId, result->RectRel);
11002
11003 // Tabbing: Activates Inputable or Focus non-Inputable
11004 if ((g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Tabbing) && (result->InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Inputable))
11005 {
11006 g.NavNextActivateId = result->ID;
11007 g.NavNextActivateFlags = ImGuiActivateFlags_PreferInput | ImGuiActivateFlags_TryToPreserveState;
11008 g.NavMoveFlags |= ImGuiNavMoveFlags_DontSetNavHighlight;
11009 }
11010
11011 // Activate
11012 if (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Activate)
11013 {
11014 g.NavNextActivateId = result->ID;
11015 g.NavNextActivateFlags = ImGuiActivateFlags_None;
11016 }
11017
11018 // Enable nav highlight
11019 if ((g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_DontSetNavHighlight) == 0)
11020 NavRestoreHighlightAfterMove();
11021}
11022
11023// Process NavCancel input (to close a popup, get back to parent, clear focus)
11024// FIXME: In order to support e.g. Escape to clear a selection we'll need:
11025// - either to store the equivalent of ActiveIdUsingKeyInputMask for a FocusScope and test for it.
11026// - either to move most/all of those tests to the epilogue/end functions of the scope they are dealing with (e.g. exit child window in EndChild()) or in EndFrame(), to allow an earlier intercept
11027static void ImGui::NavUpdateCancelRequest()
11028{
11029 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11030 if (!IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_Cancel, ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed))
11031 return;
11032
11033 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] ImGuiNavInput_Cancel\n");
11034 if (g.ActiveId != 0)
11035 {
11036 if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavInput(ImGuiNavInput_Cancel))
11037 ClearActiveID();
11038 }
11039 else if (g.NavLayer != ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
11040 {
11041 // Leave the "menu" layer
11042 NavRestoreLayer(ImGuiNavLayer_Main);
11043 NavRestoreHighlightAfterMove();
11044 }
11045 else if (g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow != g.NavWindow->RootWindow && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && g.NavWindow->ParentWindow)
11046 {
11047 // Exit child window
11048 ImGuiWindow* child_window = g.NavWindow;
11049 ImGuiWindow* parent_window = g.NavWindow->ParentWindow;
11050 IM_ASSERT(child_window->ChildId != 0);
11051 ImRect child_rect = child_window->Rect();
11052 FocusWindow(parent_window);
11053 SetNavID(child_window->ChildId, ImGuiNavLayer_Main, 0, WindowRectAbsToRel(parent_window, child_rect));
11054 NavRestoreHighlightAfterMove();
11055 }
11056 else if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size > 0)
11057 {
11058 // Close open popup/menu
11059 if (!(g.OpenPopupStack.back().Window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal))
11060 ClosePopupToLevel(g.OpenPopupStack.Size - 1, true);
11061 }
11062 else
11063 {
11064 // Clear NavLastId for popups but keep it for regular child window so we can leave one and come back where we were
11065 if (g.NavWindow && ((g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) || !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)))
11066 g.NavWindow->NavLastIds[0] = 0;
11067 g.NavId = g.NavFocusScopeId = 0;
11068 }
11069}
11070
11071// Handle PageUp/PageDown/Home/End keys
11072// Called from NavUpdateCreateMoveRequest() which will use our output to create a move request
11073// FIXME-NAV: This doesn't work properly with NavFlattened siblings as we use NavWindow rectangle for reference
11074// FIXME-NAV: how to get Home/End to aim at the beginning/end of a 2D grid?
11075static float ImGui::NavUpdatePageUpPageDown()
11076{
11077 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11078 ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
11079 if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs) || g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL)
11080 return 0.0f;
11081
11082 const bool page_up_held = IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_PageUp) && !IsActiveIdUsingKey(ImGuiKey_PageUp);
11083 const bool page_down_held = IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_PageDown) && !IsActiveIdUsingKey(ImGuiKey_PageDown);
11084 const bool home_pressed = IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Home) && !IsActiveIdUsingKey(ImGuiKey_Home);
11085 const bool end_pressed = IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_End) && !IsActiveIdUsingKey(ImGuiKey_End);
11086 if (page_up_held == page_down_held && home_pressed == end_pressed) // Proceed if either (not both) are pressed, otherwise early out
11087 return 0.0f;
11088
11089 if (g.NavLayer != ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
11090 NavRestoreLayer(ImGuiNavLayer_Main);
11091
11092 if (window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask == 0x00 && window->DC.NavHasScroll)
11093 {
11094 // Fallback manual-scroll when window has no navigable item
11095 if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_PageUp, true))
11096 SetScrollY(window, window->Scroll.y - window->InnerRect.GetHeight());
11097 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_PageDown, true))
11098 SetScrollY(window, window->Scroll.y + window->InnerRect.GetHeight());
11099 else if (home_pressed)
11100 SetScrollY(window, 0.0f);
11101 else if (end_pressed)
11102 SetScrollY(window, window->ScrollMax.y);
11103 }
11104 else
11105 {
11106 ImRect& nav_rect_rel = window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer];
11107 const float page_offset_y = ImMax(0.0f, window->InnerRect.GetHeight() - window->CalcFontSize() * 1.0f + nav_rect_rel.GetHeight());
11108 float nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = 0.0f;
11109 if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_PageUp, true))
11110 {
11111 nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = -page_offset_y;
11112 g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Down; // Because our scoring rect is offset up, we request the down direction (so we can always land on the last item)
11113 g.NavMoveClipDir = ImGuiDir_Up;
11114 g.NavMoveFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet;
11115 }
11116 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_PageDown, true))
11117 {
11118 nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = +page_offset_y;
11119 g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Up; // Because our scoring rect is offset down, we request the up direction (so we can always land on the last item)
11120 g.NavMoveClipDir = ImGuiDir_Down;
11121 g.NavMoveFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet;
11122 }
11123 else if (home_pressed)
11124 {
11125 // FIXME-NAV: handling of Home/End is assuming that the top/bottom most item will be visible with Scroll.y == 0/ScrollMax.y
11126 // Scrolling will be handled via the ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdgeY flag, we don't scroll immediately to avoid scrolling happening before nav result.
11127 // Preserve current horizontal position if we have any.
11128 nav_rect_rel.Min.y = nav_rect_rel.Max.y = 0.0f;
11129 if (nav_rect_rel.IsInverted())
11130 nav_rect_rel.Min.x = nav_rect_rel.Max.x = 0.0f;
11131 g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Down;
11132 g.NavMoveFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdgeY;
