11133 // FIXME-NAV: MoveClipDir left to _None, intentional?
11134 }
11135 else if (end_pressed)
11136 {
11137 nav_rect_rel.Min.y = nav_rect_rel.Max.y = window->ContentSize.y;
11138 if (nav_rect_rel.IsInverted())
11139 nav_rect_rel.Min.x = nav_rect_rel.Max.x = 0.0f;
11140 g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Up;
11141 g.NavMoveFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdgeY;
11142 // FIXME-NAV: MoveClipDir left to _None, intentional?
11143 }
11144 return nav_scoring_rect_offset_y;
11145 }
11146 return 0.0f;
11147}
11148
11149static void ImGui::NavEndFrame()
11150{
11151 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11152
11153 // Show CTRL+TAB list window
11154 if (g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL)
11155 NavUpdateWindowingOverlay();
11156
11157 // Perform wrap-around in menus
11158 // FIXME-NAV: Wrap may need to apply a weight bias on the other axis. e.g. 4x4 grid with 2 last items missing on last item won't handle LoopY/WrapY correctly.
11159 // FIXME-NAV: Wrap (not Loop) support could be handled by the scoring function and then WrapX would function without an extra frame.
11160 const ImGuiNavMoveFlags wanted_flags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopX | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopY;
11161 if (g.NavWindow && NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet() && (g.NavMoveFlags & wanted_flags) && (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Forwarded) == 0)
11162 NavUpdateCreateWrappingRequest();
11163}
11164
11165static void ImGui::NavUpdateCreateWrappingRequest()
11166{
11167 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11168 ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
11169
11170 bool do_forward = false;
11171 ImRect bb_rel = window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer];
11172 ImGuiDir clip_dir = g.NavMoveDir;
11173 const ImGuiNavMoveFlags move_flags = g.NavMoveFlags;
11174 if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left && (move_flags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopX)))
11175 {
11176 bb_rel.Min.x = bb_rel.Max.x = window->ContentSize.x + window->WindowPadding.x;
11177 if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX)
11178 {
11179 bb_rel.TranslateY(-bb_rel.GetHeight()); // Previous row
11180 clip_dir = ImGuiDir_Up;
11181 }
11182 do_forward = true;
11183 }
11184 if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Right && (move_flags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopX)))
11185 {
11186 bb_rel.Min.x = bb_rel.Max.x = -window->WindowPadding.x;
11187 if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX)
11188 {
11189 bb_rel.TranslateY(+bb_rel.GetHeight()); // Next row
11190 clip_dir = ImGuiDir_Down;
11191 }
11192 do_forward = true;
11193 }
11194 if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up && (move_flags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopY)))
11195 {
11196 bb_rel.Min.y = bb_rel.Max.y = window->ContentSize.y + window->WindowPadding.y;
11197 if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY)
11198 {
11199 bb_rel.TranslateX(-bb_rel.GetWidth()); // Previous column
11200 clip_dir = ImGuiDir_Left;
11201 }
11202 do_forward = true;
11203 }
11204 if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Down && (move_flags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopY)))
11205 {
11206 bb_rel.Min.y = bb_rel.Max.y = -window->WindowPadding.y;
11207 if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY)
11208 {
11209 bb_rel.TranslateX(+bb_rel.GetWidth()); // Next column
11210 clip_dir = ImGuiDir_Right;
11211 }
11212 do_forward = true;
11213 }
11214 if (!do_forward)
11215 return;
11216 window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer] = bb_rel;
11217 NavMoveRequestForward(g.NavMoveDir, clip_dir, move_flags, g.NavMoveScrollFlags);
11218}
11219
11220static int ImGui::FindWindowFocusIndex(ImGuiWindow* window)
11221{
11222 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11223 IM_UNUSED(g);
11224 int order = window->FocusOrder;
11225 IM_ASSERT(window->RootWindow == window); // No child window (not testing _ChildWindow because of docking)
11226 IM_ASSERT(g.WindowsFocusOrder[order] == window);
11227 return order;
11228}
11229
11230static ImGuiWindow* FindWindowNavFocusable(int i_start, int i_stop, int dir) // FIXME-OPT O(N)
11231{
11232 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11233 for (int i = i_start; i >= 0 && i < g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size && i != i_stop; i += dir)
11234 if (ImGui::IsWindowNavFocusable(g.WindowsFocusOrder[i]))
11235 return g.WindowsFocusOrder[i];
11236 return NULL;
11237}
11238
11239static void NavUpdateWindowingHighlightWindow(int focus_change_dir)
11240{
11241 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11242 IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindowingTarget);
11243 if (g.NavWindowingTarget->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)
11244 return;
11245
11246 const int i_current = ImGui::FindWindowFocusIndex(g.NavWindowingTarget);
11247 ImGuiWindow* window_target = FindWindowNavFocusable(i_current + focus_change_dir, -INT_MAX, focus_change_dir);
11248 if (!window_target)
11249 window_target = FindWindowNavFocusable((focus_change_dir < 0) ? (g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1) : 0, i_current, focus_change_dir);
11250 if (window_target) // Don't reset windowing target if there's a single window in the list
11251 g.NavWindowingTarget = g.NavWindowingTargetAnim = window_target;
11252 g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = false;
11253}
11254
11255// Windowing management mode
11256// Keyboard: CTRL+Tab (change focus/move/resize), Alt (toggle menu layer)
11257// Gamepad: Hold Menu/Square (change focus/move/resize), Tap Menu/Square (toggle menu layer)
11258static void ImGui::NavUpdateWindowing()
11259{
11260 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11261 ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
11262
11263 ImGuiWindow* apply_focus_window = NULL;
11264 bool apply_toggle_layer = false;
11265
11266 ImGuiWindow* modal_window = GetTopMostPopupModal();
11267 bool allow_windowing = (modal_window == NULL);
11268 if (!allow_windowing)
11269 g.NavWindowingTarget = NULL;
11270
11271 // Fade out
11272 if (g.NavWindowingTargetAnim && g.NavWindowingTarget == NULL)
11273 {
11274 g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = ImMax(g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha - io.DeltaTime * 10.0f, 0.0f);
11275 if (g.DimBgRatio <= 0.0f && g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha <= 0.0f)
11276 g.NavWindowingTargetAnim = NULL;
11277 }
11278
11279 // Start CTRL+Tab or Square+L/R window selection
11280 const bool start_windowing_with_gamepad = allow_windowing && !g.NavWindowingTarget && IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_Menu, ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed);
11281 const bool start_windowing_with_keyboard = allow_windowing && !g.NavWindowingTarget && io.KeyCtrl && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Tab);
11282 if (start_windowing_with_gamepad || start_windowing_with_keyboard)
11283 if (ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow ? g.NavWindow : FindWindowNavFocusable(g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1, -INT_MAX, -1))
11284 {
11285 g.NavWindowingTarget = g.NavWindowingTargetAnim = window->RootWindow;
11286 g.NavWindowingTimer = g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = 0.0f;
11287 g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = start_windowing_with_gamepad ? true : false; // Gamepad starts toggling layer
11288 g.NavInputSource = start_windowing_with_keyboard ? ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard : ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad;
11289 }
11290
11291 // Gamepad update
11292 g.NavWindowingTimer += io.DeltaTime;
11293 if (g.NavWindowingTarget && g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad)
11294 {
11295 // Highlight only appears after a brief time holding the button, so that a fast tap on PadMenu (to toggle NavLayer) doesn't add visual noise
11296 g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = ImMax(g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha, ImSaturate((g.NavWindowingTimer - NAV_WINDOWING_HIGHLIGHT_DELAY) / 0.05f));
11297
11298 // Select window to focus
11299 const int focus_change_dir = (int)IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_FocusPrev, ImGuiInputReadMode_RepeatSlow) - (int)IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_FocusNext, ImGuiInputReadMode_RepeatSlow);
11300 if (focus_change_dir != 0)
11301 {
11302 NavUpdateWindowingHighlightWindow(focus_change_dir);
11303 g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = 1.0f;
11304 }
11305
11306 // Single press toggles NavLayer, long press with L/R apply actual focus on release (until then the window was merely rendered top-most)
11307 if (!IsNavInputDown(ImGuiNavInput_Menu))
11308 {
11309 g.NavWindowingToggleLayer &= (g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha < 1.0f); // Once button was held long enough we don't consider it a tap-to-toggle-layer press anymore.
11310 if (g.NavWindowingToggleLayer && g.NavWindow)
11311 apply_toggle_layer = true;
11312 else if (!g.NavWindowingToggleLayer)
11313 apply_focus_window = g.NavWindowingTarget;
11314 g.NavWindowingTarget = NULL;
11315 }
11316 }
11317
11318 // Keyboard: Focus
11319 if (g.NavWindowingTarget && g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard)
11320 {
11321 // Visuals only appears after a brief time after pressing TAB the first time, so that a fast CTRL+TAB doesn't add visual noise
11322 g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = ImMax(g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha, ImSaturate((g.NavWindowingTimer - NAV_WINDOWING_HIGHLIGHT_DELAY) / 0.05f)); // 1.0f
11323 if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Tab, true))
11324 NavUpdateWindowingHighlightWindow(io.KeyShift ? +1 : -1);
11325 if (!io.KeyCtrl)
11326 apply_focus_window = g.NavWindowingTarget;
11327 }
11328
11329 // Keyboard: Press and Release ALT to toggle menu layer
11330 // - Testing that only Alt is tested prevents Alt+Shift or AltGR from toggling menu layer.
11331 // - AltGR is normally Alt+Ctrl but we can't reliably detect it (not all backends/systems/layout emit it as Alt+Ctrl). But even on keyboards without AltGR we don't want Alt+Ctrl to open menu anyway.
11332 const bool nav_keyboard_active = (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard) != 0;
11333 if (nav_keyboard_active && io.KeyMods == ImGuiKeyModFlags_Alt && (io.KeyModsPrev & ImGuiKeyModFlags_Alt) == 0)
11334 {
11335 g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = true;
11336 g.NavInputSource = ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard;
11337 }
11338 if (g.NavWindowingToggleLayer && g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard)
11339 {
11340 // We cancel toggling nav layer when any text has been typed (generally while holding Alt). (See #370)
11341 // We cancel toggling nav layer when other modifiers are pressed. (See #4439)
11342 if (io.InputQueueCharacters.Size > 0 || io.KeyCtrl || io.KeyShift || io.KeySuper)
11343 g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = false;
11344
11345 // Apply layer toggle on release
11346 // Important: we don't assume that Alt was previously held in order to handle loss of focus when backend calls io.AddFocusEvent(false)
11347 // Important: as before version <18314 we lacked an explicit IO event for focus gain/loss, we also compare mouse validity to detect old backends clearing mouse pos on focus loss.
11348 if (!(io.KeyMods & ImGuiKeyModFlags_Alt) && (io.KeyModsPrev & ImGuiKeyModFlags_Alt) && g.NavWindowingToggleLayer)
11349 if (g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap)
11350 if (IsMousePosValid(&io.MousePos) == IsMousePosValid(&io.MousePosPrev))
11351 apply_toggle_layer = true;
11352 if (!io.KeyAlt)
11353 g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = false;
11354 }
11355
11356 // Move window
11357 if (g.NavWindowingTarget && !(g.NavWindowingTarget->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove))
11358 {
11359 ImVec2 move_delta;
11360 if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard && !io.KeyShift)
11361 move_delta = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_RawKeyboard, ImGuiInputReadMode_Down);
11362 if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad)
11363 move_delta = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadLStick, ImGuiInputReadMode_Down);
11364 if (move_delta.x != 0.0f || move_delta.y != 0.0f)
11365 {
11366 const float NAV_MOVE_SPEED = 800.0f;
11367 const float move_speed = ImFloor(NAV_MOVE_SPEED * io.DeltaTime * ImMin(io.DisplayFramebufferScale.x, io.DisplayFramebufferScale.y)); // FIXME: Doesn't handle variable framerate very well
11368 ImGuiWindow* moving_window = g.NavWindowingTarget->RootWindowDockTree;
11369 SetWindowPos(moving_window, moving_window->Pos + move_delta * move_speed, ImGuiCond_Always);
11370 MarkIniSettingsDirty(moving_window);
11371 g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
11372 }
11373 }
11374
11375 // Apply final focus
11376 if (apply_focus_window && (g.NavWindow == NULL || apply_focus_window != g.NavWindow->RootWindow))
11377 {
11378 ImGuiViewport* previous_viewport = g.NavWindow ? g.NavWindow->Viewport : NULL;
11379 ClearActiveID();
11380 NavRestoreHighlightAfterMove();
11381 apply_focus_window = NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(apply_focus_window);
11382 ClosePopupsOverWindow(apply_focus_window, false);
11383 FocusWindow(apply_focus_window);
11384 if (apply_focus_window->NavLastIds[0] == 0)
11385 NavInitWindow(apply_focus_window, false);
11386
11387 // If the window has ONLY a menu layer (no main layer), select it directly
11388 // Use NavLayersActiveMaskNext since windows didn't have a chance to be Begin()-ed on this frame,
11389 // so CTRL+Tab where the keys are only held for 1 frame will be able to use correct layers mask since
11390 // the target window as already been previewed once.
11391 // FIXME-NAV: This should be done in NavInit.. or in FocusWindow... However in both of those cases,
11392 // we won't have a guarantee that windows has been visible before and therefore NavLayersActiveMask*
11393 // won't be valid.
11394 if (apply_focus_window->DC.NavLayersActiveMaskNext == (1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Menu))
11395 g.NavLayer = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
11396
11397 // Request OS level focus
11398 if (apply_focus_window->Viewport != previous_viewport && g.PlatformIO.Platform_SetWindowFocus)
11399 g.PlatformIO.Platform_SetWindowFocus(apply_focus_window->Viewport);
11400 }
11401 if (apply_focus_window)
11402 g.NavWindowingTarget = NULL;
11403
11404 // Apply menu/layer toggle
11405 if (apply_toggle_layer && g.NavWindow)
11406 {
11407 ClearActiveID();
11408
11409 // Move to parent menu if necessary
11410 ImGuiWindow* new_nav_window = g.NavWindow;
11411 while (new_nav_window->ParentWindow
11412 && (new_nav_window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask & (1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Menu)) == 0
11413 && (new_nav_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) != 0
11414 && (new_nav_window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)) == 0)
11415 new_nav_window = new_nav_window->ParentWindow;
11416 if (new_nav_window != g.NavWindow)
11417 {
11418 ImGuiWindow* old_nav_window = g.NavWindow;
11419 FocusWindow(new_nav_window);
11420 new_nav_window->NavLastChildNavWindow = old_nav_window;
11421 }
11422
11423 // Toggle layer
11424 const ImGuiNavLayer new_nav_layer = (g.NavWindow->DC.NavLayersActiveMask & (1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Menu)) ? (ImGuiNavLayer)((int)g.NavLayer ^ 1) : ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
11425 if (new_nav_layer != g.NavLayer)
11426 {
11427 // Reinitialize navigation when entering menu bar with the Alt key (FIXME: could be a properly of the layer?)
11428 const bool preserve_layer_1_nav_id = (new_nav_window->DockNodeAsHost != NULL);
11429 if (new_nav_layer == ImGuiNavLayer_Menu && !preserve_layer_1_nav_id)
11430 g.NavWindow->NavLastIds[new_nav_layer] = 0;
11431 NavRestoreLayer(new_nav_layer);
11432 NavRestoreHighlightAfterMove();
11433 }
11434 }
11435}
11436
11437// Window has already passed the IsWindowNavFocusable()
11438static const char* GetFallbackWindowNameForWindowingList(ImGuiWindow* window)
11439{
11440 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
11441 return "(Popup)";
11442 if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar) && strcmp(window->Name, "##MainMenuBar") == 0)
11443 return "(Main menu bar)";
11444 if (window->DockNodeAsHost)
11445 return "(Dock node)";
11446 return "(Untitled)";
11447}
11448
11449// Overlay displayed when using CTRL+TAB. Called by EndFrame().
11450void ImGui::NavUpdateWindowingOverlay()
11451{
11452 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11453 IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL);
11454
11455 if (g.NavWindowingTimer < NAV_WINDOWING_LIST_APPEAR_DELAY)
11456 return;
11457
11458 if (g.NavWindowingListWindow == NULL)
11459 g.NavWindowingListWindow = FindWindowByName("###NavWindowingList");
11460 const ImGuiViewport* viewport = /*g.NavWindow ? g.NavWindow->Viewport :*/ GetMainViewport();
11461 SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(viewport->Size.x * 0.20f, viewport->Size.y * 0.20f), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX));
11462 SetNextWindowPos(viewport->GetCenter(), ImGuiCond_Always, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
11463 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, g.Style.WindowPadding * 2.0f);
11464 Begin("###NavWindowingList", NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings);
11465 for (int n = g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1; n >= 0; n--)
11466 {
11467 ImGuiWindow* window = g.WindowsFocusOrder[n];
11468 IM_ASSERT(window != NULL); // Fix static analyzers
11469 if (!IsWindowNavFocusable(window))
11470 continue;
11471 const char* label = window->Name;
11472 if (label == FindRenderedTextEnd(label))
11473 label = GetFallbackWindowNameForWindowingList(window);
11474 Selectable(label, g.NavWindowingTarget == window);
11475 }
11476 End();
11477 PopStyleVar();
11478}
11479
11480
11481//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
11482// [SECTION] DRAG AND DROP
11483//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
11484
11485void ImGui::ClearDragDrop()
11486{
11487 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11488 g.DragDropActive = false;
11489 g.DragDropPayload.Clear();
11490 g.DragDropAcceptFlags = ImGuiDragDropFlags_None;
11491 g.DragDropAcceptIdCurr = g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev = 0;
11492 g.DragDropAcceptIdCurrRectSurface = FLT_MAX;
11493 g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount = -1;
11494
11495 g.DragDropPayloadBufHeap.clear();
11496 memset(&g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal, 0, sizeof(g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal));
11497}
11498
11499// When this returns true you need to: a) call SetDragDropPayload() exactly once, b) you may render the payload visual/description, c) call EndDragDropSource()
11500// If the item has an identifier:
11501// - This assume/require the item to be activated (typically via ButtonBehavior).
11502// - Therefore if you want to use this with a mouse button other than left mouse button, it is up to the item itself to activate with another button.
11503// - We then pull and use the mouse button that was used to activate the item and use it to carry on the drag.
11504// If the item has no identifier:
11505// - Currently always assume left mouse button.
11506bool ImGui::BeginDragDropSource(ImGuiDragDropFlags flags)
11507{
11508 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11509 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
11510
11511 // FIXME-DRAGDROP: While in the common-most "drag from non-zero active id" case we can tell the mouse button,
11512 // in both SourceExtern and id==0 cases we may requires something else (explicit flags or some heuristic).
11513 ImGuiMouseButton mouse_button = ImGuiMouseButton_Left;
11514
11515 bool source_drag_active = false;
11516 ImGuiID source_id = 0;
11517 ImGuiID source_parent_id = 0;
11518 if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceExtern))
11519 {
11520 source_id = g.LastItemData.ID;
11521 if (source_id != 0)
11522 {
11523 // Common path: items with ID
11524 if (g.ActiveId != source_id)
11525 return false;
11526 if (g.ActiveIdMouseButton != -1)
11527 mouse_button = g.ActiveIdMouseButton;
11528 if (g.IO.MouseDown[mouse_button] == false || window->SkipItems)
11529 return false;
11530 g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = false;
11531 }
11532 else
11533 {
11534 // Uncommon path: items without ID
11535 if (g.IO.MouseDown[mouse_button] == false || window->SkipItems)
11536 return false;
11537 if ((g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect) == 0 && (g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveIdWindow != window))
11538 return false;
11539
11540 // If you want to use BeginDragDropSource() on an item with no unique identifier for interaction, such as Text() or Image(), you need to:
11541 // A) Read the explanation below, B) Use the ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID flag.
11542 if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID))
11543 {
11544 IM_ASSERT(0);
11545 return false;
11546 }
11547
11548 // Magic fallback to handle items with no assigned ID, e.g. Text(), Image()
11549 // We build a throwaway ID based on current ID stack + relative AABB of items in window.
11550 // THE IDENTIFIER WON'T SURVIVE ANY REPOSITIONING/RESIZINGG OF THE WIDGET, so if your widget moves your dragging operation will be canceled.
11551 // We don't need to maintain/call ClearActiveID() as releasing the button will early out this function and trigger !ActiveIdIsAlive.
11552 // Rely on keeping other window->LastItemXXX fields intact.
11553 source_id = g.LastItemData.ID = window->GetIDFromRectangle(g.LastItemData.Rect);
11554 bool is_hovered = ItemHoverable(g.LastItemData.Rect, source_id);
11555 if (is_hovered && g.IO.MouseClicked[mouse_button])
11556 {
11557 SetActiveID(source_id, window);
11558 FocusWindow(window);
11559 }
11560 if (g.ActiveId == source_id) // Allow the underlying widget to display/return hovered during the mouse release frame, else we would get a flicker.
11561 g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = is_hovered;
11562 }
11563 if (g.ActiveId != source_id)
11564 return false;
11565 source_parent_id = window->IDStack.back();
11566 source_drag_active = IsMouseDragging(mouse_button);
11567
11568 // Disable navigation and key inputs while dragging + cancel existing request if any
11569 SetActiveIdUsingNavAndKeys();
11570 }
11571 else
11572 {
11573 window = NULL;
11574 source_id = ImHashStr("#SourceExtern");
11575 source_drag_active = true;
11576 }
11577
11578 if (source_drag_active)
11579 {
11580 if (!g.DragDropActive)
11581 {
11582 IM_ASSERT(source_id != 0);
11583 ClearDragDrop();
11584 ImGuiPayload& payload = g.DragDropPayload;
11585 payload.SourceId = source_id;
11586 payload.SourceParentId = source_parent_id;
11587 g.DragDropActive = true;
11588 g.DragDropSourceFlags = flags;
11589 g.DragDropMouseButton = mouse_button;
11590 if (payload.SourceId == g.ActiveId)
11591 g.ActiveIdNoClearOnFocusLoss = true;
11592 }
11593 g.DragDropSourceFrameCount = g.FrameCount;
11594 g.DragDropWithinSource = true;
11595
11596 if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip))
11597 {
11598 // Target can request the Source to not display its tooltip (we use a dedicated flag to make this request explicit)
11599 // We unfortunately can't just modify the source flags and skip the call to BeginTooltip, as caller may be emitting contents.
11600 BeginTooltip();
11601 if (g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev && (g.DragDropAcceptFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoPreviewTooltip))
11602 {
11603 ImGuiWindow* tooltip_window = g.CurrentWindow;
11604 tooltip_window->Hidden = tooltip_window->SkipItems = true;
11605 tooltip_window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1;
11606 }
11607 }
11608
11609 if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoDisableHover) && !(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceExtern))
11610 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags &= ~ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect;
11611
11612 return true;
11613 }
11614 return false;
11615}
11616
11617void ImGui::EndDragDropSource()
11618{
11619 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11620 IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropActive);
11621 IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropWithinSource && "Not after a BeginDragDropSource()?");
11622
11623 if (!(g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip))
11624 EndTooltip();
11625
11626 // Discard the drag if have not called SetDragDropPayload()
11627 if (g.DragDropPayload.DataFrameCount == -1)
11628 ClearDragDrop();
11629 g.DragDropWithinSource = false;
11630}
11631
11632// Use 'cond' to choose to submit payload on drag start or every frame
11633bool ImGui::SetDragDropPayload(const char* type, const void* data, size_t data_size, ImGuiCond cond)
11634{
11635 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11636 ImGuiPayload& payload = g.DragDropPayload;
11637 if (cond == 0)
11638 cond = ImGuiCond_Always;
11639
11640 IM_ASSERT(type != NULL);
11641 IM_ASSERT(strlen(type) < IM_ARRAYSIZE(payload.DataType) && "Payload type can be at most 32 characters long");
11642 IM_ASSERT((data != NULL && data_size > 0) || (data == NULL && data_size == 0));
11643 IM_ASSERT(cond == ImGuiCond_Always || cond == ImGuiCond_Once);
11644 IM_ASSERT(payload.SourceId != 0); // Not called between BeginDragDropSource() and EndDragDropSource()
11645
11646 if (cond == ImGuiCond_Always || payload.DataFrameCount == -1)
11647 {
11648 // Copy payload
11649 ImStrncpy(payload.DataType, type, IM_ARRAYSIZE(payload.DataType));
11650 g.DragDropPayloadBufHeap.resize(0);
11651 if (data_size > sizeof(g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal))
11652 {
11653 // Store in heap
11654 g.DragDropPayloadBufHeap.resize((int)data_size);
11655 payload.Data = g.DragDropPayloadBufHeap.Data;
11656 memcpy(payload.Data, data, data_size);
11657 }
11658 else if (data_size > 0)
11659 {
11660 // Store locally
11661 memset(&g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal, 0, sizeof(g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal));
11662 payload.Data = g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal;
11663 memcpy(payload.Data, data, data_size);
11664 }
11665 else
11666 {
11667 payload.Data = NULL;
11668 }
11669 payload.DataSize = (int)data_size;
11670 }
11671 payload.DataFrameCount = g.FrameCount;
11672
11673 // Return whether the payload has been accepted
11674 return (g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount == g.FrameCount) || (g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount == g.FrameCount - 1);
11675}
11676
11677bool ImGui::BeginDragDropTargetCustom(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id)
11678{
11679 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11680 if (!g.DragDropActive)
11681 return false;
11682
11683 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
11684 ImGuiWindow* hovered_window = g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow;
11685 if (hovered_window == NULL || window->RootWindowDockTree != hovered_window->RootWindowDockTree)
11686 return false;
11687 IM_ASSERT(id != 0);
11688 if (!IsMouseHoveringRect(bb.Min, bb.Max) || (id == g.DragDropPayload.SourceId))
11689 return false;
11690 if (window->SkipItems)
11691 return false;
11692
11693 IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropWithinTarget == false);
11694 g.DragDropTargetRect = bb;
11695 g.DragDropTargetId = id;
11696 g.DragDropWithinTarget = true;
11697 return true;
11698}
11699
11700// We don't use BeginDragDropTargetCustom() and duplicate its code because:
11701// 1) we use LastItemRectHoveredRect which handles items that pushes a temporarily clip rectangle in their code. Calling BeginDragDropTargetCustom(LastItemRect) would not handle them.
11702// 2) and it's faster. as this code may be very frequently called, we want to early out as fast as we can.
11703// Also note how the HoveredWindow test is positioned differently in both functions (in both functions we optimize for the cheapest early out case)
11704bool ImGui::BeginDragDropTarget()
11705{
11706 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11707 if (!g.DragDropActive)
11708 return false;
11709
11710 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
11711 if (!(g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect))
11712 return false;
11713 ImGuiWindow* hovered_window = g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow;
11714 if (hovered_window == NULL || window->RootWindowDockTree != hovered_window->RootWindowDockTree || window->SkipItems)
11715 return false;
11716
11717 const ImRect& display_rect = (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDisplayRect) ? g.LastItemData.DisplayRect : g.LastItemData.Rect;
11718 ImGuiID id = g.LastItemData.ID;
11719 if (id == 0)
11720 id = window->GetIDFromRectangle(display_rect);
11721 if (g.DragDropPayload.SourceId == id)
11722 return false;
11723
11724 IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropWithinTarget == false);
11725 g.DragDropTargetRect = display_rect;
11726 g.DragDropTargetId = id;
11727 g.DragDropWithinTarget = true;
11728 return true;
11729}
11730
11731bool ImGui::IsDragDropPayloadBeingAccepted()
11732{
11733 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11734 return g.DragDropActive && g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev != 0;
11735}
11736
11737const ImGuiPayload* ImGui::AcceptDragDropPayload(const char* type, ImGuiDragDropFlags flags)
11738{
11739 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11740 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
11741 ImGuiPayload& payload = g.DragDropPayload;
11742 IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropActive); // Not called between BeginDragDropTarget() and EndDragDropTarget() ?
11743 IM_ASSERT(payload.DataFrameCount != -1); // Forgot to call EndDragDropTarget() ?
11744 if (type != NULL && !payload.IsDataType(type))
11745 return NULL;
11746
11747 // Accept smallest drag target bounding box, this allows us to nest drag targets conveniently without ordering constraints.
11748 // NB: We currently accept NULL id as target. However, overlapping targets requires a unique ID to function!
11749 const bool was_accepted_previously = (g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev == g.DragDropTargetId);
11750 ImRect r = g.DragDropTargetRect;
11751 float r_surface = r.GetWidth() * r.GetHeight();
11752 if (r_surface <= g.DragDropAcceptIdCurrRectSurface)
11753 {
11754 g.DragDropAcceptFlags = flags;
11755 g.DragDropAcceptIdCurr = g.DragDropTargetId;
11756 g.DragDropAcceptIdCurrRectSurface = r_surface;
11757 }
11758
11759 // Render default drop visuals
11760 // FIXME-DRAGDROP: Settle on a proper default visuals for drop target.
11761 payload.Preview = was_accepted_previously;
11762 flags |= (g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect); // Source can also inhibit the preview (useful for external sources that lives for 1 frame)
11763 if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect) && payload.Preview)
11764 window->DrawList->AddRect(r.Min - ImVec2(3.5f,3.5f), r.Max + ImVec2(3.5f, 3.5f), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_DragDropTarget), 0.0f, 0, 2.0f);
11765
11766 g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount = g.FrameCount;
11767 payload.Delivery = was_accepted_previously && !IsMouseDown(g.DragDropMouseButton); // For extern drag sources affecting os window focus, it's easier to just test !IsMouseDown() instead of IsMouseReleased()
11768 if (!payload.Delivery && !(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery))
11769 return NULL;
11770
11771 return &payload;
11772}
11773
11774const ImGuiPayload* ImGui::GetDragDropPayload()
11775{
11776 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11777 return g.DragDropActive ? &g.DragDropPayload : NULL;
11778}
11779
11780// We don't really use/need this now, but added it for the sake of consistency and because we might need it later.
11781void ImGui::EndDragDropTarget()
11782{
11783 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11784 IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropActive);
11785 IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropWithinTarget);
11786 g.DragDropWithinTarget = false;
11787}
11788
11789//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
11790// [SECTION] LOGGING/CAPTURING
11791//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
11792// All text output from the interface can be captured into tty/file/clipboard.
11793// By default, tree nodes are automatically opened during logging.
11794//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
11795
11796// Pass text data straight to log (without being displayed)
11797static inline void LogTextV(ImGuiContext& g, const char* fmt, va_list args)
11798{
11799 if (g.LogFile)
11800 {
11801 g.LogBuffer.Buf.resize(0);
11802 g.LogBuffer.appendfv(fmt, args);
11803 ImFileWrite(g.LogBuffer.c_str(), sizeof(char), (ImU64)g.LogBuffer.size(), g.LogFile);
11804 }
11805 else
11806 {
11807 g.LogBuffer.appendfv(fmt, args);
11808 }
11809}
11810
11811void ImGui::LogText(const char* fmt, ...)
11812{
11813 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11814 if (!g.LogEnabled)
11815 return;
11816
11817 va_list args;
11818 va_start(args, fmt);
11819 LogTextV(g, fmt, args);
11820 va_end(args);
11821}
11822
11823void ImGui::LogTextV(const char* fmt, va_list args)
11824{
11825 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11826 if (!g.LogEnabled)
11827 return;
11828
11829 LogTextV(g, fmt, args);
11830}
11831
11832// Internal version that takes a position to decide on newline placement and pad items according to their depth.
11833// We split text into individual lines to add current tree level padding
11834// FIXME: This code is a little complicated perhaps, considering simplifying the whole system.
11835void ImGui::LogRenderedText(const ImVec2* ref_pos, const char* text, const char* text_end)
11836{
11837 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11838 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
11839
11840 const char* prefix = g.LogNextPrefix;
11841 const char* suffix = g.LogNextSuffix;
11842 g.LogNextPrefix = g.LogNextSuffix = NULL;
11843
11844 if (!text_end)
11845 text_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(text, text_end);
11846
11847 const bool log_new_line = ref_pos && (ref_pos->y > g.LogLinePosY + g.Style.FramePadding.y + 1);
11848 if (ref_pos)
11849 g.LogLinePosY = ref_pos->y;
11850 if (log_new_line)
11851 {
11852 LogText(IM_NEWLINE);
11853 g.LogLineFirstItem = true;
11854 }
11855
11856 if (prefix)
11857 LogRenderedText(ref_pos, prefix, prefix + strlen(prefix)); // Calculate end ourself to ensure "##" are included here.
11858
11859 // Re-adjust padding if we have popped out of our starting depth
11860 if (g.LogDepthRef > window->DC.TreeDepth)
11861 g.LogDepthRef = window->DC.TreeDepth;
11862 const int tree_depth = (window->DC.TreeDepth - g.LogDepthRef);
11863
11864 const char* text_remaining = text;
11865 for (;;)
11866 {
11867 // Split the string. Each new line (after a '\n') is followed by indentation corresponding to the current depth of our log entry.
11868 // We don't add a trailing \n yet to allow a subsequent item on the same line to be captured.
11869 const char* line_start = text_remaining;
11870 const char* line_end = ImStreolRange(line_start, text_end);
11871 const bool is_last_line = (line_end == text_end);
11872 if (line_start != line_end || !is_last_line)
11873 {
11874 const int line_length = (int)(line_end - line_start);
11875 const int indentation = g.LogLineFirstItem ? tree_depth * 4 : 1;
11876 LogText("%*s%.*s", indentation, "", line_length, line_start);
11877 g.LogLineFirstItem = false;
11878 if (*line_end == '\n')
11879 {
11880 LogText(IM_NEWLINE);
11881 g.LogLineFirstItem = true;
11882 }
11883 }
11884 if (is_last_line)
11885 break;
11886 text_remaining = line_end + 1;
11887 }
11888
11889 if (suffix)
11890 LogRenderedText(ref_pos, suffix, suffix + strlen(suffix));
11891}
11892
11893// Start logging/capturing text output
11894void ImGui::LogBegin(ImGuiLogType type, int auto_open_depth)
11895{
11896 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11897 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
11898 IM_ASSERT(g.LogEnabled == false);
11899 IM_ASSERT(g.LogFile == NULL);
11900 IM_ASSERT(g.LogBuffer.empty());
11901 g.LogEnabled = true;
11902 g.LogType = type;
11903 g.LogNextPrefix = g.LogNextSuffix = NULL;
11904 g.LogDepthRef = window->DC.TreeDepth;
11905 g.LogDepthToExpand = ((auto_open_depth >= 0) ? auto_open_depth : g.LogDepthToExpandDefault);
11906 g.LogLinePosY = FLT_MAX;
11907 g.LogLineFirstItem = true;
11908}
11909
11910// Important: doesn't copy underlying data, use carefully (prefix/suffix must be in scope at the time of the next LogRenderedText)
11911void ImGui::LogSetNextTextDecoration(const char* prefix, const char* suffix)
11912{
11913 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11914 g.LogNextPrefix = prefix;
11915 g.LogNextSuffix = suffix;
11916}
11917
11918void ImGui::LogToTTY(int auto_open_depth)
11919{
11920 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11921 if (g.LogEnabled)
11922 return;
11923 IM_UNUSED(auto_open_depth);
11924#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS
11925 LogBegin(ImGuiLogType_TTY, auto_open_depth);
11926 g.LogFile = stdout;
11927#endif
11928}
11929
11930// Start logging/capturing text output to given file
11931void ImGui::LogToFile(int auto_open_depth, const char* filename)
11932{
11933 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11934 if (g.LogEnabled)
11935 return;
11936
11937 // FIXME: We could probably open the file in text mode "at", however note that clipboard/buffer logging will still
11938 // be subject to outputting OS-incompatible carriage return if within strings the user doesn't use IM_NEWLINE.
11939 // By opening the file in binary mode "ab" we have consistent output everywhere.
11940 if (!filename)
11941 filename = g.IO.LogFilename;
11942 if (!filename || !filename[0])
11943 return;
11944 ImFileHandle f = ImFileOpen(filename, "ab");
11945 if (!f)
11946 {
11947 IM_ASSERT(0);
11948 return;
11949 }
11950
11951 LogBegin(ImGuiLogType_File, auto_open_depth);
11952 g.LogFile = f;
11953}
11954
11955// Start logging/capturing text output to clipboard
11956void ImGui::LogToClipboard(int auto_open_depth)
11957{
11958 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11959 if (g.LogEnabled)
11960 return;
11961 LogBegin(ImGuiLogType_Clipboard, auto_open_depth);
11962}
11963
11964void ImGui::LogToBuffer(int auto_open_depth)
11965{
11966 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11967 if (g.LogEnabled)
11968 return;
11969 LogBegin(ImGuiLogType_Buffer, auto_open_depth);
11970}
11971
11972void ImGui::LogFinish()
11973{
11974 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11975 if (!g.LogEnabled)
11976 return;
11977
11978 LogText(IM_NEWLINE);
11979 switch (g.LogType)
11980 {
11981 case ImGuiLogType_TTY:
11982#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS
11983 fflush(g.LogFile);
11984#endif
11985 break;
11986 case ImGuiLogType_File:
11987 ImFileClose(g.LogFile);
11988 break;
11989 case ImGuiLogType_Buffer:
11990 break;
11991 case ImGuiLogType_Clipboard:
11992 if (!g.LogBuffer.empty())
11993 SetClipboardText(g.LogBuffer.begin());
11994 break;
11995 case ImGuiLogType_None:
11996 IM_ASSERT(0);
11997 break;
11998 }
11999
12000 g.LogEnabled = false;
12001 g.LogType = ImGuiLogType_None;
12002 g.LogFile = NULL;
12003 g.LogBuffer.clear();
12004}
12005
12006// Helper to display logging buttons
12007// FIXME-OBSOLETE: We should probably obsolete this and let the user have their own helper (this is one of the oldest function alive!)
12008void ImGui::LogButtons()
12009{
12010 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12011
12012 PushID("LogButtons");
12013#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS
12014 const bool log_to_tty = Button("Log To TTY"); SameLine();
12015#else
12016 const bool log_to_tty = false;
12017#endif
12018 const bool log_to_file = Button("Log To File"); SameLine();
12019 const bool log_to_clipboard = Button("Log To Clipboard"); SameLine();
12020 PushAllowKeyboardFocus(false);
12021 SetNextItemWidth(80.0f);
12022 SliderInt("Default Depth", &g.LogDepthToExpandDefault, 0, 9, NULL);
12023 PopAllowKeyboardFocus();
12024 PopID();
12025
12026 // Start logging at the end of the function so that the buttons don't appear in the log
12027 if (log_to_tty)
12028 LogToTTY();
12029 if (log_to_file)
12030 LogToFile();
12031 if (log_to_clipboard)
12032 LogToClipboard();
12033}
12034
12035
12036//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12037// [SECTION] SETTINGS
12038//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12039// - UpdateSettings() [Internal]
12040// - MarkIniSettingsDirty() [Internal]
12041// - CreateNewWindowSettings() [Internal]
12042// - FindWindowSettings() [Internal]
12043// - FindOrCreateWindowSettings() [Internal]
12044// - FindSettingsHandler() [Internal]
12045// - ClearIniSettings() [Internal]
12046// - LoadIniSettingsFromDisk()
12047// - LoadIniSettingsFromMemory()
12048// - SaveIniSettingsToDisk()
12049// - SaveIniSettingsToMemory()
12050// - WindowSettingsHandler_***() [Internal]
12051//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12052
12053// Called by NewFrame()
12054void ImGui::UpdateSettings()
12055{
12056 // Load settings on first frame (if not explicitly loaded manually before)
12057 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12058 if (!g.SettingsLoaded)
12059 {
12060 IM_ASSERT(g.SettingsWindows.empty());
12061 if (g.IO.IniFilename)
12062 LoadIniSettingsFromDisk(g.IO.IniFilename);
12063 g.SettingsLoaded = true;
12064 }
12065
12066 // Save settings (with a delay after the last modification, so we don't spam disk too much)
12067 if (g.SettingsDirtyTimer > 0.0f)
12068 {
12069 g.SettingsDirtyTimer -= g.IO.DeltaTime;
12070 if (g.SettingsDirtyTimer <= 0.0f)
12071 {
12072 if (g.IO.IniFilename != NULL)
12073 SaveIniSettingsToDisk(g.IO.IniFilename);
12074 else
12075 g.IO.WantSaveIniSettings = true; // Let user know they can call SaveIniSettingsToMemory(). user will need to clear io.WantSaveIniSettings themselves.
12076 g.SettingsDirtyTimer = 0.0f;
12077 }
12078 }
12079}
12080
12081void ImGui::MarkIniSettingsDirty()
12082{
12083 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12084 if (g.SettingsDirtyTimer <= 0.0f)
12085 g.SettingsDirtyTimer = g.IO.IniSavingRate;
12086}
12087
12088void ImGui::MarkIniSettingsDirty(ImGuiWindow* window)
12089{
12090 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12091 if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings))
12092 if (g.SettingsDirtyTimer <= 0.0f)
12093 g.SettingsDirtyTimer = g.IO.IniSavingRate;
12094}
12095
12096ImGuiWindowSettings* ImGui::CreateNewWindowSettings(const char* name)
12097{
12098 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12099
12100#if !IMGUI_DEBUG_INI_SETTINGS
12101 // Skip to the "###" marker if any. We don't skip past to match the behavior of GetID()
12102 // Preserve the full string when IMGUI_DEBUG_INI_SETTINGS is set to make .ini inspection easier.
12103 if (const char* p = strstr(name, "###"))
12104 name = p;
12105#endif
12106 const size_t name_len = strlen(name);
12107
12108 // Allocate chunk
12109 const size_t chunk_size = sizeof(ImGuiWindowSettings) + name_len + 1;
12110 ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.alloc_chunk(chunk_size);
12111 IM_PLACEMENT_NEW(settings) ImGuiWindowSettings();
12112 settings->ID = ImHashStr(name, name_len);
12113 memcpy(settings->GetName(), name, name_len + 1); // Store with zero terminator
12114
12115 return settings;
12116}
12117
12118ImGuiWindowSettings* ImGui::FindWindowSettings(ImGuiID id)
12119{
12120 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12121 for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
12122 if (settings->ID == id)
12123 return settings;
12124 return NULL;
12125}
12126
12127ImGuiWindowSettings* ImGui::FindOrCreateWindowSettings(const char* name)
12128{
12129 if (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = FindWindowSettings(ImHashStr(name)))
12130 return settings;
12131 return CreateNewWindowSettings(name);
12132}
12133
12134ImGuiSettingsHandler* ImGui::FindSettingsHandler(const char* type_name)
12135{
12136 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12137 const ImGuiID type_hash = ImHashStr(type_name);
12138 for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
12139 if (g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].TypeHash == type_hash)
12140 return &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n];
12141 return NULL;
12142}
12143
12144void ImGui::ClearIniSettings()
12145{
12146 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12147 g.SettingsIniData.clear();
12148 for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
12149 if (g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ClearAllFn)
12150 g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ClearAllFn(&g, &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n]);
12151}
12152
12153void ImGui::LoadIniSettingsFromDisk(const char* ini_filename)
12154{
12155 size_t file_data_size = 0;
12156 char* file_data = (char*)ImFileLoadToMemory(ini_filename, "rb", &file_data_size);
12157 if (!file_data)
12158 return;
12159 LoadIniSettingsFromMemory(file_data, (size_t)file_data_size);
12160 IM_FREE(file_data);
12161}
12162
12163// Zero-tolerance, no error reporting, cheap .ini parsing
12164void ImGui::LoadIniSettingsFromMemory(const char* ini_data, size_t ini_size)
12165{
12166 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12167 IM_ASSERT(g.Initialized);
12168 //IM_ASSERT(!g.WithinFrameScope && "Cannot be called between NewFrame() and EndFrame()");
12169 //IM_ASSERT(g.SettingsLoaded == false && g.FrameCount == 0);
12170
12171 // For user convenience, we allow passing a non zero-terminated string (hence the ini_size parameter).
12172 // For our convenience and to make the code simpler, we'll also write zero-terminators within the buffer. So let's create a writable copy..
12173 if (ini_size == 0)
12174 ini_size = strlen(ini_data);
12175 g.SettingsIniData.Buf.resize((int)ini_size + 1);
12176 char* const buf = g.SettingsIniData.Buf.Data;
12177 char* const buf_end = buf + ini_size;
12178 memcpy(buf, ini_data, ini_size);
12179 buf_end[0] = 0;
12180
12181 // Call pre-read handlers
12182 // Some types will clear their data (e.g. dock information) some types will allow merge/override (window)
12183 for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
12184 if (g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ReadInitFn)
12185 g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ReadInitFn(&g, &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n]);
12186
12187 void* entry_data = NULL;
12188 ImGuiSettingsHandler* entry_handler = NULL;
12189
12190 char* line_end = NULL;
12191 for (char* line = buf; line < buf_end; line = line_end + 1)
12192 {
12193 // Skip new lines markers, then find end of the line
12194 while (*line == '\n' || *line == '\r')
12195 line++;
12196 line_end = line;
12197 while (line_end < buf_end && *line_end != '\n' && *line_end != '\r')
12198 line_end++;
12199 line_end[0] = 0;
12200 if (line[0] == ';')
12201 continue;
12202 if (line[0] == '[' && line_end > line && line_end[-1] == ']')
12203 {
12204 // Parse "[Type][Name]". Note that 'Name' can itself contains [] characters, which is acceptable with the current format and parsing code.
12205 line_end[-1] = 0;
12206 const char* name_end = line_end - 1;
12207 const char* type_start = line + 1;
12208 char* type_end = (char*)(void*)ImStrchrRange(type_start, name_end, ']');
12209 const char* name_start = type_end ? ImStrchrRange(type_end + 1, name_end, '[') : NULL;
12210 if (!type_end || !name_start)
12211 continue;
12212 *type_end = 0; // Overwrite first ']'
12213 name_start++; // Skip second '['
12214 entry_handler = FindSettingsHandler(type_start);
12215 entry_data = entry_handler ? entry_handler->ReadOpenFn(&g, entry_handler, name_start) : NULL;
12216 }
12217 else if (entry_handler != NULL && entry_data != NULL)
12218 {
12219 // Let type handler parse the line
12220 entry_handler->ReadLineFn(&g, entry_handler, entry_data, line);
12221 }
12222 }
12223 g.SettingsLoaded = true;
12224
12225 // [DEBUG] Restore untouched copy so it can be browsed in Metrics (not strictly necessary)
12226 memcpy(buf, ini_data, ini_size);
12227
12228 // Call post-read handlers
12229 for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
12230 if (g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ApplyAllFn)
12231 g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ApplyAllFn(&g, &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n]);
12232}
12233
12234void ImGui::SaveIniSettingsToDisk(const char* ini_filename)
12235{
12236 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12237 g.SettingsDirtyTimer = 0.0f;
12238 if (!ini_filename)
12239 return;
12240
12241 size_t ini_data_size = 0;
12242 const char* ini_data = SaveIniSettingsToMemory(&ini_data_size);
12243 ImFileHandle f = ImFileOpen(ini_filename, "wt");
12244 if (!f)
12245 return;
12246 ImFileWrite(ini_data, sizeof(char), ini_data_size, f);
12247 ImFileClose(f);
12248}
12249
12250// Call registered handlers (e.g. SettingsHandlerWindow_WriteAll() + custom handlers) to write their stuff into a text buffer
12251const char* ImGui::SaveIniSettingsToMemory(size_t* out_size)
12252{
12253 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12254 g.SettingsDirtyTimer = 0.0f;
12255 g.SettingsIniData.Buf.resize(0);
12256 g.SettingsIniData.Buf.push_back(0);
12257 for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
12258 {
12259 ImGuiSettingsHandler* handler = &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n];
12260 handler->WriteAllFn(&g, handler, &g.SettingsIniData);
12261 }
12262 if (out_size)
12263 *out_size = (size_t)g.SettingsIniData.size();
12264 return g.SettingsIniData.c_str();
12265}
12266
12267static void WindowSettingsHandler_ClearAll(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler*)
12268{
12269 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
12270 for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
12271 g.Windows[i]->SettingsOffset = -1;
12272 g.SettingsWindows.clear();
12273}
12274
12275static void* WindowSettingsHandler_ReadOpen(ImGuiContext*, ImGuiSettingsHandler*, const char* name)
12276{
12277 ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = ImGui::FindOrCreateWindowSettings(name);
12278 ImGuiID id = settings->ID;
12279 *settings = ImGuiWindowSettings(); // Clear existing if recycling previous entry
12280 settings->ID = id;
12281 settings->WantApply = true;
12282 return (void*)settings;
12283}
12284
12285static void WindowSettingsHandler_ReadLine(ImGuiContext*, ImGuiSettingsHandler*, void* entry, const char* line)
12286{
12287 ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = (ImGuiWindowSettings*)entry;
12288 int x, y;
12289 int i;
12290 ImU32 u1;
12291 if (sscanf(line, "Pos=%i,%i", &x, &y) == 2) { settings->Pos = ImVec2ih((short)x, (short)y); }
12292 else if (sscanf(line, "Size=%i,%i", &x, &y) == 2) { settings->Size = ImVec2ih((short)x, (short)y); }
12293 else if (sscanf(line, "ViewportId=0x%08X", &u1) == 1) { settings->ViewportId = u1; }
12294 else if (sscanf(line, "ViewportPos=%i,%i", &x, &y) == 2){ settings->ViewportPos = ImVec2ih((short)x, (short)y); }
12295 else if (sscanf(line, "Collapsed=%d", &i) == 1) { settings->Collapsed = (i != 0); }
12296 else if (sscanf(line, "DockId=0x%X,%d", &u1, &i) == 2) { settings->DockId = u1; settings->DockOrder = (short)i; }
12297 else if (sscanf(line, "DockId=0x%X", &u1) == 1) { settings->DockId = u1; settings->DockOrder = -1; }
12298 else if (sscanf(line, "ClassId=0x%X", &u1) == 1) { settings->ClassId = u1; }
12299}
12300
12301// Apply to existing windows (if any)
12302static void WindowSettingsHandler_ApplyAll(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler*)
12303{
12304 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
12305 for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
12306 if (settings->WantApply)
12307 {
12308 if (ImGuiWindow* window = ImGui::FindWindowByID(settings->ID))
12309 ApplyWindowSettings(window, settings);
12310 settings->WantApply = false;
12311 }
12312}
12313
12314static void WindowSettingsHandler_WriteAll(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler* handler, ImGuiTextBuffer* buf)
12315{
12316 // Gather data from windows that were active during this session
12317 // (if a window wasn't opened in this session we preserve its settings)
12318 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
12319 for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
12320 {
12321 ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[i];
12322 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings)
12323 continue;
12324
12325 ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = (window->SettingsOffset != -1) ? g.SettingsWindows.ptr_from_offset(window->SettingsOffset) : ImGui::FindWindowSettings(window->ID);
12326 if (!settings)
12327 {
12328 settings = ImGui::CreateNewWindowSettings(window->Name);
12329 window->SettingsOffset = g.SettingsWindows.offset_from_ptr(settings);
12330 }
12331 IM_ASSERT(settings->ID == window->ID);
12332 settings->Pos = ImVec2ih(window->Pos - window->ViewportPos);
12333 settings->Size = ImVec2ih(window->SizeFull);
12334 settings->ViewportId = window->ViewportId;
12335 settings->ViewportPos = ImVec2ih(window->ViewportPos);
12336 IM_ASSERT(window->DockNode == NULL || window->DockNode->ID == window->DockId);
12337 settings->DockId = window->DockId;
12338 settings->ClassId = window->WindowClass.ClassId;
12339 settings->DockOrder = window->DockOrder;
12340 settings->Collapsed = window->Collapsed;
12341 }
12342
12343 // Write to text buffer
12344 buf->reserve(buf->size() + g.SettingsWindows.size() * 6); // ballpark reserve
12345 for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
12346 {
12347 const char* settings_name = settings->GetName();
12348 buf->appendf("[%s][%s]\n", handler->TypeName, settings_name);
12349 if (settings->ViewportId != 0 && settings->ViewportId != ImGui::IMGUI_VIEWPORT_DEFAULT_ID)
12350 {
12351 buf->appendf("ViewportPos=%d,%d\n", settings->ViewportPos.x, settings->ViewportPos.y);
12352 buf->appendf("ViewportId=0x%08X\n", settings->ViewportId);
12353 }
12354 if (settings->Pos.x != 0 || settings->Pos.y != 0 || settings->ViewportId == ImGui::IMGUI_VIEWPORT_DEFAULT_ID)
12355 buf->appendf("Pos=%d,%d\n", settings->Pos.x, settings->Pos.y);
12356 if (settings->Size.x != 0 || settings->Size.y != 0)
12357 buf->appendf("Size=%d,%d\n", settings->Size.x, settings->Size.y);
12358 buf->appendf("Collapsed=%d\n", settings->Collapsed);
12359 if (settings->DockId != 0)
12360 {
12361 if (settings->DockOrder == -1)
12362 buf->appendf("DockId=0x%08X\n", settings->DockId);
12363 else
12364 buf->appendf("DockId=0x%08X,%d\n", settings->DockId, settings->DockOrder);
12365 if (settings->ClassId != 0)
12366 buf->appendf("ClassId=0x%08X\n", settings->ClassId);
12367 }
12368 buf->append("\n");
12369 }
12370}
12371
12372
12373//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12374// [SECTION] VIEWPORTS, PLATFORM WINDOWS
12375//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12376// - GetMainViewport()
12377// - FindViewportByID()
12378// - FindViewportByPlatformHandle()
12379// - SetCurrentViewport() [Internal]
12380// - SetWindowViewport() [Internal]
12381// - GetWindowAlwaysWantOwnViewport() [Internal]
12382// - UpdateTryMergeWindowIntoHostViewport() [Internal]
12383// - UpdateTryMergeWindowIntoHostViewports() [Internal]
12384// - TranslateWindowsInViewport() [Internal]
12385// - ScaleWindowsInViewport() [Internal]
12386// - FindHoveredViewportFromPlatformWindowStack() [Internal]
12387// - UpdateViewportsNewFrame() [Internal]
12388// - UpdateViewportsEndFrame() [Internal]
12389// - AddUpdateViewport() [Internal]
12390// - WindowSelectViewport() [Internal]
12391// - WindowSyncOwnedViewport() [Internal]
12392// - UpdatePlatformWindows()
12393// - RenderPlatformWindowsDefault()
12394// - FindPlatformMonitorForPos() [Internal]
12395// - FindPlatformMonitorForRect() [Internal]
12396// - UpdateViewportPlatformMonitor() [Internal]
12397// - DestroyPlatformWindow() [Internal]
12398// - DestroyPlatformWindows()
12399//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12400
12401ImGuiViewport* ImGui::GetMainViewport()
12402{
12403 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12404 return g.Viewports[0];
12405}
12406
12407// FIXME: This leaks access to viewports not listed in PlatformIO.Viewports[]. Problematic? (#4236)
12408ImGuiViewport* ImGui::FindViewportByID(ImGuiID id)
12409{
12410 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12411 for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
12412 if (g.Viewports[n]->ID == id)
12413 return g.Viewports[n];
12414 return NULL;
12415}
12416
12417ImGuiViewport* ImGui::FindViewportByPlatformHandle(void* platform_handle)
12418{
12419 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12420 for (int i = 0; i != g.Viewports.Size; i++)
12421 if (g.Viewports[i]->PlatformHandle == platform_handle)
12422 return g.Viewports[i];
12423 return NULL;
12424}
12425
12426void ImGui::SetCurrentViewport(ImGuiWindow* current_window, ImGuiViewportP* viewport)
12427{
12428 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12429 (void)current_window;
12430
12431 if (viewport)
12432 viewport->LastFrameActive = g.FrameCount;
12433 if (g.CurrentViewport == viewport)
12434 return;
12435 g.CurrentDpiScale = viewport ? viewport->DpiScale : 1.0f;
12436 g.CurrentViewport = viewport;
12437 //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_VIEWPORT("SetCurrentViewport changed '%s' 0x%08X\n", current_window ? current_window->Name : NULL, viewport ? viewport->ID : 0);
12438
12439 // Notify platform layer of viewport changes
12440 // FIXME-DPI: This is only currently used for experimenting with handling of multiple DPI
12441 if (g.CurrentViewport && g.PlatformIO.Platform_OnChangedViewport)
12442 g.PlatformIO.Platform_OnChangedViewport(g.CurrentViewport);
12443}
12444
12445static void SetWindowViewport(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiViewportP* viewport)
12446{
12447 // Abandon viewport
12448 if (window->ViewportOwned && window->Viewport->Window == window)
12449 window->Viewport->Size = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
12450
12451 window->Viewport = viewport;
12452 window->ViewportId = viewport->ID;
12453 window->ViewportOwned = (viewport->Window == window);
12454}
12455
12456static bool ImGui::GetWindowAlwaysWantOwnViewport(ImGuiWindow* window)
12457{
12458 // Tooltips and menus are not automatically forced into their own viewport when the NoMerge flag is set, however the multiplication of viewports makes them more likely to protrude and create their own.
12459 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12460 if (g.IO.ConfigViewportsNoAutoMerge || (window->WindowClass.ViewportFlagsOverrideSet & ImGuiViewportFlags_NoAutoMerge))
12461 if (g.ConfigFlagsCurrFrame & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable)
12462 if (!window->DockIsActive)
12463 if ((window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu | ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)) == 0)
12464 if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) == 0 || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal) != 0)
12465 return true;
12466 return false;
12467}
12468
12469static bool ImGui::UpdateTryMergeWindowIntoHostViewport(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiViewportP* viewport)
12470{
12471 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12472 if (window->Viewport == viewport)
12473 return false;
12474 if ((viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_CanHostOtherWindows) == 0)
12475 return false;
12476 if ((viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized) != 0)
12477 return false;
12478 if (!viewport->GetMainRect().Contains(window->Rect()))
12479 return false;
12480 if (GetWindowAlwaysWantOwnViewport(window))
12481 return false;
12482
12483 // FIXME: Can't use g.WindowsFocusOrder[] for root windows only as we care about Z order. If we maintained a DisplayOrder along with FocusOrder we could..
12484 for (int n = 0; n < g.Windows.Size; n++)
12485 {
12486 ImGuiWindow* window_behind = g.Windows[n];
12487 if (window_behind == window)
12488 break;
12489 if (window_behind->WasActive && window_behind->ViewportOwned && !(window_behind->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow))
12490 if (window_behind->Viewport->GetMainRect().Overlaps(window->Rect()))
12491 return false;
12492 }
12493
12494 // Move to the existing viewport, Move child/hosted windows as well (FIXME-OPT: iterate child)
12495 ImGuiViewportP* old_viewport = window->Viewport;
12496 if (window->ViewportOwned)
12497 for (int n = 0; n < g.Windows.Size; n++)
12498 if (g.Windows[n]->Viewport == old_viewport)
12499 SetWindowViewport(g.Windows[n], viewport);
12500 SetWindowViewport(window, viewport);
12501 BringWindowToDisplayFront(window);
12502
12503 return true;
12504}
12505
12506// FIXME: handle 0 to N host viewports
12507static bool ImGui::UpdateTryMergeWindowIntoHostViewports(ImGuiWindow* window)
12508{
12509 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12510 return UpdateTryMergeWindowIntoHostViewport(window, g.Viewports[0]);
12511}
12512
12513// Translate Dear ImGui windows when a Host Viewport has been moved
12514// (This additionally keeps windows at the same place when ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable is toggled!)
12515void ImGui::TranslateWindowsInViewport(ImGuiViewportP* viewport, const ImVec2& old_pos, const ImVec2& new_pos)
12516{
12517 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12518 IM_ASSERT(viewport->Window == NULL && (viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_CanHostOtherWindows));
12519
12520 // 1) We test if ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable was just toggled, which allows us to conveniently
12521 // translate imgui windows from OS-window-local to absolute coordinates or vice-versa.
12522 // 2) If it's not going to fit into the new size, keep it at same absolute position.
12523 // One problem with this is that most Win32 applications doesn't update their render while dragging,
12524 // and so the window will appear to teleport when releasing the mouse.
12525 const bool translate_all_windows = (g.ConfigFlagsCurrFrame & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable) != (g.ConfigFlagsLastFrame & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable);
12526 ImRect test_still_fit_rect(old_pos, old_pos + viewport->Size);
12527 ImVec2 delta_pos = new_pos - old_pos;
12528 for (int window_n = 0; window_n < g.Windows.Size; window_n++) // FIXME-OPT
12529 if (translate_all_windows || (g.Windows[window_n]->Viewport == viewport && test_still_fit_rect.Contains(g.Windows[window_n]->Rect())))
12530 TranslateWindow(g.Windows[window_n], delta_pos);
12531}
12532
12533// Scale all windows (position, size). Use when e.g. changing DPI. (This is a lossy operation!)
12534void ImGui::ScaleWindowsInViewport(ImGuiViewportP* viewport, float scale)
12535{
12536 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12537 if (viewport->Window)
12538 {
12539 ScaleWindow(viewport->Window, scale);
12540 }
12541 else
12542 {
12543 for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
12544 if (g.Windows[i]->Viewport == viewport)
12545 ScaleWindow(g.Windows[i], scale);
12546 }
12547}
12548
12549// If the backend doesn't set MouseLastHoveredViewport or doesn't honor ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs, we do a search ourselves.
12550// A) It won't take account of the possibility that non-imgui windows may be in-between our dragged window and our target window.
12551// B) It requires Platform_GetWindowFocus to be implemented by backend.
12552ImGuiViewportP* ImGui::FindHoveredViewportFromPlatformWindowStack(const ImVec2& mouse_platform_pos)
12553{
12554 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12555 ImGuiViewportP* best_candidate = NULL;
12556 for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
12557 {
12558 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
12559 if (!(viewport->Flags & (ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized)) && viewport->GetMainRect().Contains(mouse_platform_pos))
12560 if (best_candidate == NULL || best_candidate->LastFrontMostStampCount < viewport->LastFrontMostStampCount)
12561 best_candidate = viewport;
12562 }
12563 return best_candidate;
12564}
12565
12566// Update viewports and monitor infos
12567// Note that this is running even if 'ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable' is not set, in order to clear unused viewports (if any) and update monitor info.
12568static void ImGui::UpdateViewportsNewFrame()
12569{
12570 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12571 IM_ASSERT(g.PlatformIO.Viewports.Size <= g.Viewports.Size);
12572
12573 // Update Minimized status (we need it first in order to decide if we'll apply Pos/Size of the main viewport)
12574 const bool viewports_enabled = (g.ConfigFlagsCurrFrame & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable) != 0;
12575 if (viewports_enabled)
12576 {
12577 for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
12578 {
12579 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
12580 const bool platform_funcs_available = viewport->PlatformWindowCreated;
12581 if (g.PlatformIO.Platform_GetWindowMinimized && platform_funcs_available)
12582 {
12583 bool minimized = g.PlatformIO.Platform_GetWindowMinimized(viewport);
12584 if (minimized)
12585 viewport->Flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized;
12586 else
12587 viewport->Flags &= ~ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized;
12588 }
12589 }
12590 }
12591
12592 // Create/update main viewport with current platform position.
12593 // FIXME-VIEWPORT: Size is driven by backend/user code for backward-compatibility but we should aim to make this more consistent.
12594 ImGuiViewportP* main_viewport = g.Viewports[0];
12595 IM_ASSERT(main_viewport->ID == IMGUI_VIEWPORT_DEFAULT_ID);
12596 IM_ASSERT(main_viewport->Window == NULL);
12597 ImVec2 main_viewport_pos = viewports_enabled ? g.PlatformIO.Platform_GetWindowPos(main_viewport) : ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
12598 ImVec2 main_viewport_size = g.IO.DisplaySize;
12599 if (viewports_enabled && (main_viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized))
12600 {
12601 main_viewport_pos = main_viewport->Pos; // Preserve last pos/size when minimized (FIXME: We don't do the same for Size outside of the viewport path)
12602 main_viewport_size = main_viewport->Size;
12603 }
12604 AddUpdateViewport(NULL, IMGUI_VIEWPORT_DEFAULT_ID, main_viewport_pos, main_viewport_size, ImGuiViewportFlags_OwnedByApp | ImGuiViewportFlags_CanHostOtherWindows);
12605
12606 g.CurrentDpiScale = 0.0f;
12607 g.CurrentViewport = NULL;
12608 g.MouseViewport = NULL;
12609 for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
12610 {
12611 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
12612 viewport->Idx = n;
12613
12614 // Erase unused viewports
12615 if (n > 0 && viewport->LastFrameActive < g.FrameCount - 2)
12616 {
12617 DestroyViewport(viewport);
12618 n--;
12619 continue;
12620 }
12621
12622 const bool platform_funcs_available = viewport->PlatformWindowCreated;
12623 if (viewports_enabled)
12624 {
12625 // Update Position and Size (from Platform Window to ImGui) if requested.
12626 // We do it early in the frame instead of waiting for UpdatePlatformWindows() to avoid a frame of lag when moving/resizing using OS facilities.
12627 if (!(viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized) && platform_funcs_available)
12628 {
12629 // Viewport->WorkPos and WorkSize will be updated below
12630 if (viewport->PlatformRequestMove)
12631 viewport->Pos = viewport->LastPlatformPos = g.PlatformIO.Platform_GetWindowPos(viewport);
12632 if (viewport->PlatformRequestResize)
12633 viewport->Size = viewport->LastPlatformSize = g.PlatformIO.Platform_GetWindowSize(viewport);
12634 }
12635 }
12636
12637 // Update/copy monitor info
12638 UpdateViewportPlatformMonitor(viewport);
12639
12640 // Lock down space taken by menu bars and status bars, reset the offset for functions like BeginMainMenuBar() to alter them again.
12641 viewport->WorkOffsetMin = viewport->BuildWorkOffsetMin;
12642 viewport->WorkOffsetMax = viewport->BuildWorkOffsetMax;
12643 viewport->BuildWorkOffsetMin = viewport->BuildWorkOffsetMax = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
12644 viewport->UpdateWorkRect();
12645
12646 // Reset alpha every frame. Users of transparency (docking) needs to request a lower alpha back.
12647 viewport->Alpha = 1.0f;
12648
12649 // Translate Dear ImGui windows when a Host Viewport has been moved
12650 // (This additionally keeps windows at the same place when ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable is toggled!)
12651 const ImVec2 viewport_delta_pos = viewport->Pos - viewport->LastPos;
12652 if ((viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_CanHostOtherWindows) && (viewport_delta_pos.x != 0.0f || viewport_delta_pos.y != 0.0f))
12653 TranslateWindowsInViewport(viewport, viewport->LastPos, viewport->Pos);
12654
12655 // Update DPI scale
12656 float new_dpi_scale;
12657 if (g.PlatformIO.Platform_GetWindowDpiScale && platform_funcs_available)
12658 new_dpi_scale = g.PlatformIO.Platform_GetWindowDpiScale(viewport);
12659 else if (viewport->PlatformMonitor != -1)
12660 new_dpi_scale = g.PlatformIO.Monitors[viewport->PlatformMonitor].DpiScale;
12661 else
12662 new_dpi_scale = (viewport->DpiScale != 0.0f) ? viewport->DpiScale : 1.0f;
12663 if (viewport->DpiScale != 0.0f && new_dpi_scale != viewport->DpiScale)
12664 {
12665 float scale_factor = new_dpi_scale / viewport->DpiScale;
12666 if (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_DpiEnableScaleViewports)
12667 ScaleWindowsInViewport(viewport, scale_factor);
12668 //if (viewport == GetMainViewport())
12669 // g.PlatformInterface.SetWindowSize(viewport, viewport->Size * scale_factor);
12670
12671 // Scale our window moving pivot so that the window will rescale roughly around the mouse position.
12672 // FIXME-VIEWPORT: This currently creates a resizing feedback loop when a window is straddling a DPI transition border.
12673 // (Minor: since our sizes do not perfectly linearly scale, deferring the click offset scale until we know the actual window scale ratio may get us slightly more precise mouse positioning.)
12674 //if (g.MovingWindow != NULL && g.MovingWindow->Viewport == viewport)
12675 // g.ActiveIdClickOffset = ImFloor(g.ActiveIdClickOffset * scale_factor);
12676 }
12677 viewport->DpiScale = new_dpi_scale;
12678 }
12679
12680 // Update fallback monitor
12681 if (g.PlatformIO.Monitors.Size == 0)
12682 {
12683 ImGuiPlatformMonitor* monitor = &g.FallbackMonitor;
12684 monitor->MainPos = main_viewport->Pos;
12685 monitor->MainSize = main_viewport->Size;
12686 monitor->WorkPos = main_viewport->WorkPos;
12687 monitor->WorkSize = main_viewport->WorkSize;
12688 monitor->DpiScale = main_viewport->DpiScale;
12689 }
12690
12691 if (!viewports_enabled)
12692 {
12693 g.MouseViewport = main_viewport;
12694 return;
12695 }
12696
12697 // Mouse handling: decide on the actual mouse viewport for this frame between the active/focused viewport and the hovered viewport.
12698 // Note that 'viewport_hovered' should skip over any viewport that has the ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs flags set.
12699 ImGuiViewportP* viewport_hovered = NULL;
12700 if (g.IO.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport)
12701 {
12702 viewport_hovered = g.IO.MouseHoveredViewport ? (ImGuiViewportP*)FindViewportByID(g.IO.MouseHoveredViewport) : NULL;
12703 if (viewport_hovered && (viewport_hovered->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs))
12704 {
12705 // Backend failed at honoring its contract if it returned a viewport with the _NoInputs flag.
12706 IM_ASSERT(0);
12707 viewport_hovered = FindHoveredViewportFromPlatformWindowStack(g.IO.MousePos);
12708 }
12709 }
12710 else
12711 {
12712 // If the backend doesn't know how to honor ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs, we do a search ourselves. Note that this search:
12713 // A) won't take account of the possibility that non-imgui windows may be in-between our dragged window and our target window.
12714 // B) uses LastFrameAsRefViewport as a flawed replacement for the last time a window was focused (we could/should fix that by introducing Focus functions in PlatformIO)
12715 viewport_hovered = FindHoveredViewportFromPlatformWindowStack(g.IO.MousePos);
12716 }
12717 if (viewport_hovered != NULL)
12718 g.MouseLastHoveredViewport = viewport_hovered;
12719 else if (g.MouseLastHoveredViewport == NULL)
12720 g.MouseLastHoveredViewport = g.Viewports[0];
12721
12722 // Update mouse reference viewport
12723 // (when moving a window we aim at its viewport, but this will be overwritten below if we go in drag and drop mode)
12724 // (MovingViewport->Viewport will be NULL in the rare situation where the window disappared while moving, set UpdateMouseMovingWindowNewFrame() for details)
12725 if (g.MovingWindow && g.MovingWindow->Viewport)
12726 g.MouseViewport = g.MovingWindow->Viewport;
12727 else
12728 g.MouseViewport = g.MouseLastHoveredViewport;
12729
12730 // When dragging something, always refer to the last hovered viewport.
12731 // - when releasing a moving window we will revert to aiming behind (at viewport_hovered)
12732 // - when we are between viewports, our dragged preview will tend to show in the last viewport _even_ if we don't have tooltips in their viewports (when lacking monitor info)
12733 // - consider the case of holding on a menu item to browse child menus: even thou a mouse button is held, there's no active id because menu items only react on mouse release.
12734 // FIXME-VIEWPORT: This is essentially broken, when ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport is set we want to trust when viewport_hovered==NULL and use that.
12735 const bool is_mouse_dragging_with_an_expected_destination = g.DragDropActive;
12736 if (is_mouse_dragging_with_an_expected_destination && viewport_hovered == NULL)
12737 viewport_hovered = g.MouseLastHoveredViewport;
12738 if (is_mouse_dragging_with_an_expected_destination || g.ActiveId == 0 || !IsAnyMouseDown())
12739 if (viewport_hovered != NULL && viewport_hovered != g.MouseViewport && !(viewport_hovered->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs))
12740 g.MouseViewport = viewport_hovered;
12741
12742 IM_ASSERT(g.MouseViewport != NULL);
12743}
12744
12745// Update user-facing viewport list (g.Viewports -> g.PlatformIO.Viewports after filtering out some)
12746static void ImGui::UpdateViewportsEndFrame()
12747{
12748 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12749 g.PlatformIO.Viewports.resize(0);
12750 for (int i = 0; i < g.Viewports.Size; i++)
12751 {
12752 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[i];
12753 viewport->LastPos = viewport->Pos;
12754 if (viewport->LastFrameActive < g.FrameCount || viewport->Size.x <= 0.0f || viewport->Size.y <= 0.0f)
12755 if (i > 0) // Always include main viewport in the list
12756 continue;
12757 if (viewport->Window && !IsWindowActiveAndVisible(viewport->Window))
12758 continue;
12759 if (i > 0)
12760 IM_ASSERT(viewport->Window != NULL);
12761 g.PlatformIO.Viewports.push_back(viewport);
12762 }
12763 g.Viewports[0]->ClearRequestFlags(); // Clear main viewport flags because UpdatePlatformWindows() won't do it and may not even be called
12764}
12765
12766// FIXME: We should ideally refactor the system to call this every frame (we currently don't)
12767ImGuiViewportP* ImGui::AddUpdateViewport(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& pos, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiViewportFlags flags)
12768{
12769 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12770 IM_ASSERT(id != 0);
12771
12772 flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_IsPlatformWindow;
12773 if (window != NULL)
12774 {
12775 if (g.MovingWindow && g.MovingWindow->RootWindowDockTree == window)
12776 flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing;
12777 if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs) && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
12778 flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs;
12779 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing)
12780 flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing;
12781 }
12782
12783 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = (ImGuiViewportP*)FindViewportByID(id);
12784 if (viewport)
12785 {
12786 if (!viewport->PlatformRequestMove)
12787 viewport->Pos = pos;
12788 if (!viewport->PlatformRequestResize)
12789 viewport->Size = size;
12790 viewport->Flags = flags | (viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized); // Preserve existing flags
12791 }
12792 else
12793 {
12794 // New viewport
12795 viewport = IM_NEW(ImGuiViewportP)();
12796 viewport->ID = id;
12797 viewport->Idx = g.Viewports.Size;
12798 viewport->Pos = viewport->LastPos = pos;
12799 viewport->Size = size;
12800 viewport->Flags = flags;
12801 UpdateViewportPlatformMonitor(viewport);
12802 g.Viewports.push_back(viewport);
12803 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_VIEWPORT("Add Viewport %08X (%s)\n", id, window->Name);
12804
12805 // We normally setup for all viewports in NewFrame() but here need to handle the mid-frame creation of a new viewport.
12806 // We need to extend the fullscreen clip rect so the OverlayDrawList clip is correct for that the first frame
12807 g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen.x = ImMin(g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen.x, viewport->Pos.x);
12808 g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen.y = ImMin(g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen.y, viewport->Pos.y);
12809 g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen.z = ImMax(g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen.z, viewport->Pos.x + viewport->Size.x);
12810 g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen.w = ImMax(g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen.w, viewport->Pos.y + viewport->Size.y);
12811
12812 // Store initial DpiScale before the OS platform window creation, based on expected monitor data.
12813 // This is so we can select an appropriate font size on the first frame of our window lifetime
12814 if (viewport->PlatformMonitor != -1)
12815 viewport->DpiScale = g.PlatformIO.Monitors[viewport->PlatformMonitor].DpiScale;
12816 }
12817
12818 viewport->Window = window;
12819 viewport->LastFrameActive = g.FrameCount;
12820 viewport->UpdateWorkRect();
12821 IM_ASSERT(window == NULL || viewport->ID == window->ID);
12822
12823 if (window != NULL)
12824 window->ViewportOwned = true;
12825
12826 return viewport;
12827}
12828
12829static void ImGui::DestroyViewport(ImGuiViewportP* viewport)
12830{
12831 // Clear references to this viewport in windows (window->ViewportId becomes the master data)
12832 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12833 for (int window_n = 0; window_n < g.Windows.Size; window_n++)
12834 {
12835 ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[window_n];
12836 if (window->Viewport != viewport)
12837 continue;
12838 window->Viewport = NULL;
12839 window->ViewportOwned = false;
12840 }
12841 if (viewport == g.MouseLastHoveredViewport)
12842 g.MouseLastHoveredViewport = NULL;
12843
12844 // Destroy
12845 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_VIEWPORT("Delete Viewport %08X (%s)\n", viewport->ID, viewport->Window ? viewport->Window->Name : "n/a");
12846 DestroyPlatformWindow(viewport); // In most circumstances the platform window will already be destroyed here.
12847 IM_ASSERT(g.PlatformIO.Viewports.contains(viewport) == false);
12848 IM_ASSERT(g.Viewports[viewport->Idx] == viewport);
12849 g.Viewports.erase(g.Viewports.Data + viewport->Idx);
12850 IM_DELETE(viewport);
12851}
12852
12853// FIXME-VIEWPORT: This is all super messy and ought to be clarified or rewritten.
12854static void ImGui::WindowSelectViewport(ImGuiWindow* window)
12855{
12856 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12857 ImGuiWindowFlags flags = window->Flags;
12858 window->ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend = -1;
12859
12860 // Restore main viewport if multi-viewport is not supported by the backend
12861 ImGuiViewportP* main_viewport = (ImGuiViewportP*)(void*)GetMainViewport();
12862 if (!(g.ConfigFlagsCurrFrame & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable))
12863 {
12864 SetWindowViewport(window, main_viewport);
12865 return;
12866 }
12867 window->ViewportOwned = false;
12868
12869 // Appearing popups reset their viewport so they can inherit again
12870 if ((flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)) && window->Appearing)
12871 {
12872 window->Viewport = NULL;
12873 window->ViewportId = 0;
12874 }
12875
12876 if ((g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasViewport) == 0)
12877 {
12878 // By default inherit from parent window
12879 if (window->Viewport == NULL && window->ParentWindow && (!window->ParentWindow->IsFallbackWindow || window->ParentWindow->WasActive))
12880 window->Viewport = window->ParentWindow->Viewport;
12881
12882 // Attempt to restore saved viewport id (= window that hasn't been activated yet), try to restore the viewport based on saved 'window->ViewportPos' restored from .ini file
12883 if (window->Viewport == NULL && window->ViewportId != 0)
12884 {
12885 window->Viewport = (ImGuiViewportP*)FindViewportByID(window->ViewportId);
12886 if (window->Viewport == NULL && window->ViewportPos.x != FLT_MAX && window->ViewportPos.y != FLT_MAX)
12887 window->Viewport = AddUpdateViewport(window, window->ID, window->ViewportPos, window->Size, ImGuiViewportFlags_None);
12888 }
12889 }
12890
12891 bool lock_viewport = false;
12892 if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasViewport)
12893 {
12894 // Code explicitly request a viewport
12895 window->Viewport = (ImGuiViewportP*)FindViewportByID(g.NextWindowData.ViewportId);
12896 window->ViewportId = g.NextWindowData.ViewportId; // Store ID even if Viewport isn't resolved yet.
12897 lock_viewport = true;
12898 }
12899 else if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) || (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
12900 {
12901 // Always inherit viewport from parent window
12902 if (window->DockNode && window->DockNode->HostWindow)
12903 IM_ASSERT(window->DockNode->HostWindow->Viewport == window->ParentWindow->Viewport);
12904 window->Viewport = window->ParentWindow->Viewport;
12905 }
12906 else if (window->DockNode && window->DockNode->HostWindow)
12907 {
12908 // This covers the "always inherit viewport from parent window" case for when a window reattach to a node that was just created mid-frame
12909 window->Viewport = window->DockNode->HostWindow->Viewport;
12910 }
12911 else if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)
12912 {
12913 window->Viewport = g.MouseViewport;
12914 }
12915 else if (GetWindowAlwaysWantOwnViewport(window))
12916 {
12917 window->Viewport = AddUpdateViewport(window, window->ID, window->Pos, window->Size, ImGuiViewportFlags_None);
12918 }
12919 else if (g.MovingWindow && g.MovingWindow->RootWindowDockTree == window && IsMousePosValid())
12920 {
12921 if (window->Viewport != NULL && window->Viewport->Window == window)
12922 window->Viewport = AddUpdateViewport(window, window->ID, window->Pos, window->Size, ImGuiViewportFlags_None);
12923 }
12924 else
12925 {
12926 // Merge into host viewport?
12927 // We cannot test window->ViewportOwned as it set lower in the function.
12928 bool try_to_merge_into_host_viewport = (window->Viewport && window == window->Viewport->Window && g.ActiveId == 0);
12929 if (try_to_merge_into_host_viewport)
12930 UpdateTryMergeWindowIntoHostViewports(window);
12931 }
12932
