12933 // Fallback: merge in default viewport if z-order matches, otherwise create a new viewport
12934 if (window->Viewport == NULL)
12935 if (!UpdateTryMergeWindowIntoHostViewport(window, main_viewport))
12936 window->Viewport = AddUpdateViewport(window, window->ID, window->Pos, window->Size, ImGuiViewportFlags_None);
12937
12938 // Mark window as allowed to protrude outside of its viewport and into the current monitor
12939 if (!lock_viewport)
12940 {
12941 if (flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup))
12942 {
12943 // We need to take account of the possibility that mouse may become invalid.
12944 // Popups/Tooltip always set ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend so GetWindowAllowedExtentRect() will return full monitor bounds.
12945 ImVec2 mouse_ref = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) ? g.IO.MousePos : g.BeginPopupStack.back().OpenMousePos;
12946 bool use_mouse_ref = (g.NavDisableHighlight || !g.NavDisableMouseHover || !g.NavWindow);
12947 bool mouse_valid = IsMousePosValid(&mouse_ref);
12948 if ((window->Appearing || (flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))) && (!use_mouse_ref || mouse_valid))
12949 window->ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend = FindPlatformMonitorForPos((use_mouse_ref && mouse_valid) ? mouse_ref : NavCalcPreferredRefPos());
12950 else
12951 window->ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend = window->Viewport->PlatformMonitor;
12952 }
12953 else if (window->Viewport && window != window->Viewport->Window && window->Viewport->Window && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && window->DockNode == NULL)
12954 {
12955 // When called from Begin() we don't have access to a proper version of the Hidden flag yet, so we replicate this code.
12956 const bool will_be_visible = (window->DockIsActive && !window->DockTabIsVisible) ? false : true;
12957 if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost) && window->Viewport->LastFrameActive < g.FrameCount && will_be_visible)
12958 {
12959 // Steal/transfer ownership
12960 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_VIEWPORT("Window '%s' steal Viewport %08X from Window '%s'\n", window->Name, window->Viewport->ID, window->Viewport->Window->Name);
12961 window->Viewport->Window = window;
12962 window->Viewport->ID = window->ID;
12963 window->Viewport->LastNameHash = 0;
12964 }
12965 else if (!UpdateTryMergeWindowIntoHostViewports(window)) // Merge?
12966 {
12967 // New viewport
12968 window->Viewport = AddUpdateViewport(window, window->ID, window->Pos, window->Size, ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing);
12969 }
12970 }
12971 else if (window->ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend < 0 && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) == 0)
12972 {
12973 // Regular (non-child, non-popup) windows by default are also allowed to protrude
12974 // Child windows are kept contained within their parent.
12975 window->ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend = window->Viewport->PlatformMonitor;
12976 }
12977 }
12978
12979 // Update flags
12980 window->ViewportOwned = (window == window->Viewport->Window);
12981 window->ViewportId = window->Viewport->ID;
12982
12983 // If the OS window has a title bar, hide our imgui title bar
12984 //if (window->ViewportOwned && !(window->Viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_NoDecoration))
12985 // window->Flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar;
12986}
12987
12988void ImGui::WindowSyncOwnedViewport(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiWindow* parent_window_in_stack)
12989{
12990 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12991
12992 bool viewport_rect_changed = false;
12993
12994 // Synchronize window --> viewport in most situations
12995 // Synchronize viewport -> window in case the platform window has been moved or resized from the OS/WM
12996 if (window->Viewport->PlatformRequestMove)
12997 {
12998 window->Pos = window->Viewport->Pos;
12999 MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
13000 }
13001 else if (memcmp(&window->Viewport->Pos, &window->Pos, sizeof(window->Pos)) != 0)
13002 {
13003 viewport_rect_changed = true;
13004 window->Viewport->Pos = window->Pos;
13005 }
13006
13007 if (window->Viewport->PlatformRequestResize)
13008 {
13009 window->Size = window->SizeFull = window->Viewport->Size;
13010 MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
13011 }
13012 else if (memcmp(&window->Viewport->Size, &window->Size, sizeof(window->Size)) != 0)
13013 {
13014 viewport_rect_changed = true;
13015 window->Viewport->Size = window->Size;
13016 }
13017 window->Viewport->UpdateWorkRect();
13018
13019 // The viewport may have changed monitor since the global update in UpdateViewportsNewFrame()
13020 // Either a SetNextWindowPos() call in the current frame or a SetWindowPos() call in the previous frame may have this effect.
13021 if (viewport_rect_changed)
13022 UpdateViewportPlatformMonitor(window->Viewport);
13023
13024 // Update common viewport flags
13025 const ImGuiViewportFlags viewport_flags_to_clear = ImGuiViewportFlags_TopMost | ImGuiViewportFlags_NoTaskBarIcon | ImGuiViewportFlags_NoDecoration | ImGuiViewportFlags_NoRendererClear;
13026 ImGuiViewportFlags viewport_flags = window->Viewport->Flags & ~viewport_flags_to_clear;
13027 ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = window->Flags;
13028 const bool is_modal = (window_flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal) != 0;
13029 const bool is_short_lived_floating_window = (window_flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu | ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)) != 0;
13030 if (window_flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)
13031 viewport_flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_TopMost;
13032 if ((g.IO.ConfigViewportsNoTaskBarIcon || is_short_lived_floating_window) && !is_modal)
13033 viewport_flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_NoTaskBarIcon;
13034 if (g.IO.ConfigViewportsNoDecoration || is_short_lived_floating_window)
13035 viewport_flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_NoDecoration;
13036
13037 // Not correct to set modal as topmost because:
13038 // - Because other popups can be stacked above a modal (e.g. combo box in a modal)
13039 // - ImGuiViewportFlags_TopMost is currently handled different in backends: in Win32 it is "appear top most" whereas in GLFW and SDL it is "stay topmost"
13040 //if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)
13041 // viewport_flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_TopMost;
13042
13043 // For popups and menus that may be protruding out of their parent viewport, we enable _NoFocusOnClick so that clicking on them
13044 // won't steal the OS focus away from their parent window (which may be reflected in OS the title bar decoration).
13045 // Setting _NoFocusOnClick would technically prevent us from bringing back to front in case they are being covered by an OS window from a different app,
13046 // but it shouldn't be much of a problem considering those are already popups that are closed when clicking elsewhere.
13047 if (is_short_lived_floating_window && !is_modal)
13048 viewport_flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing | ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnClick;
13049
13050 // We can overwrite viewport flags using ImGuiWindowClass (advanced users)
13051 if (window->WindowClass.ViewportFlagsOverrideSet)
13052 viewport_flags |= window->WindowClass.ViewportFlagsOverrideSet;
13053 if (window->WindowClass.ViewportFlagsOverrideClear)
13054 viewport_flags &= ~window->WindowClass.ViewportFlagsOverrideClear;
13055
13056 // We can also tell the backend that clearing the platform window won't be necessary,
13057 // as our window background is filling the viewport and we have disabled BgAlpha.
13058 // FIXME: Work on support for per-viewport transparency (#2766)
13059 if (!(window_flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground))
13060 viewport_flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_NoRendererClear;
13061
13062 window->Viewport->Flags = viewport_flags;
13063
13064 // Update parent viewport ID
13065 // (the !IsFallbackWindow test mimic the one done in WindowSelectViewport())
13066 if (window->WindowClass.ParentViewportId != (ImGuiID)-1)
13067 window->Viewport->ParentViewportId = window->WindowClass.ParentViewportId;
13068 else if ((window_flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)) && parent_window_in_stack && (!parent_window_in_stack->IsFallbackWindow || parent_window_in_stack->WasActive))
13069 window->Viewport->ParentViewportId = parent_window_in_stack->Viewport->ID;
13070 else
13071 window->Viewport->ParentViewportId = g.IO.ConfigViewportsNoDefaultParent ? 0 : IMGUI_VIEWPORT_DEFAULT_ID;
13072}
13073
13074// Called by user at the end of the main loop, after EndFrame()
13075// This will handle the creation/update of all OS windows via function defined in the ImGuiPlatformIO api.
13076void ImGui::UpdatePlatformWindows()
13077{
13078 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
13079 IM_ASSERT(g.FrameCountEnded == g.FrameCount && "Forgot to call Render() or EndFrame() before UpdatePlatformWindows()?");
13080 IM_ASSERT(g.FrameCountPlatformEnded < g.FrameCount);
13081 g.FrameCountPlatformEnded = g.FrameCount;
13082 if (!(g.ConfigFlagsCurrFrame & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable))
13083 return;
13084
13085 // Create/resize/destroy platform windows to match each active viewport.
13086 // Skip the main viewport (index 0), which is always fully handled by the application!
13087 for (int i = 1; i < g.Viewports.Size; i++)
13088 {
13089 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[i];
13090
13091 // Destroy platform window if the viewport hasn't been submitted or if it is hosting a hidden window
13092 // (the implicit/fallback Debug##Default window will be registering its viewport then be disabled, causing a dummy DestroyPlatformWindow to be made each frame)
13093 bool destroy_platform_window = false;
13094 destroy_platform_window |= (viewport->LastFrameActive < g.FrameCount - 1);
13095 destroy_platform_window |= (viewport->Window && !IsWindowActiveAndVisible(viewport->Window));
13096 if (destroy_platform_window)
13097 {
13098 DestroyPlatformWindow(viewport);
13099 continue;
13100 }
13101
13102 // New windows that appears directly in a new viewport won't always have a size on their first frame
13103 if (viewport->LastFrameActive < g.FrameCount || viewport->Size.x <= 0 || viewport->Size.y <= 0)
13104 continue;
13105
13106 // Create window
13107 bool is_new_platform_window = (viewport->PlatformWindowCreated == false);
13108 if (is_new_platform_window)
13109 {
13110 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_VIEWPORT("Create Platform Window %08X (%s)\n", viewport->ID, viewport->Window ? viewport->Window->Name : "n/a");
13111 g.PlatformIO.Platform_CreateWindow(viewport);
13112 if (g.PlatformIO.Renderer_CreateWindow != NULL)
13113 g.PlatformIO.Renderer_CreateWindow(viewport);
13114 viewport->LastNameHash = 0;
13115 viewport->LastPlatformPos = viewport->LastPlatformSize = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX); // By clearing those we'll enforce a call to Platform_SetWindowPos/Size below, before Platform_ShowWindow (FIXME: Is that necessary?)
13116 viewport->LastRendererSize = viewport->Size; // We don't need to call Renderer_SetWindowSize() as it is expected Renderer_CreateWindow() already did it.
13117 viewport->PlatformWindowCreated = true;
13118 }
13119
13120 // Apply Position and Size (from ImGui to Platform/Renderer backends)
13121 if ((viewport->LastPlatformPos.x != viewport->Pos.x || viewport->LastPlatformPos.y != viewport->Pos.y) && !viewport->PlatformRequestMove)
13122 g.PlatformIO.Platform_SetWindowPos(viewport, viewport->Pos);
13123 if ((viewport->LastPlatformSize.x != viewport->Size.x || viewport->LastPlatformSize.y != viewport->Size.y) && !viewport->PlatformRequestResize)
13124 g.PlatformIO.Platform_SetWindowSize(viewport, viewport->Size);
13125 if ((viewport->LastRendererSize.x != viewport->Size.x || viewport->LastRendererSize.y != viewport->Size.y) && g.PlatformIO.Renderer_SetWindowSize)
13126 g.PlatformIO.Renderer_SetWindowSize(viewport, viewport->Size);
13127 viewport->LastPlatformPos = viewport->Pos;
13128 viewport->LastPlatformSize = viewport->LastRendererSize = viewport->Size;
13129
13130 // Update title bar (if it changed)
13131 if (ImGuiWindow* window_for_title = GetWindowForTitleDisplay(viewport->Window))
13132 {
13133 const char* title_begin = window_for_title->Name;
13134 char* title_end = (char*)(intptr_t)FindRenderedTextEnd(title_begin);
13135 const ImGuiID title_hash = ImHashStr(title_begin, title_end - title_begin);
13136 if (viewport->LastNameHash != title_hash)
13137 {
13138 char title_end_backup_c = *title_end;
13139 *title_end = 0; // Cut existing buffer short instead of doing an alloc/free, no small gain.
13140 g.PlatformIO.Platform_SetWindowTitle(viewport, title_begin);
13141 *title_end = title_end_backup_c;
13142 viewport->LastNameHash = title_hash;
13143 }
13144 }
13145
13146 // Update alpha (if it changed)
13147 if (viewport->LastAlpha != viewport->Alpha && g.PlatformIO.Platform_SetWindowAlpha)
13148 g.PlatformIO.Platform_SetWindowAlpha(viewport, viewport->Alpha);
13149 viewport->LastAlpha = viewport->Alpha;
13150
13151 // Optional, general purpose call to allow the backend to perform general book-keeping even if things haven't changed.
13152 if (g.PlatformIO.Platform_UpdateWindow)
13153 g.PlatformIO.Platform_UpdateWindow(viewport);
13154
13155 if (is_new_platform_window)
13156 {
13157 // On startup ensure new platform window don't steal focus (give it a few frames, as nested contents may lead to viewport being created a few frames late)
13158 if (g.FrameCount < 3)
13159 viewport->Flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing;
13160
13161 // Show window
13162 g.PlatformIO.Platform_ShowWindow(viewport);
13163
13164 // Even without focus, we assume the window becomes front-most.
13165 // This is useful for our platform z-order heuristic when io.MouseHoveredViewport is not available.
13166 if (viewport->LastFrontMostStampCount != g.ViewportFrontMostStampCount)
13167 viewport->LastFrontMostStampCount = ++g.ViewportFrontMostStampCount;
13168 }
13169
13170 // Clear request flags
13171 viewport->ClearRequestFlags();
13172 }
13173
13174 // Update our implicit z-order knowledge of platform windows, which is used when the backend cannot provide io.MouseHoveredViewport.
13175 // When setting Platform_GetWindowFocus, it is expected that the platform backend can handle calls without crashing if it doesn't have data stored.
13176 // FIXME-VIEWPORT: We should use this information to also set dear imgui-side focus, allowing us to handle os-level alt+tab.
13177 if (g.PlatformIO.Platform_GetWindowFocus != NULL)
13178 {
13179 ImGuiViewportP* focused_viewport = NULL;
13180 for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size && focused_viewport == NULL; n++)
13181 {
13182 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
13183 if (viewport->PlatformWindowCreated)
13184 if (g.PlatformIO.Platform_GetWindowFocus(viewport))
13185 focused_viewport = viewport;
13186 }
13187
13188 // Store a tag so we can infer z-order easily from all our windows
13189 // We compare PlatformLastFocusedViewportId so newly created viewports with _NoFocusOnAppearing flag
13190 // will keep the front most stamp instead of losing it back to their parent viewport.
13191 if (focused_viewport && g.PlatformLastFocusedViewportId != focused_viewport->ID)
13192 {
13193 if (focused_viewport->LastFrontMostStampCount != g.ViewportFrontMostStampCount)
13194 focused_viewport->LastFrontMostStampCount = ++g.ViewportFrontMostStampCount;
13195 g.PlatformLastFocusedViewportId = focused_viewport->ID;
13196 }
13197 }
13198}
13199
13200// This is a default/basic function for performing the rendering/swap of multiple Platform Windows.
13201// Custom renderers may prefer to not call this function at all, and instead iterate the publicly exposed platform data and handle rendering/sync themselves.
13202// The Render/Swap functions stored in ImGuiPlatformIO are merely here to allow for this helper to exist, but you can do it yourself:
13203//
13204// ImGuiPlatformIO& platform_io = ImGui::GetPlatformIO();
13205// for (int i = 1; i < platform_io.Viewports.Size; i++)
13206// if ((platform_io.Viewports[i]->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized) == 0)
13207// MyRenderFunction(platform_io.Viewports[i], my_args);
13208// for (int i = 1; i < platform_io.Viewports.Size; i++)
13209// if ((platform_io.Viewports[i]->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized) == 0)
13210// MySwapBufferFunction(platform_io.Viewports[i], my_args);
13211//
13212void ImGui::RenderPlatformWindowsDefault(void* platform_render_arg, void* renderer_render_arg)
13213{
13214 // Skip the main viewport (index 0), which is always fully handled by the application!
13215 ImGuiPlatformIO& platform_io = ImGui::GetPlatformIO();
13216 for (int i = 1; i < platform_io.Viewports.Size; i++)
13217 {
13218 ImGuiViewport* viewport = platform_io.Viewports[i];
13219 if (viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized)
13220 continue;
13221 if (platform_io.Platform_RenderWindow) platform_io.Platform_RenderWindow(viewport, platform_render_arg);
13222 if (platform_io.Renderer_RenderWindow) platform_io.Renderer_RenderWindow(viewport, renderer_render_arg);
13223 }
13224 for (int i = 1; i < platform_io.Viewports.Size; i++)
13225 {
13226 ImGuiViewport* viewport = platform_io.Viewports[i];
13227 if (viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized)
13228 continue;
13229 if (platform_io.Platform_SwapBuffers) platform_io.Platform_SwapBuffers(viewport, platform_render_arg);
13230 if (platform_io.Renderer_SwapBuffers) platform_io.Renderer_SwapBuffers(viewport, renderer_render_arg);
13231 }
13232}
13233
13234static int ImGui::FindPlatformMonitorForPos(const ImVec2& pos)
13235{
13236 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
13237 for (int monitor_n = 0; monitor_n < g.PlatformIO.Monitors.Size; monitor_n++)
13238 {
13239 const ImGuiPlatformMonitor& monitor = g.PlatformIO.Monitors[monitor_n];
13240 if (ImRect(monitor.MainPos, monitor.MainPos + monitor.MainSize).Contains(pos))
13241 return monitor_n;
13242 }
13243 return -1;
13244}
13245
13246// Search for the monitor with the largest intersection area with the given rectangle
13247// We generally try to avoid searching loops but the monitor count should be very small here
13248// FIXME-OPT: We could test the last monitor used for that viewport first, and early
13249static int ImGui::FindPlatformMonitorForRect(const ImRect& rect)
13250{
13251 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
13252
13253 const int monitor_count = g.PlatformIO.Monitors.Size;
13254 if (monitor_count <= 1)
13255 return monitor_count - 1;
13256
13257 // Use a minimum threshold of 1.0f so a zero-sized rect won't false positive, and will still find the correct monitor given its position.
13258 // This is necessary for tooltips which always resize down to zero at first.
13259 const float surface_threshold = ImMax(rect.GetWidth() * rect.GetHeight() * 0.5f, 1.0f);
13260 int best_monitor_n = -1;
13261 float best_monitor_surface = 0.001f;
13262
13263 for (int monitor_n = 0; monitor_n < g.PlatformIO.Monitors.Size && best_monitor_surface < surface_threshold; monitor_n++)
13264 {
13265 const ImGuiPlatformMonitor& monitor = g.PlatformIO.Monitors[monitor_n];
13266 const ImRect monitor_rect = ImRect(monitor.MainPos, monitor.MainPos + monitor.MainSize);
13267 if (monitor_rect.Contains(rect))
13268 return monitor_n;
13269 ImRect overlapping_rect = rect;
13270 overlapping_rect.ClipWithFull(monitor_rect);
13271 float overlapping_surface = overlapping_rect.GetWidth() * overlapping_rect.GetHeight();
13272 if (overlapping_surface < best_monitor_surface)
13273 continue;
13274 best_monitor_surface = overlapping_surface;
13275 best_monitor_n = monitor_n;
13276 }
13277 return best_monitor_n;
13278}
13279
13280// Update monitor from viewport rectangle (we'll use this info to clamp windows and save windows lost in a removed monitor)
13281static void ImGui::UpdateViewportPlatformMonitor(ImGuiViewportP* viewport)
13282{
13283 viewport->PlatformMonitor = (short)FindPlatformMonitorForRect(viewport->GetMainRect());
13284}
13285
13286// Return value is always != NULL, but don't hold on it across frames.
13287const ImGuiPlatformMonitor* ImGui::GetViewportPlatformMonitor(ImGuiViewport* viewport_p)
13288{
13289 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
13290 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = (ImGuiViewportP*)(void*)viewport_p;
13291 int monitor_idx = viewport->PlatformMonitor;
13292 if (monitor_idx >= 0 && monitor_idx < g.PlatformIO.Monitors.Size)
13293 return &g.PlatformIO.Monitors[monitor_idx];
13294 return &g.FallbackMonitor;
13295}
13296
13297void ImGui::DestroyPlatformWindow(ImGuiViewportP* viewport)
13298{
13299 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
13300 if (viewport->PlatformWindowCreated)
13301 {
13302 if (g.PlatformIO.Renderer_DestroyWindow)
13303 g.PlatformIO.Renderer_DestroyWindow(viewport);
13304 if (g.PlatformIO.Platform_DestroyWindow)
13305 g.PlatformIO.Platform_DestroyWindow(viewport);
13306 IM_ASSERT(viewport->RendererUserData == NULL && viewport->PlatformUserData == NULL);
13307
13308 // Don't clear PlatformWindowCreated for the main viewport, as we initially set that up to true in Initialize()
13309 // The righter way may be to leave it to the backend to set this flag all-together, and made the flag public.
13310 if (viewport->ID != IMGUI_VIEWPORT_DEFAULT_ID)
13311 viewport->PlatformWindowCreated = false;
13312 }
13313 else
13314 {
13315 IM_ASSERT(viewport->RendererUserData == NULL && viewport->PlatformUserData == NULL && viewport->PlatformHandle == NULL);
13316 }
13317 viewport->RendererUserData = viewport->PlatformUserData = viewport->PlatformHandle = NULL;
13318 viewport->ClearRequestFlags();
13319}
13320
13321void ImGui::DestroyPlatformWindows()
13322{
13323 // We call the destroy window on every viewport (including the main viewport, index 0) to give a chance to the backend
13324 // to clear any data they may have stored in e.g. PlatformUserData, RendererUserData.
13325 // It is convenient for the platform backend code to store something in the main viewport, in order for e.g. the mouse handling
13326 // code to operator a consistent manner.
13327 // It is expected that the backend can handle calls to Renderer_DestroyWindow/Platform_DestroyWindow without
13328 // crashing if it doesn't have data stored.
13329 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
13330 for (int i = 0; i < g.Viewports.Size; i++)
13331 DestroyPlatformWindow(g.Viewports[i]);
13332}
13333
13334
13335//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13336// [SECTION] DOCKING
13337//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13338// Docking: Internal Types
13339// Docking: Forward Declarations
13340// Docking: ImGuiDockContext
13341// Docking: ImGuiDockContext Docking/Undocking functions
13342// Docking: ImGuiDockNode
13343// Docking: ImGuiDockNode Tree manipulation functions
13344// Docking: Public Functions (SetWindowDock, DockSpace, DockSpaceOverViewport)
13345// Docking: Builder Functions
13346// Docking: Begin/End Support Functions (called from Begin/End)
13347// Docking: Settings
13348//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13349
13350//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13351// Typical Docking call flow: (root level is generally public API):
13352//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13353// - NewFrame() new dear imgui frame
13354// | DockContextNewFrameUpdateUndocking() - process queued undocking requests
13355// | - DockContextProcessUndockWindow() - process one window undocking request
13356// | - DockContextProcessUndockNode() - process one whole node undocking request
13357// | DockContextNewFrameUpdateUndocking() - process queue docking requests, create floating dock nodes
13358// | - update g.HoveredDockNode - [debug] update node hovered by mouse
13359// | - DockContextProcessDock() - process one docking request
13360// | - DockNodeUpdate()
13361// | - DockNodeUpdateForRootNode()
13362// | - DockNodeUpdateFlagsAndCollapse()
13363// | - DockNodeFindInfo()
13364// | - destroy unused node or tab bar
13365// | - create dock node host window
13366// | - Begin() etc.
13367// | - DockNodeStartMouseMovingWindow()
13368// | - DockNodeTreeUpdatePosSize()
13369// | - DockNodeTreeUpdateSplitter()
13370// | - draw node background
13371// | - DockNodeUpdateTabBar() - create/update tab bar for a docking node
13372// | - DockNodeAddTabBar()
13373// | - DockNodeUpdateWindowMenu()
13374// | - DockNodeCalcTabBarLayout()
13375// | - BeginTabBarEx()
13376// | - TabItemEx() calls
13377// | - EndTabBar()
13378// | - BeginDockableDragDropTarget()
13379// | - DockNodeUpdate() - recurse into child nodes...
13380//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13381// - DockSpace() user submit a dockspace into a window
13382// | Begin(Child) - create a child window
13383// | DockNodeUpdate() - call main dock node update function
13384// | End(Child)
13385// | ItemSize()
13386//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13387// - Begin()
13388// | BeginDocked()
13389// | BeginDockableDragDropSource()
13390// | BeginDockableDragDropTarget()
13391// | - DockNodePreviewDockRender()
13392//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13393// - EndFrame()
13394// | DockContextEndFrame()
13395//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13396
13397//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13398// Docking: Internal Types
13399//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13400// - ImGuiDockRequestType
13401// - ImGuiDockRequest
13402// - ImGuiDockPreviewData
13403// - ImGuiDockNodeSettings
13404// - ImGuiDockContext
13405//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13406
13407enum ImGuiDockRequestType
13408{
13409 ImGuiDockRequestType_None = 0,
13410 ImGuiDockRequestType_Dock,
13411 ImGuiDockRequestType_Undock,
13412 ImGuiDockRequestType_Split // Split is the same as Dock but without a DockPayload
13413};
13414
13415struct ImGuiDockRequest
13416{
13417 ImGuiDockRequestType Type;
13418 ImGuiWindow* DockTargetWindow; // Destination/Target Window to dock into (may be a loose window or a DockNode, might be NULL in which case DockTargetNode cannot be NULL)
13419 ImGuiDockNode* DockTargetNode; // Destination/Target Node to dock into
13420 ImGuiWindow* DockPayload; // Source/Payload window to dock (may be a loose window or a DockNode), [Optional]
13421 ImGuiDir DockSplitDir;
13422 float DockSplitRatio;
13423 bool DockSplitOuter;
13424 ImGuiWindow* UndockTargetWindow;
13425 ImGuiDockNode* UndockTargetNode;
13426
13427 ImGuiDockRequest()
13428 {
13429 Type = ImGuiDockRequestType_None;
13430 DockTargetWindow = DockPayload = UndockTargetWindow = NULL;
13431 DockTargetNode = UndockTargetNode = NULL;
13432 DockSplitDir = ImGuiDir_None;
13433 DockSplitRatio = 0.5f;
13434 DockSplitOuter = false;
13435 }
13436};
13437
13438struct ImGuiDockPreviewData
13439{
13440 ImGuiDockNode FutureNode;
13441 bool IsDropAllowed;
13442 bool IsCenterAvailable;
13443 bool IsSidesAvailable; // Hold your breath, grammar freaks..
13444 bool IsSplitDirExplicit; // Set when hovered the drop rect (vs. implicit SplitDir==None when hovered the window)
13445 ImGuiDockNode* SplitNode;
13446 ImGuiDir SplitDir;
13447 float SplitRatio;
13448 ImRect DropRectsDraw[ImGuiDir_COUNT + 1]; // May be slightly different from hit-testing drop rects used in DockNodeCalcDropRects()
13449
13450 ImGuiDockPreviewData() : FutureNode(0) { IsDropAllowed = IsCenterAvailable = IsSidesAvailable = IsSplitDirExplicit = false; SplitNode = NULL; SplitDir = ImGuiDir_None; SplitRatio = 0.f; for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(DropRectsDraw); n++) DropRectsDraw[n] = ImRect(+FLT_MAX, +FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX); }
13451};
13452
13453// Persistent Settings data, stored contiguously in SettingsNodes (sizeof() ~32 bytes)
13454struct ImGuiDockNodeSettings
13455{
13456 ImGuiID ID;
13457 ImGuiID ParentNodeId;
13458 ImGuiID ParentWindowId;
13459 ImGuiID SelectedTabId;
13460 signed char SplitAxis;
13461 char Depth;
13462 ImGuiDockNodeFlags Flags; // NB: We save individual flags one by one in ascii format (ImGuiDockNodeFlags_SavedFlagsMask_)
13463 ImVec2ih Pos;
13464 ImVec2ih Size;
13465 ImVec2ih SizeRef;
13466 ImGuiDockNodeSettings() { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); SplitAxis = ImGuiAxis_None; }
13467};
13468
13469//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13470// Docking: Forward Declarations
13471//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13472
13473namespace ImGui
13474{
13475 // ImGuiDockContext
13476 static ImGuiDockNode* DockContextAddNode(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiID id);
13477 static void DockContextRemoveNode(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNode* node, bool merge_sibling_into_parent_node);
13478 static void DockContextQueueNotifyRemovedNode(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNode* node);
13479 static void DockContextProcessDock(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockRequest* req);
13480 static void DockContextProcessUndockWindow(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiWindow* window, bool clear_persistent_docking_ref = true);
13481 static void DockContextProcessUndockNode(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNode* node);
13482 static void DockContextPruneUnusedSettingsNodes(ImGuiContext* ctx);
13483 static ImGuiDockNode* DockContextFindNodeByID(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiID id);
13484 static ImGuiDockNode* DockContextBindNodeToWindow(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiWindow* window);
13485 static void DockContextBuildNodesFromSettings(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNodeSettings* node_settings_array, int node_settings_count);
13486 static void DockContextBuildAddWindowsToNodes(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiID root_id); // Use root_id==0 to add all
13487
13488 // ImGuiDockNode
13489 static void DockNodeAddWindow(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiWindow* window, bool add_to_tab_bar);
13490 static void DockNodeMoveWindows(ImGuiDockNode* dst_node, ImGuiDockNode* src_node);
13491 static void DockNodeMoveChildNodes(ImGuiDockNode* dst_node, ImGuiDockNode* src_node);
13492 static ImGuiWindow* DockNodeFindWindowByID(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiID id);
13493 static void DockNodeApplyPosSizeToWindows(ImGuiDockNode* node);
13494 static void DockNodeRemoveWindow(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiID save_dock_id);
13495 static void DockNodeHideHostWindow(ImGuiDockNode* node);
13496 static void DockNodeUpdate(ImGuiDockNode* node);
13497 static void DockNodeUpdateForRootNode(ImGuiDockNode* node);
13498 static void DockNodeUpdateFlagsAndCollapse(ImGuiDockNode* node);
13499 static void DockNodeUpdateHasCentralNodeChild(ImGuiDockNode* node);
13500 static void DockNodeUpdateTabBar(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiWindow* host_window);
13501 static void DockNodeAddTabBar(ImGuiDockNode* node);
13502 static void DockNodeRemoveTabBar(ImGuiDockNode* node);
13503 static ImGuiID DockNodeUpdateWindowMenu(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar);
13504 static void DockNodeUpdateVisibleFlag(ImGuiDockNode* node);
13505 static void DockNodeStartMouseMovingWindow(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiWindow* window);
13506 static bool DockNodeIsDropAllowed(ImGuiWindow* host_window, ImGuiWindow* payload_window);
13507 static void DockNodePreviewDockSetup(ImGuiWindow* host_window, ImGuiDockNode* host_node, ImGuiWindow* payload_window, ImGuiDockPreviewData* preview_data, bool is_explicit_target, bool is_outer_docking);
13508 static void DockNodePreviewDockRender(ImGuiWindow* host_window, ImGuiDockNode* host_node, ImGuiWindow* payload_window, const ImGuiDockPreviewData* preview_data);
13509 static void DockNodeCalcTabBarLayout(const ImGuiDockNode* node, ImRect* out_title_rect, ImRect* out_tab_bar_rect, ImVec2* out_window_menu_button_pos, ImVec2* out_close_button_pos);
13510 static void DockNodeCalcSplitRects(ImVec2& pos_old, ImVec2& size_old, ImVec2& pos_new, ImVec2& size_new, ImGuiDir dir, ImVec2 size_new_desired);
13511 static bool DockNodeCalcDropRectsAndTestMousePos(const ImRect& parent, ImGuiDir dir, ImRect& out_draw, bool outer_docking, ImVec2* test_mouse_pos);
13512 static const char* DockNodeGetHostWindowTitle(ImGuiDockNode* node, char* buf, int buf_size) { ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, "##DockNode_%02X", node->ID); return buf; }
13513 static int DockNodeGetTabOrder(ImGuiWindow* window);
13514
13515 // ImGuiDockNode tree manipulations
13516 static void DockNodeTreeSplit(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNode* parent_node, ImGuiAxis split_axis, int split_first_child, float split_ratio, ImGuiDockNode* new_node);
13517 static void DockNodeTreeMerge(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNode* parent_node, ImGuiDockNode* merge_lead_child);
13518 static void DockNodeTreeUpdatePosSize(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImVec2 pos, ImVec2 size, ImGuiDockNode* only_write_to_single_node = NULL);
13519 static void DockNodeTreeUpdateSplitter(ImGuiDockNode* node);
13520 static ImGuiDockNode* DockNodeTreeFindVisibleNodeByPos(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImVec2 pos);
13521 static ImGuiDockNode* DockNodeTreeFindFallbackLeafNode(ImGuiDockNode* node);
13522
13523 // Settings
13524 static void DockSettingsRenameNodeReferences(ImGuiID old_node_id, ImGuiID new_node_id);
13525 static void DockSettingsRemoveNodeReferences(ImGuiID* node_ids, int node_ids_count);
13526 static ImGuiDockNodeSettings* DockSettingsFindNodeSettings(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiID node_id);
13527 static void DockSettingsHandler_ClearAll(ImGuiContext*, ImGuiSettingsHandler*);
13528 static void DockSettingsHandler_ApplyAll(ImGuiContext*, ImGuiSettingsHandler*);
13529 static void* DockSettingsHandler_ReadOpen(ImGuiContext*, ImGuiSettingsHandler*, const char* name);
13530 static void DockSettingsHandler_ReadLine(ImGuiContext*, ImGuiSettingsHandler*, void* entry, const char* line);
13531 static void DockSettingsHandler_WriteAll(ImGuiContext* imgui_ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler* handler, ImGuiTextBuffer* buf);
13532}
13533
13534//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13535// Docking: ImGuiDockContext
13536//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13537// The lifetime model is different from the one of regular windows: we always create a ImGuiDockNode for each ImGuiDockNodeSettings,
13538// or we always hold the entire docking node tree. Nodes are frequently hidden, e.g. if the window(s) or child nodes they host are not active.
13539// At boot time only, we run a simple GC to remove nodes that have no references.
13540// Because dock node settings (which are small, contiguous structures) are always mirrored by their corresponding dock nodes (more complete structures),
13541// we can also very easily recreate the nodes from scratch given the settings data (this is what DockContextRebuild() does).
13542// This is convenient as docking reconfiguration can be implemented by mostly poking at the simpler settings data.
13543//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13544// - DockContextInitialize()
13545// - DockContextShutdown()
13546// - DockContextClearNodes()
13547// - DockContextRebuildNodes()
13548// - DockContextNewFrameUpdateUndocking()
13549// - DockContextNewFrameUpdateDocking()
13550// - DockContextEndFrame()
13551// - DockContextFindNodeByID()
13552// - DockContextBindNodeToWindow()
13553// - DockContextGenNodeID()
13554// - DockContextAddNode()
13555// - DockContextRemoveNode()
13556// - ImGuiDockContextPruneNodeData
13557// - DockContextPruneUnusedSettingsNodes()
13558// - DockContextBuildNodesFromSettings()
13559// - DockContextBuildAddWindowsToNodes()
13560//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13561
13562void ImGui::DockContextInitialize(ImGuiContext* ctx)
13563{
13564 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
13565
13566 // Add .ini handle for persistent docking data
13567 ImGuiSettingsHandler ini_handler;
13568 ini_handler.TypeName = "Docking";
13569 ini_handler.TypeHash = ImHashStr("Docking");
13570 ini_handler.ClearAllFn = DockSettingsHandler_ClearAll;
13571 ini_handler.ReadInitFn = DockSettingsHandler_ClearAll; // Also clear on read
13572 ini_handler.ReadOpenFn = DockSettingsHandler_ReadOpen;
13573 ini_handler.ReadLineFn = DockSettingsHandler_ReadLine;
13574 ini_handler.ApplyAllFn = DockSettingsHandler_ApplyAll;
13575 ini_handler.WriteAllFn = DockSettingsHandler_WriteAll;
13576 g.SettingsHandlers.push_back(ini_handler);
13577}
13578
13579void ImGui::DockContextShutdown(ImGuiContext* ctx)
13580{
13581 ImGuiDockContext* dc = &ctx->DockContext;
13582 for (int n = 0; n < dc->Nodes.Data.Size; n++)
13583 if (ImGuiDockNode* node = (ImGuiDockNode*)dc->Nodes.Data[n].val_p)
13584 IM_DELETE(node);
13585}
13586
13587void ImGui::DockContextClearNodes(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiID root_id, bool clear_settings_refs)
13588{
13589 IM_UNUSED(ctx);
13590 IM_ASSERT(ctx == GImGui);
13591 DockBuilderRemoveNodeDockedWindows(root_id, clear_settings_refs);
13592 DockBuilderRemoveNodeChildNodes(root_id);
13593}
13594
13595// [DEBUG] This function also acts as a defacto test to make sure we can rebuild from scratch without a glitch
13596// (Different from DockSettingsHandler_ClearAll() + DockSettingsHandler_ApplyAll() because this reuses current settings!)
13597void ImGui::DockContextRebuildNodes(ImGuiContext* ctx)
13598{
13599 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockContextRebuild()\n");
13600 ImGuiDockContext* dc = &ctx->DockContext;
13601 SaveIniSettingsToMemory();
13602 ImGuiID root_id = 0; // Rebuild all
13603 DockContextClearNodes(ctx, root_id, false);
13604 DockContextBuildNodesFromSettings(ctx, dc->NodesSettings.Data, dc->NodesSettings.Size);
13605 DockContextBuildAddWindowsToNodes(ctx, root_id);
13606}
13607
13608// Docking context update function, called by NewFrame()
13609void ImGui::DockContextNewFrameUpdateUndocking(ImGuiContext* ctx)
13610{
13611 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
13612 ImGuiDockContext* dc = &ctx->DockContext;
13613 if (!(g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable))
13614 {
13615 if (dc->Nodes.Data.Size > 0 || dc->Requests.Size > 0)
13616 DockContextClearNodes(ctx, 0, true);
13617 return;
13618 }
13619
13620 // Setting NoSplit at runtime merges all nodes
13621 if (g.IO.ConfigDockingNoSplit)
13622 for (int n = 0; n < dc->Nodes.Data.Size; n++)
13623 if (ImGuiDockNode* node = (ImGuiDockNode*)dc->Nodes.Data[n].val_p)
13624 if (node->IsRootNode() && node->IsSplitNode())
13625 {
13626 DockBuilderRemoveNodeChildNodes(node->ID);
13627 //dc->WantFullRebuild = true;
13628 }
13629
13630 // Process full rebuild
13631#if 0
13632 if (ImGui::IsKeyPressed(ImGui::GetKeyIndex(ImGuiKey_C)))
13633 dc->WantFullRebuild = true;
13634#endif
13635 if (dc->WantFullRebuild)
13636 {
13637 DockContextRebuildNodes(ctx);
13638 dc->WantFullRebuild = false;
13639 }
13640
13641 // Process Undocking requests (we need to process them _before_ the UpdateMouseMovingWindowNewFrame call in NewFrame)
13642 for (int n = 0; n < dc->Requests.Size; n++)
13643 {
13644 ImGuiDockRequest* req = &dc->Requests[n];
13645 if (req->Type == ImGuiDockRequestType_Undock && req->UndockTargetWindow)
13646 DockContextProcessUndockWindow(ctx, req->UndockTargetWindow);
13647 else if (req->Type == ImGuiDockRequestType_Undock && req->UndockTargetNode)
13648 DockContextProcessUndockNode(ctx, req->UndockTargetNode);
13649 }
13650}
13651
13652// Docking context update function, called by NewFrame()
13653void ImGui::DockContextNewFrameUpdateDocking(ImGuiContext* ctx)
13654{
13655 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
13656 ImGuiDockContext* dc = &ctx->DockContext;
13657 if (!(g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable))
13658 return;
13659
13660 // [DEBUG] Store hovered dock node.
13661 // We could in theory use DockNodeTreeFindVisibleNodeByPos() on the root host dock node, but using ->DockNode is a good shortcut.
13662 // Note this is mostly a debug thing and isn't actually used for docking target, because docking involve more detailed filtering.
13663 g.HoveredDockNode = NULL;
13664 if (ImGuiWindow* hovered_window = g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow)
13665 {
13666 if (hovered_window->DockNodeAsHost)
13667 g.HoveredDockNode = DockNodeTreeFindVisibleNodeByPos(hovered_window->DockNodeAsHost, g.IO.MousePos);
13668 else if (hovered_window->RootWindow->DockNode)
13669 g.HoveredDockNode = hovered_window->RootWindow->DockNode;
13670 }
13671
13672 // Process Docking requests
13673 for (int n = 0; n < dc->Requests.Size; n++)
13674 if (dc->Requests[n].Type == ImGuiDockRequestType_Dock)
13675 DockContextProcessDock(ctx, &dc->Requests[n]);
13676 dc->Requests.resize(0);
13677
13678 // Create windows for each automatic docking nodes
13679 // We can have NULL pointers when we delete nodes, but because ID are recycled this should amortize nicely (and our node count will never be very high)
13680 for (int n = 0; n < dc->Nodes.Data.Size; n++)
13681 if (ImGuiDockNode* node = (ImGuiDockNode*)dc->Nodes.Data[n].val_p)
13682 if (node->IsFloatingNode())
13683 DockNodeUpdate(node);
13684}
13685
13686void ImGui::DockContextEndFrame(ImGuiContext* ctx)
13687{
13688 // Draw backgrounds of node missing their window
13689 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
13690 ImGuiDockContext* dc = &g.DockContext;
13691 for (int n = 0; n < dc->Nodes.Data.Size; n++)
13692 if (ImGuiDockNode* node = (ImGuiDockNode*)dc->Nodes.Data[n].val_p)
13693 if (node->LastFrameActive == g.FrameCount && node->IsVisible && node->HostWindow && node->IsLeafNode() && !node->IsBgDrawnThisFrame)
13694 {
13695 ImRect bg_rect(node->Pos + ImVec2(0.0f, GetFrameHeight()), node->Pos + node->Size);
13696 ImDrawFlags bg_rounding_flags = CalcRoundingFlagsForRectInRect(bg_rect, node->HostWindow->Rect(), DOCKING_SPLITTER_SIZE);
13697 node->HostWindow->DrawList->ChannelsSetCurrent(0);
13698 node->HostWindow->DrawList->AddRectFilled(bg_rect.Min, bg_rect.Max, node->LastBgColor, node->HostWindow->WindowRounding, bg_rounding_flags);
13699 }
13700}
13701
13702static ImGuiDockNode* ImGui::DockContextFindNodeByID(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiID id)
13703{
13704 return (ImGuiDockNode*)ctx->DockContext.Nodes.GetVoidPtr(id);
13705}
13706
13707ImGuiID ImGui::DockContextGenNodeID(ImGuiContext* ctx)
13708{
13709 // Generate an ID for new node (the exact ID value doesn't matter as long as it is not already used)
13710 // FIXME-OPT FIXME-DOCK: This is suboptimal, even if the node count is small enough not to be a worry.0
13711 // We should poke in ctx->Nodes to find a suitable ID faster. Even more so trivial that ctx->Nodes lookup is already sorted.
13712 ImGuiID id = 0x0001;
13713 while (DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, id) != NULL)
13714 id++;
13715 return id;
13716}
13717
13718static ImGuiDockNode* ImGui::DockContextAddNode(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiID id)
13719{
13720 // Generate an ID for the new node (the exact ID value doesn't matter as long as it is not already used) and add the first window.
13721 if (id == 0)
13722 id = DockContextGenNodeID(ctx);
13723 else
13724 IM_ASSERT(DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, id) == NULL);
13725
13726 // We don't set node->LastFrameAlive on construction. Nodes are always created at all time to reflect .ini settings!
13727 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockContextAddNode 0x%08X\n", id);
13728 ImGuiDockNode* node = IM_NEW(ImGuiDockNode)(id);
13729 ctx->DockContext.Nodes.SetVoidPtr(node->ID, node);
13730 return node;
13731}
13732
13733static void ImGui::DockContextRemoveNode(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNode* node, bool merge_sibling_into_parent_node)
13734{
13735 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
13736 ImGuiDockContext* dc = &ctx->DockContext;
13737
13738 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockContextRemoveNode 0x%08X\n", node->ID);
13739 IM_ASSERT(DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, node->ID) == node);
13740 IM_ASSERT(node->ChildNodes[0] == NULL && node->ChildNodes[1] == NULL);
13741 IM_ASSERT(node->Windows.Size == 0);
13742
13743 if (node->HostWindow)
13744 node->HostWindow->DockNodeAsHost = NULL;
13745
13746 ImGuiDockNode* parent_node = node->ParentNode;
13747 const bool merge = (merge_sibling_into_parent_node && parent_node != NULL);
13748 if (merge)
13749 {
13750 IM_ASSERT(parent_node->ChildNodes[0] == node || parent_node->ChildNodes[1] == node);
13751 ImGuiDockNode* sibling_node = (parent_node->ChildNodes[0] == node ? parent_node->ChildNodes[1] : parent_node->ChildNodes[0]);
13752 DockNodeTreeMerge(&g, parent_node, sibling_node);
13753 }
13754 else
13755 {
13756 for (int n = 0; parent_node && n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(parent_node->ChildNodes); n++)
13757 if (parent_node->ChildNodes[n] == node)
13758 node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[n] = NULL;
13759 dc->Nodes.SetVoidPtr(node->ID, NULL);
13760 IM_DELETE(node);
13761 }
13762}
13763
13764static int IMGUI_CDECL DockNodeComparerDepthMostFirst(const void* lhs, const void* rhs)
13765{
13766 const ImGuiDockNode* a = *(const ImGuiDockNode* const*)lhs;
13767 const ImGuiDockNode* b = *(const ImGuiDockNode* const*)rhs;
13768 return ImGui::DockNodeGetDepth(b) - ImGui::DockNodeGetDepth(a);
13769}
13770
13771// Pre C++0x doesn't allow us to use a function-local type (without linkage) as template parameter, so we moved this here.
13772struct ImGuiDockContextPruneNodeData
13773{
13774 int CountWindows, CountChildWindows, CountChildNodes;
13775 ImGuiID RootId;
13776 ImGuiDockContextPruneNodeData() { CountWindows = CountChildWindows = CountChildNodes = 0; RootId = 0; }
13777};
13778
13779// Garbage collect unused nodes (run once at init time)
13780static void ImGui::DockContextPruneUnusedSettingsNodes(ImGuiContext* ctx)
13781{
13782 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
13783 ImGuiDockContext* dc = &ctx->DockContext;
13784 IM_ASSERT(g.Windows.Size == 0);
13785
13786 ImPool<ImGuiDockContextPruneNodeData> pool;
13787 pool.Reserve(dc->NodesSettings.Size);
13788
13789 // Count child nodes and compute RootID
13790 for (int settings_n = 0; settings_n < dc->NodesSettings.Size; settings_n++)
13791 {
13792 ImGuiDockNodeSettings* settings = &dc->NodesSettings[settings_n];
13793 ImGuiDockContextPruneNodeData* parent_data = settings->ParentNodeId ? pool.GetByKey(settings->ParentNodeId) : 0;
13794 pool.GetOrAddByKey(settings->ID)->RootId = parent_data ? parent_data->RootId : settings->ID;
13795 if (settings->ParentNodeId)
13796 pool.GetOrAddByKey(settings->ParentNodeId)->CountChildNodes++;
13797 }
13798
13799 // Count reference to dock ids from dockspaces
13800 // We track the 'auto-DockNode <- manual-Window <- manual-DockSpace' in order to avoid 'auto-DockNode' being ditched by DockContextPruneUnusedSettingsNodes()
13801 for (int settings_n = 0; settings_n < dc->NodesSettings.Size; settings_n++)
13802 {
13803 ImGuiDockNodeSettings* settings = &dc->NodesSettings[settings_n];
13804 if (settings->ParentWindowId != 0)
13805 if (ImGuiWindowSettings* window_settings = FindWindowSettings(settings->ParentWindowId))
13806 if (window_settings->DockId)
13807 if (ImGuiDockContextPruneNodeData* data = pool.GetByKey(window_settings->DockId))
13808 data->CountChildNodes++;
13809 }
13810
13811 // Count reference to dock ids from window settings
13812 // We guard against the possibility of an invalid .ini file (RootID may point to a missing node)
13813 for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
13814 if (ImGuiID dock_id = settings->DockId)
13815 if (ImGuiDockContextPruneNodeData* data = pool.GetByKey(dock_id))
13816 {
13817 data->CountWindows++;
13818 if (ImGuiDockContextPruneNodeData* data_root = (data->RootId == dock_id) ? data : pool.GetByKey(data->RootId))
13819 data_root->CountChildWindows++;
13820 }
13821
13822 // Prune
13823 for (int settings_n = 0; settings_n < dc->NodesSettings.Size; settings_n++)
13824 {
13825 ImGuiDockNodeSettings* settings = &dc->NodesSettings[settings_n];
13826 ImGuiDockContextPruneNodeData* data = pool.GetByKey(settings->ID);
13827 if (data->CountWindows > 1)
13828 continue;
13829 ImGuiDockContextPruneNodeData* data_root = (data->RootId == settings->ID) ? data : pool.GetByKey(data->RootId);
13830
13831 bool remove = false;
13832 remove |= (data->CountWindows == 1 && settings->ParentNodeId == 0 && data->CountChildNodes == 0 && !(settings->Flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_CentralNode)); // Floating root node with only 1 window
13833 remove |= (data->CountWindows == 0 && settings->ParentNodeId == 0 && data->CountChildNodes == 0); // Leaf nodes with 0 window
13834 remove |= (data_root->CountChildWindows == 0);
13835 if (remove)
13836 {
13837 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockContextPruneUnusedSettingsNodes: Prune 0x%08X\n", settings->ID);
13838 DockSettingsRemoveNodeReferences(&settings->ID, 1);
13839 settings->ID = 0;
13840 }
13841 }
13842}
13843
13844static void ImGui::DockContextBuildNodesFromSettings(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNodeSettings* node_settings_array, int node_settings_count)
13845{
13846 // Build nodes
13847 for (int node_n = 0; node_n < node_settings_count; node_n++)
13848 {
13849 ImGuiDockNodeSettings* settings = &node_settings_array[node_n];
13850 if (settings->ID == 0)
13851 continue;
13852 ImGuiDockNode* node = DockContextAddNode(ctx, settings->ID);
13853 node->ParentNode = settings->ParentNodeId ? DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, settings->ParentNodeId) : NULL;
13854 node->Pos = ImVec2(settings->Pos.x, settings->Pos.y);
13855 node->Size = ImVec2(settings->Size.x, settings->Size.y);
13856 node->SizeRef = ImVec2(settings->SizeRef.x, settings->SizeRef.y);
13857 node->AuthorityForPos = node->AuthorityForSize = node->AuthorityForViewport = ImGuiDataAuthority_DockNode;
13858 if (node->ParentNode && node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[0] == NULL)
13859 node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[0] = node;
13860 else if (node->ParentNode && node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[1] == NULL)
13861 node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[1] = node;
13862 node->SelectedTabId = settings->SelectedTabId;
13863 node->SplitAxis = (ImGuiAxis)settings->SplitAxis;
13864 node->SetLocalFlags(settings->Flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_SavedFlagsMask_);
13865
13866 // Bind host window immediately if it already exist (in case of a rebuild)
13867 // This is useful as the RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight links necessary to highlight the currently focused node requires node->HostWindow to be set.
13868 char host_window_title[20];
13869 ImGuiDockNode* root_node = DockNodeGetRootNode(node);
13870 node->HostWindow = FindWindowByName(DockNodeGetHostWindowTitle(root_node, host_window_title, IM_ARRAYSIZE(host_window_title)));
13871 }
13872}
13873
13874void ImGui::DockContextBuildAddWindowsToNodes(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiID root_id)
13875{
13876 // Rebind all windows to nodes (they can also lazily rebind but we'll have a visible glitch during the first frame)
13877 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
13878 for (int n = 0; n < g.Windows.Size; n++)
13879 {
13880 ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[n];
13881 if (window->DockId == 0 || window->LastFrameActive < g.FrameCount - 1)
13882 continue;
13883 if (window->DockNode != NULL)
13884 continue;
13885
13886 ImGuiDockNode* node = DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, window->DockId);
13887 IM_ASSERT(node != NULL); // This should have been called after DockContextBuildNodesFromSettings()
13888 if (root_id == 0 || DockNodeGetRootNode(node)->ID == root_id)
13889 DockNodeAddWindow(node, window, true);
13890 }
13891}
13892
13893//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13894// Docking: ImGuiDockContext Docking/Undocking functions
13895//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13896// - DockContextQueueDock()
13897// - DockContextQueueUndockWindow()
13898// - DockContextQueueUndockNode()
13899// - DockContextQueueNotifyRemovedNode()
13900// - DockContextProcessDock()
13901// - DockContextProcessUndockWindow()
13902// - DockContextProcessUndockNode()
13903// - DockContextCalcDropPosForDocking()
13904//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
13905
13906void ImGui::DockContextQueueDock(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiWindow* target, ImGuiDockNode* target_node, ImGuiWindow* payload, ImGuiDir split_dir, float split_ratio, bool split_outer)
13907{
13908 IM_ASSERT(target != payload);
13909 ImGuiDockRequest req;
13910 req.Type = ImGuiDockRequestType_Dock;
13911 req.DockTargetWindow = target;
13912 req.DockTargetNode = target_node;
13913 req.DockPayload = payload;
13914 req.DockSplitDir = split_dir;
13915 req.DockSplitRatio = split_ratio;
13916 req.DockSplitOuter = split_outer;
13917 ctx->DockContext.Requests.push_back(req);
13918}
13919
13920void ImGui::DockContextQueueUndockWindow(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiWindow* window)
13921{
13922 ImGuiDockRequest req;
13923 req.Type = ImGuiDockRequestType_Undock;
13924 req.UndockTargetWindow = window;
13925 ctx->DockContext.Requests.push_back(req);
13926}
13927
13928void ImGui::DockContextQueueUndockNode(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNode* node)
13929{
13930 ImGuiDockRequest req;
13931 req.Type = ImGuiDockRequestType_Undock;
13932 req.UndockTargetNode = node;
13933 ctx->DockContext.Requests.push_back(req);
13934}
13935
13936void ImGui::DockContextQueueNotifyRemovedNode(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNode* node)
13937{
13938 ImGuiDockContext* dc = &ctx->DockContext;
13939 for (int n = 0; n < dc->Requests.Size; n++)
13940 if (dc->Requests[n].DockTargetNode == node)
13941 dc->Requests[n].Type = ImGuiDockRequestType_None;
13942}
13943
13944void ImGui::DockContextProcessDock(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockRequest* req)
13945{
13946 IM_ASSERT((req->Type == ImGuiDockRequestType_Dock && req->DockPayload != NULL) || (req->Type == ImGuiDockRequestType_Split && req->DockPayload == NULL));
13947 IM_ASSERT(req->DockTargetWindow != NULL || req->DockTargetNode != NULL);
13948
13949 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
13950 IM_UNUSED(g);
13951
13952 ImGuiWindow* payload_window = req->DockPayload; // Optional
13953 ImGuiWindow* target_window = req->DockTargetWindow;
13954 ImGuiDockNode* node = req->DockTargetNode;
13955 if (payload_window)
13956 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockContextProcessDock node 0x%08X target '%s' dock window '%s', split_dir %d\n", node ? node->ID : 0, target_window ? target_window->Name : "NULL", payload_window ? payload_window->Name : "NULL", req->DockSplitDir);
13957 else
13958 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockContextProcessDock node 0x%08X, split_dir %d\n", node ? node->ID : 0, req->DockSplitDir);
13959
13960 // Decide which Tab will be selected at the end of the operation
13961 ImGuiID next_selected_id = 0;
13962 ImGuiDockNode* payload_node = NULL;
13963 if (payload_window)
13964 {
13965 payload_node = payload_window->DockNodeAsHost;
13966 payload_window->DockNodeAsHost = NULL; // Important to clear this as the node will have its life as a child which might be merged/deleted later.
13967 if (payload_node && payload_node->IsLeafNode())
13968 next_selected_id = payload_node->TabBar->NextSelectedTabId ? payload_node->TabBar->NextSelectedTabId : payload_node->TabBar->SelectedTabId;
13969 if (payload_node == NULL)
13970 next_selected_id = payload_window->ID;
13971 }
13972
13973 // FIXME-DOCK: When we are trying to dock an existing single-window node into a loose window, transfer Node ID as well
13974 // When processing an interactive split, usually LastFrameAlive will be < g.FrameCount. But DockBuilder operations can make it ==.
13975 if (node)
13976 IM_ASSERT(node->LastFrameAlive <= g.FrameCount);
13977 if (node && target_window && node == target_window->DockNodeAsHost)
13978 IM_ASSERT(node->Windows.Size > 0 || node->IsSplitNode() || node->IsCentralNode());
13979
13980 // Create new node and add existing window to it
13981 if (node == NULL)
13982 {
13983 node = DockContextAddNode(ctx, 0);
13984 node->Pos = target_window->Pos;
13985 node->Size = target_window->Size;
13986 if (target_window->DockNodeAsHost == NULL)
13987 {
13988 DockNodeAddWindow(node, target_window, true);
13989 node->TabBar->Tabs[0].Flags &= ~ImGuiTabItemFlags_Unsorted;
13990 target_window->DockIsActive = true;
13991 }
13992 }
13993
13994 ImGuiDir split_dir = req->DockSplitDir;
13995 if (split_dir != ImGuiDir_None)
13996 {
13997 // Split into two, one side will be our payload node unless we are dropping a loose window
13998 const ImGuiAxis split_axis = (split_dir == ImGuiDir_Left || split_dir == ImGuiDir_Right) ? ImGuiAxis_X : ImGuiAxis_Y;
13999 const int split_inheritor_child_idx = (split_dir == ImGuiDir_Left || split_dir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? 1 : 0; // Current contents will be moved to the opposite side
14000 const float split_ratio = req->DockSplitRatio;
14001 DockNodeTreeSplit(ctx, node, split_axis, split_inheritor_child_idx, split_ratio, payload_node); // payload_node may be NULL here!
14002 ImGuiDockNode* new_node = node->ChildNodes[split_inheritor_child_idx ^ 1];
14003 new_node->HostWindow = node->HostWindow;
14004 node = new_node;
14005 }
14006 node->SetLocalFlags(node->LocalFlags & ~ImGuiDockNodeFlags_HiddenTabBar);
14007
14008 if (node != payload_node)
14009 {
14010 // Create tab bar before we call DockNodeMoveWindows (which would attempt to move the old tab-bar, which would lead us to payload tabs wrongly appearing before target tabs!)
14011 if (node->Windows.Size > 0 && node->TabBar == NULL)
14012 {
14013 DockNodeAddTabBar(node);
14014 for (int n = 0; n < node->Windows.Size; n++)
14015 TabBarAddTab(node->TabBar, ImGuiTabItemFlags_None, node->Windows[n]);
14016 }
14017
14018 if (payload_node != NULL)
14019 {
14020 // Transfer full payload node (with 1+ child windows or child nodes)
14021 if (payload_node->IsSplitNode())
14022 {
14023 if (node->Windows.Size > 0)
14024 {
14025 // We can dock a split payload into a node that already has windows _only_ if our payload is a node tree with a single visible node.
14026 // In this situation, we move the windows of the target node into the currently visible node of the payload.
14027 // This allows us to preserve some of the underlying dock tree settings nicely.
14028 IM_ASSERT(payload_node->OnlyNodeWithWindows != NULL); // The docking should have been blocked by DockNodePreviewDockSetup() early on and never submitted.
14029 ImGuiDockNode* visible_node = payload_node->OnlyNodeWithWindows;
14030 if (visible_node->TabBar)
14031 IM_ASSERT(visible_node->TabBar->Tabs.Size > 0);
14032 DockNodeMoveWindows(node, visible_node);
14033 DockNodeMoveWindows(visible_node, node);
14034 DockSettingsRenameNodeReferences(node->ID, visible_node->ID);
14035 }
14036 if (node->IsCentralNode())
14037 {
14038 // Central node property needs to be moved to a leaf node, pick the last focused one.
14039 // FIXME-DOCK: If we had to transfer other flags here, what would the policy be?
14040 ImGuiDockNode* last_focused_node = DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, payload_node->LastFocusedNodeId);
14041 IM_ASSERT(last_focused_node != NULL);
14042 ImGuiDockNode* last_focused_root_node = DockNodeGetRootNode(last_focused_node);
14043 IM_ASSERT(last_focused_root_node == DockNodeGetRootNode(payload_node));
14044 last_focused_node->SetLocalFlags(last_focused_node->LocalFlags | ImGuiDockNodeFlags_CentralNode);
14045 node->SetLocalFlags(node->LocalFlags & ~ImGuiDockNodeFlags_CentralNode);
14046 last_focused_root_node->CentralNode = last_focused_node;
14047 }
14048
14049 IM_ASSERT(node->Windows.Size == 0);
14050 DockNodeMoveChildNodes(node, payload_node);
14051 }
14052 else
14053 {
14054 const ImGuiID payload_dock_id = payload_node->ID;
14055 DockNodeMoveWindows(node, payload_node);
14056 DockSettingsRenameNodeReferences(payload_dock_id, node->ID);
14057 }
14058 DockContextRemoveNode(ctx, payload_node, true);
14059 }
14060 else if (payload_window)
14061 {
14062 // Transfer single window
14063 const ImGuiID payload_dock_id = payload_window->DockId;
14064 node->VisibleWindow = payload_window;
14065 DockNodeAddWindow(node, payload_window, true);
14066 if (payload_dock_id != 0)
14067 DockSettingsRenameNodeReferences(payload_dock_id, node->ID);
14068 }
14069 }
14070 else
14071 {
14072 // When docking a floating single window node we want to reevaluate auto-hiding of the tab bar
14073 node->WantHiddenTabBarUpdate = true;
14074 }
14075
14076 // Update selection immediately
14077 if (ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar = node->TabBar)
14078 tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = next_selected_id;
14079 MarkIniSettingsDirty();
14080}
14081
14082// Problem:
14083// Undocking a large (~full screen) window would leave it so large that the bottom right sizing corner would more
14084// than likely be off the screen and the window would be hard to resize to fit on screen. This can be particularly problematic
14085// with 'ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly=true' and/or with 'ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges=false' as well (the later can be
14086// due to missing ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors backend flag).
14087// Solution:
14088// When undocking a window we currently force its maximum size to 90% of the host viewport or monitor.
14089// Reevaluate this when we implement preserving docked/undocked size ("docking_wip/undocked_size" branch).
14090static ImVec2 FixLargeWindowsWhenUndocking(const ImVec2& size, ImGuiViewport* ref_viewport)
14091{
14092 if (ref_viewport == NULL)
14093 return size;
14094
14095 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
14096 ImVec2 max_size = ImFloor(ref_viewport->WorkSize * 0.90f);
14097 if (g.ConfigFlagsCurrFrame & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable)
14098 {
14099 const ImGuiPlatformMonitor* monitor = ImGui::GetViewportPlatformMonitor(ref_viewport);
14100 max_size = ImFloor(monitor->WorkSize * 0.90f);
14101 }
14102 return ImMin(size, max_size);
14103}
14104
14105void ImGui::DockContextProcessUndockWindow(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiWindow* window, bool clear_persistent_docking_ref)
14106{
14107 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockContextProcessUndockWindow window '%s', clear_persistent_docking_ref = %d\n", window->Name, clear_persistent_docking_ref);
14108 IM_UNUSED(ctx);
14109 if (window->DockNode)
14110 DockNodeRemoveWindow(window->DockNode, window, clear_persistent_docking_ref ? 0 : window->DockId);
14111 else
14112 window->DockId = 0;
14113 window->Collapsed = false;
14114 window->DockIsActive = false;
14115 window->DockNodeIsVisible = window->DockTabIsVisible = false;
14116 window->Size = window->SizeFull = FixLargeWindowsWhenUndocking(window->SizeFull, window->Viewport);
14117
14118 MarkIniSettingsDirty();
14119}
14120
14121void ImGui::DockContextProcessUndockNode(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNode* node)
14122{
14123 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockContextProcessUndockNode node %08X\n", node->ID);
14124 IM_ASSERT(node->IsLeafNode());
14125 IM_ASSERT(node->Windows.Size >= 1);
14126
14127 if (node->IsRootNode() || node->IsCentralNode())
14128 {
14129 // In the case of a root node or central node, the node will have to stay in place. Create a new node to receive the payload.
14130 ImGuiDockNode* new_node = DockContextAddNode(ctx, 0);
14131 new_node->Pos = node->Pos;
14132 new_node->Size = node->Size;
14133 new_node->SizeRef = node->SizeRef;
14134 DockNodeMoveWindows(new_node, node);
14135 DockSettingsRenameNodeReferences(node->ID, new_node->ID);
14136 for (int n = 0; n < new_node->Windows.Size; n++)
14137 {
14138 ImGuiWindow* window = new_node->Windows[n];
14139 window->Flags &= ~ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow;
14140 if (window->ParentWindow)
14141 window->ParentWindow->DC.ChildWindows.find_erase(window);
14142 UpdateWindowParentAndRootLinks(window, window->Flags, NULL);
14143 }
14144 node = new_node;
14145 }
14146 else
14147 {
14148 // Otherwise extract our node and merge our sibling back into the parent node.
14149 IM_ASSERT(node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[0] == node || node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[1] == node);
14150 int index_in_parent = (node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[0] == node) ? 0 : 1;
14151 node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[index_in_parent] = NULL;
14152 DockNodeTreeMerge(ctx, node->ParentNode, node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[index_in_parent ^ 1]);
14153 node->ParentNode->AuthorityForViewport = ImGuiDataAuthority_Window; // The node that stays in place keeps the viewport, so our newly dragged out node will create a new viewport
14154 node->ParentNode = NULL;
14155 }
14156 node->AuthorityForPos = node->AuthorityForSize = ImGuiDataAuthority_DockNode;
14157 node->Size = FixLargeWindowsWhenUndocking(node->Size, node->Windows[0]->Viewport);
14158 node->WantMouseMove = true;
14159 MarkIniSettingsDirty();
14160}
14161
14162// This is mostly used for automation.
14163bool ImGui::DockContextCalcDropPosForDocking(ImGuiWindow* target, ImGuiDockNode* target_node, ImGuiWindow* payload, ImGuiDir split_dir, bool split_outer, ImVec2* out_pos)
14164{
14165 // In DockNodePreviewDockSetup() for a root central node instead of showing both "inner" and "outer" drop rects
14166 // (which would be functionally identical) we only show the outer one. Reflect this here.
14167 if (target_node && target_node->ParentNode == NULL && target_node->IsCentralNode() && split_dir != ImGuiDir_None)
14168 split_outer = true;
14169 ImGuiDockPreviewData split_data;
14170 DockNodePreviewDockSetup(target, target_node, payload, &split_data, false, split_outer);
14171 if (split_data.DropRectsDraw[split_dir+1].IsInverted())
14172 return false;
14173 *out_pos = split_data.DropRectsDraw[split_dir+1].GetCenter();
14174 return true;
14175}
14176
14177//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
14178// Docking: ImGuiDockNode
14179//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
14180// - DockNodeGetTabOrder()
14181// - DockNodeAddWindow()
14182// - DockNodeRemoveWindow()
14183// - DockNodeMoveChildNodes()
14184// - DockNodeMoveWindows()
14185// - DockNodeApplyPosSizeToWindows()
14186// - DockNodeHideHostWindow()
14187// - ImGuiDockNodeFindInfoResults
14188// - DockNodeFindInfo()
14189// - DockNodeFindWindowByID()
14190// - DockNodeUpdateFlagsAndCollapse()
14191// - DockNodeUpdateHasCentralNodeFlag()
14192// - DockNodeUpdateVisibleFlag()
14193// - DockNodeStartMouseMovingWindow()
14194// - DockNodeUpdate()
14195// - DockNodeUpdateWindowMenu()
14196// - DockNodeBeginAmendTabBar()
14197// - DockNodeEndAmendTabBar()
14198// - DockNodeUpdateTabBar()
14199// - DockNodeAddTabBar()
14200// - DockNodeRemoveTabBar()
14201// - DockNodeIsDropAllowedOne()
14202// - DockNodeIsDropAllowed()
14203// - DockNodeCalcTabBarLayout()
14204// - DockNodeCalcSplitRects()
14205// - DockNodeCalcDropRectsAndTestMousePos()
14206// - DockNodePreviewDockSetup()
14207// - DockNodePreviewDockRender()
14208//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
14209
14210ImGuiDockNode::ImGuiDockNode(ImGuiID id)
14211{
14212 ID = id;
14213 SharedFlags = LocalFlags = LocalFlagsInWindows = MergedFlags = ImGuiDockNodeFlags_None;
14214 ParentNode = ChildNodes[0] = ChildNodes[1] = NULL;
14215 TabBar = NULL;
14216 SplitAxis = ImGuiAxis_None;
14217
14218 State = ImGuiDockNodeState_Unknown;
14219 LastBgColor = IM_COL32_WHITE;
14220 HostWindow = VisibleWindow = NULL;
14221 CentralNode = OnlyNodeWithWindows = NULL;
14222 CountNodeWithWindows = 0;
14223 LastFrameAlive = LastFrameActive = LastFrameFocused = -1;
14224 LastFocusedNodeId = 0;
14225 SelectedTabId = 0;
14226 WantCloseTabId = 0;
14227 AuthorityForPos = AuthorityForSize = ImGuiDataAuthority_DockNode;
14228 AuthorityForViewport = ImGuiDataAuthority_Auto;
14229 IsVisible = true;
14230 IsFocused = HasCloseButton = HasWindowMenuButton = HasCentralNodeChild = false;
14231 IsBgDrawnThisFrame = false;
14232 WantCloseAll = WantLockSizeOnce = WantMouseMove = WantHiddenTabBarUpdate = WantHiddenTabBarToggle = false;
14233}
14234
14235ImGuiDockNode::~ImGuiDockNode()
14236{
14237 IM_DELETE(TabBar);
14238 TabBar = NULL;
14239 ChildNodes[0] = ChildNodes[1] = NULL;
14240}
14241
14242int ImGui::DockNodeGetTabOrder(ImGuiWindow* window)
14243{
14244 ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar = window->DockNode->TabBar;
14245 if (tab_bar == NULL)
14246 return -1;
14247 ImGuiTabItem* tab = TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, window->ID);
14248 return tab ? tab_bar->GetTabOrder(tab) : -1;
14249}
14250
14251static void DockNodeHideWindowDuringHostWindowCreation(ImGuiWindow* window)
14252{
14253 window->Hidden = true;
14254 window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = window->Active ? 1 : 2;
14255}
14256
14257static void ImGui::DockNodeAddWindow(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiWindow* window, bool add_to_tab_bar)
14258{
14259 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui; (void)g;
14260 if (window->DockNode)
14261 {
14262 // Can overwrite an existing window->DockNode (e.g. pointing to a disabled DockSpace node)
14263 IM_ASSERT(window->DockNode->ID != node->ID);
14264 DockNodeRemoveWindow(window->DockNode, window, 0);
14265 }
14266 IM_ASSERT(window->DockNode == NULL || window->DockNodeAsHost == NULL);
14267 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockNodeAddWindow node 0x%08X window '%s'\n", node->ID, window->Name);
14268
14269 // If more than 2 windows appeared on the same frame leading to the creation of a new hosting window,
14270 // we'll hide windows until the host window is ready. Hide the 1st window after its been output (so it is not visible for one frame).
14271 // We will call DockNodeHideWindowDuringHostWindowCreation() on ourselves in Begin()
14272 if (node->HostWindow == NULL && node->Windows.Size == 1 && node->Windows[0]->WasActive == false)
14273 DockNodeHideWindowDuringHostWindowCreation(node->Windows[0]);
14274
14275 node->Windows.push_back(window);
14276 node->WantHiddenTabBarUpdate = true;
14277 window->DockNode = node;
14278 window->DockId = node->ID;
14279 window->DockIsActive = (node->Windows.Size > 1);
14280 window->DockTabWantClose = false;
14281
14282 // When reactivating a node with one or two loose window, the window pos/size/viewport are authoritative over the node storage.
14283 // In particular it is important we init the viewport from the first window so we don't create two viewports and drop one.
14284 if (node->HostWindow == NULL && node->IsFloatingNode())
14285 {
14286 if (node->AuthorityForPos == ImGuiDataAuthority_Auto)
14287 node->AuthorityForPos = ImGuiDataAuthority_Window;
14288 if (node->AuthorityForSize == ImGuiDataAuthority_Auto)
14289 node->AuthorityForSize = ImGuiDataAuthority_Window;
14290 if (node->AuthorityForViewport == ImGuiDataAuthority_Auto)
14291 node->AuthorityForViewport = ImGuiDataAuthority_Window;
14292 }
14293
14294 // Add to tab bar if requested
14295 if (add_to_tab_bar)
14296 {
14297 if (node->TabBar == NULL)
14298 {
14299 DockNodeAddTabBar(node);
14300 node->TabBar->SelectedTabId = node->TabBar->NextSelectedTabId = node->SelectedTabId;
14301
14302 // Add existing windows
14303 for (int n = 0; n < node->Windows.Size - 1; n++)
14304 TabBarAddTab(node->TabBar, ImGuiTabItemFlags_None, node->Windows[n]);
14305 }
14306 TabBarAddTab(node->TabBar, ImGuiTabItemFlags_Unsorted, window);
14307 }
14308
14309 DockNodeUpdateVisibleFlag(node);
14310
14311 // Update this without waiting for the next time we Begin() in the window, so our host window will have the proper title bar color on its first frame.
14312 if (node->HostWindow)
14313 UpdateWindowParentAndRootLinks(window, window->Flags | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow, node->HostWindow);
14314}
14315
14316static void ImGui::DockNodeRemoveWindow(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiID save_dock_id)
14317{
14318 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
14319 IM_ASSERT(window->DockNode == node);
14320 //IM_ASSERT(window->RootWindowDockTree == node->HostWindow);
14321 //IM_ASSERT(window->LastFrameActive < g.FrameCount); // We may call this from Begin()
14322 IM_ASSERT(save_dock_id == 0 || save_dock_id == node->ID);
14323 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockNodeRemoveWindow node 0x%08X window '%s'\n", node->ID, window->Name);
14324
14325 window->DockNode = NULL;
14326 window->DockIsActive = window->DockTabWantClose = false;
14327 window->DockId = save_dock_id;
14328 window->Flags &= ~ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow;
14329 if (window->ParentWindow)
14330 window->ParentWindow->DC.ChildWindows.find_erase(window);
14331 UpdateWindowParentAndRootLinks(window, window->Flags, NULL); // Update immediately
14332
14333 // Remove window
14334 bool erased = false;
14335 for (int n = 0; n < node->Windows.Size; n++)
14336 if (node->Windows[n] == window)
14337 {
14338 node->Windows.erase(node->Windows.Data + n);
14339 erased = true;
14340 break;
14341 }
14342 if (!erased)
14343 IM_ASSERT(erased);
14344 if (node->VisibleWindow == window)
14345 node->VisibleWindow = NULL;
14346
14347 // Remove tab and possibly tab bar
14348 node->WantHiddenTabBarUpdate = true;
14349 if (node->TabBar)
14350 {
14351 TabBarRemoveTab(node->TabBar, window->ID);
14352 const int tab_count_threshold_for_tab_bar = node->IsCentralNode() ? 1 : 2;
14353 if (node->Windows.Size < tab_count_threshold_for_tab_bar)
14354 DockNodeRemoveTabBar(node);
14355 }
14356
14357 if (node->Windows.Size == 0 && !node->IsCentralNode() && !node->IsDockSpace() && window->DockId != node->ID)
14358 {
14359 // Automatic dock node delete themselves if they are not holding at least one tab
14360 DockContextRemoveNode(&g, node, true);
14361 return;
14362 }
14363
14364 if (node->Windows.Size == 1 && !node->IsCentralNode() && node->HostWindow)
14365 {
14366 ImGuiWindow* remaining_window = node->Windows[0];
14367 if (node->HostWindow->ViewportOwned && node->IsRootNode())
14368 {
14369 // Transfer viewport back to the remaining loose window
14370 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_VIEWPORT("Node %08X transfer Viewport %08X=>%08X for Window '%s'\n", node->ID, node->HostWindow->Viewport->ID, remaining_window->ID, remaining_window->Name);
14371 IM_ASSERT(node->HostWindow->Viewport->Window == node->HostWindow);
14372 node->HostWindow->Viewport->Window = remaining_window;
14373 node->HostWindow->Viewport->ID = remaining_window->ID;
14374 }
14375 remaining_window->Collapsed = node->HostWindow->Collapsed;
14376 }
14377
14378 // Update visibility immediately is required so the DockNodeUpdateRemoveInactiveChilds() processing can reflect changes up the tree
14379 DockNodeUpdateVisibleFlag(node);
14380}
14381
14382static void ImGui::DockNodeMoveChildNodes(ImGuiDockNode* dst_node, ImGuiDockNode* src_node)
14383{
14384 IM_ASSERT(dst_node->Windows.Size == 0);
14385 dst_node->ChildNodes[0] = src_node->ChildNodes[0];
14386 dst_node->ChildNodes[1] = src_node->ChildNodes[1];
14387 if (dst_node->ChildNodes[0])
14388 dst_node->ChildNodes[0]->ParentNode = dst_node;
14389 if (dst_node->ChildNodes[1])
14390 dst_node->ChildNodes[1]->ParentNode = dst_node;
14391 dst_node->SplitAxis = src_node->SplitAxis;
14392 dst_node->SizeRef = src_node->SizeRef;
14393 src_node->ChildNodes[0] = src_node->ChildNodes[1] = NULL;
14394}
14395
14396static void ImGui::DockNodeMoveWindows(ImGuiDockNode* dst_node, ImGuiDockNode* src_node)
14397{
14398 // Insert tabs in the same orders as currently ordered (node->Windows isn't ordered)
14399 IM_ASSERT(src_node && dst_node && dst_node != src_node);
14400 ImGuiTabBar* src_tab_bar = src_node->TabBar;
14401 if (src_tab_bar != NULL)
14402 IM_ASSERT(src_node->Windows.Size <= src_node->TabBar->Tabs.Size);
14403
14404 // If the dst_node is empty we can just move the entire tab bar (to preserve selection, scrolling, etc.)
14405 bool move_tab_bar = (src_tab_bar != NULL) && (dst_node->TabBar == NULL);
14406 if (move_tab_bar)
14407 {
14408 dst_node->TabBar = src_node->TabBar;
14409 src_node->TabBar = NULL;
14410 }
14411
14412 for (int n = 0; n < src_node->Windows.Size; n++)
14413 {
14414 // DockNode's TabBar may have non-window Tabs manually appended by user
14415 if (ImGuiWindow* window = src_tab_bar ? src_tab_bar->Tabs[n].Window : src_node->Windows[n])
14416 {
14417 window->DockNode = NULL;
14418 window->DockIsActive = false;
14419 DockNodeAddWindow(dst_node, window, move_tab_bar ? false : true);
14420 }
14421 }
14422 src_node->Windows.clear();
14423
14424 if (!move_tab_bar && src_node->TabBar)
14425 {
14426 if (dst_node->TabBar)
14427 dst_node->TabBar->SelectedTabId = src_node->TabBar->SelectedTabId;
14428 DockNodeRemoveTabBar(src_node);
14429 }
14430}
14431
14432static void ImGui::DockNodeApplyPosSizeToWindows(ImGuiDockNode* node)
14433{
14434 for (int n = 0; n < node->Windows.Size; n++)
14435 {
14436 SetWindowPos(node->Windows[n], node->Pos, ImGuiCond_Always); // We don't assign directly to Pos because it can break the calculation of SizeContents on next frame
14437 SetWindowSize(node->Windows[n], node->Size, ImGuiCond_Always);
14438 }
14439}
14440
14441static void ImGui::DockNodeHideHostWindow(ImGuiDockNode* node)
14442{
14443 if (node->HostWindow)
14444 {
14445 if (node->HostWindow->DockNodeAsHost == node)
14446 node->HostWindow->DockNodeAsHost = NULL;
14447 node->HostWindow = NULL;
14448 }
14449
14450 if (node->Windows.Size == 1)
14451 {
14452 node->VisibleWindow = node->Windows[0];
14453 node->Windows[0]->DockIsActive = false;
14454 }
14455
14456 if (node->TabBar)
14457 DockNodeRemoveTabBar(node);
14458}
14459
14460// Search function called once by root node in DockNodeUpdate()
14461struct ImGuiDockNodeTreeInfo
14462{
14463 ImGuiDockNode* CentralNode;
14464 ImGuiDockNode* FirstNodeWithWindows;
14465 int CountNodesWithWindows;
14466 //ImGuiWindowClass WindowClassForMerges;
14467
14468 ImGuiDockNodeTreeInfo() { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); }
14469};
14470
14471static void DockNodeFindInfo(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiDockNodeTreeInfo* info)
14472{
14473 if (node->Windows.Size > 0)
14474 {
14475 if (info->FirstNodeWithWindows == NULL)
14476 info->FirstNodeWithWindows = node;
14477 info->CountNodesWithWindows++;
14478 }
14479 if (node->IsCentralNode())
14480 {
14481 IM_ASSERT(info->CentralNode == NULL); // Should be only one
14482 IM_ASSERT(node->IsLeafNode() && "If you get this assert: please submit .ini file + repro of actions leading to this.");
14483 info->CentralNode = node;
14484 }
14485 if (info->CountNodesWithWindows > 1 && info->CentralNode != NULL)
14486 return;
14487 if (node->ChildNodes[0])
14488 DockNodeFindInfo(node->ChildNodes[0], info);
14489 if (node->ChildNodes[1])
14490 DockNodeFindInfo(node->ChildNodes[1], info);
14491}
14492
14493static ImGuiWindow* ImGui::DockNodeFindWindowByID(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiID id)
14494{
14495 IM_ASSERT(id != 0);
14496 for (int n = 0; n < node->Windows.Size; n++)
14497 if (node->Windows[n]->ID == id)
14498 return node->Windows[n];
14499 return NULL;
14500}
14501
14502// - Remove inactive windows/nodes.
14503// - Update visibility flag.
14504static void ImGui::DockNodeUpdateFlagsAndCollapse(ImGuiDockNode* node)
14505{
14506 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
14507 IM_ASSERT(node->ParentNode == NULL || node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[0] == node || node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[1] == node);
14508
14509 // Inherit most flags
14510 if (node->ParentNode)
14511 node->SharedFlags = node->ParentNode->SharedFlags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_SharedFlagsInheritMask_;
14512
14513 // Recurse into children
14514 // There is the possibility that one of our child becoming empty will delete itself and moving its sibling contents into 'node'.
14515 // If 'node->ChildNode[0]' delete itself, then 'node->ChildNode[1]->Windows' will be moved into 'node'
14516 // If 'node->ChildNode[1]' delete itself, then 'node->ChildNode[0]->Windows' will be moved into 'node' and the "remove inactive windows" loop will have run twice on those windows (harmless)
14517 node->HasCentralNodeChild = false;
14518 if (node->ChildNodes[0])
14519 DockNodeUpdateFlagsAndCollapse(node->ChildNodes[0]);
14520 if (node->ChildNodes[1])
14521 DockNodeUpdateFlagsAndCollapse(node->ChildNodes[1]);
14522
14523 // Remove inactive windows, collapse nodes
14524 // Merge node flags overrides stored in windows
14525 node->LocalFlagsInWindows = ImGuiDockNodeFlags_None;
14526 for (int window_n = 0; window_n < node->Windows.Size; window_n++)
14527 {
14528 ImGuiWindow* window = node->Windows[window_n];
14529 IM_ASSERT(window->DockNode == node);
14530
14531 bool node_was_active = (node->LastFrameActive + 1 == g.FrameCount);
14532 bool remove = false;
14533 remove |= node_was_active && (window->LastFrameActive + 1 < g.FrameCount);
14534 remove |= node_was_active && (node->WantCloseAll || node->WantCloseTabId == window->ID) && window->HasCloseButton && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument); // Submit all _expected_ closure from last frame
14535 remove |= (window->DockTabWantClose);
14536 if (remove)
14537 {
14538 window->DockTabWantClose = false;
14539 if (node->Windows.Size == 1 && !node->IsCentralNode())
14540 {
14541 DockNodeHideHostWindow(node);
14542 node->State = ImGuiDockNodeState_HostWindowHiddenBecauseSingleWindow;
