16123 ImGuiDockNode* node = DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, id);
16124 if (!node)
16125 {
16126 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockSpace: dockspace node 0x%08X created\n", id);
16127 node = DockContextAddNode(ctx, id);
16128 node->SetLocalFlags(ImGuiDockNodeFlags_CentralNode);
16129 }
16130 if (window_class && window_class->ClassId != node->WindowClass.ClassId)
16131 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockSpace: dockspace node 0x%08X: setup WindowClass 0x%08X -> 0x%08X\n", id, node->WindowClass.ClassId, window_class->ClassId);
16132 node->SharedFlags = flags;
16133 node->WindowClass = window_class ? *window_class : ImGuiWindowClass();
16134
16135 // When a DockSpace transitioned form implicit to explicit this may be called a second time
16136 // It is possible that the node has already been claimed by a docked window which appeared before the DockSpace() node, so we overwrite IsDockSpace again.
16137 if (node->LastFrameActive == g.FrameCount && !(flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_KeepAliveOnly))
16138 {
16139 IM_ASSERT(node->IsDockSpace() == false && "Cannot call DockSpace() twice a frame with the same ID");
16140 node->SetLocalFlags(node->LocalFlags | ImGuiDockNodeFlags_DockSpace);
16141 return id;
16142 }
16143 node->SetLocalFlags(node->LocalFlags | ImGuiDockNodeFlags_DockSpace);
16144
16145 // Keep alive mode, this is allow windows docked into this node so stay docked even if they are not visible
16146 if (flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_KeepAliveOnly)
16147 {
16148 node->LastFrameAlive = g.FrameCount;
16149 return id;
16150 }
16151
16152 const ImVec2 content_avail = GetContentRegionAvail();
16153 ImVec2 size = ImFloor(size_arg);
16154 if (size.x <= 0.0f)
16155 size.x = ImMax(content_avail.x + size.x, 4.0f); // Arbitrary minimum child size (0.0f causing too much issues)
16156 if (size.y <= 0.0f)
16157 size.y = ImMax(content_avail.y + size.y, 4.0f);
16158 IM_ASSERT(size.x > 0.0f && size.y > 0.0f);
16159
16160 node->Pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
16161 node->Size = node->SizeRef = size;
16162 SetNextWindowPos(node->Pos);
16163 SetNextWindowSize(node->Size);
16164 g.NextWindowData.PosUndock = false;
16165
16166 // FIXME-DOCK: Why do we need a child window to host a dockspace, could we host it in the existing window?
16167 // FIXME-DOCK: What is the reason for not simply calling BeginChild()? (OK to have a reason but should be commented)
16168 ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost;
16169 window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar;
16170 window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse;
16171 window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground;
16172
16173 char title[256];
16174 ImFormatString(title, IM_ARRAYSIZE(title), "%s/DockSpace_%08X", window->Name, id);
16175
16176 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildBorderSize, 0.0f);
16177 Begin(title, NULL, window_flags);
16178 PopStyleVar();
16179
16180 ImGuiWindow* host_window = g.CurrentWindow;
16181 DockNodeSetupHostWindow(node, host_window);
16182 host_window->ChildId = window->GetID(title);
16183 node->OnlyNodeWithWindows = NULL;
16184
16185 IM_ASSERT(node->IsRootNode());
16186
16187 // We need to handle the rare case were a central node is missing.
16188 // This can happen if the node was first created manually with DockBuilderAddNode() but _without_ the ImGuiDockNodeFlags_Dockspace.
16189 // Doing it correctly would set the _CentralNode flags, which would then propagate according to subsequent split.
16190 // It would also be ambiguous to attempt to assign a central node while there are split nodes, so we wait until there's a single node remaining.
16191 // The specific sub-property of _CentralNode we are interested in recovering here is the "Don't delete when empty" property,
16192 // as it doesn't make sense for an empty dockspace to not have this property.
16193 if (node->IsLeafNode() && !node->IsCentralNode())
16194 node->SetLocalFlags(node->LocalFlags | ImGuiDockNodeFlags_CentralNode);
16195
16196 // Update the node
16197 DockNodeUpdate(node);
16198
16199 End();
16200 ItemSize(size);
16201 return id;
16202}
16203
16204// Tips: Use with ImGuiDockNodeFlags_PassthruCentralNode!
16205// The limitation with this call is that your window won't have a menu bar.
16206// Even though we could pass window flags, it would also require the user to be able to call BeginMenuBar() somehow meaning we can't Begin/End in a single function.
16207// But you can also use BeginMainMenuBar(). If you really want a menu bar inside the same window as the one hosting the dockspace, you will need to copy this code somewhere and tweak it.
16208ImGuiID ImGui::DockSpaceOverViewport(const ImGuiViewport* viewport, ImGuiDockNodeFlags dockspace_flags, const ImGuiWindowClass* window_class)
16209{
16210 if (viewport == NULL)
16211 viewport = GetMainViewport();
16212
16213 SetNextWindowPos(viewport->WorkPos);
16214 SetNextWindowSize(viewport->WorkSize);
16215 SetNextWindowViewport(viewport->ID);
16216
16217 ImGuiWindowFlags host_window_flags = 0;
16218 host_window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking;
16219 host_window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus;
16220 if (dockspace_flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_PassthruCentralNode)
16221 host_window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground;
16222
16223 char label[32];
16224 ImFormatString(label, IM_ARRAYSIZE(label), "DockSpaceViewport_%08X", viewport->ID);
16225
16226 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowRounding, 0.0f);
16227 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowBorderSize, 0.0f);
16228 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f));
16229 Begin(label, NULL, host_window_flags);
16230 PopStyleVar(3);
16231
16232 ImGuiID dockspace_id = GetID("DockSpace");
16233 DockSpace(dockspace_id, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f), dockspace_flags, window_class);
16234 End();
16235
16236 return dockspace_id;
16237}
16238
16239//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
16240// Docking: Builder Functions
16241//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
16242// Very early end-user API to manipulate dock nodes.
16243// Only available in imgui_internal.h. Expect this API to change/break!
16244// It is expected that those functions are all called _before_ the dockspace node submission.
16245//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
16246// - DockBuilderDockWindow()
16247// - DockBuilderGetNode()
16248// - DockBuilderSetNodePos()
16249// - DockBuilderSetNodeSize()
16250// - DockBuilderAddNode()
16251// - DockBuilderRemoveNode()
16252// - DockBuilderRemoveNodeChildNodes()
16253// - DockBuilderRemoveNodeDockedWindows()
16254// - DockBuilderSplitNode()
16255// - DockBuilderCopyNodeRec()
16256// - DockBuilderCopyNode()
16257// - DockBuilderCopyWindowSettings()
16258// - DockBuilderCopyDockSpace()
16259// - DockBuilderFinish()
16260//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
16261
16262void ImGui::DockBuilderDockWindow(const char* window_name, ImGuiID node_id)
16263{
16264 // We don't preserve relative order of multiple docked windows (by clearing DockOrder back to -1)
16265 ImGuiID window_id = ImHashStr(window_name);
16266 if (ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByID(window_id))
16267 {
16268 // Apply to created window
16269 SetWindowDock(window, node_id, ImGuiCond_Always);
16270 window->DockOrder = -1;
16271 }
16272 else
16273 {
16274 // Apply to settings
16275 ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = FindWindowSettings(window_id);
16276 if (settings == NULL)
16277 settings = CreateNewWindowSettings(window_name);
16278 settings->DockId = node_id;
16279 settings->DockOrder = -1;
16280 }
16281}
16282
16283ImGuiDockNode* ImGui::DockBuilderGetNode(ImGuiID node_id)
16284{
16285 ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui;
16286 return DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, node_id);
16287}
16288
16289void ImGui::DockBuilderSetNodePos(ImGuiID node_id, ImVec2 pos)
16290{
16291 ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui;
16292 ImGuiDockNode* node = DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, node_id);
16293 if (node == NULL)
16294 return;
16295 node->Pos = pos;
16296 node->AuthorityForPos = ImGuiDataAuthority_DockNode;
16297}
16298
16299void ImGui::DockBuilderSetNodeSize(ImGuiID node_id, ImVec2 size)
16300{
16301 ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui;
16302 ImGuiDockNode* node = DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, node_id);
16303 if (node == NULL)
16304 return;
16305 IM_ASSERT(size.x > 0.0f && size.y > 0.0f);
16306 node->Size = node->SizeRef = size;
16307 node->AuthorityForSize = ImGuiDataAuthority_DockNode;
16308}
16309
16310// Make sure to use the ImGuiDockNodeFlags_DockSpace flag to create a dockspace node! Otherwise this will create a floating node!
16311// - Floating node: you can then call DockBuilderSetNodePos()/DockBuilderSetNodeSize() to position and size the floating node.
16312// - Dockspace node: calling DockBuilderSetNodePos() is unnecessary.
16313// - If you intend to split a node immediately after creation using DockBuilderSplitNode(), make sure to call DockBuilderSetNodeSize() beforehand!
16314// For various reason, the splitting code currently needs a base size otherwise space may not be allocated as precisely as you would expect.
16315// - Use (id == 0) to let the system allocate a node identifier.
16316// - Existing node with a same id will be removed.
16317ImGuiID ImGui::DockBuilderAddNode(ImGuiID id, ImGuiDockNodeFlags flags)
16318{
16319 ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui;
16320
16321 if (id != 0)
16322 DockBuilderRemoveNode(id);
16323
16324 ImGuiDockNode* node = NULL;
16325 if (flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_DockSpace)
16326 {
16327 DockSpace(id, ImVec2(0, 0), (flags & ~ImGuiDockNodeFlags_DockSpace) | ImGuiDockNodeFlags_KeepAliveOnly);
16328 node = DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, id);
16329 }
16330 else
16331 {
16332 node = DockContextAddNode(ctx, id);
16333 node->SetLocalFlags(flags);
16334 }
16335 node->LastFrameAlive = ctx->FrameCount; // Set this otherwise BeginDocked will undock during the same frame.
16336 return node->ID;
16337}
16338
16339void ImGui::DockBuilderRemoveNode(ImGuiID node_id)
16340{
16341 ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui;
16342 ImGuiDockNode* node = DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, node_id);
16343 if (node == NULL)
16344 return;
16345 DockBuilderRemoveNodeDockedWindows(node_id, true);
16346 DockBuilderRemoveNodeChildNodes(node_id);
16347 // Node may have moved or deleted if e.g. any merge happened
16348 node = DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, node_id);
16349 if (node == NULL)
16350 return;
16351 if (node->IsCentralNode() && node->ParentNode)
16352 node->ParentNode->SetLocalFlags(node->ParentNode->LocalFlags | ImGuiDockNodeFlags_CentralNode);
16353 DockContextRemoveNode(ctx, node, true);
16354}
16355
16356// root_id = 0 to remove all, root_id != 0 to remove child of given node.
16357void ImGui::DockBuilderRemoveNodeChildNodes(ImGuiID root_id)
16358{
16359 ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui;
16360 ImGuiDockContext* dc = &ctx->DockContext;
16361
16362 ImGuiDockNode* root_node = root_id ? DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, root_id) : NULL;
16363 if (root_id && root_node == NULL)
16364 return;
16365 bool has_central_node = false;
16366
16367 ImGuiDataAuthority backup_root_node_authority_for_pos = root_node ? root_node->AuthorityForPos : ImGuiDataAuthority_Auto;
16368 ImGuiDataAuthority backup_root_node_authority_for_size = root_node ? root_node->AuthorityForSize : ImGuiDataAuthority_Auto;
16369
16370 // Process active windows
16371 ImVector<ImGuiDockNode*> nodes_to_remove;
16372 for (int n = 0; n < dc->Nodes.Data.Size; n++)
16373 if (ImGuiDockNode* node = (ImGuiDockNode*)dc->Nodes.Data[n].val_p)
16374 {
16375 bool want_removal = (root_id == 0) || (node->ID != root_id && DockNodeGetRootNode(node)->ID == root_id);
16376 if (want_removal)
16377 {
16378 if (node->IsCentralNode())
16379 has_central_node = true;
16380 if (root_id != 0)
16381 DockContextQueueNotifyRemovedNode(ctx, node);
16382 if (root_node)
16383 {
16384 DockNodeMoveWindows(root_node, node);
16385 DockSettingsRenameNodeReferences(node->ID, root_node->ID);
16386 }
16387 nodes_to_remove.push_back(node);
16388 }
16389 }
16390
16391 // DockNodeMoveWindows->DockNodeAddWindow will normally set those when reaching two windows (which is only adequate during interactive merge)
16392 // Make sure we don't lose our current pos/size. (FIXME-DOCK: Consider tidying up that code in DockNodeAddWindow instead)
16393 if (root_node)
16394 {
16395 root_node->AuthorityForPos = backup_root_node_authority_for_pos;
16396 root_node->AuthorityForSize = backup_root_node_authority_for_size;
16397 }
16398
16399 // Apply to settings
16400 for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = ctx->SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = ctx->SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
16401 if (ImGuiID window_settings_dock_id = settings->DockId)
16402 for (int n = 0; n < nodes_to_remove.Size; n++)
16403 if (nodes_to_remove[n]->ID == window_settings_dock_id)
16404 {
16405 settings->DockId = root_id;
16406 break;
16407 }
16408
16409 // Not really efficient, but easier to destroy a whole hierarchy considering DockContextRemoveNode is attempting to merge nodes
16410 if (nodes_to_remove.Size > 1)
16411 ImQsort(nodes_to_remove.Data, nodes_to_remove.Size, sizeof(ImGuiDockNode*), DockNodeComparerDepthMostFirst);
16412 for (int n = 0; n < nodes_to_remove.Size; n++)
16413 DockContextRemoveNode(ctx, nodes_to_remove[n], false);
16414
16415 if (root_id == 0)
16416 {
16417 dc->Nodes.Clear();
16418 dc->Requests.clear();
16419 }
16420 else if (has_central_node)
16421 {
16422 root_node->CentralNode = root_node;
16423 root_node->SetLocalFlags(root_node->LocalFlags | ImGuiDockNodeFlags_CentralNode);
16424 }
16425}
16426
16427void ImGui::DockBuilderRemoveNodeDockedWindows(ImGuiID root_id, bool clear_settings_refs)
16428{
16429 // Clear references in settings
16430 ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui;
16431 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
16432 if (clear_settings_refs)
16433 {
16434 for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
16435 {
16436 bool want_removal = (root_id == 0) || (settings->DockId == root_id);
16437 if (!want_removal && settings->DockId != 0)
16438 if (ImGuiDockNode* node = DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, settings->DockId))
16439 if (DockNodeGetRootNode(node)->ID == root_id)
16440 want_removal = true;
16441 if (want_removal)
16442 settings->DockId = 0;
16443 }
16444 }
16445
16446 // Clear references in windows
16447 for (int n = 0; n < g.Windows.Size; n++)
16448 {
16449 ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[n];
16450 bool want_removal = (root_id == 0) || (window->DockNode && DockNodeGetRootNode(window->DockNode)->ID == root_id) || (window->DockNodeAsHost && window->DockNodeAsHost->ID == root_id);
16451 if (want_removal)
16452 {
16453 const ImGuiID backup_dock_id = window->DockId;
16454 IM_UNUSED(backup_dock_id);
16455 DockContextProcessUndockWindow(ctx, window, clear_settings_refs);
16456 if (!clear_settings_refs)
16457 IM_ASSERT(window->DockId == backup_dock_id);
16458 }
16459 }
16460}
16461
16462// If 'out_id_at_dir' or 'out_id_at_opposite_dir' are non NULL, the function will write out the ID of the two new nodes created.
16463// Return value is ID of the node at the specified direction, so same as (*out_id_at_dir) if that pointer is set.
16464// FIXME-DOCK: We are not exposing nor using split_outer.
16465ImGuiID ImGui::DockBuilderSplitNode(ImGuiID id, ImGuiDir split_dir, float size_ratio_for_node_at_dir, ImGuiID* out_id_at_dir, ImGuiID* out_id_at_opposite_dir)
16466{
16467 ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui;
16468 IM_ASSERT(split_dir != ImGuiDir_None);
16469 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockBuilderSplitNode node 0x%08X, split_dir %d\n", id, split_dir);
16470
16471 ImGuiDockNode* node = DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, id);
16472 if (node == NULL)
16473 {
16474 IM_ASSERT(node != NULL);
16475 return 0;
16476 }
16477
16478 IM_ASSERT(!node->IsSplitNode()); // Assert if already Split
16479
16480 ImGuiDockRequest req;
16481 req.Type = ImGuiDockRequestType_Split;
16482 req.DockTargetWindow = NULL;
16483 req.DockTargetNode = node;
16484 req.DockPayload = NULL;
16485 req.DockSplitDir = split_dir;
16486 req.DockSplitRatio = ImSaturate((split_dir == ImGuiDir_Left || split_dir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? size_ratio_for_node_at_dir : 1.0f - size_ratio_for_node_at_dir);
16487 req.DockSplitOuter = false;
16488 DockContextProcessDock(ctx, &req);
16489
16490 ImGuiID id_at_dir = node->ChildNodes[(split_dir == ImGuiDir_Left || split_dir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? 0 : 1]->ID;
16491 ImGuiID id_at_opposite_dir = node->ChildNodes[(split_dir == ImGuiDir_Left || split_dir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? 1 : 0]->ID;
16492 if (out_id_at_dir)
16493 *out_id_at_dir = id_at_dir;
16494 if (out_id_at_opposite_dir)
16495 *out_id_at_opposite_dir = id_at_opposite_dir;
16496 return id_at_dir;
16497}
16498
16499static ImGuiDockNode* DockBuilderCopyNodeRec(ImGuiDockNode* src_node, ImGuiID dst_node_id_if_known, ImVector<ImGuiID>* out_node_remap_pairs)
16500{
16501 ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui;
16502 ImGuiDockNode* dst_node = ImGui::DockContextAddNode(ctx, dst_node_id_if_known);
16503 dst_node->SharedFlags = src_node->SharedFlags;
16504 dst_node->LocalFlags = src_node->LocalFlags;
16505 dst_node->LocalFlagsInWindows = ImGuiDockNodeFlags_None;
16506 dst_node->Pos = src_node->Pos;
16507 dst_node->Size = src_node->Size;
16508 dst_node->SizeRef = src_node->SizeRef;
16509 dst_node->SplitAxis = src_node->SplitAxis;
16510 dst_node->UpdateMergedFlags();
16511
16512 out_node_remap_pairs->push_back(src_node->ID);
16513 out_node_remap_pairs->push_back(dst_node->ID);
16514
16515 for (int child_n = 0; child_n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(src_node->ChildNodes); child_n++)
16516 if (src_node->ChildNodes[child_n])
16517 {
16518 dst_node->ChildNodes[child_n] = DockBuilderCopyNodeRec(src_node->ChildNodes[child_n], 0, out_node_remap_pairs);
16519 dst_node->ChildNodes[child_n]->ParentNode = dst_node;
16520 }
16521
16522 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("Fork node %08X -> %08X (%d childs)\n", src_node->ID, dst_node->ID, dst_node->IsSplitNode() ? 2 : 0);
16523 return dst_node;
16524}
16525
16526void ImGui::DockBuilderCopyNode(ImGuiID src_node_id, ImGuiID dst_node_id, ImVector<ImGuiID>* out_node_remap_pairs)
16527{
16528 ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui;
16529 IM_ASSERT(src_node_id != 0);
16530 IM_ASSERT(dst_node_id != 0);
16531 IM_ASSERT(out_node_remap_pairs != NULL);
16532
16533 DockBuilderRemoveNode(dst_node_id);
16534
16535 ImGuiDockNode* src_node = DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, src_node_id);
16536 IM_ASSERT(src_node != NULL);
16537
16538 out_node_remap_pairs->clear();
16539 DockBuilderCopyNodeRec(src_node, dst_node_id, out_node_remap_pairs);
16540
16541 IM_ASSERT((out_node_remap_pairs->Size % 2) == 0);
16542}
16543
16544void ImGui::DockBuilderCopyWindowSettings(const char* src_name, const char* dst_name)
16545{
16546 ImGuiWindow* src_window = FindWindowByName(src_name);
16547 if (src_window == NULL)
16548 return;
16549 if (ImGuiWindow* dst_window = FindWindowByName(dst_name))
16550 {
16551 dst_window->Pos = src_window->Pos;
16552 dst_window->Size = src_window->Size;
16553 dst_window->SizeFull = src_window->SizeFull;
16554 dst_window->Collapsed = src_window->Collapsed;
16555 }
16556 else if (ImGuiWindowSettings* dst_settings = FindOrCreateWindowSettings(dst_name))
16557 {
16558 ImVec2ih window_pos_2ih = ImVec2ih(src_window->Pos);
16559 if (src_window->ViewportId != 0 && src_window->ViewportId != IMGUI_VIEWPORT_DEFAULT_ID)
16560 {
16561 dst_settings->ViewportPos = window_pos_2ih;
16562 dst_settings->ViewportId = src_window->ViewportId;
16563 dst_settings->Pos = ImVec2ih(0, 0);
16564 }
16565 else
16566 {
16567 dst_settings->Pos = window_pos_2ih;
16568 }
16569 dst_settings->Size = ImVec2ih(src_window->SizeFull);
16570 dst_settings->Collapsed = src_window->Collapsed;
16571 }
16572}
16573
16574// FIXME: Will probably want to change this signature, in particular how the window remapping pairs are passed.
16575void ImGui::DockBuilderCopyDockSpace(ImGuiID src_dockspace_id, ImGuiID dst_dockspace_id, ImVector<const char*>* in_window_remap_pairs)
16576{
16577 IM_ASSERT(src_dockspace_id != 0);
16578 IM_ASSERT(dst_dockspace_id != 0);
16579 IM_ASSERT(in_window_remap_pairs != NULL);
16580 IM_ASSERT((in_window_remap_pairs->Size % 2) == 0);
16581
16582 // Duplicate entire dock
16583 // FIXME: When overwriting dst_dockspace_id, windows that aren't part of our dockspace window class but that are docked in a same node will be split apart,
16584 // whereas we could attempt to at least keep them together in a new, same floating node.
16585 ImVector<ImGuiID> node_remap_pairs;
16586 DockBuilderCopyNode(src_dockspace_id, dst_dockspace_id, &node_remap_pairs);
16587
16588 // Attempt to transition all the upcoming windows associated to dst_dockspace_id into the newly created hierarchy of dock nodes
16589 // (The windows associated to src_dockspace_id are staying in place)
16590 ImVector<ImGuiID> src_windows;
16591 for (int remap_window_n = 0; remap_window_n < in_window_remap_pairs->Size; remap_window_n += 2)
16592 {
16593 const char* src_window_name = (*in_window_remap_pairs)[remap_window_n];
16594 const char* dst_window_name = (*in_window_remap_pairs)[remap_window_n + 1];
16595 ImGuiID src_window_id = ImHashStr(src_window_name);
16596 src_windows.push_back(src_window_id);
16597
16598 // Search in the remapping tables
16599 ImGuiID src_dock_id = 0;
16600 if (ImGuiWindow* src_window = FindWindowByID(src_window_id))
16601 src_dock_id = src_window->DockId;
16602 else if (ImGuiWindowSettings* src_window_settings = FindWindowSettings(src_window_id))
16603 src_dock_id = src_window_settings->DockId;
16604 ImGuiID dst_dock_id = 0;
16605 for (int dock_remap_n = 0; dock_remap_n < node_remap_pairs.Size; dock_remap_n += 2)
16606 if (node_remap_pairs[dock_remap_n] == src_dock_id)
16607 {
16608 dst_dock_id = node_remap_pairs[dock_remap_n + 1];
16609 //node_remap_pairs[dock_remap_n] = node_remap_pairs[dock_remap_n + 1] = 0; // Clear
16610 break;
16611 }
16612
16613 if (dst_dock_id != 0)
16614 {
16615 // Docked windows gets redocked into the new node hierarchy.
16616 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("Remap live window '%s' 0x%08X -> '%s' 0x%08X\n", src_window_name, src_dock_id, dst_window_name, dst_dock_id);
16617 DockBuilderDockWindow(dst_window_name, dst_dock_id);
16618 }
16619 else
16620 {
16621 // Floating windows gets their settings transferred (regardless of whether the new window already exist or not)
16622 // When this is leading to a Copy and not a Move, we would get two overlapping floating windows. Could we possibly dock them together?
16623 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("Remap window settings '%s' -> '%s'\n", src_window_name, dst_window_name);
16624 DockBuilderCopyWindowSettings(src_window_name, dst_window_name);
16625 }
16626 }
16627
16628 // Anything else in the source nodes of 'node_remap_pairs' are windows that were docked in src_dockspace_id but are not owned by it (unaffiliated windows, e.g. "ImGui Demo")
16629 // Find those windows and move to them to the cloned dock node. This may be optional?
16630 for (int dock_remap_n = 0; dock_remap_n < node_remap_pairs.Size; dock_remap_n += 2)
16631 if (ImGuiID src_dock_id = node_remap_pairs[dock_remap_n])
16632 {
16633 ImGuiID dst_dock_id = node_remap_pairs[dock_remap_n + 1];
16634 ImGuiDockNode* node = DockBuilderGetNode(src_dock_id);
16635 for (int window_n = 0; window_n < node->Windows.Size; window_n++)
16636 {
16637 ImGuiWindow* window = node->Windows[window_n];
16638 if (src_windows.contains(window->ID))
16639 continue;
16640
16641 // Docked windows gets redocked into the new node hierarchy.
16642 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("Remap window '%s' %08X -> %08X\n", window->Name, src_dock_id, dst_dock_id);
16643 DockBuilderDockWindow(window->Name, dst_dock_id);
16644 }
16645 }
16646}
16647
16648// FIXME-DOCK: This is awkward because in series of split user is likely to loose access to its root node.
16649void ImGui::DockBuilderFinish(ImGuiID root_id)
16650{
16651 ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui;
16652 //DockContextRebuild(ctx);
16653 DockContextBuildAddWindowsToNodes(ctx, root_id);
16654}
16655
16656//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
16657// Docking: Begin/End Support Functions (called from Begin/End)
16658//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
16659// - GetWindowAlwaysWantOwnTabBar()
16660// - DockContextBindNodeToWindow()
16661// - BeginDocked()
16662// - BeginDockableDragDropSource()
16663// - BeginDockableDragDropTarget()
16664//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
16665
16666bool ImGui::GetWindowAlwaysWantOwnTabBar(ImGuiWindow* window)
16667{
16668 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
16669 if (g.IO.ConfigDockingAlwaysTabBar || window->WindowClass.DockingAlwaysTabBar)
16670 if ((window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking)) == 0)
16671 if (!window->IsFallbackWindow) // We don't support AlwaysTabBar on the fallback/implicit window to avoid unused dock-node overhead/noise
16672 return true;
16673 return false;
16674}
16675
16676static ImGuiDockNode* ImGui::DockContextBindNodeToWindow(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiWindow* window)
16677{
16678 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
16679 ImGuiDockNode* node = DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, window->DockId);
16680 IM_ASSERT(window->DockNode == NULL);
16681
16682 // We should not be docking into a split node (SetWindowDock should avoid this)
16683 if (node && node->IsSplitNode())
16684 {
16685 DockContextProcessUndockWindow(ctx, window);
16686 return NULL;
16687 }
16688
16689 // Create node
16690 if (node == NULL)
16691 {
16692 node = DockContextAddNode(ctx, window->DockId);
16693 node->AuthorityForPos = node->AuthorityForSize = node->AuthorityForViewport = ImGuiDataAuthority_Window;
16694 node->LastFrameAlive = g.FrameCount;
16695 }
16696
16697 // If the node just turned visible and is part of a hierarchy, it doesn't have a Size assigned by DockNodeTreeUpdatePosSize() yet,
16698 // so we're forcing a Pos/Size update from the first ancestor that is already visible (often it will be the root node).
16699 // If we don't do this, the window will be assigned a zero-size on its first frame, which won't ideally warm up the layout.
16700 // This is a little wonky because we don't normally update the Pos/Size of visible node mid-frame.
16701 if (!node->IsVisible)
16702 {
16703 ImGuiDockNode* ancestor_node = node;
16704 while (!ancestor_node->IsVisible && ancestor_node->ParentNode)
16705 ancestor_node = ancestor_node->ParentNode;
16706 IM_ASSERT(ancestor_node->Size.x > 0.0f && ancestor_node->Size.y > 0.0f);
16707 DockNodeUpdateHasCentralNodeChild(DockNodeGetRootNode(ancestor_node));
16708 DockNodeTreeUpdatePosSize(ancestor_node, ancestor_node->Pos, ancestor_node->Size, node);
16709 }
16710
16711 // Add window to node
16712 bool node_was_visible = node->IsVisible;
16713 DockNodeAddWindow(node, window, true);
16714 node->IsVisible = node_was_visible; // Don't mark visible right away (so DockContextEndFrame() doesn't render it, maybe other side effects? will see)
16715 IM_ASSERT(node == window->DockNode);
16716 return node;
16717}
16718
16719void ImGui::BeginDocked(ImGuiWindow* window, bool* p_open)
16720{
16721 ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui;
16722 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
16723
16724 // Clear fields ahead so most early-out paths don't have to do it
16725 window->DockIsActive = window->DockNodeIsVisible = window->DockTabIsVisible = false;
16726
16727 const bool auto_dock_node = GetWindowAlwaysWantOwnTabBar(window);
16728 if (auto_dock_node)
16729 {
16730 if (window->DockId == 0)
16731 {
16732 IM_ASSERT(window->DockNode == NULL);
16733 window->DockId = DockContextGenNodeID(ctx);
16734 }
16735 }
16736 else
16737 {
16738 // Calling SetNextWindowPos() undock windows by default (by setting PosUndock)
16739 bool want_undock = false;
16740 want_undock |= (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking) != 0;
16741 want_undock |= (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasPos) && (window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags & g.NextWindowData.PosCond) && g.NextWindowData.PosUndock;
16742 if (want_undock)
16743 {
16744 DockContextProcessUndockWindow(ctx, window);
16745 return;
16746 }
16747 }
16748
16749 // Bind to our dock node
16750 ImGuiDockNode* node = window->DockNode;
16751 if (node != NULL)
16752 IM_ASSERT(window->DockId == node->ID);
16753 if (window->DockId != 0 && node == NULL)
16754 {
16755 node = DockContextBindNodeToWindow(ctx, window);
16756 if (node == NULL)
16757 return;
16758 }
16759
16760#if 0
16761 // Undock if the ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingInCentralNode got set
16762 if (node->IsCentralNode && (node->Flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingInCentralNode))
16763 {
16764 DockContextProcessUndockWindow(ctx, window);
16765 return;
16766 }
16767#endif
16768
16769 // Undock if our dockspace node disappeared
16770 // Note how we are testing for LastFrameAlive and NOT LastFrameActive. A DockSpace node can be maintained alive while being inactive with ImGuiDockNodeFlags_KeepAliveOnly.
16771 if (node->LastFrameAlive < g.FrameCount)
16772 {
16773 // If the window has been orphaned, transition the docknode to an implicit node processed in DockContextNewFrameUpdateDocking()
16774 ImGuiDockNode* root_node = DockNodeGetRootNode(node);
16775 if (root_node->LastFrameAlive < g.FrameCount)
16776 DockContextProcessUndockWindow(ctx, window);
16777 else
16778 window->DockIsActive = true;
16779 return;
16780 }
16781
16782 // Store style overrides
16783 for (int color_n = 0; color_n < ImGuiWindowDockStyleCol_COUNT; color_n++)
16784 window->DockStyle.Colors[color_n] = ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(g.Style.Colors[GWindowDockStyleColors[color_n]]);
16785
16786 // Fast path return. It is common for windows to hold on a persistent DockId but be the only visible window,
16787 // and never create neither a host window neither a tab bar.
16788 // FIXME-DOCK: replace ->HostWindow NULL compare with something more explicit (~was initially intended as a first frame test)
16789 if (node->HostWindow == NULL)
16790 {
16791 if (node->State == ImGuiDockNodeState_HostWindowHiddenBecauseWindowsAreResizing)
16792 window->DockIsActive = true;
16793 if (node->Windows.Size > 1)
16794 DockNodeHideWindowDuringHostWindowCreation(window);
16795 return;
16796 }
16797
16798 // We can have zero-sized nodes (e.g. children of a small-size dockspace)
16799 IM_ASSERT(node->HostWindow);
16800 IM_ASSERT(node->IsLeafNode());
16801 IM_ASSERT(node->Size.x >= 0.0f && node->Size.y >= 0.0f);
16802 node->State = ImGuiDockNodeState_HostWindowVisible;
16803
16804 // Undock if we are submitted earlier than the host window
16805 if (!(node->MergedFlags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_KeepAliveOnly) && window->BeginOrderWithinContext < node->HostWindow->BeginOrderWithinContext)
16806 {
16807 DockContextProcessUndockWindow(ctx, window);
16808 return;
16809 }
16810
16811 // Position/Size window
16812 SetNextWindowPos(node->Pos);
16813 SetNextWindowSize(node->Size);
16814 g.NextWindowData.PosUndock = false; // Cancel implicit undocking of SetNextWindowPos()
16815 window->DockIsActive = true;
16816 window->DockNodeIsVisible = true;
16817 window->DockTabIsVisible = false;
16818 if (node->MergedFlags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_KeepAliveOnly)
16819 return;
16820
16821 // When the window is selected we mark it as visible.
16822 if (node->VisibleWindow == window)
16823 window->DockTabIsVisible = true;
16824
16825 // Update window flag
16826 IM_ASSERT((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) == 0);
16827 window->Flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysUseWindowPadding | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize;
16828 if (node->IsHiddenTabBar() || node->IsNoTabBar())
16829 window->Flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar;
16830 else
16831 window->Flags &= ~ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar; // Clear the NoTitleBar flag in case the user set it: confusingly enough we need a title bar height so we are correctly offset, but it won't be displayed!
16832
16833 // Save new dock order only if the window has been visible once already
16834 // This allows multiple windows to be created in the same frame and have their respective dock orders preserved.
16835 if (node->TabBar && window->WasActive)
16836 window->DockOrder = (short)DockNodeGetTabOrder(window);
16837
16838 if ((node->WantCloseAll || node->WantCloseTabId == window->ID) && p_open != NULL)
16839 *p_open = false;
16840
16841 // Update ChildId to allow returning from Child to Parent with Escape
16842 ImGuiWindow* parent_window = window->DockNode->HostWindow;
16843 window->ChildId = parent_window->GetID(window->Name);
16844}
16845
16846void ImGui::BeginDockableDragDropSource(ImGuiWindow* window)
16847{
16848 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
16849 IM_ASSERT(g.ActiveId == window->MoveId);
16850 IM_ASSERT(g.MovingWindow == window);
16851 IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindow == window);
16852
16853 g.LastItemData.ID = window->MoveId;
16854 window = window->RootWindowDockTree;
16855 IM_ASSERT((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking) == 0);
16856 bool is_drag_docking = (g.IO.ConfigDockingWithShift) || ImRect(0, 0, window->SizeFull.x, GetFrameHeight()).Contains(g.ActiveIdClickOffset); // FIXME-DOCKING: Need to make this stateful and explicit
16857 if (is_drag_docking && BeginDragDropSource(ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip | ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoHoldToOpenOthers | ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAutoExpirePayload))
16858 {
16859 SetDragDropPayload(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_WINDOW, &window, sizeof(window));
16860 EndDragDropSource();
16861
16862 // Store style overrides
16863 for (int color_n = 0; color_n < ImGuiWindowDockStyleCol_COUNT; color_n++)
16864 window->DockStyle.Colors[color_n] = ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(g.Style.Colors[GWindowDockStyleColors[color_n]]);
16865 }
16866}
16867
16868void ImGui::BeginDockableDragDropTarget(ImGuiWindow* window)
16869{
16870 ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui;
16871 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
16872
16873 //IM_ASSERT(window->RootWindowDockTree == window); // May also be a DockSpace
16874 IM_ASSERT((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking) == 0);
16875 if (!g.DragDropActive)
16876 return;
16877 //GetForegroundDrawList(window)->AddRect(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
16878 if (!BeginDragDropTargetCustom(window->Rect(), window->ID))
16879 return;
16880
16881 // Peek into the payload before calling AcceptDragDropPayload() so we can handle overlapping dock nodes with filtering
16882 // (this is a little unusual pattern, normally most code would call AcceptDragDropPayload directly)
16883 const ImGuiPayload* payload = &g.DragDropPayload;
16884 if (!payload->IsDataType(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_WINDOW) || !DockNodeIsDropAllowed(window, *(ImGuiWindow**)payload->Data))
16885 {
16886 EndDragDropTarget();
16887 return;
16888 }
16889
16890 ImGuiWindow* payload_window = *(ImGuiWindow**)payload->Data;
16891 if (AcceptDragDropPayload(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_WINDOW, ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery | ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect))
16892 {
16893 // Select target node
16894 // (Important: we cannot use g.HoveredDockNode here! Because each of our target node have filters based on payload, each candidate drop target will do its own evaluation)
16895 bool dock_into_floating_window = false;
16896 ImGuiDockNode* node = NULL;
16897 if (window->DockNodeAsHost)
16898 {
16899 // Cannot assume that node will != NULL even though we passed the rectangle test: it depends on padding/spacing handled by DockNodeTreeFindVisibleNodeByPos().
16900 node = DockNodeTreeFindVisibleNodeByPos(window->DockNodeAsHost, g.IO.MousePos);
16901
16902 // There is an edge case when docking into a dockspace which only has _inactive_ nodes (because none of the windows are active)
16903 // In this case we need to fallback into any leaf mode, possibly the central node.
16904 // FIXME-20181220: We should not have to test for IsLeafNode() here but we have another bug to fix first.
16905 if (node && node->IsDockSpace() && node->IsRootNode())
16906 node = (node->CentralNode && node->IsLeafNode()) ? node->CentralNode : DockNodeTreeFindFallbackLeafNode(node);
16907 }
16908 else
16909 {
16910 if (window->DockNode)
16911 node = window->DockNode;
16912 else
16913 dock_into_floating_window = true; // Dock into a regular window
16914 }
16915
16916 const ImRect explicit_target_rect = (node && node->TabBar && !node->IsHiddenTabBar() && !node->IsNoTabBar()) ? node->TabBar->BarRect : ImRect(window->Pos, window->Pos + ImVec2(window->Size.x, GetFrameHeight()));
16917 const bool is_explicit_target = g.IO.ConfigDockingWithShift || IsMouseHoveringRect(explicit_target_rect.Min, explicit_target_rect.Max);
16918
16919 // Preview docking request and find out split direction/ratio
16920 //const bool do_preview = true; // Ignore testing for payload->IsPreview() which removes one frame of delay, but breaks overlapping drop targets within the same window.
16921 const bool do_preview = payload->IsPreview() || payload->IsDelivery();
16922 if (do_preview && (node != NULL || dock_into_floating_window))
16923 {
16924 ImGuiDockPreviewData split_inner;
16925 ImGuiDockPreviewData split_outer;
16926 ImGuiDockPreviewData* split_data = &split_inner;
16927 if (node && (node->ParentNode || node->IsCentralNode()))
16928 if (ImGuiDockNode* root_node = DockNodeGetRootNode(node))
16929 {
16930 DockNodePreviewDockSetup(window, root_node, payload_window, &split_outer, is_explicit_target, true);
16931 if (split_outer.IsSplitDirExplicit)
16932 split_data = &split_outer;
16933 }
16934 DockNodePreviewDockSetup(window, node, payload_window, &split_inner, is_explicit_target, false);
16935 if (split_data == &split_outer)
16936 split_inner.IsDropAllowed = false;
16937
16938 // Draw inner then outer, so that previewed tab (in inner data) will be behind the outer drop boxes
16939 DockNodePreviewDockRender(window, node, payload_window, &split_inner);
16940 DockNodePreviewDockRender(window, node, payload_window, &split_outer);
16941
16942 // Queue docking request
16943 if (split_data->IsDropAllowed && payload->IsDelivery())
16944 DockContextQueueDock(ctx, window, split_data->SplitNode, payload_window, split_data->SplitDir, split_data->SplitRatio, split_data == &split_outer);
16945 }
16946 }
16947 EndDragDropTarget();
16948}
16949
16950//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
16951// Docking: Settings
16952//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
16953// - DockSettingsRenameNodeReferences()
16954// - DockSettingsRemoveNodeReferences()
16955// - DockSettingsFindNodeSettings()
16956// - DockSettingsHandler_ApplyAll()
16957// - DockSettingsHandler_ReadOpen()
16958// - DockSettingsHandler_ReadLine()
16959// - DockSettingsHandler_DockNodeToSettings()
16960// - DockSettingsHandler_WriteAll()
16961//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
16962
16963static void ImGui::DockSettingsRenameNodeReferences(ImGuiID old_node_id, ImGuiID new_node_id)
16964{
16965 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
16966 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockSettingsRenameNodeReferences: from 0x%08X -> to 0x%08X\n", old_node_id, new_node_id);
16967 for (int window_n = 0; window_n < g.Windows.Size; window_n++)
16968 {
16969 ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[window_n];
16970 if (window->DockId == old_node_id && window->DockNode == NULL)
16971 window->DockId = new_node_id;
16972 }
16974 for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
16975 if (settings->DockId == old_node_id)
16976 settings->DockId = new_node_id;
16977}
16978
16979// Remove references stored in ImGuiWindowSettings to the given ImGuiDockNodeSettings
16980static void ImGui::DockSettingsRemoveNodeReferences(ImGuiID* node_ids, int node_ids_count)
16981{
16982 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
16983 int found = 0;
16985 for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
16986 for (int node_n = 0; node_n < node_ids_count; node_n++)
16987 if (settings->DockId == node_ids[node_n])
16988 {
16989 settings->DockId = 0;
16990 settings->DockOrder = -1;
16991 if (++found < node_ids_count)
16992 break;
16993 return;
16994 }
16995}
16996
16997static ImGuiDockNodeSettings* ImGui::DockSettingsFindNodeSettings(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiID id)
16998{
16999 // FIXME-OPT
17000 ImGuiDockContext* dc = &ctx->DockContext;
17001 for (int n = 0; n < dc->NodesSettings.Size; n++)
17002 if (dc->NodesSettings[n].ID == id)
17003 return &dc->NodesSettings[n];
17004 return NULL;
17005}
17006
17007// Clear settings data
17008static void ImGui::DockSettingsHandler_ClearAll(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler*)
17009{
17010 ImGuiDockContext* dc = &ctx->DockContext;
17011 dc->NodesSettings.clear();
17012 DockContextClearNodes(ctx, 0, true);
17013}
17014
17015// Recreate nodes based on settings data
17016static void ImGui::DockSettingsHandler_ApplyAll(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler*)
17017{
17018 // Prune settings at boot time only
17019 ImGuiDockContext* dc = &ctx->DockContext;
17020 if (ctx->Windows.Size == 0)
17021 DockContextPruneUnusedSettingsNodes(ctx);
17022 DockContextBuildNodesFromSettings(ctx, dc->NodesSettings.Data, dc->NodesSettings.Size);
17023 DockContextBuildAddWindowsToNodes(ctx, 0);
17024}
17025
17026static void* ImGui::DockSettingsHandler_ReadOpen(ImGuiContext*, ImGuiSettingsHandler*, const char* name)
17027{
17028 if (strcmp(name, "Data") != 0)
17029 return NULL;
17030 return (void*)1;
17031}
17032
17033static void ImGui::DockSettingsHandler_ReadLine(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler*, void*, const char* line)
17034{
17035 char c = 0;
17036 int x = 0, y = 0;
17037 int r = 0;
17038
17039 // Parsing, e.g.
17040 // " DockNode ID=0x00000001 Pos=383,193 Size=201,322 Split=Y,0.506 "
17041 // " DockNode ID=0x00000002 Parent=0x00000001 "
17042 // Important: this code expect currently fields in a fixed order.
17043 ImGuiDockNodeSettings node;
17044 line = ImStrSkipBlank(line);
17045 if (strncmp(line, "DockNode", 8) == 0) { line = ImStrSkipBlank(line + strlen("DockNode")); }
17046 else if (strncmp(line, "DockSpace", 9) == 0) { line = ImStrSkipBlank(line + strlen("DockSpace")); node.Flags |= ImGuiDockNodeFlags_DockSpace; }
17047 else return;
17048 if (sscanf(line, "ID=0x%08X%n", &node.ID, &r) == 1) { line += r; } else return;
17049 if (sscanf(line, " Parent=0x%08X%n", &node.ParentNodeId, &r) == 1) { line += r; if (node.ParentNodeId == 0) return; }
17050 if (sscanf(line, " Window=0x%08X%n", &node.ParentWindowId, &r) ==1) { line += r; if (node.ParentWindowId == 0) return; }
17051 if (node.ParentNodeId == 0)
17052 {
17053 if (sscanf(line, " Pos=%i,%i%n", &x, &y, &r) == 2) { line += r; node.Pos = ImVec2ih((short)x, (short)y); } else return;
17054 if (sscanf(line, " Size=%i,%i%n", &x, &y, &r) == 2) { line += r; node.Size = ImVec2ih((short)x, (short)y); } else return;
17055 }
17056 else
17057 {
17058 if (sscanf(line, " SizeRef=%i,%i%n", &x, &y, &r) == 2) { line += r; node.SizeRef = ImVec2ih((short)x, (short)y); }
17059 }
17060 if (sscanf(line, " Split=%c%n", &c, &r) == 1) { line += r; if (c == 'X') node.SplitAxis = ImGuiAxis_X; else if (c == 'Y') node.SplitAxis = ImGuiAxis_Y; }
17061 if (sscanf(line, " NoResize=%d%n", &x, &r) == 1) { line += r; if (x != 0) node.Flags |= ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoResize; }
17062 if (sscanf(line, " CentralNode=%d%n", &x, &r) == 1) { line += r; if (x != 0) node.Flags |= ImGuiDockNodeFlags_CentralNode; }
17063 if (sscanf(line, " NoTabBar=%d%n", &x, &r) == 1) { line += r; if (x != 0) node.Flags |= ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoTabBar; }
17064 if (sscanf(line, " HiddenTabBar=%d%n", &x, &r) == 1) { line += r; if (x != 0) node.Flags |= ImGuiDockNodeFlags_HiddenTabBar; }
17065 if (sscanf(line, " NoWindowMenuButton=%d%n", &x, &r) == 1) { line += r; if (x != 0) node.Flags |= ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoWindowMenuButton; }
17066 if (sscanf(line, " NoCloseButton=%d%n", &x, &r) == 1) { line += r; if (x != 0) node.Flags |= ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoCloseButton; }
17067 if (sscanf(line, " Selected=0x%08X%n", &node.SelectedTabId,&r) == 1) { line += r; }
17068 if (node.ParentNodeId != 0)
17069 if (ImGuiDockNodeSettings* parent_settings = DockSettingsFindNodeSettings(ctx, node.ParentNodeId))
17070 node.Depth = parent_settings->Depth + 1;
17071 ctx->DockContext.NodesSettings.push_back(node);
17072}
17073
17074static void DockSettingsHandler_DockNodeToSettings(ImGuiDockContext* dc, ImGuiDockNode* node, int depth)
17075{
17076 ImGuiDockNodeSettings node_settings;
17077 IM_ASSERT(depth < (1 << (sizeof(node_settings.Depth) << 3)));
17078 node_settings.ID = node->ID;
17079 node_settings.ParentNodeId = node->ParentNode ? node->ParentNode->ID : 0;
17080 node_settings.ParentWindowId = (node->IsDockSpace() && node->HostWindow && node->HostWindow->ParentWindow) ? node->HostWindow->ParentWindow->ID : 0;
17081 node_settings.SelectedTabId = node->SelectedTabId;
17082 node_settings.SplitAxis = (signed char)(node->IsSplitNode() ? node->SplitAxis : ImGuiAxis_None);
17083 node_settings.Depth = (char)depth;
17084 node_settings.Flags = (node->LocalFlags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_SavedFlagsMask_);
17085 node_settings.Pos = ImVec2ih(node->Pos);
17086 node_settings.Size = ImVec2ih(node->Size);
17087 node_settings.SizeRef = ImVec2ih(node->SizeRef);
17088 dc->NodesSettings.push_back(node_settings);
17089 if (node->ChildNodes[0])
17090 DockSettingsHandler_DockNodeToSettings(dc, node->ChildNodes[0], depth + 1);
17091 if (node->ChildNodes[1])
17092 DockSettingsHandler_DockNodeToSettings(dc, node->ChildNodes[1], depth + 1);
17093}
17094
17095static void ImGui::DockSettingsHandler_WriteAll(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler* handler, ImGuiTextBuffer* buf)
17096{
17097 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
17098 ImGuiDockContext* dc = &ctx->DockContext;
17099 if (!(g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable))
17100 return;
17101
17102 // Gather settings data
17103 // (unlike our windows settings, because nodes are always built we can do a full rewrite of the SettingsNode buffer)
17104 dc->NodesSettings.resize(0);
17105 dc->NodesSettings.reserve(dc->Nodes.Data.Size);
17106 for (int n = 0; n < dc->Nodes.Data.Size; n++)
17107 if (ImGuiDockNode* node = (ImGuiDockNode*)dc->Nodes.Data[n].val_p)
17108 if (node->IsRootNode())
17109 DockSettingsHandler_DockNodeToSettings(dc, node, 0);
17110
17111 int max_depth = 0;
17112 for (int node_n = 0; node_n < dc->NodesSettings.Size; node_n++)
17113 max_depth = ImMax((int)dc->NodesSettings[node_n].Depth, max_depth);
17114
17115 // Write to text buffer
17116 buf->appendf("[%s][Data]\n", handler->TypeName);
17117 for (int node_n = 0; node_n < dc->NodesSettings.Size; node_n++)
17118 {
17119 const int line_start_pos = buf->size(); (void)line_start_pos;
17120 const ImGuiDockNodeSettings* node_settings = &dc->NodesSettings[node_n];
17121 buf->appendf("%*s%s%*s", node_settings->Depth * 2, "", (node_settings->Flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_DockSpace) ? "DockSpace" : "DockNode ", (max_depth - node_settings->Depth) * 2, ""); // Text align nodes to facilitate looking at .ini file
17122 buf->appendf(" ID=0x%08X", node_settings->ID);
17123 if (node_settings->ParentNodeId)
17124 {
17125 buf->appendf(" Parent=0x%08X SizeRef=%d,%d", node_settings->ParentNodeId, node_settings->SizeRef.x, node_settings->SizeRef.y);
17126 }
17127 else
17128 {
17129 if (node_settings->ParentWindowId)
17130 buf->appendf(" Window=0x%08X", node_settings->ParentWindowId);
17131 buf->appendf(" Pos=%d,%d Size=%d,%d", node_settings->Pos.x, node_settings->Pos.y, node_settings->Size.x, node_settings->Size.y);
17132 }
17133 if (node_settings->SplitAxis != ImGuiAxis_None)
17134 buf->appendf(" Split=%c", (node_settings->SplitAxis == ImGuiAxis_X) ? 'X' : 'Y');
17135 if (node_settings->Flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoResize)
17136 buf->appendf(" NoResize=1");
17137 if (node_settings->Flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_CentralNode)
17138 buf->appendf(" CentralNode=1");
17139 if (node_settings->Flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoTabBar)
17140 buf->appendf(" NoTabBar=1");
17141 if (node_settings->Flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_HiddenTabBar)
17142 buf->appendf(" HiddenTabBar=1");
17143 if (node_settings->Flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoWindowMenuButton)
17144 buf->appendf(" NoWindowMenuButton=1");
17145 if (node_settings->Flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoCloseButton)
17146 buf->appendf(" NoCloseButton=1");
17147 if (node_settings->SelectedTabId)
17148 buf->appendf(" Selected=0x%08X", node_settings->SelectedTabId);
17149
17150#if IMGUI_DEBUG_INI_SETTINGS
17151 // [DEBUG] Include comments in the .ini file to ease debugging
17152 if (ImGuiDockNode* node = DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, node_settings->ID))
17153 {
17154 buf->appendf("%*s", ImMax(2, (line_start_pos + 92) - buf->size()), ""); // Align everything
17155 if (node->IsDockSpace() && node->HostWindow && node->HostWindow->ParentWindow)
17156 buf->appendf(" ; in '%s'", node->HostWindow->ParentWindow->Name);
17157 // Iterate settings so we can give info about windows that didn't exist during the session.
17158 int contains_window = 0;
17159 for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
17160 if (settings->DockId == node_settings->ID)
17161 {
17162 if (contains_window++ == 0)
17163 buf->appendf(" ; contains ");
17164 buf->appendf("'%s' ", settings->GetName());
17165 }
17166 }
17167#endif
17168 buf->appendf("\n");
17169 }
17170 buf->appendf("\n");
17171}
17172
17173
17174//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
17175// [SECTION] PLATFORM DEPENDENT HELPERS
17176//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
17177
17178#if defined(_WIN32) && !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_FUNCTIONS) && !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_CLIPBOARD_FUNCTIONS)
17179
17180#ifdef _MSC_VER
17181#pragma comment(lib, "user32")
17182#pragma comment(lib, "kernel32")
17183#endif
17184
17185// Win32 clipboard implementation
17186// We use g.ClipboardHandlerData for temporary storage to ensure it is freed on Shutdown()
17187static const char* GetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void*)
17188{
17189 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
17190 g.ClipboardHandlerData.clear();
17191 if (!::OpenClipboard(NULL))
17192 return NULL;
17193 HANDLE wbuf_handle = ::GetClipboardData(CF_UNICODETEXT);
17194 if (wbuf_handle == NULL)
17195 {
17196 ::CloseClipboard();
17197 return NULL;
17198 }
17199 if (const WCHAR* wbuf_global = (const WCHAR*)::GlobalLock(wbuf_handle))
17200 {
17201 int buf_len = ::WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, wbuf_global, -1, NULL, 0, NULL, NULL);
17202 g.ClipboardHandlerData.resize(buf_len);
17203 ::WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, wbuf_global, -1, g.ClipboardHandlerData.Data, buf_len, NULL, NULL);
17204 }
17205 ::GlobalUnlock(wbuf_handle);
17206 ::CloseClipboard();
17207 return g.ClipboardHandlerData.Data;
17208}
17209
17210static void SetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void*, const char* text)
17211{
17212 if (!::OpenClipboard(NULL))
17213 return;
17214 const int wbuf_length = ::MultiByteToWideChar(CP_UTF8, 0, text, -1, NULL, 0);
17215 HGLOBAL wbuf_handle = ::GlobalAlloc(GMEM_MOVEABLE, (SIZE_T)wbuf_length * sizeof(WCHAR));
17216 if (wbuf_handle == NULL)
17217 {
17218 ::CloseClipboard();
17219 return;
17220 }
17221 WCHAR* wbuf_global = (WCHAR*)::GlobalLock(wbuf_handle);
17222 ::MultiByteToWideChar(CP_UTF8, 0, text, -1, wbuf_global, wbuf_length);
17223 ::GlobalUnlock(wbuf_handle);
17224 ::EmptyClipboard();
17225 if (::SetClipboardData(CF_UNICODETEXT, wbuf_handle) == NULL)
17226 ::GlobalFree(wbuf_handle);
17227 ::CloseClipboard();
17228}
17229
17230#elif defined(__APPLE__) && TARGET_OS_OSX && defined(IMGUI_ENABLE_OSX_DEFAULT_CLIPBOARD_FUNCTIONS)
17231
17232#include <Carbon/Carbon.h> // Use old API to avoid need for separate .mm file
17233static PasteboardRef main_clipboard = 0;
17234
17235// OSX clipboard implementation
17236// If you enable this you will need to add '-framework ApplicationServices' to your linker command-line!
17237static void SetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void*, const char* text)
17238{
17239 if (!main_clipboard)
17240 PasteboardCreate(kPasteboardClipboard, &main_clipboard);
17241 PasteboardClear(main_clipboard);
17242 CFDataRef cf_data = CFDataCreate(kCFAllocatorDefault, (const UInt8*)text, strlen(text));
17243 if (cf_data)
17244 {
17245 PasteboardPutItemFlavor(main_clipboard, (PasteboardItemID)1, CFSTR("public.utf8-plain-text"), cf_data, 0);
17246 CFRelease(cf_data);
17247 }
17248}
17249
17250static const char* GetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void*)
17251{
17252 if (!main_clipboard)
17253 PasteboardCreate(kPasteboardClipboard, &main_clipboard);
17254 PasteboardSynchronize(main_clipboard);
17255
17256 ItemCount item_count = 0;
17257 PasteboardGetItemCount(main_clipboard, &item_count);
17258 for (ItemCount i = 0; i < item_count; i++)
17259 {
17260 PasteboardItemID item_id = 0;
17261 PasteboardGetItemIdentifier(main_clipboard, i + 1, &item_id);
17262 CFArrayRef flavor_type_array = 0;
17263 PasteboardCopyItemFlavors(main_clipboard, item_id, &flavor_type_array);
17264 for (CFIndex j = 0, nj = CFArrayGetCount(flavor_type_array); j < nj; j++)
17265 {
17266 CFDataRef cf_data;
17267 if (PasteboardCopyItemFlavorData(main_clipboard, item_id, CFSTR("public.utf8-plain-text"), &cf_data) == noErr)
17268 {
17269 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
17270 g.ClipboardHandlerData.clear();
17271 int length = (int)CFDataGetLength(cf_data);
17272 g.ClipboardHandlerData.resize(length + 1);
17273 CFDataGetBytes(cf_data, CFRangeMake(0, length), (UInt8*)g.ClipboardHandlerData.Data);
17274 g.ClipboardHandlerData[length] = 0;
17275 CFRelease(cf_data);
17276 return g.ClipboardHandlerData.Data;
17277 }
17278 }
17279 }
17280 return NULL;
17281}
17282
17283#else
17284
17285// Local Dear ImGui-only clipboard implementation, if user hasn't defined better clipboard handlers.
17286static const char* GetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void*)
17287{
17288 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
17289 return g.ClipboardHandlerData.empty() ? NULL : g.ClipboardHandlerData.begin();
17290}
17291
17292static void SetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void*, const char* text)
17293{
17294 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
17295 g.ClipboardHandlerData.clear();
17296 const char* text_end = text + strlen(text);
17297 g.ClipboardHandlerData.resize((int)(text_end - text) + 1);
17298 memcpy(&g.ClipboardHandlerData[0], text, (size_t)(text_end - text));
17299 g.ClipboardHandlerData[(int)(text_end - text)] = 0;
17300}
17301
17302#endif
17303
17304// Win32 API IME support (for Asian languages, etc.)
17305#if defined(_WIN32) && !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_FUNCTIONS) && !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_IME_FUNCTIONS)
17306
17307#include <imm.h>
17308#ifdef _MSC_VER
17309#pragma comment(lib, "imm32")
17310#endif
17311
17312static void SetPlatformImeDataFn_DefaultImpl(ImGuiViewport* viewport, ImGuiPlatformImeData* data)
17313{
17314 // Notify OS Input Method Editor of text input position
17315 HWND hwnd = (HWND)viewport->PlatformHandleRaw;
17316#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
17317 if (hwnd == 0)
17318 hwnd = (HWND)ImGui::GetIO().ImeWindowHandle;
17319#endif
17320 if (hwnd == 0)
17321 return;
17322
17323 ::ImmAssociateContextEx(hwnd, NULL, data->WantVisible ? IACE_DEFAULT : 0);
17324
17325 if (HIMC himc = ::ImmGetContext(hwnd))
17326 {
17327 COMPOSITIONFORM composition_form = {};
17328 composition_form.ptCurrentPos.x = (LONG)(data->InputPos.x - viewport->Pos.x);
17329 composition_form.ptCurrentPos.y = (LONG)(data->InputPos.y - viewport->Pos.y);
17330 composition_form.dwStyle = CFS_FORCE_POSITION;
17331 ::ImmSetCompositionWindow(himc, &composition_form);
17332 CANDIDATEFORM candidate_form = {};
17333 candidate_form.dwStyle = CFS_CANDIDATEPOS;
17334 candidate_form.ptCurrentPos.x = (LONG)(data->InputPos.x - viewport->Pos.x);
17335 candidate_form.ptCurrentPos.y = (LONG)(data->InputPos.y - viewport->Pos.y);
17336 ::ImmSetCandidateWindow(himc, &candidate_form);
17337 ::ImmReleaseContext(hwnd, himc);
17338 }
17339}
17340
17341#else
17342
17343static void SetPlatformImeDataFn_DefaultImpl(ImGuiViewport*, ImGuiPlatformImeData*) {}
17344
17345#endif
17346
17347//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
17348// [SECTION] METRICS/DEBUGGER WINDOW
17349//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
17350// - RenderViewportThumbnail() [Internal]
17351// - RenderViewportsThumbnails() [Internal]
17352// - MetricsHelpMarker() [Internal]
17353// - ShowMetricsWindow()
17354// - DebugNodeColumns() [Internal]
17355// - DebugNodeDockNode() [Internal]
17356// - DebugNodeDrawList() [Internal]
17357// - DebugNodeDrawCmdShowMeshAndBoundingBox() [Internal]
17358// - DebugNodeStorage() [Internal]
17359// - DebugNodeTabBar() [Internal]
17360// - DebugNodeViewport() [Internal]
17361// - DebugNodeWindow() [Internal]
17362// - DebugNodeWindowSettings() [Internal]
17363// - DebugNodeWindowsList() [Internal]
17364// - DebugNodeWindowsListByBeginStackParent() [Internal]
17365//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
17366
17367#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_METRICS_WINDOW
17368
17369void ImGui::DebugRenderViewportThumbnail(ImDrawList* draw_list, ImGuiViewportP* viewport, const ImRect& bb)
17370{
17371 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
17372 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
17373
17374 ImVec2 scale = bb.GetSize() / viewport->Size;
17375 ImVec2 off = bb.Min - viewport->Pos * scale;
17376 float alpha_mul = (viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized) ? 0.30f : 1.00f;
17377 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(bb.Min, bb.Max, ImGui::GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border, alpha_mul * 0.40f));
17378 for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
17379 {
17380 ImGuiWindow* thumb_window = g.Windows[i];
17381 if (!thumb_window->WasActive || (thumb_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow))
17382 continue;
17383 if (thumb_window->Viewport != viewport)
17384 continue;
17385
17386 ImRect thumb_r = thumb_window->Rect();
17387 ImRect title_r = thumb_window->TitleBarRect();
17388 thumb_r = ImRect(ImFloor(off + thumb_r.Min * scale), ImFloor(off + thumb_r.Max * scale));
17389 title_r = ImRect(ImFloor(off + title_r.Min * scale), ImFloor(off + ImVec2(title_r.Max.x, title_r.Min.y) * scale) + ImVec2(0,5)); // Exaggerate title bar height
17390 thumb_r.ClipWithFull(bb);
17391 title_r.ClipWithFull(bb);
17392 const bool window_is_focused = (g.NavWindow && thumb_window->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight == g.NavWindow->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight);
17393 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(thumb_r.Min, thumb_r.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_WindowBg, alpha_mul));
17394 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(title_r.Min, title_r.Max, GetColorU32(window_is_focused ? ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive : ImGuiCol_TitleBg, alpha_mul));
17395 window->DrawList->AddRect(thumb_r.Min, thumb_r.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border, alpha_mul));
17396 window->DrawList->AddText(g.Font, g.FontSize * 1.0f, title_r.Min, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text, alpha_mul), thumb_window->Name, FindRenderedTextEnd(thumb_window->Name));
17397 }
17398 draw_list->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border, alpha_mul));
17399}
17400
17401static void RenderViewportsThumbnails()
17402{
17403 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
17404 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
17405
17406 // We don't display full monitor bounds (we could, but it often looks awkward), instead we display just enough to cover all of our viewports.
17407 float SCALE = 1.0f / 8.0f;
17408 ImRect bb_full(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX);
17409 for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
17410 bb_full.Add(g.Viewports[n]->GetMainRect());
17411 ImVec2 p = window->DC.CursorPos;
17412 ImVec2 off = p - bb_full.Min * SCALE;
17413 for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
17414 {
17415 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
17416 ImRect viewport_draw_bb(off + (viewport->Pos) * SCALE, off + (viewport->Pos + viewport->Size) * SCALE);
17417 ImGui::DebugRenderViewportThumbnail(window->DrawList, viewport, viewport_draw_bb);
17418 }
17419 ImGui::Dummy(bb_full.GetSize() * SCALE);
17420}
17421
17422static int IMGUI_CDECL ViewportComparerByFrontMostStampCount(const void* lhs, const void* rhs)
17423{
17424 const ImGuiViewportP* a = *(const ImGuiViewportP* const *)lhs;
17425 const ImGuiViewportP* b = *(const ImGuiViewportP* const *)rhs;
17426 return b->LastFrontMostStampCount - a->LastFrontMostStampCount;
17427}
17428
17429// Avoid naming collision with imgui_demo.cpp's HelpMarker() for unity builds.
17430static void MetricsHelpMarker(const char* desc)
17431{
17432 ImGui::TextDisabled("(?)");
17433 if (ImGui::IsItemHovered())
17434 {
17435 ImGui::BeginTooltip();
17436 ImGui::PushTextWrapPos(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 35.0f);
17437 ImGui::TextUnformatted(desc);
17438 ImGui::PopTextWrapPos();
17439 ImGui::EndTooltip();
17440 }
17441}
17442
17443#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEMO_WINDOWS
17444namespace ImGui { void ShowFontAtlas(ImFontAtlas* atlas); }
17445#endif
17446
17447void ImGui::ShowMetricsWindow(bool* p_open)
17448{
17449 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
17450 ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
17451 ImGuiMetricsConfig* cfg = &g.DebugMetricsConfig;
17452 if (cfg->ShowStackTool)
17453 ShowStackToolWindow(&cfg->ShowStackTool);
17454
17455 if (!Begin("Dear ImGui Metrics/Debugger", p_open) || GetCurrentWindow()->BeginCount > 1)
17456 {
17457 End();
17458 return;
17459 }
17460
17461 // Basic info
17462 Text("Dear ImGui %s", GetVersion());
17463 Text("Application average %.3f ms/frame (%.1f FPS)", 1000.0f / io.Framerate, io.Framerate);
17464 Text("%d vertices, %d indices (%d triangles)", io.MetricsRenderVertices, io.MetricsRenderIndices, io.MetricsRenderIndices / 3);
17465 Text("%d visible windows, %d active allocations", io.MetricsRenderWindows, io.MetricsActiveAllocations);
17466 //SameLine(); if (SmallButton("GC")) { g.GcCompactAll = true; }
17467
17468 Separator();
17469
17470 // Debugging enums
17471 enum { WRT_OuterRect, WRT_OuterRectClipped, WRT_InnerRect, WRT_InnerClipRect, WRT_WorkRect, WRT_Content, WRT_ContentIdeal, WRT_ContentRegionRect, WRT_Count }; // Windows Rect Type
17472 const char* wrt_rects_names[WRT_Count] = { "OuterRect", "OuterRectClipped", "InnerRect", "InnerClipRect", "WorkRect", "Content", "ContentIdeal", "ContentRegionRect" };
17473 enum { TRT_OuterRect, TRT_InnerRect, TRT_WorkRect, TRT_HostClipRect, TRT_InnerClipRect, TRT_BackgroundClipRect, TRT_ColumnsRect, TRT_ColumnsWorkRect, TRT_ColumnsClipRect, TRT_ColumnsContentHeadersUsed, TRT_ColumnsContentHeadersIdeal, TRT_ColumnsContentFrozen, TRT_ColumnsContentUnfrozen, TRT_Count }; // Tables Rect Type
17474 const char* trt_rects_names[TRT_Count] = { "OuterRect", "InnerRect", "WorkRect", "HostClipRect", "InnerClipRect", "BackgroundClipRect", "ColumnsRect", "ColumnsWorkRect", "ColumnsClipRect", "ColumnsContentHeadersUsed", "ColumnsContentHeadersIdeal", "ColumnsContentFrozen", "ColumnsContentUnfrozen" };
17475 if (cfg->ShowWindowsRectsType < 0)
17476 cfg->ShowWindowsRectsType = WRT_WorkRect;
17477 if (cfg->ShowTablesRectsType < 0)
17478 cfg->ShowTablesRectsType = TRT_WorkRect;
17479
17480 struct Funcs
17481 {
17482 static ImRect GetTableRect(ImGuiTable* table, int rect_type, int n)
17483 {
17484 if (rect_type == TRT_OuterRect) { return table->OuterRect; }
17485 else if (rect_type == TRT_InnerRect) { return table->InnerRect; }
17486 else if (rect_type == TRT_WorkRect) { return table->WorkRect; }
17487 else if (rect_type == TRT_HostClipRect) { return table->HostClipRect; }
17488 else if (rect_type == TRT_InnerClipRect) { return table->InnerClipRect; }
17489 else if (rect_type == TRT_BackgroundClipRect) { return table->BgClipRect; }
17490 else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsRect) { ImGuiTableColumn* c = &table->Columns[n]; return ImRect(c->MinX, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y, c->MaxX, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y + table->LastOuterHeight); }
17491 else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsWorkRect) { ImGuiTableColumn* c = &table->Columns[n]; return ImRect(c->WorkMinX, table->WorkRect.Min.y, c->WorkMaxX, table->WorkRect.Max.y); }
17492 else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsClipRect) { ImGuiTableColumn* c = &table->Columns[n]; return c->ClipRect; }
17493 else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsContentHeadersUsed){ ImGuiTableColumn* c = &table->Columns[n]; return ImRect(c->WorkMinX, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y, c->ContentMaxXHeadersUsed, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y + table->LastFirstRowHeight); } // Note: y1/y2 not always accurate
17494 else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsContentHeadersIdeal){ImGuiTableColumn* c = &table->Columns[n]; return ImRect(c->WorkMinX, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y, c->ContentMaxXHeadersIdeal, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y + table->LastFirstRowHeight); }
17495 else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsContentFrozen) { ImGuiTableColumn* c = &table->Columns[n]; return ImRect(c->WorkMinX, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y, c->ContentMaxXFrozen, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y + table->LastFirstRowHeight); }
17496 else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsContentUnfrozen) { ImGuiTableColumn* c = &table->Columns[n]; return ImRect(c->WorkMinX, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y + table->LastFirstRowHeight, c->ContentMaxXUnfrozen, table->InnerClipRect.Max.y); }
17497 IM_ASSERT(0);
17498 return ImRect();
17499 }
17500
17501 static ImRect GetWindowRect(ImGuiWindow* window, int rect_type)
17502 {
17503 if (rect_type == WRT_OuterRect) { return window->Rect(); }
17504 else if (rect_type == WRT_OuterRectClipped) { return window->OuterRectClipped; }
17505 else if (rect_type == WRT_InnerRect) { return window->InnerRect; }
17506 else if (rect_type == WRT_InnerClipRect) { return window->InnerClipRect; }
17507 else if (rect_type == WRT_WorkRect) { return window->WorkRect; }
17508 else if (rect_type == WRT_Content) { ImVec2 min = window->InnerRect.Min - window->Scroll + window->WindowPadding; return ImRect(min, min + window->ContentSize); }
17509 else if (rect_type == WRT_ContentIdeal) { ImVec2 min = window->InnerRect.Min - window->Scroll + window->WindowPadding; return ImRect(min, min + window->ContentSizeIdeal); }
17510 else if (rect_type == WRT_ContentRegionRect) { return window->ContentRegionRect; }
17511 IM_ASSERT(0);
17512 return ImRect();
17513 }
17514 };
17515
17516 // Tools
17517 if (TreeNode("Tools"))
17518 {
17519 // Stack Tool is your best friend!
17520 Checkbox("Show stack tool", &cfg->ShowStackTool);
17521 SameLine();
17522 MetricsHelpMarker("You can also call ImGui::ShowStackToolWindow() from your code.");
17523
17524 Checkbox("Show windows begin order", &cfg->ShowWindowsBeginOrder);
17525 Checkbox("Show windows rectangles", &cfg->ShowWindowsRects);
17526 SameLine();
17527 SetNextItemWidth(GetFontSize() * 12);
17528 cfg->ShowWindowsRects |= Combo("##show_windows_rect_type", &cfg->ShowWindowsRectsType, wrt_rects_names, WRT_Count, WRT_Count);
17529 if (cfg->ShowWindowsRects && g.NavWindow != NULL)
17530 {
17531 BulletText("'%s':", g.NavWindow->Name);
17532 Indent();
17533 for (int rect_n = 0; rect_n < WRT_Count; rect_n++)
17534 {
17535 ImRect r = Funcs::GetWindowRect(g.NavWindow, rect_n);
17536 Text("(%6.1f,%6.1f) (%6.1f,%6.1f) Size (%6.1f,%6.1f) %s", r.Min.x, r.Min.y, r.Max.x, r.Max.y, r.GetWidth(), r.GetHeight(), wrt_rects_names[rect_n]);
17537 }
17538 Unindent();
17539 }
17540
17541 Checkbox("Show tables rectangles", &cfg->ShowTablesRects);
17542 SameLine();
17543 SetNextItemWidth(GetFontSize() * 12);
17544 cfg->ShowTablesRects |= Combo("##show_table_rects_type", &cfg->ShowTablesRectsType, trt_rects_names, TRT_Count, TRT_Count);
17545 if (cfg->ShowTablesRects && g.NavWindow != NULL)
17546 {
17547 for (int table_n = 0; table_n < g.Tables.GetMapSize(); table_n++)
17548 {
17549 ImGuiTable* table = g.Tables.TryGetMapData(table_n);
17550 if (table == NULL || table->LastFrameActive < g.FrameCount - 1 || (table->OuterWindow != g.NavWindow && table->InnerWindow != g.NavWindow))
17551 continue;
17552
17553 BulletText("Table 0x%08X (%d columns, in '%s')", table->ID, table->ColumnsCount, table->OuterWindow->Name);
17554 if (IsItemHovered())
17555 GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(table->OuterRect.Min - ImVec2(1, 1), table->OuterRect.Max + ImVec2(1, 1), IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255), 0.0f, 0, 2.0f);
17556 Indent();
17557 char buf[128];
17558 for (int rect_n = 0; rect_n < TRT_Count; rect_n++)
17559 {
17560 if (rect_n >= TRT_ColumnsRect)
17561 {
17562 if (rect_n != TRT_ColumnsRect && rect_n != TRT_ColumnsClipRect)
17563 continue;
17564 for (int column_n = 0; column_n < table->ColumnsCount; column_n++)
17565 {
17566 ImRect r = Funcs::GetTableRect(table, rect_n, column_n);
17567 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "(%6.1f,%6.1f) (%6.1f,%6.1f) Size (%6.1f,%6.1f) Col %d %s", r.Min.x, r.Min.y, r.Max.x, r.Max.y, r.GetWidth(), r.GetHeight(), column_n, trt_rects_names[rect_n]);
17568 Selectable(buf);
17569 if (IsItemHovered())
17570 GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(r.Min - ImVec2(1, 1), r.Max + ImVec2(1, 1), IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255), 0.0f, 0, 2.0f);
17571 }
17572 }
17573 else
17574 {
17575 ImRect r = Funcs::GetTableRect(table, rect_n, -1);
17576 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "(%6.1f,%6.1f) (%6.1f,%6.1f) Size (%6.1f,%6.1f) %s", r.Min.x, r.Min.y, r.Max.x, r.Max.y, r.GetWidth(), r.GetHeight(), trt_rects_names[rect_n]);
17577 Selectable(buf);
17578 if (IsItemHovered())
17579 GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(r.Min - ImVec2(1, 1), r.Max + ImVec2(1, 1), IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255), 0.0f, 0, 2.0f);
17580 }
17581 }
17582 Unindent();
17583 }
17584 }
17585
17586 // The Item Picker tool is super useful to visually select an item and break into the call-stack of where it was submitted.
17587 if (Button("Item Picker.."))
17588 DebugStartItemPicker();
17589 SameLine();
17590 MetricsHelpMarker("Will call the IM_DEBUG_BREAK() macro to break in debugger.\nWarning: If you don't have a debugger attached, this will probably crash.");
17591
17592 TreePop();
17593 }
17594
17595 // Windows
17596 if (TreeNode("Windows", "Windows (%d)", g.Windows.Size))
17597 {
17598 //SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once);
17599 DebugNodeWindowsList(&g.Windows, "By display order");
17600 DebugNodeWindowsList(&g.WindowsFocusOrder, "By focus order (root windows)");
17601 if (TreeNode("By submission order (begin stack)"))
17602 {
17603 // Here we display windows in their submitted order/hierarchy, however note that the Begin stack doesn't constitute a Parent<>Child relationship!
17604 ImVector<ImGuiWindow*>& temp_buffer = g.WindowsTempSortBuffer;
17605 temp_buffer.resize(0);
17606 for (int i = 0; i < g.Windows.Size; i++)
17607 if (g.Windows[i]->LastFrameActive + 1 >= g.FrameCount)
17608 temp_buffer.push_back(g.Windows[i]);
17609 struct Func { static int IMGUI_CDECL WindowComparerByBeginOrder(const void* lhs, const void* rhs) { return ((int)(*(const ImGuiWindow* const *)lhs)->BeginOrderWithinContext - (*(const ImGuiWindow* const*)rhs)->BeginOrderWithinContext); } };
17610 ImQsort(temp_buffer.Data, (size_t)temp_buffer.Size, sizeof(ImGuiWindow*), Func::WindowComparerByBeginOrder);
17611 DebugNodeWindowsListByBeginStackParent(temp_buffer.Data, temp_buffer.Size, NULL);
17612 TreePop();
17613 }
17614
17615 TreePop();
17616 }
17617
17618 // DrawLists
17619 int drawlist_count = 0;
17620 for (int viewport_i = 0; viewport_i < g.Viewports.Size; viewport_i++)
17621 drawlist_count += g.Viewports[viewport_i]->DrawDataBuilder.GetDrawListCount();
17622 if (TreeNode("DrawLists", "DrawLists (%d)", drawlist_count))
17623 {
17624 Checkbox("Show ImDrawCmd mesh when hovering", &cfg->ShowDrawCmdMesh);
17625 Checkbox("Show ImDrawCmd bounding boxes when hovering", &cfg->ShowDrawCmdBoundingBoxes);
17626 for (int viewport_i = 0; viewport_i < g.Viewports.Size; viewport_i++)
17627 {
17628 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[viewport_i];
17629 bool viewport_has_drawlist = false;
17630 for (int layer_i = 0; layer_i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers); layer_i++)
17631 for (int draw_list_i = 0; draw_list_i < viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[layer_i].Size; draw_list_i++)
17632 {
17633 if (!viewport_has_drawlist)
17634 Text("Active DrawLists in Viewport #%d, ID: 0x%08X", viewport->Idx, viewport->ID);
17635 viewport_has_drawlist = true;
17636 DebugNodeDrawList(NULL, viewport, viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[layer_i][draw_list_i], "DrawList");
17637 }
17638 }
17639 TreePop();
17640 }
17641
17642 // Viewports
17643 if (TreeNode("Viewports", "Viewports (%d)", g.Viewports.Size))
17644 {
17645 Indent(GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing());
17646 RenderViewportsThumbnails();
17647 Unindent(GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing());
17648
17649 bool open = TreeNode("Monitors", "Monitors (%d)", g.PlatformIO.Monitors.Size);
17650 SameLine();
17651 MetricsHelpMarker("Dear ImGui uses monitor data:\n- to query DPI settings on a per monitor basis\n- to position popup/tooltips so they don't straddle monitors.");
17652 if (open)
17653 {
17654 for (int i = 0; i < g.PlatformIO.Monitors.Size; i++)
17655 {
17656 const ImGuiPlatformMonitor& mon = g.PlatformIO.Monitors[i];
17657 BulletText("Monitor #%d: DPI %.0f%%\n MainMin (%.0f,%.0f), MainMax (%.0f,%.0f), MainSize (%.0f,%.0f)\n WorkMin (%.0f,%.0f), WorkMax (%.0f,%.0f), WorkSize (%.0f,%.0f)",
17658 i, mon.DpiScale * 100.0f,
17659 mon.MainPos.x, mon.MainPos.y, mon.MainPos.x + mon.MainSize.x, mon.MainPos.y + mon.MainSize.y, mon.MainSize.x, mon.MainSize.y,
17660 mon.WorkPos.x, mon.WorkPos.y, mon.WorkPos.x + mon.WorkSize.x, mon.WorkPos.y + mon.WorkSize.y, mon.WorkSize.x, mon.WorkSize.y);
17661 }
17662 TreePop();
17663 }
17664
17665 if (TreeNode("Inferred order (front-to-back)"))
17666 {
17667 static ImVector<ImGuiViewportP*> viewports;
17668 viewports.resize(g.Viewports.Size);
17669 memcpy(viewports.Data, g.Viewports.Data, g.Viewports.size_in_bytes());
17670 if (viewports.Size > 1)
17671 ImQsort(viewports.Data, viewports.Size, sizeof(ImGuiViewport*), ViewportComparerByFrontMostStampCount);
17672 for (int i = 0; i < viewports.Size; i++)
17673 BulletText("Viewport #%d, ID: 0x%08X, FrontMostStampCount = %08d, Window: \"%s\"", viewports[i]->Idx, viewports[i]->ID, viewports[i]->LastFrontMostStampCount, viewports[i]->Window ? viewports[i]->Window->Name : "N/A");
17674 TreePop();
17675 }
17676
17677 for (int i = 0; i < g.Viewports.Size; i++)
17678 DebugNodeViewport(g.Viewports[i]);
17679 TreePop();
17680 }
17681
17682 // Details for Popups
17683 if (TreeNode("Popups", "Popups (%d)", g.OpenPopupStack.Size))
17684 {
17685 for (int i = 0; i < g.OpenPopupStack.Size; i++)
17686 {
17687 ImGuiWindow* window = g.OpenPopupStack[i].Window;
17688 BulletText("PopupID: %08x, Window: '%s'%s%s", g.OpenPopupStack[i].PopupId, window ? window->Name : "NULL", window && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) ? " ChildWindow" : "", window && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu) ? " ChildMenu" : "");
17689 }
17690 TreePop();
17691 }
17692
17693 // Details for TabBars
17694 if (TreeNode("TabBars", "Tab Bars (%d)", g.TabBars.GetAliveCount()))
17695 {
17696 for (int n = 0; n < g.TabBars.GetMapSize(); n++)
17697 if (ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar = g.TabBars.TryGetMapData(n))
17698 {
17699 PushID(tab_bar);
17700 DebugNodeTabBar(tab_bar, "TabBar");
17701 PopID();
17702 }
17703 TreePop();
17704 }
17705
17706 // Details for Tables
17707 if (TreeNode("Tables", "Tables (%d)", g.Tables.GetAliveCount()))
17708 {
17709 for (int n = 0; n < g.Tables.GetMapSize(); n++)
17710 if (ImGuiTable* table = g.Tables.TryGetMapData(n))
17711 DebugNodeTable(table);
17712 TreePop();
17713 }
17714
17715 // Details for Fonts
17716#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEMO_WINDOWS
17717 ImFontAtlas* atlas = g.IO.Fonts;
17718 if (TreeNode("Fonts", "Fonts (%d)", atlas->Fonts.Size))
17719 {
17720 ShowFontAtlas(atlas);
17721 TreePop();
17722 }
17723#endif
17724
17725 // Details for Docking
17726#ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
17727 if (TreeNode("Docking"))
17728 {
17729 static bool root_nodes_only = true;
17730 ImGuiDockContext* dc = &g.DockContext;
17731 Checkbox("List root nodes", &root_nodes_only);
17732 Checkbox("Ctrl shows window dock info", &cfg->ShowDockingNodes);
17733 if (SmallButton("Clear nodes")) { DockContextClearNodes(&g, 0, true); }
17734 SameLine();
17735 if (SmallButton("Rebuild all")) { dc->WantFullRebuild = true; }
17736 for (int n = 0; n < dc->Nodes.Data.Size; n++)
17737 if (ImGuiDockNode* node = (ImGuiDockNode*)dc->Nodes.Data[n].val_p)
17738 if (!root_nodes_only || node->IsRootNode())
17739 DebugNodeDockNode(node, "Node");
17740 TreePop();
17741 }
17742#endif // #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
17743
17744 // Settings
17745 if (TreeNode("Settings"))
17746 {
17747 if (SmallButton("Clear"))
17748 ClearIniSettings();
17749 SameLine();
17750 if (SmallButton("Save to memory"))
17751 SaveIniSettingsToMemory();
17752 SameLine();
17753 if (SmallButton("Save to disk"))
17754 SaveIniSettingsToDisk(g.IO.IniFilename);
17755 SameLine();
17756 if (g.IO.IniFilename)
17757 Text("\"%s\"", g.IO.IniFilename);
17758 else
17759 TextUnformatted("<NULL>");
17760 Text("SettingsDirtyTimer %.2f", g.SettingsDirtyTimer);
17761 if (TreeNode("SettingsHandlers", "Settings handlers: (%d)", g.SettingsHandlers.Size))
17762 {
17763 for (int n = 0; n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; n++)
17764 BulletText("%s", g.SettingsHandlers[n].TypeName);
17765 TreePop();
17766 }
17767 if (TreeNode("SettingsWindows", "Settings packed data: Windows: %d bytes", g.SettingsWindows.size()))
17768 {
17769 for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
17770 DebugNodeWindowSettings(settings);
17771 TreePop();
17772 }
17773
17774 if (TreeNode("SettingsTables", "Settings packed data: Tables: %d bytes", g.SettingsTables.size()))
17775 {
17776 for (ImGuiTableSettings* settings = g.SettingsTables.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsTables.next_chunk(settings))
17777 DebugNodeTableSettings(settings);
17778 TreePop();
17779 }
17780
17781#ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
17782 if (TreeNode("SettingsDocking", "Settings packed data: Docking"))
17783 {
17784 ImGuiDockContext* dc = &g.DockContext;
17785 Text("In SettingsWindows:");
17786 for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
17787 if (settings->DockId != 0)
17788 BulletText("Window '%s' -> DockId %08X", settings->GetName(), settings->DockId);
17789 Text("In SettingsNodes:");
17790 for (int n = 0; n < dc->NodesSettings.Size; n++)
17791 {
17792 ImGuiDockNodeSettings* settings = &dc->NodesSettings[n];
17793 const char* selected_tab_name = NULL;
17794 if (settings->SelectedTabId)
17795 {
17796 if (ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByID(settings->SelectedTabId))
17797 selected_tab_name = window->Name;
17798 else if (ImGuiWindowSettings* window_settings = FindWindowSettings(settings->SelectedTabId))
17799 selected_tab_name = window_settings->GetName();
17800 }
17801 BulletText("Node %08X, Parent %08X, SelectedTab %08X ('%s')", settings->ID, settings->ParentNodeId, settings->SelectedTabId, selected_tab_name ? selected_tab_name : settings->SelectedTabId ? "N/A" : "");
17802 }
17803 TreePop();
17804 }
17805#endif // #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
17806
17807 if (TreeNode("SettingsIniData", "Settings unpacked data (.ini): %d bytes", g.SettingsIniData.size()))
17808 {
17809 InputTextMultiline("##Ini", (char*)(void*)g.SettingsIniData.c_str(), g.SettingsIniData.Buf.Size, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, GetTextLineHeight() * 20), ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly);
17810 TreePop();
17811 }
17812 TreePop();
17813 }
17814
17815 // Misc Details
17816 if (TreeNode("Internal state"))
17817 {
17818 Text("WINDOWING");
17819 Indent();
17820 Text("HoveredWindow: '%s'", g.HoveredWindow ? g.HoveredWindow->Name : "NULL");
17821 Text("HoveredWindow->Root: '%s'", g.HoveredWindow ? g.HoveredWindow->RootWindowDockTree->Name : "NULL");
17822 Text("HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow: '%s'", g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow ? g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow->Name : "NULL");
